column4: 1 1/2 cups sugar1/2 cup  orange juice1/4 cup water1 tblsp. grated orange peel1/2 tsp. grated ginger4 cups cranberries1/2 cup toasted pecans
column5: Bring first  5 ingredients to simmer in heavy large sauce pan over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.  Add cranberries and  cook until berries pop stirring occasionally, about five minutes. Stir in pecans.  Pour into bowl, cool, cover, and refrigerate.  Can be prepared four days ahead.  Mother's Note:This is good and easy for cranberries for Thanksgiving.  Keeps ages.

column4: 1 medium eggplant4 Tblsps. chopped onion1/4 C. butter1/2  t. salt1/2 C. dry bread crumbs2 pints oysters1/2 C. light cream
column5: Peel eggplant, cut into small cubes. Saute with onions in butter until transparent.  Add salt.  Heat oysters slowly in own liquid until edges  curl.     Layer in casserole:  Eggplant, crumbs  oysters,   ending with crumbs on top.  Pour cream over.  Bake   350 degrees for 20 to 30 minutes depending on temperature of casserole.Mother's Note:This is the oyster casserole we have for Thanksgiving.  Folks do not know that they are eating eggplant.

column4: 2 lb. rye bread ,  12" round  3 cups sour cream3 cups mayonnaise9 ozs. dried beef, chopped2 Tblsps. dill2 teaspoons parsley3 Tblsps. dried chopped onion
column5: Remove top from bread, hollow carefully to make container. Mix remaining ingredients and fill bread hollow. Serve with remaining bread cut into cubes.

column4: l Cup all purpose flour1/2 teaspoon salt3 eggs1 Cup milk1 Tblsp. melted shortening
column5: Sift flour; measure; add salt and sift again.  Beat eggs until light and thick.  Add flour and 1/3 cup of the milk; continue to  beat  slowly until all the flour is moistened--about 30 seconds. Gradually add remaining milk and melted shortening, beating until the mixture is free from lumps--1 to 2 minutes.  Fill greased  popover pans or mustard  cups a little less than half full.  Bake in a  hot oven (425*) about 40 minutes.  Serve at once.  Makes 6 to 8  large popovers.  Note:  If drier popovers are preferred, prick each one with a sharp       fork 5 minutes before the  baking is finished.  This allows the steam to escape and the insides to dry a little.

column4: 1 cup dried cashew fruit or dried lychees or pitted prunes, cut into pieces1 lemon seeded and cut into pieces1 (2") piece gingerroot, peeled and sliced4 cloves garlic, peeled1/4 tsp. mustard seed1/8 tsp. cayenne pepper1/2 tsp. salt2 T. lemon juice3/4 c. water1/2 tsp. turmeric
column5: In food processor fitted with steel blade, combine cashew fruit, lemon, ginger, garlic,. mustard seed, cayenne, turmeric, salt, lemon juice, and water.  Process briefly to chop.  Transfer to a saucepan and bring to boil.  Reduce heat and simmer until lemon is soft and most of liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.  Cool and refrigerate.

column4: 1 cup dried cashew fruit or pitted prunes3 T. sugar1/2 Cup chopped walnuts6 egg whites
column5: In saucepan, combine cashew fruit and 1/2 cup water.  Simmer 10 minutes.  Drain then process in food processor until pureed. Transfer to bowl and stir in sugar.  Add walnuts and stir to  blend.  In separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff and fold into cashew fruit mixture.  Pour into buttered 2-quart souffle dish. Place in pan of boiling water and bake 35 minutes at 350 degrees or until browned and firm.  Serve hot or cold.

column4: 2 Cups dried cashew fruit or Pitted prunes, Halved1 cup hot lychee or black tea2 T. Cointreau or Grand Marnierl cup whipping cream1 T. sugar
column5: Place fruit in bowl and pour boiling tea over.  Soak overnight. Drain and add liqueur.  Chill.  Just before serving, whip cream with sugar.  Drain fruit and fold into whipped cream.

column4: 4 small eggplants, sliced, partly peeled   (2 to 4 cups, approx.)1 med. green pepper, sliced4 medium sliced tomatoes     2 medium sliced onions  Add To Taste:salt and peppergarlic saltsugarMSG3/4 lb. sharp cheddar, sliced
column5: Parboil eggplant l minute Layer all ingredients in casserole, topping with cheese. Bake covered for 1/2 hour at 400 degrees; remove cover and cook 1/2 hour at 350 degrees, or until cheese is brown. Mother's Note:This is a good way to use eggplant without frying on it first. It is good and simple, and can be made ahead.

column4: 1/4 cup sour cream with chives, or add l tsp. chopped green onion to 1/4 c. plain sour cream2 tsps. Dijon mustard1/4 tsp. seasoned pepper or lemon pepper1/4 tsp. prepared horseradish
column5: Combine all ingredients in microwave container.  Cover with  waxed paper; cook  [medium power] for l minute.Spoon over hot cooked vegetables--green beans, carrots, asparagus, or mixed vegetables.

column4: 1 cup butter1 cup sugar1 cup brown sugar2 eggs1 teaspoon vanilla2 cups flour2 1/2 cups blended oatmeal*1/2 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon baking powder1 teaspoon soda12 ounces chocolate chips4 ounces grated Hershey bar1 1/2 cup chopped nuts
column5: Cream butter and sugars.  Add eggs and vanilla.  Mix with flour oatmeal*, salt, baking powder, and soda.  Add chips, candy, and nuts.  Chill.  Roll into balls and place 2" apart on cookie sheet. Bake for 6 minutes at 375 degrees.  {Makes 56 cookies} *Blended oatmeal:  Measure and blend in a food processor to a  fine powder.

column4: 4 tsps. olive oil2 fresh rosemary sprigs,  minced2 tsps minced fresh parsleyl large clove garlic, minced4  12-ounce monkfish fillets or white fish fillets, skinned.Salt to tastePepeperonata
column5: Mix first 4 ingredients in small bowl.  Rub lightly on both sides of  fish.  Arrange in nonaluminum pan.  Cover with plastic and refriger- ate for 2 hours.Preheat broiler, Sprinkle fish with salt.  Place on broiler rack  and broil 9 minutes per 1-inch thickness, turning once.  Divide hot Peperonata among plates.  Top with monkfish.
column6: Bon Appetite, Nov. 88; p. lllSee Sauces for Peperonata recipe

column4: 2 tblsps. olive oill large onion, cut into ringsl large garlic clove, minced4 medium tomatoes, peeled, and chopped3 green bell peppers, cubed3 yellow bell peppers, cubed1 unpeeled medium eggplant,cubedSalt and freshly ground pepper1/8 tsp freshly grated nutmegExtra virgin olive oilMinced fresh parsley
column5: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium  heat.  Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes.  Add tomatoes, bell peppers, and eggplant.  Season generously with salt and pepper.  Cook until almost all liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally,  30 to 40 minutes.  Stir in nutmeg.  Transfer to platter.  Drizzle with olive oil.  Sprinkle with parsley.  {Can be Prepared 2 days ahead.  Cool, cover and refrigerate.  Reheat gently, if desired.}Serve hot or cold.

column4: 1 c. all purpose flour1 c. whole wheat flour2 egg yolksl tablespoon milkl tablespoon olive oil1/4 teaspoon salt
column5: Combine flours.  Mound on work surface.  Make well in center. Add yolks, milk, oil and salt to well and blend with fork.  Gradually draw flour from edge of well into center until all flour is incorporated.  Turn dough out onto loghtly floured surface and knead until dough comes together.  Wrap in plastic and let stant 30 minutes.  {Can be prepared 2 days ahead.  Refrigerate.}Cut dough in half.  Flatten 1 piece of dough[keep remainder covered to prevent drying.]  Fold in thirds.  Turn pasta machine to widest setting and run dough through several times until smooth and velvety, folding before each run and dusting with flour.  Adjust machine to next narrower setting.  Run dough through machine without folding.  Repeat narrowing rollers after each run until pasta is 1/16" thick.  Dust with flour if necessary; hang to dry 10 to 30 minutes.

column4: 1 can flaky biscuits1/2 lb. hot sausage2 eggs, beaten slightly1 cup cottage cheese1/2 cup parmesan cheese2 Tablespoons chopped chivessalt & pepper
column5: Crumble and brown sausage, draining well.  Flatten biscuits and  line greased muffin tins.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Divide  sausage among cups and fill with egg mixture.  Bake in pre-heated 375 degree oven until brown and set.  (About 20 minutes.)Mother's Note:These are the things we always took skiing.  Can be made ahead and frozen to be pulled out and used anytime.  I drain the sausage on paper towels placed over newspaper, and I squeeze until there is no more grease!

column4: 4 (8-10) fillets fresh dolphinMelted butter for bastingOld Bay seasoning1 Lemon4 oz. Butter2 tsp. garlic minced2 fresh tomatos diced1(14 oz.) can artichoke hearts, quarters8 oz.fresh mushrooms, sliced4 T. capers2 T. fresh parsley, chopped8 oz. dry white wine
column5: Place dolphin fillets on a sheet pan; baste with butter, Squeeze the lemon over the filets and sprinkle lightly with Old Bay seasoning.Place filets in a 450 degree oven and bake until firm to the touch, 10 to 15 minutes.Place a saute pan on the stove over high heat. Add 4 ounces of butter and melt. Add the garlic and saute until it becomes tan in color. Add the tomatos, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, capers and parsley; saute until vegatables are heated throughly. Add the white wine to the pan, allowing it to reduce until the has a slightly thickened appearance.Spoon the sauce over the baked dolphin and serve immediately.

column4: MARINADE:4(6 oz.) tuna steaks1 cup Kikoman teriyaki sauce1 cup blush wine1/2 bunch chopped green onion2 t. sugar2 t. sesame oilVEGATABLES:4 oz. snow peas, Julianne strips4 oz. red peppers, Julianne strips4.oz. carrots, Julianne stripsA little chopped garlicSesame oil, for sauteeing
column5: Combine all ingredients for marinade.Place the tuna steaks in marinade for approximately 2 hours.After  2 hours. pat tuna steaks dry and saute until browned on the outside but still moist and pink in the center. Hold in a warm place.saute the vegetables and garlic in sesame oil over high heat and finish with a little of the marinade. Keep the vegatables crisp.Arrange a nest of vegatables around the tuna steaks and serve with your favorite side dish.

column4: 2(10 1/2 oz.) cans chopped clams1(8 oz.) bottle clam juice1/4 cup olive oil5 t. flour2 tsp minced garlic2 tsp. basilDash white pepper1 T. chopped parsley1 cup heavy cream
column5: Drain juice from chopped clams; reserve both juice and clams. Set aside.Saute garlic in olive oil; do not brown. Add flour to olive oil and cook for a few minutes; do not brown. Add drained clam juice from clams and bottle of clam juice. Cook til slightly thickened. Add basil, salt, pepper, parsley and cream; bring back to as simmer.Add clams and heat through. Do not boil.Cook your favorite pasts, top generously with clam sauce.

column4: 8 oz. egg tortellini with cheese8 oz. spinach tortellini with cheese3 oz. swordfish, cubed3 0z. bay scallops3 oz. (60-70-count) peeled shrimp4 oz. red pepper, diced3 green onions, chopped1 shallot, chopped4 oz. fresh mushrooms, sliced2 0z. white wine3 T. grated Parmesan cheeseLIGHT BECHAMEL SAUCE:1 qt. half-and-half3 T. flour2 t> butter1/2 tsp. salt 1 dash white pepper
column5: LIGHT BECHACEL SAUCE: Saute the flour in the butter until bubbly; approximately 5 minutes. Add the half-and-half, salt and pepper. Cook until the sauce is slightly thickened and smooth. Remove from heat and set aside.Cook the pasta in salted water until tender. Drain and set aside.In a large saute pan, saute the seafood in a little butter for a few minutes. Stir in the shallots, red peppers, mushrooms and green onion until crisp. Add a little white wine and reduce.Combine the pasta with the sauteed vegatables. Add thebechamel sauce. Heat until the sauce begins to bubble; reduce heat.Stir in the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately on heated plates.

column4: 1 1/2 cups salad oil3/4 cup soy sauce1/2 cup wine vinegar1/3 cup Lemon juice1/4 cup Worchestershire2 Tblsps. dry mustard2 1/2 teaspoons salt1 Tblsp. coarsley ground pepper2 teaspoons chopped parsley2 cloves garlic,crushed
column5: Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Store in a tightly covered jar in refrigerator or freezer if not used immediately.  Makes 3 1/2 cups.Mother's Note: Add wine to taste if necessary to increase volume.

column4: 4 ducks2 large onions, chopped2 pared carrots, cut in half crosswise2 stalks celery, chopped2 apples, cored & chopped1/4 cup flour2 cans (10 1/2 oz.) consomme1/2 cup dry sherry.
column5: Allow ducks to stand in salted water one hour.  Remove from water and dry with a towel.  Rub generously with salt and pepper.  Stuff  cavities with part of vegetables.  Place ducks in a pan.  Arrange remaining vegetables around ducks.  Smoke for 1 hour.  Dust ducks with flour.  Add consomme, 1 soup can water and 1/2 cup dry sherry.  Continue smoking for about 3 1/2 hours or until done. Strain pan juices and add more sherry if desired.  Serves 4-6.Mother's Note: I have never done this--It's Jim's receipt.

column4: 2 pounds yellow squash, sliced2 eggs1 cup Mayo1/4 cup chopped green pepper1 small onion1 cup Grated Parm. cheesebread crumbs or potato chips
column5: Cook squash in water and drain.  Beat eggs and add to rest of  ingredients.  Add squash, top with butter and bread crumbs or crushed potato chips.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.Mother's Note:This is a good do ahead dish.

column4: 4 bacon slices12 small onions1 small green pepper, diced2 cups hot water1 pound green beans6 ears corn, broken in thirds1 tablespoon salt2 teaspoons sugar1/4 teaspoon white pepper6 small zucchini, cut in 1-inch chunks2 large celery stalks,  cut in 1-inch slices1 large tomato, cut in wedges
column5: 1.  In 6 quart-Dutch oven over medium heat, fry bacon until crisp; drain on paper towels.2.  To drippings in Dutch oven, add onions and green pepper; cook until golden; add hot water and next 5 ingredients.  Heat to        boiling; reduce heat to low, cover, simmer 10 minutes.3.  Add zucchini and celery; cover and cook 8 to 10 minutes until all vegetables are tender.4.  With slotted spoon, arrange vegetables on large  platter or in a large shallow bowl; crumble bacon and sporinkle over top. Arrange tomato wedges on top.

column4: 1 cup flour1 teaspoon salt1 1/2 teaspoon sugar5 Tblsps. butter, 1/2 teaspoon lemon rind1 hard cooked egg yolkl raw egg white
column5: Pour into mix bowl of processor in order given;  mix with off-on starts until ball is formed; Chill, shape into balls and press into small pans.  (individual)   Bake 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

column4: tuna filletsMarinade:1/2 cup peanut oil1/4 cup lemon juice2 Tablespoons chopped parsley2 Tablespoons chopped mint2 chopped cloves garlic
column5: Cook marinated fish (3/4 inch thick) 5 minutes under broiler, turn, and cook 2 minutes on other side.  Cook to 140 degrees inside.

column4: fillets of white fishflour, salt and pepperSAUCE:2 Tablespoons butter1 cup orange juice1 cup vermoth
column5: Simmer sauce ingredients until alcohol is evaporated.Sprinkle fillets with flour, salt, and pepper on all sides.Pour half of reduced sauce into baking dish.  Place fish on sauce, and cover with remaining sauce.  Bake 350 degrees for 20 minutes.Pour off sauce from cooked fish, cook to reduce, and replace on cooked fish.  Garnish with orange slices.

column4: 1 cup shelled, roasted, salted peanuts1 bunch green onions, choppedlemon juice2 Tablespoons honey1/3 cup soy sauce3 cloves garlic1 Tablespoon coriander2 Tablespoons hot dried pepper1/2 cup beef broth1/4 cup melted butter1 1/2 pounds lean pork or venison cut into bite size pieces, or 1" cubes.
column5: Mix all ingredients except meat in bowl of processor in order given. Cut off all fat from meat; cut into 1" pieces; marinate 8 hours or over night.    Place on cookie sheet and grill in oven untill done, or cook over grill as desired.   Boil remaining marinade and serve as a sauce for dipping

column4: 2 pounds okrasaltfreshly ground pepperSAUCE 3 Tablespoons vinegar 3 Tablespoons lemon juice 2 Tablespoons chopped shallots 1 1/2 cup butter
column5: Cook okra in boiling water for 45 seconds, drain, and cool  immediately.Heat sauce ingredients, adding butter tablespoon at a time to thicken If the sauce gets too hot, it will separate.  Cool it off over ice or  in the 'fridge, and cook again.Reheat okra  8 to 10 minutes in oven and pour hot butter sauce over.

column4: 1 baked 8-inch pie shell2 Tablespoons butter 1/2 cup sugar3 Tablespoons flour2 teaspoons cinnamon1/2 teaspoon ground cloves1/2 teaspoon allspice1 egg2 tablespoons vinegarl cup water
column5: Cream butter or margarine and sugar.  Measure and sift flour, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice;  add to creamed mixture.   Then add egg, vinegar, and water.  Cook in top of double boiler until thick.  Pour into pastry shell that has been baked 2 or 3 minutes.Bake at 350 degrees until done.  Yield:  l  8" pie.Mother's Note:Mary Hart had this somewhere, and wanted me to find the recipe, which I did.  I have never made it, but she thinks it is wonderful.

column4: 1  lb. flank or skirt steak, thinly sliced (or pork)3  Tblsps. soy sauce1  Tblsp. cornstarch1  Tblsp. Chinese rice wine or Dry Sherry (or wine)1 Tblsp. oriental sesame oil1 tsp. sugar2 Tblsp. vegetable oil1 garlic clove, peeled2 tsps. minced peeled fresh ginger1 clove garlic, peeled, minced1 cup chopped green onions1/2  lb. mushrooms, sliced1/2  lb. spinach, stemmedSalt and pepperFreshly cooked riceAdditional soy sauce
column5: Place beef in bowl, Combine 3 tblsps. soy sauce and next 3 ingreds. in small bowl.  Pour over beef and toss. Heat both oils in wok or heavy large skillet over high heat.  Add ginger and garlic and stir-fry about 45 seconds.  Add beef and  marinade and stir-fry until beef begins to brown, about 2 minutes. Add green onions and mushrooms and stir-fry until onions begin to soften, about 2 minutes.  Add spinach and stir-fry about 45 seconds. Season with salt and pepper.  Serve immediately with rice, passing soy sauce separately.

column4: 2 tomatoes2 lg. cans stewed tomatoes2 cans (6 oz.) tomato paste1 green pepper1 red pepper1 jalepeno pepper1 cup carrots1 cup celery1 cup red wine1/2 tbl. tabasco1 tbl. salt 1 tbl. pepper1/2 tbl. cayenne1/2 tbl basil1/2 tbl. garlic1 pound ground beef1/2 tbl. oregano1/2 tbl cumin1/4 cup dijon mustard1/2 cup fresh mushrooms1/2 cup Monterray Jack cheese2 cans (12 oz.) kidney beans1 can (12 oz.) black beans
column5: Fry and season ground beef.  Add all ingrediants to large pot and  cook for 10 to 12 hours on low heat.  season to taste with Tobasco.Mother's Note:  This is a recipe Charles got from Alex.  Never tried it.

column2: Sweet and Sour Cabbage Stew with Cumin Meatballs
column4: STEW:2 medium onions, quartered1  16-oz. can whole tomatoes2  T. safflower oil1/4 c. (or more) firmly packed brown sugar1 large green cabbage head, cored and cut into 1-inch chunks2 1/2 c. chicken stock or canned broth1/3 c. fresh lemon juice1/3 c. tomato paste1 1/2 t. salt1/2 teaspoon Hungarian hot paprika1/4 t. ground allspiceFreshly ground pepperHot pepper sauce (such as Tobasco)MEATBALLS:2 1/3 slices thin white bread, quartered1/4 small onion1 lb. ground beef chuck1/2 c. milk1 t. salt1/2 t. ground cumin1/2 t. ground corianderFreshly ground pepperl large tomato (about 6 ounces seeded, cut into 1/3 inch dice)Buttered cooked noodles
column5: For STEW:  Insert Steel Knife.  Process l onion at a time until minced.  Set aside.  Add tomatoes and chop coarsely. Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium heat.  Add onion and cook until soft, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.  Add tomatoes, 1/4 cup sugar, cabbage and next 6 ingredients.  Season with pepper and hot pepper sauce.   Bring to boil.  Cover and simmer  until cabbage is soft, about 30 minutes.For MEATBALLS:  Insert Steel Knife, Process bread until fine crumbs form about 5 seconds.  Add onion and process until minced.  Add ground chuck and next 4 ingredients.  Season with pepper.  Process until combined, about 10 seconds.  Wet hands and roll meat  mixture into 1 1/4 inch diameter balls, using about 1 tablespoon for each.Add meatballs to stew and stir gently.  Simmer uncovered until  meatbals are cooked through, shaking pot frequently to ensure even cooking, about 10 minutes.  Add diced tomato and stir.  Adjust seasoning, adding more brown sugar if desired.  (Can be prepared ahead.  Cover and refrigerate.  Rewarm before continuing.)  Place buttered noodles in large shallow soup bowls.  Spoon hot stew over  and serve.

column4: 2 lbs. sausage, cooked, drained1 cup chopped green pepper1 cup sliced cooked mushrooms2 Tblsps. flour1 tsp. curry1 1/2 cup milkBread Crumbs, butteredParmesan cheese
column5: Fry sausage until brown; drain on paper towels until there is NO fat.  Add Green Pepper and mushrooms, cook slightly.  Blend in  flour and curry.  Add milk and cook until thickened.  Add salt and cook one minute.  In oven safe baking dish, combine mixture with drained sausage; top with crumbs and cheese.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until warmed through.May be prepared ahead and frozen.
column6: Mother's Note:This is the secret recipe I never gave anyone in Suffolk.  Mary Perts gave it to me and told me to keep it for myself.  We all  used to love it before the world stopped eating fat.  It will freeze well--super to make ahead and serve with that mock egg-cheese souffle.  Keep it for yourselves.

column4: 1 cup sugar1 envelope gelatine1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/4 cup milk1 teaspoon vanilla1  3 oz. can coconut2 cups heavy cream, whipped
column5: 1.  Mix first three ingredients2.  Add milk, stir over medium heat until sugar and gelatine are dissolved.3.  Chill until set.4.  Add vanilla; fold in coconut  and whipped cream;5.  Pour into mold.  (or set until firm and cut with heart cutter)6.  Serve with raspberry sauce.Mother's Note: This is a wonderful dessert served to the Literary Club for a  Valentine's Party.  It is worth whatever it takes!

column4: 1  10 oz. frozen raspberries1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch1/2 cup red current jelly
column5: Thaw berries, combine  with corn starch and current jelly and cook until clear.  Strain seeds away.  Serve over Raspberry fluff.*Mother's Note:Sauce to go with Rasberry Fluff.  Sauce keeps in 'fridge for several days. *The dessert may be made ahead and frozen.  It is easier to cut into shapes then.  Also, it is best when  less than 3/4" thick.

column4: 1 cup fresh orange juice2 Tblsps. minced shallot or green onion1 1/2 Tblsps. white wine vinegar1 Tblsp. dry white wine1 Tblsp.firmly packed golden brown sugar2 Tblsps (1/4 stick) unsalted butter2 boneless chicken brest halves5 Tblsps. chilled unsalted butter, cut into 5 pieces1  2x 3/4" wide strip orange peel (orange part only), cut julienneSalt/freshly ground pepperFreshly grated nutmeg
column5: Bring first 5 ingredients to simmer in heavy small saucepan  over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.  Increase heat and boil until sauce is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 15 minutes.Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons butter in heavy medium skillet over medium heat.  Add  chicken and cook until just springy to touch about 4 minutes per side.  Transfer chicken to plates.Remove sauce from heat and whisk in 2 peices chilled butter. Set pan over low heat and whisk in remaining 3 butter pieces 1 piece at a time, removing pan from heat briefly if drops of melted butter appear.  (If sauce breaks down at any time, remove from  heat and whisk in 2 tablespoons chilled butter.)  Mix in orange peel. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.  Spoon over chicken.

column4: 1 cauliflower head, separated into floretsl broccoli head, same8 ozs. green beans, halved4 large carrots, cut diagonal into thin slicesDressing:1/2 cup red wine vinegar1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice2 1/2 Teaspoons W'shire sauce1 teaspoon sugar1 teaspoon dry mustard2 garlic cloves, minced1 1/2 cup vegetable oil.Salt/ freshly ground pepper2 med. red or green bell peppers, cut into strips1 basket cherry tomatoes,stemmed Lettuce leaves1/3 cup chopped chives
column5: FOR VEGETABLES:  Bring large pot of salted water to boil over high heat.  Add cauli and cook until crisp-tender.  Remove using slotted spoon and immerse in cold water.  Return water to boil.  Repeat cooking process with broccoli, green beans and then carrots.  Drain vegetables.  (Can be prepared 1 day ahead.  Cover and refrigerate.)FOR DRESSING:  Combine first 6 ingredients in large bowl.  Whisk in oil.  Season with salt and pepper.  (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Store at room temperature.) Combine cooked vegetables, bell peppers and tomatoes in large  bowl.  Pour dressing over.   Marinate at least 1 and up to 4 hours at room temperature.Line platter with lettuce leaves.  Arrange vegetables on top. Sprinkle with chopped fresh chives and serve.

column4: 1/4 c. sour cream with chives (or add 1 t.chopped green onions to sour cream.)2 t. Dijon mustard1/4 t. seasoned pepper or lemon pepper1/4 t. Prepared horseradish
column5: Combine all ingredients in microwave container.  Cover with waxed paper; cook on medium power for 1 minute. Spoon over hot cooked vegetables--green beans, carrots, asparagus, or mixed vegetables.

column4: 2 cups assorted prepared raw vegetables; (red or green peppers, onion, mushrooms, carrots, celery, spinach, snow peas, or thawed frozen peas; choose 3 or More from above.)3 ozs. linguine or fettuccine1 T. Olive oil1 clove garlic, crushed1/4 c. dry white wine or chicken broth2 T. grated Parmesan or Romano cheeseSalt and Pepper to taste
column5: Cook fettuccine in boiling, salted water according to package directions.Meanwhile, heat 10-inch heavy saute pan over high heat, add oil, then add red and green peppers, onion, mushrooms, broccoli and cauliflour buds, carrot and celery.  Cook, shaking pan or stirring often until vegetables are barely tender, about 3 minutes.Stir in garlic, wine or broth, salt and pepper.  Bring rapidly to a  boil, cook until wine is reduced by half.  Stir in spinach and snow peas; cover and set aside to keep warm.  Drain pasta, turn into dinner plate, pour Primavera sauce over pasta, sprinkle with cheese.Note: makes 1 serving of about 480 calories, including 235 fat calories.

column4: TARRAGON VINEGAR1 Pint Tarragon leaves1 Pint wine vinegar2 whole cloves1 clove garlicGARLIC VINEGAR1/4 lb. peeled bruised garlic1 t. salt.5 cloves10 peppercorns1 t. Caraway seeds1 qt. wine vinegar
column5: TARRAGON VINEGARPick a pint of Tarragon leaves and crush them slightly with the hands.  Add 1 pint of wine vinegar, 2 cloves, and 1 clove of garlic halved.  Cover and let stand.  After24 hours, take out the garlic, then let stand 14 days more.  After that strain and press through a cloth.  Bottle and cork tightly. Spearmint, basil, dill or any other herb may be put into vinegar as in Tarragon Vinegar.  After straining, a whole herb branch may be added for appearance.                          GARLIC VINEGARPut  peeled bruised garlic cloves into a jar with a cover.  Add salt and other seasonings previously pounded in  a mortar;  add hot wine vinegar, let stand 1 week, then strain and bottle, corking well.

column4: 1 C. softened butter or oleo1 C. sugar1 egg1 t. almond extract1/2 t. vanilla extract2  1/3 C. unsifted flour1 t. cream of tarter1 t. baking sodaSugar for topping
column5: Cream butter or oleo and sugar; mix in egg, almond and vanilla. In separate bowl, blend flour, cream of tartar, and soda.* Stir into butter mixture.  Blend well.  Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.  Roll on floured board to 1/8" thickness, cut and place on greased cookie sheets.  Bake at 350  degrees for 8 minutes.Sprinkle with sugar while hot.Cookiedough may be divided, shaped, and placed on waxed paper. Roll out in long tubes to desired circumference. Chill.   Cut with knife.*I  mix entire recipe in one bowl and leave out this step.

column4: 1/2 c. finely chopped onion1/4 c.  chopped green pepper1 T. Margarine2 T. flour1 T. grated Parmesan cheese1/4 t. saltDash Worchestershire sauceDash hot pepper sauce1/2 c. finely crushed Ritz crackers (round)1 (7 oz.) can minced clams1/2 c. chopped water chestnuts1 T. Margarine, melted
column5: In saucepan, cook onion and green pepper until tender but not brown in 1 tablespoon margarine.  Stir in flour; add cheese, salt, W'shire sauce and red pepper sauce.Add 1/4 cup of the crackers; mix well.  Stir in the undrained clams  and the water chestnuts.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Divide mixture among 6 coquille shells, baking shells or individual baking dishes.Combine remaining crackers and the 1 tablespoon melted margarine; sprinkle atop mixture in each shell.Bake in 350 degree oven 15 minutes or until heated through.  Garnish with cherry tomatoes and parsley if desired.

column4: 1 1/2 C. Beef Broth2 1/2 to 3 1/2 C. water1 cup lentils, picked over, and washed.1 cup chopped onions1 cup diced carrots1 cup finely diced smoked pork, (cut away fat)1 teaspoon butter or margarine1/2 cup diced celery2 cloves garlic, peeled minced4 cups packed, coarsely chopped collard greensFreshly ground black pepper
column5: 1.  In large saucepan, bring broth and 2 1/2 cups of water to boil. Add the lentils, carrots, 1/2 cup of onions, and the pork. Return the mixture to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer the mixture for 30 minutes.2.  Meanwhile, melt the butter or margarine in a small skillet, add the remaining 1/2 cup of onions and the celery, and saute the vegetables for 5 minutes or until they turn a light gold.  Add the garlic, and saute it, stirring it, 1 minute more. Set the vegetables aside.  (If in a hurry, I omit this step and add all at once with the lentils.)3.  After the lentils have simmered for 30 minutes, add the remaining sauteed vegetables and the collard greens.  Cover the pan, and simmer the soup for about 20 minutes (more if desired)      checking the liquid and adding more water, if needed.  Stir in the pepper, and serve the soup hot.

column4: 2 egg whites3 eggs3/4 cup skim milk1/4 t. salt1/4 t. freshly ground pepper2 t. butter or margarine1 small onion peeled sliced2 c. sliced mushrooms3 med. apples, sliced, peeled3 ozs. chedddar cheese (3/4 cup)2T. minced Parsley
column5: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.Melt butter in oven proof skillet, saute mushrooms, onions, and apples 3 to 5 minutes.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in  egg mixture, tilting pan so that eggs run under the apple mixture.Cook until the omelete is nearly set and its bottom is lightly  browned.Place skillet in hot oven, bake for 5 minutes or until set on top. Cut into quarters and garnish with parsley.
column6: Jane Brody's Good Food Cook Book

column4: 2 eggs1/2 cup oil1 cup self-rising corn meal*1 cup sour cream7 oz. can creamed corn*1 Tablespoon baking powder  1/2 teaspoon salt  3/4 cup cornmeal, PLUS 3 Tablespoons        cornmeal
column5: Beat eggs, combined with sour cream, oil and corn.  Add corn meal.  Stir only until mixed, do not over beat.  Pour into a greased, hot iron skillet or 9" x 9" pan.  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until brown.

column4: 1 (14 to 16 pound) Turkeymelted butter or margarine1 tablespoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper2 teaspoons seasoned salt1 teaspoon ground poultry seasoning (or sage)1 teaspoon garlic powder1/2 teaspoon ground ginger1 teaspoon paprika1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper1/4 teaspoon dried basil
column5: Clean and dry turkey; set aside neck giblets and liver.  Brush turkey with melted butter.  Mix dry seasonings and rub thoroughly into inside and outside of bird.  Truss and tie securely; place breast-side up in roaster (or place on broiler pan with a rack).  Add 1 cup of water, cover and bake at 350 degrees until tender, about 3 to 4 hours.  If turkey is not evenly browned, remove cover for last 1/2 hour and lower temperature to 300 degrees.Mother's Notes: My recipe for every turkey except one which was smoked. This is a good way to have fool-proof gravy. ** Note:  Pan juices can be combined with giblets to make a delicious gravy.** Note:  Roasting chicken may be used instead of turkey.

column4: 56 ounces. pineapple juice1 1/2 cup sugar12 oz. can pink lemonade4 1/2 cup water1/2 gal. strawberry ice cream4 quarts ginger ale, chilled2 tablespoons almond extract
column5: Combine pineapple juice, sugar, lemonade, water and almond ext.Add ice cream.  Stir in ginger ale.

column4: 4 C. chopped broccoli1/4 c. raisins1/4 c. chopped onions8 strips cooked bacon,chopped1/4 c. sugar3/4 c. mayonnaise2 T. vinegar
column5: Cut broccoli into bite size floweretts.  Add raisins and onions.Marinate overnight with dressing  (sugar, mayo, and vinegar)Cook bacon and crumble over just before serving.

column4: 2 cups cake flour (sifted)2 cups sugar2 tsp soda2 tsp cinnamon1 tsp salt1 cup Wesson oil4 eggs3 cups carrots, shredded1 tsp vanilla
column5: Combine flour, sugar, soda seasonings and oil.  Then beat in eggs, one at a time, carrots and vanilla.  Pour into 2 greased 9" cake pans.    Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes.  When cool, frost cake prepared as follows:Icing: Cream together  8 oz. Phil. cream cheese and 1/4 lb. butter add 1 box confectioners 10x sugar, 1 tsp vanilla and 1 cup pecans.  Beat    until well blended.

column4: 2 slices rye bread2 slices  firm white bread1 cup water1 pound lean ground beefl med. onion, chopped1 egg, beaten to blend3 T. freshly grated Parm. cheese2 T. minced fresh parsley1 t.. salt1/4 t. pepper1  8-oz. tomato sauce1 t. dried oregano, crumbled
column5: Grease 9 x 5 loaf pan.  Place rye and white breads in large bowl.   Pour 1 cup water over.  Let soak 5 minutes.  Drain off any excess water.  Mash bread finely with fork.  Add ground beef, onion, egg, Parm. cheese, parsley, salt and pepper and mix well.  Transfer to  prepared dish, shape into loaf shape.  (Can be prepared 6 hours ahead.  Chill.)Preheat oven to 375 degrees.  Bake meat loaf 30 minutes.  Pour tomato sauce over.  Sprinkle with oregano.  Bake 20 minutes more.   Let stand 5 minutes.

column4: 1 1/2 pounds ground beef1 tbs. salad oil2 medium onions, chopped1 tbs. chili powder1 tsp. salt1/2 tsp ground red pepper1/2 tsp. ground cumin1/2 tsp. dried oregano leaves1 16 oz. can tomatoes, drained1/2 lb. Monterey Jack cheese, shredded1 med. sized tomato, chopped1 8 3/4-ounce can whole-kernel corn, drained2 tbs. chopped parsley6 7-inch flour tortillas
column5: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.  Cook beef.  Remove from pan and  saute onions until tender.  Retrn beef to skillet, stir in chili powder, salt, red pepper, cumin, and oregano; cook 1 minute.  Stir in  tomatoes, and break into smaller pieces.   Remove from heat and add cheese.In bowl, mix chopped tomato, corn and parsley.Spoon beef mixture into center of each tortillia; roll up and  arrange in shallow 2 1/2 quart casserole.  Top with tomato-corn  mixture.Bake uncovered 20 to 25 minutes until warmed through.

column4: 1/2 c. Olive oil2 T. Red wine Vinegar1/2 t. chopped onion1 T. Dijon mustardSalt and Pepper4 boneless skinless chicken breasts1/2 C. English walnuts1 C. Orange sections1 C. Feta cheese, cubed
column5: Mix first five ingredients for salad dressing. Saute chicken brests in small amount of butter until cooked. Add remaining ingredients and toss with salad dressing. Serve cold or at room temperature.  Serves 4.Mother's Note:This is a good do it ahead, and nice served for a group.

column4: SHORTBREAD:2  1/2 cups flour1/2  cup sugar1 cup butter1/2 teaspoon saltTOFFEE:1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk1  1/2 cup butter1 cup sugar3 Tablespoons corn syrup1 teaspoon vanillaCHOCOLATE TOPPING:3 squares unsweetened choc.2 Tablespoons butter
column5: I.  Mix all ingredients for shortbread with pastry cutter.  Divide dough into three equal parts and  gently press into bottom and about 1/2 to one inch high up the sides of three 8 inch spring-form pans.  Bake at 325 degrees for 15 to 30 minutes until     light brown.  Cool.II.  Mix all ingredients for toffee filling in sauce pan and bring to boil for 4 minutes. This will burn easily, so stir constantly until slightly brown. Pour over the three crusts and cool.III.  Melt chocolate squares with butter, mix well, and pour over cooled caramel toffee, tilting pans so that chocolate will completely cover top of toffee with thin layer.Cool, and slice into very small pie shaped wedges.  This is a very rich dessert, and should only be served in small pieces.   I store in the 'fridge. Freezes well.

column4: 1 whole sausagecorn on cobShrimp1T. Old Bay SaltSugarPotatoes (optional)Fresh tomato wedges for garnish
column5: In large pot of boiling water, cook sausage for 20 minutes. Add corn on cob for number of servings; cook 5 minutes. Add shrimp (1/2 lb. per person); cook 3 minutes. Pour all onto large platter and garnish with fresh tomato wedges.Recipe #2:Add 1/2 salt; a red, gold package of shrimp boil, Potatoes Onion or twoMother's Note:This is easy and fun for a casual party.

column4: 18 oz. pineapple preserves18 oz.  Apple jelly5   oz. jar horseradish1 T. ground pepper1.12 oz. ground mustard
column5: Mix all ingredients and store in tight container in refrigerator for  weeks.Serve over a block of cream cheese.

column4: 1 large cabbage1  large onion1 green pepper1 cup sugar3/4 cup oil1 cup vinegar1 tsp. dry mustard1 tsp. celery seed1 Tablespoon salt
column5: Shred in order listed.  DO NOT STIR.  Pour sugar over this.DO NOT STIR.  Combine remainder of ingredients and bring to boiling point.  Pour over cabbage while hot.  DO NOT STIR.  Refrigerate at least overnight.    (This delicious slaw keeps 2-3 days.)

column4: Layer in order given:3 c. unpeeled sliced apples2 c. fresh cranberries1 c. oatmeal1/2 c. chopped pecans3/4 c. white sugar3/4 c. brown sugar1 stick melted margarine
column5: Layer ingredients* in order given; pour melted oleo over all; bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 60 minutes.Mother's Note: *I layered apples and cranberries, and mixed melted oleo with other intredients until crumbly to spread on top. This is the Thanksgiving recipe.  I peel the apples, however.

column4: 1- 3 1/2 to 4 pound broiler/fryer1 large onion, chopped6 cups hot water3 cups sliced carrots1/4 tsp peppersalt1 cup all purpose flour1 egg1 to 2 tbsp milk1 cup chopped celery with leaves
column5: 1. In 8-qt.   Dutch oven or large saucepot over high heat, heat chicken, onion, water, carrots, pepper and 1 tbsp salt to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 45 minutes or until chicken is fork tender. 2. Remove chicken to cutting board and allow to cool. 3. Meanwhile, prepare the rivels: In medium bowl with fork, stir flour, egg, 1/2 tsp salt and approximately 1 tbsp milk, to make a crumbly but moist mixture. 4. With spoon, sprinkle rivels into simmering soup.  Add celery; cook 20 minutes or until tender. 5. Cut chicken from bones into small chunks; stir into soup; reheat.Mother's Note:This is the chicken soup recipe we have always used.  If it is not "strong" enough, I add some bouillon cubes.  I make the rivels  in the food processor.

column4: 3-4 T. butter2 C. Yellow or white cornmeal2 1/2 t. Baking powder1/2  t. Baking soda1 T. Sugar1/4 C. Chopped peperoncini peppers2 Eggs1 1/2 C. Buttermilk
column5: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Melt butter in 9" ovenproof skillet and keep warm.  Sift dry ingredients into a mixing bowl, stir inpeperoncini.  Whisk together eggs, buttermilk and melted butter and quickly fold into dry ingredients.  Pour into warm skillet and bake 25-30 minutes.

column4: 3 ears fresh corn1/2 stick butter2 T. flour1 small onion, chopped2 scallions, finely chopped2 cans chicken broth3 ripe plum tomatoes, peeled seeded, and chopped1 C. small shrimp, shelled (halve if large.)
column5: Cut corn from cob and set aside.  Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat, add flour and stir together for a minute or two before adding the onion and scallions.  Cook for 10 minutes over very low heat stirring often.  Add broth and tomatoes and simmer for 30 minutes.  Add corn and shrimp, cook for another 10 minutes  and serve at once.

column4: 1  lb. backfin or lump crab meat1/2 c. MayonnaiseMix into mayo:saltwhite pepperdash of cayenne1 Tblsp. Lemon juice1/2 tsp. Worchestershire sauceDash of maceTouch of mustard
column5: Season Mayonnasie with salt, peppers, lemon juice, Worchestershire sauce, mace, and mustard to taste.Carefully mix with crab meat.This may be served hot in shells with bread crumbs and dots of  butter.  Brown in oven to serve hot.

column2: Black Bean Salad with Cumin Vinaigrette
column4: 1 pound dried black beans, rinsed, picked over1 tsp. cumin seeds2 Tbsp.  or more fresh lemon juice2 Tbsp. Soy sauce2 tsp. Dijon mustard1 large clove garlic, pressed1/2 c. extra virgin olive oil1 red bell pepper, diced1 yellow bell pepper, diced1/2 cup red onion2 tsp. minced seeded jalapeno chiliessalt and pepperhalved cherry tomatoesminced cilantro
column5: Cook beans according to package.  Cook cumin seeds in heavy small skillet over medium heat until lightly toasted and aromatic, stirring constantly, about one minute.  Transfer cumin seeds to work surface and cool.  Finely chop cumin.  Whisk 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, soy sauce, mustard and garlic in large bowl.  Gradually whisk in oil.  Add beans, cumin, bell peppers, red onion, and chilies and toss well.  Season with salt and pepper.  Cover and regfrigerate at least 2 hours to blend flavors.  Let beans stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.  Taste, adding more lemon juice if necessary.  Garnish with tomatoes and cilantro and serve.

column4: 1 lb. medium raw shrimp peeled and deveined3 eggs, beaten to blend3 T. dry Sherry1 T. soy sauce1 T. oriental sesame oil2 teaspoons cornstarch12 slices firm white bread, trimmedSesame seeds
column5: Mince shrimp to coarse paste using heavy large knife.  Transfer to large bowl.  Add  eggs, Sherry, soy sauce and sesame oil.  Mix well.  Stir in cornstarch.  Drain off any excess liquid.  Spread 3 T. shrimp mixture on each bread slice, covering completely.  Sprinkle with Sesame seeds.Heat 2 inches oil to 375 degrees.  Add bread, spread side up, fry until golden brown, about 1 1/2 minutes.  Turn and cook until spread is golden brown, about same.  Remove from oil using slotted spoon; drain on paper towels;  cut into 1/2" wide strips.  Serve

column4: 2  2-pound ripe Brie cheeses,well chilled1 cup sliced almonds, toasted2 Cups Cranberry ChutneyItalian  parsley sprigsCrackers
column5: Cut rind off top of each cheese and discard.  Cut cheeses in half horizontally.  Place lower half of each on baking sheet  cut side up.  Spread 1/2 cup almonds over each.  Replace top half.  Bring to room temperature.Preheat oven to 275 degrees.  Cover each cheese with 1 cup   chutney.  Bake until cheesea are just soft but not runny, about 10 minutes.  Garnish with parsley sprigs.  Serve with crackersMother's Note:        Recipe we gave the caterer to serve at the Cindy/Mark wedding.

column4: 2 cups cranberries1 cup whole frozen unsweetened raspberries, thawed1 cup honey1 tart apple, peeled, cored, and coarsely chopped1 large orange, peeled, pith removed, cut into 1/4 inch thick slices and seeded1 medium celery stalk, sliced1/2 cup raspberry vinegar2 T. water1 1/2 t. grated fresh ginger1/4 t. dry mustard1/8 t. ground cloves
column5: Makes about 2 1/2 cups.Combine all ingredients in heavy large saucepan.  Bring to boil, stirring frequently.  Reduce heat and simmer until mixture thickens and liquid is syrupy, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour.  Spoon into hot jars.  Cover and cool.  Store in refrigerator until ready to use.(Can be prepared 3 weeks ahead.)Mother's Note:Recipe we gave caterer to serve at the Cindy/Mark wedding.

column4: 2  10-oz packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry1  1/2  cups dry bread crumbs1 cup grated Parmesan cheese1/2 cup (1 stick) butter room temperature2 eggs, beaten to blend3 garlic cloves, mincedSalt and freshly ground pepper
column5: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.  Combine first 6 ingredients  in medium bowl.  Season with salt and pepper.  Form into  2-inch balls and place on baking sheet.  Bake until just brown, about 45 minutes. Serve immediatley.

column4: 1   9-inch frozen pie crust (thawed)1/4 cup mayonnaise1/4 cup sour cream1 T. chopped fresh dill or 1 t. dried dill weed2 t. prepared mustardSalt and Pepper1  3.6-ounce can smoked oysters, drained, patted dryFresh dill sprigs
column5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Place pie crust on flat surface,  press down sides.  Using 3-inch diameter cookie cutter, cut into rounds.  Gather scraps;  roll and cut additional rounds.  Press dough rounds into miniature muffin tins.  Bake until golden, about 10 minutes.  Cool completely.  (Can be prepared ahead and stored in airtight container, or bought prepared at bakery.) Mix mayonnaise and next 3 ingredients in small bowl.  Season with  salt and pepper.  Spoon mayonnaise into tartlet shells.  Top each with smoked oyster.  Garnish with dill sprigs.Mother's Note:Recipe we gave caterer to serve at the Cindy/Mark wedding. Good for teas.

column4: 1/4 cup mayonnaise or reduced calorie mayo2 T. minced celery2 T. minced onion1 t. curry powder1 cup crab meat4 heads Belgian endive, spears separated2 T. minced fresh cilantro
column5: Combine first 4 ingredients in small bwol.  Mix in crabmeat. Season to taste with pepper.  (Can be prepared 8 hours ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)Place 1 heaping teaspoon crab mixture on base of each endive spear.  Sprinkle with cilantro.  Arrange on platter in spoke pattern and serve.Mother's Note:Good "Biddy-Tea" or cocktail fare.

column4: 2 1/2 cups sugar2 cups cake flour1 3/4 cups + 3 T. all purpose flour1/8 t. baking soda1/8 t. salt4 large eggs2 teaspoons unsalted butter1 t. vanilla extract1/4 t. almond extract1 1/2 cups whole almonds sightly toasted (about 5 ounces)
column5: Preheat oven to 300 degrees.  Grease and flour 2 large cookie sheets.  Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl of electric mixer. Add eggs, butter, vanilla and almond extract.  Mix just until com- bined.  Stir in almonds.  Transfer dough to well-floured surface. Using well floured hands, form into 5 or 6   1 x 6-inch logs.  Space logs 2 1/2 inches apart on prepared sheets.  Bake until light golden brown, about 1 hour (logs will spread and flatten.)  Cool slightly.Transfer logs to cutting board.  Using serrated knife, slice logs on  diagonal into 1/2-inch-wide biscotti.  Place biscotti on cookie sheet, cut surface down.  Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes.  Cool completely on rack.  (biscotti can be prepared 5 days ahead.  Store in airtight container.)

column4: 2  lbs. ground round steak2 eggs1 1/2 cups bread crumbs3/4 cup ketchup1 tsp. Accent1/2 cup warm water1 package Lipton's onion soup mix2 strips bacon1  8-oz. can tomato sauce
column5: Mix thoroughly.  Put into loaf pan, cover with two strips of bacon if desired.  Pour over all one 8 oz. can tomato sauce.  Bake one hour at 350 degrees.  Serves sixMother's Note:The best and easiest meatloaf recipe.  Good left over for sandwiches.

column4: 1 pkg. Hillshire Farm Smoked saausage, or Kielbasa3 T. Oil3 1/4 cups broccoli, carrots, onion, mushrooms, etc.3/4 c. grated parm. cheese1 1/2 cups raw riceSalt pepper, Garlic, Oregano
column5: Cook rice and keep warm. Saute vegetables in oil until crisp and tender. Add sausage and seasoning.Heat thoroughly. Mix in 1 1/2 cups parmesan cheese and serve immediately over warm rice sprinkling with remaining rice.Mother's Note:       Good quick, emergency dinner.  I only use about 1/3 of the sausage.

column4: chicken, cut up1 can of cream of celery soupchopped parsleychopped pimentochicken brothalmondspaprikasalt and pepper
column5: Put cut  up chicken pieces in a shallow casserole.  Cover with 1 can of cream of celery soup, thinned with a little broth.  Add remaining ingredients to taste.  Sprinkle top with almonds and paprika.  Cook in oven at 375 degrees for 1 hour.Mother's Note:  This is a quick, easy B+ dish.  Chicken broth is not necessary, but I use it to replace some of the soup.

column4: 1 quart fresh strawberries1 cup sugar3 Tablespoons corn starch1/2 cup waterbaked 8 or 9 inch pie shellWhipped Cream topping:1/2 pint whipping cream2-3 Tblsps. sugar1 t. vanilla
column5: Divide the berries, using the best of them to place in cooled pie shell. Take the other half and crush berries, adding sugar, water and corn starch and boil until clear.  Cool and pour over the uncooked berries.  Refrigerate about two hours.  Before serving beat one half pint of whipping cream until it stands in soft peaks, sweeten to taste, add vanilla to taste, and spread over top of berry pie.
column6: Episcopal CookbookIce cream may be used if desired instead of whipped cream.

column4: 1 Gallon good strong coffee2 scant cups sugar1 qt. whipping cream2 qts.  vanilla ice cream or chocolate  or both
column5: Make one gallon good strong coffee.  Stir in scant 2 cups of sugar while coffee is hot.  Let chill completely.  When ready to serve, mix with the cream which has been whipped stiff.  Cut the ice cream into large pieces and add to punch bowl  with other ingredients.  Stir and serve in punch cups.  Add powdered sugar to taste if it is not sweet enough. Mother's Note:  Chocolate ice cream, Kaluah, and chocolate sauce  may be added as well.  For the proportion for coffee, you should get about 15 cups from one pound.  This should not be made with weak coffee.  It is yummy, and everyone likes it.

column4: 3 cups flour1 1/2 t. salt1/4 cup sugar1/2 cup water2/3 stick margarine1/2 cup cold water1 yeast cake1 egg, beaten
column5: Sift together salt and flour and set aside.  Melt margarine,water and sugar.  Mix cold water and yeast cake.When the hot mixture has cooled, add yeast mixture and 1 egg to the flour.  Mix well.  Cover and put into refrigerator.  Will keep for several days. Shape as desired. Allow to rise 2 to 3 hours, depending upon weather.  Bake at 450 degrees until browned and done.Mothers Note:  These are wonderful, but I make them with the dried yeast (not quick), and use hot water as directed on package. Can also be made into a nice loaf of bread.

column4: 1  1-lb. can jellied cranberry sauce3 Tb. Lemon juice1 c. heavy cream, whipped1 3-oz. pkg. cream cheese, whipped1/4 c. mayonnaise1/4 c. sifted confectioner's sugar1 c. California walnuts, chopped
column5: Crush cranberry sauce with fork, add lemon juice, pour into paper cups (cup cake cups).  Combine remaining ingredients, spread over cranberry mixture in cups, cover each tightly and freeze until firm.  Cut or tear paper cup away, place on lettuce, and serve.Mother's Note:This is a good do ahead salad for serving with turkey, etc.  I use cranberry sauce with crushed berries just because I like the texture.  Also, it is easier to do if you freeze the red layer a bit first before putting the white layer over it--inhibits bleeding.  These can be made far ahead and stored in container in freezer to use when needed.  It also helps them to keep their shape to place the cups in muffin tins as they freeze.

column4: 2 c. stewed pumpkin1 c. brown sugar1 tsp. ground ginger1 tsp. ground cinnamon1/4 tsp. salt2 Tbsp. melted butter2 eggs1 c. milk2 Unbaked pie crusts 8-9 inch
column5: Mix ingredients in order listed.  Stir in butter last and bake in hot oven--400 degrees for 10 minutes--then lower heat to 325 and cook until done, about 45 minutes.  (Done is when they don't shake in the center.)Mother's Note:This is the pumpkin pie I have always made, either with canned or with fresh cooked pumpkin.  It will make two smallish pies or one big, thick deep dish pie.  I also like to bake the crusts a little first so that they will not be " doughy."

column4: 1 Pkg. Elglish Muffins1 stick margarine1 Jar Old English Cheese Spread (Farm Fresh)1  7oz. can crab meat, drain well2 Tbs. mayonnaiseSeason salt to tasteOld Bay to tasteCayenne Pepper to taste
column5: Soften margarine and cheese in microwave. Add other ingredients and mix.  Put into freezer to "harden" a few minutes to make spreading easier.  Spread on 12 muffins halves.  Cut into quarters.  Broil until hot and bubbly.  Drain slightly on paper towel to absorb grease.   Serve hot. Makes 48 quarters.

column4: 2 cups fresh sliced peaches (fairly thin)3/4 cup sugar (or less to taste if fruit is sweet)3 Tblsps. cornstarch1/2 stick butter1 Tblsp. lemon juice1/2 tsp. almond flavoringbaked pie shellWhipped cream
column5: Peel and slice peaches.  Add sugar, mix and let stand until juice comes out (2 or 3 hours).  Drain juice into saucepan, add cornstarch and butter. Cook until thickened.  Mix lemon juice with peaches to prevent darkening (pie usually doesn't last long enough for the peaches to darken.)Cool syrup and add almond flavoring.   Mix with peaches and  pour into baked, cooled pie shell.Cover with whipped cream sweetened and flavored with almond flavoring.

column4: PUDDING:3/4 c. raisins2 T. dark rum1 lb. French bread, cut into 1" cubes3 c. milk (not low or nonfat)1 c. half and half3 eggs, beaten to blend2 c. sugar3 T. unsalted butter2 T. vanilla1/2 t. ground cinnamonWhiskey Sauce - See recipe under Sauce
column5: FOR PUDDING:   Place raisins in small bowl.  Pour rum over.  Let soak 20 minutes.Preheat oven to 325 degrees.  Butter a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan or pyrex dish.  Place bread in large bowl.  Pour milk and half and half over.  Let soak 5 minutes.  Whisk eggs with sugar, butter, vanilla and cinnamon in medium bowl.  Pour over bread.  Add raisins and rum and toss to coat.  Transfer bread mixture to prepared pan. Bake until top is deep  golden brown(bread may puff above rim of  pan), about 1 hour.Serve warm with whiskey sauce and dollops of whipped cream.Mother's Note:This is VERY rich and VERY good.  Serve with warm sauce. Be sure to use good French bread--not ordinary white bread.

column4: 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter1/2 cup firmly packed golden brown sugar1/2 cup sugar1 egg3 Tablespoons whiskey
column5: Melt butter with both sugars in heavy saucepan over low heat,  stirring until sugars dissolve.  Whisk egg in small bowl to blend.  Gradually whisk in some of melted butter mixture.  Return mixture to saucepan and whisk until smooth, 1 minute; do not boil.  Whisk in whiskey.Spoon sauce over warm bread pudding.Note:  If you don't want to mess with the egg, whisk in scant 1/4 cup cream instead for a fine sauce.

column4: 8 string beans2 carrots1 small onion or green tops1/4 head of cabbage1 clove of garlic2 pieces of chicken2 pork chopsTo Taste:Salt, Pepper, MSG, and paprika1 small pkg. mung bean noodles*
column5: Boil meat until tender, reserving broth.  Add salt.  Bone chicken, cut chicken and pork into small pieces.  Saute garlic and onions in a small amount of fat.  Add the pork and flaked chicken.  Stir.  Add the string beans, carrots, and shreadded cabbage.  Stir and cook until vegetables are crisp.  Pour in reserved broth and bring to boil, add noodles.  Cook 10 minutes more.  Add MSG, paprika, salt and pepper to taste.Mother's Note:Soak the noodles in warm water for about 15 minutes before cooking.  Any type of vegetable may be substituted, and I add shrimp as well.

column4: chicken breast (2-4 pieces)1 teaspoon olive oil2 green onions with tops, chopped1 clove garlic5 ozs. chicken broth5 ozs.  good wineCapersCooked pasta
column5: Brown and cook chicken in 1 teaspoon of olive oil.  When done,   remove meat from pan and saute onions and garlic.   Add wine and broth and reduce by about half.  Return chicken to sauce; pour over cooked pasta and add capers to taste.Mother's Note:This is quick, easy, no fat, and good.  Be sure to use lots of capers, for they are what make the dish tasty.

column4: 1 cup medium pearl barley, divided2-2 1/2 quarts beef stock1 T. olive oil or butter1 cup leeks, chopped2 cloves garlic, minced1 shallot, minced1 T. grated fresh ginger root1/4 cup dry red wine1 T. light soy sauce1 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced thinly1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
column5: Place 1/2 cup barley in large stockpot.  Cover with water and bring to a boil; remove from heat.  Cover pot and allow to soak for 1 hour.  Drain barley, return to stock pot.  Add beef stock bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer partially covered for 30 minutes.Meanwhile, in medium skillet, saute the remaining barley in 1 tablespoon oil until golden.  Add leeks, garlic, shallot and gingerroot.  Saute until leeks are limp.  Add mixture to stock, along with wine and soy sauce.  Continue cooking at a simmer, uncovered for 30 more minutes or until barley is tender.  The sauteed barley will still have some crunch.Meanwhile, saute mushrooms in oil or butter until light golden.  Add chopped parsley and saute for several minutes.  Add to barley and stock and cook for 15 minutes.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  Remove from heat and allow to rest for about 30 minutes for flavors to mingle.  Return to heat and bring to a boil.  Serve in hot soup plates.

column4: 2/3 c. water1 1/2 t. salt2 T. yeast1 Tablespoon sugar (scant)1 oz. chopped onion1 1/3 cups high gluten flour8 or 9 ozs. rye flour1 tsp. carraway seed2 Tablespoons butter, softEGG WASH: SALT-RYE FLAKES1 egg2 ozs. (1/4 cup) rye flakes* 2 1/2 ozs. milk                    2 ozs. Kosher salt (2 1/2 T = 1 oz.)
column5: Place water and salt in machine.  Add yeast slowly.  Stir in sugar, onion, flours, carraway seed, and butter.  Mix until dough pulls away from mixing bowl.  Place on floured surface; knead; cover and let rise in bowl one hour; Punch down when double, roll out, cut into two pieces.  Shape into round loaf, dip in egg-wash.  Roll each loaf in salt-rye to cover all curfaces.  Let rise again for 30 minutes.  Bake at 300 degrees for one hour.  Cool on rack.  To  serve warm, heat oven to 500 degrees, but loaf in half, then slice and reshape and wrap in foil.   Heat 5 to 7 minutes.MOTHER'S NOTE:If I don't have rye flakes, I have put some oatmeal into the machine long enough to slightly course grind it.  Works fine.  Course salt is a must, however.

column4: 2 cucumbers, thinly sliced1 T. wine vinegar1 T. sugar2 t. sesame seed oil1 t. soy sauce1/4 cup olive oil1/2 t. salt1/4 t. hot-pepper sauce
column5: Put sliced cucumbers in a bowl with a coverCombine the rest of the ingredients and pour over cucumbers. Chill.  These will keep for several days.

column4: 1 pkg. yeast (2 1/2 t.)3 1/3 c. flour1/4 t. baking soda1 1/2 t. salt1 unbeaten eggHEAT:1/4 C. water3/4 C. Cottage cheese3/4 c. sour cream3 Tbs. sugar2 Tbs. whole dill seed3 Tbs. minced dried onion1 1/2 Tbs. Butter
column5: Add first five ingredients in order listed to bread machine. Mix and warm the remaining ingredients to between 100 and 120 degrees and add to machineSelect white bread and press start.

column4: 3 eggs2 cups sugar1 cup oil1/4 teaspoon baking powder2 teaspoons soda1 teaspoon salt3 teaspoons cinnamon3 teaspoons vanilla2 cups (packed) raw grated zucchini3 cups flour1 cup milk1 cup nuts
column5: Beat eggs; add sugar, oil, and vanilla.  Blend well.  Stir in zucchini.  Add dry ingredients.  Fold in nuts (optional). Bake for one hour at 350 degrees in two  9 x 5  loaf pans for 45 minutes or until tester inserted into thickest part of loaf comes out clean.

column4: Marinate egg plant in:1 clove garlic1/4 c. Balsamic Vinegar1/2 c. olive oilTampanade Spread:1/2 c. calamata olives, seeded2 garlic cloves1/2 teaspoon capers1 anchovy fillet1/2 teaspoon lemon juice2 teaspoons olive oilSandwich ingredients:4 Japanese eggplant, slicedlarge roasted red peppers4 ripe tomatoes4 slices Mozarella cheese1 tablespoon olive oilHoney wheat bread
column5: I.  Marinate egg plant and peppers in sauce.2.  Make tampanade spread, in food processor or blender. This may be kept in the 'fridge for several weeks.3.  Grill eggplant, peppers, and tomatoes if they are not homegrown or are greenish.4.  Build sandwich. Spread both slices of bread with tampanade spread, generously. Layer on eggplant, slices of roasted peeled peppers, tomato slices and cheese. Brush outside of sandwich      with small amount of oil, and grill slightly on both sides until cheese is melted.

column4: 7 pounds cucumbers, thinly sliced2 1/2 cups finishing lime mixed with 2 gallons water5 pounds sugar3 pints vinegar1 teaspoon whole allspice1 teaspoon whole cloves1 teaspoon celery seeds1 teaspoon salt
column5: Let cucumbers stand in lime water for 24 hours.Drain.  Soak in clear water, changing water ever hour for four  hours.Mix sugar, vinegar and spices and bring to a boil.  Pour over  drained cucumbers and let stand overnight.Next day, boil cucumbers and syrup for 1 hour.  Pack in sterlizied jars and seal.Yields about 8 pints.*Recipe of Vivian Lane Gwaltney

column4: 4 egg whites2   3/4 c. sifted flour4 t. baking powder3/4 c. butter 1 c. sugar1/2 c. sugar1 c. milk3/4 t. salt1 t. vanilla extract1 t. almond extract
column5: Cream butter and one cup sugar by hand 15 minutes. Add flour, milk and baking powder in thirds.  Stir only until mixed. Beat egg whites until they stand in peaks and add 1/2 cup sugar, a little at a time, and beat until it makes a satiny meringue. Fold gently into batter with spatula . Add other ingredients. Cook in round pans which have been buttered and floured.  Bake at 350 degrees until straw inserted comes out clean.
column6: McCall's MagazineMother's Notes:  This is the cake for Mummy's famous coconut cake.  It may be baked in either two or three                            layers.  The secret is creaming the butter and                            sugar by hand until it looks like whipped cream.                            The heat of your hand melts the butter and makes                            the mixture fluffier.

column4: 1 c. granulated sugar1/4 t. salt2 T. white corn syrup2 unbeaten egg whites3 T. water1 t. vanilla1 1/2 c. sifted confectioner's sugar
column5: Mix all ingredients except vanilla and confectioner's sugar in top of double boiler.  Beat well and place over boiling water.  Cook until mixture stands in peaks, beating the entire time with rotary beater.  Remove from heat, add vanilla and confectioner's sugar and blend until smooth and thick.  Generous for two 9 inch layers or will ice three 8 inch layers.  Especially  good for devil's food layers or with coconut.Mother's Note:  This makes very generous icing.  It is enough to use to decorate birthday cakes with  different colors.  Just add more confectioner's sugar if it is too thin, or a drop more water if it is too thick.  I like to use flake coconut betweek layers to make the cake easier to slice.

column2: PICKLED BABY CARROTS WITH MUSTARD SEEDS, HONEY, DILL
column4: 3/4 c. white wine vinegar1/2 c. honey2 T. whole mustard seeds2 1-pound packages ready-to-eat peeled baby carrots2 T. minced fresh dill or 2 t. dried dillweed
column5: Whisk first 4 ingredients in large bowl until well blended.  Cook carots in large pot of boiling, salted water until just crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.  Drain well.  Add hot carrots to dressing.  Cool carrots to room temperature in dressing. Cover and chill overnight, stirring occasionally.  (Can be made 3 days ahead.)Bring carrots to room temperature.  Stir in dill and serve.

column4: 2 lemons, peeled2 t. horse radish3 t. Worstershire sauce1 t. celery salt1 t. lemon pepper1 1/2 t. garlic powder1 t. pepper2 t. Texas Pete2 t. salt46 ozs. tomato juicepinch parsley10 ozs. vodka
column5: Peel and seed lemons.  Place lemons and next eight ingredients in  blender and mix.* Add juice, parsley and vodka.*Mix first nine ingredients.  This will keep in 'fridge for ages.

column4: rice filling-prepare ahead4 T olive oil3 lg. onions chopped1 clove garlic finely chopped1 1/2 C uncooked long grain rice1 t lemon zest1/2 C lemon juice2 T chopped fresh dill1/4 C chopped flat leaf parsleysalt & pepper to taste2 T pine nuts6 scallions(3 in. of green left on) fine chop3 C defatted veg broth or water1 egg white, lightly beaten--------------------------1 med to lg cabbage2 med onionshalved and slivered2 T butter1/2 C golden raisins6 T lemon juice2 T brn sugar1 can (28 oz) plum tomatoes crushed w/ juice.
column5: 1.   to prepare rice filling, place oil in large pot; saute onions and garlic over low heat for 10 mins.  Add rice and cook for 10 mins., stirring. 2.  Add remaining Rice Filling ingredients except egg whites and stir to mix. Bring mixture to boil, rerduce heat, cover and cook over low heat for 15 min or until liq is absorbed and rice tender. Cool to room temp andmix in egg white.  Set aside and refrig.   3.  Cabbage; core and remove outer leaves 4. Boil cabbage in large pot of salted water. 5.  Separate lg leaves and pat dry; save smaller leaves;  sliver remaining small leaf core and set aside. 6. Remove tough center rib of lg. leaves. 7.  Place lg leaf on work surface and cover cut out rib area with a smakker leaf; Place 2 T of rice filling in centerand roll leaf to make a cabbage roll; secure with toothpick. 8.  Melt butter in lg pot,add slivered onions and cabbage; cook 5 min. Add raisias, lemon juice, and brown sugar; Cook 10 min; Add tomatoes, bring to boil, Remove from heat. 9.  Ladle 1 C of tomato sauce into lg pot, layer in cabbage rolls (about 8 to ea layer and cover with remaining sauce. Bring to boil, reduce to low, cover and cook for 2 hrs 10.  Serve in shallow dish.  Remove toothpicks and spoon sauce over.

column4: Cookies:2 sticks butter1/3 c. powdered sugar1 c. flour2/3 c. corn starchGlaze:2 1/2 c. powdered sugar1/2 c. melted butter2 T. fresh lemon juice
column5: I.  For cookies:a.  Beat softened butter and sugar together for one minute.b.  Sift, and add dry ingredients.c.  Blend for one minute.d.  Drop by teaspoons full on ungreased cookie sheet.e.  Bake in 350 degree (preheated) oven for 15 minutes.II.  For Icing:a.  Melt butterb.  Add sugarc.  Add lemon juiced.  Put on slightly warm cookiese.  Best not eaten right away.

column4: 1 lb ground beef1 envelope Old El Paso Taco Thick 'n chunky Picante1 Pet*Ritz Deep Dish Pie Crust, frozen1 egg1 1/2 c. shredded Jack or Ched. cheese1 can (4.5 ozs) Old El Paso chopped Green chilies1/3 Cup broken Tortilla chipsShredded lettuceSour Cream
column5: 1.  In skillet, brown ground beef; drain.  Add taco seasoning mix and 1 cup picante.  Simmer 5 to 8 minutes; remove from heat.  Stir in egg.2.  Sprinkle frozen pie crust with 1/2 cup cheese; top with green chilies. Sprinkle Tortilla chips over top.3.  Bake in preheated 350 degree oven on preheated baking sheet for  20 to 25 minutes.  Garnish with shredded lettuce, sour cream and remaining picante.

column4: 5 lbs. small red potatoes1/2 c. dry white vermouth3/4 c. safflower oil2/3 c. apple cider vinegar3 tsp. tobasco sauce3 T. sugar3 T. grainy mustard3 cloves garlic, minced1 tsp. cumin1 T. celery seed6 scallions, chopped1 orange bell pepper, dicedsalt and pepper6 fresh basil leaves6 ozs. bleu cheese crumbled
column5: Place scrubbed potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water.  Bring to a boil over high heat and immediately reduce to a simmer, cooking potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes.  Don't overcook.   Drain potatoes well and cool slightly.  Cut them in half.  While they are still warm, toss the potatoes in a large bowl with the vermouth. In a medium bowl, whisk together safflower oil,vinegar, tobasco, sugar, mustard, garlic, cumin, and celery seed.  Gently stir in scallions and orange pepper.  Pour dressing over potatoes. Season with salt and pepper.  Cut the basil leaves in long thin strips.  Sprinkle over the potatoes, add crumbled bleu cheese and toss.  Can be made in advance, but is best served right away. *Note:  I usually half this recipe!

column4: 3 cups all purpose flour2 cups sugar1 t. baking soda1 t. salt1 t. ground cinnamon3 eggs, beaten1 c. vegetable oil1 1/2 t. vanilla extract1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, undrained1 c. chopped pecans1 c. chopped bananasCream Cheese Frosting1/2 c. chopped pecans1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese softened1/2 c. butter or margarine1 (16 oz) powdered sugar1 t. vanilla extract
column5: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large mixing bowl; add eggs and oil, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened.  Do not beat.  Stir in vanilla, pineapple, 1 cup pecans, and bananas.Spoon batter into 3 greased and floured 9-inch baking pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool in pans 10 minutes, remove from pans and cool completely.Spread frosting between layers and on top and sides of cake; then sprinkle 1/2 cup chopped pecans on top.  Yield:  one 3-layer cake.Cream Cheese Frosting:    Combine cream cheese and butter, beating until smooth.  Add powdered sugar and vanilla; beat until light and fluffy.  Yield; enough frosting for one 3-layer cake.

column4: 2 (3-ounce) packages lemon gelatine2 cups small curd cottage cheese1/2 cup mayonnaise3/4 cup finely chopped green pepper1 teaspoon grated onion1 1/2 teaspoons salt, divided1 2/3 cups tomato juice, divided1 cup diced celery1 cup boiling water1 (6-ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained quarteredoptional:  1/2 pound peeled cooked shrimp
column5: Add 1 cup of boiling water to 1 package lemon gelatin; coolIn blender, puree cottage cheese until smooth.Combine mayonnaise, green pepper, grated onion, cottage cheese and 1/2 teaspoon salt; mix with cooled gelatin and pour into 7-cup gelatin mold.  Refrigerate until set, approximately 2 hours.Dissolve the second package of lemon gelatin in 1 cup hot tomato juice; add 2/3 cup cold tomato juice, 1 teaspoon salt and diced celery.*  Pour on top of first set layer; place artichokes on top.  Refrigerate until set.  (serves 12-16)*If shrimp us used in recipe place on top of first layer before adding second mixture.

column4: 1 stick butter1/4 cup all-purpose flour4 cups milk2 T. Chopped onion2 t. chicken bouillon granules2 t. finely chopped fresh parsley1 t. salt1/2 t. freshly ground black pepper1/2 t. ground nutmeg1 pound fresh crab meat1/2 pound fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces (optional)Chopped fresh chives for garnish
column5: In a large heavy saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat.  Whisk in flour and cook 3 minutes.  Gradually whisk in milk.  Add onion and next 5 ingredients.  Increase heat and bring to a boil.  Then reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until soup thickens, stirring occasionally.  Add crabmeat and cook 10 to 15 minutes until soup is creamy.  Add asparagus, if desired, and cook 5 to 7 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Serve garnished with chopped fresh chives.

column4: 3 T. flour1/2 t. ground cumin1/2 t. chili powder1/2 t. garlic powder1/4 t. ground cinnamon1 1/2 lbs. lean beef chuck, cut in 1" cubes2 T. vegetable oil1 C. beef broth1/2 c. apple juice6 potatoes, peeled/quartered2 med. sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed1 green bell pepper, 2" strips1 red bell pepper, same1 onion, peeled and slivered1 10 oz. can tomatoes with green chilies1 8 oz. can tomato sauce2 T. honey2 Granny Smith apples, cut into 1" cubes1 15 1/4 ozs. can dark red kidney beans, drained2 T. chopped flat-leaf parsleyShredded cheddar cheese for garnish; coarsely chopped black olives for garnish.
column5: 1.  Combine flour, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder and cinnamon in a large bowl.  Add the beef cubes and toss with a fork to coat.2.  Heat the oil in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.  Brown the beef, in batches, on all sides.  Return the beef to the pot.  Add the broth and apple juice.  Cover and simmer over med. heat until the meat is tender, about 1 hour.3.  Add the potatoes, bell peppers, onion, tomatoes, tomato sauce and honey.  cover and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 30 to 35 minutes4.  Add the apples and kidney beans.  Cover and simmer until the apples are tender, about 15 minutes.  Stir in the coopped parsley.  Serve in shallow bowls, garnished with the cheese and chopped olives.Mother's Note: 570 calories per serving; 86 g. carbohydrates, 34 g protein, 11 g. fat, 68 mg cholesterol.  ++ I used venison.

column4: 2 Eggs1/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon baking soda3 rounded tablespoons cake flour1 cup sour cream*2 tablespoons sugar1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel1/2 cup blueberries2 tablespoons butter, divided*this recipe was tested withLight Sour Cream.  I used "real."
column5: Prepare blueberry sauce.  Keep warm while preparing pancakes. Beat eggs in a bowl.  Add salt, baking soda and cake flour.  Stir in sour cream , sugar and lemon peel and whisk until smooth.  Fold in blueberries. Generously spray griddle with nonstick cooking spray.  Heat over medium-high heat until water droplets sizzle when sprinkled on griddle.  Add 1 tablespoon butter and allow it to melt.  Spoon batter by tablespoonsful to form 2-inch pancakes.  Cook on one side until tops are bubbly and edges set, 3 to 5 minutes.  Gently turn pancakes over and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer.  Transfer to serving plate.Melt another tablespoon butter, and continue cooking batter.  Pancakes should be served as soon as cooked.  Serve with Blueberry Sauce.M.'s note:  These are like the IHop silver dollar pancakes--light and good.

column4: 1/2 cup blueberies1/4 cup maple syrup1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamonJuice of 1 lemon
column5: Combine blueberries, maple syrup, cinnamon and lemon juice in small pan and simmer 10 minutes.

column4: 1 lb. fresh mushroomslg. bunch green onions7 cloves garlic, curshed1 stick butter, divided1 lb. cooked venison1/2 c. white wine1 tsp. salt1 tsp. fresh rosemary3 tsps. fresh dill
column5: Use half of the butter, melted; add chopped mushrooms, onions, garlic and saute.Add salt, wine, and rosemary; saute until reduced by 1/3.Remove from heat, stir in dill.Let cool 15 or 20 min.  Pulse a few times in food processor;Add cooked venison; Pulse several times more; add remaining butter and process until smooth.  If desired, form into a ball and garnish with a coating of fresh chopped parsley. Serve with crackers.

column4: 2 1/2 pounds medium sized red potatoes, unpeeled, scrubbed and quartered1/2 cup olive oil10 cloves garlic2 teaspoons chopped fresh Italian parsley3/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper
column5: In large saucepan, boil potatoes in enough water to cover by 1 inch, 10 to 20 minutes or until tender; drain.In small saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.  Add garlic cloves and cook until tender and golden.Mash unpeeled potatoes with parsley, salt and pepper. Stir in garlic and oil until thoroughly mixed.  Reheat if needed.Spoon into warm serving bowl.  Serve warm.

column4: 2 cups all purpose flour1  1/2 cups sugar2 eggs1 tsp. vanilla1 tsp. soda1/2 tsp. salt1 large can crushed pineapple, undrainedIcing:1 stick margarine1 can sweetened cond. milk1 cup coconut, flaked1 cup chopped pecans
column5: Mix all ingredients for cake mix together by hand until well blended.  Pour in greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan.  Preheat oven to 350* and bake 30 to 40 minutes.Icing:  In saucepan, melt margarine; add can of sweetened condensed milk. Stir constantly for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add 1 cup coconut and 1 cup pecans. Pour over cake while hot.Ann's note:  I use the skim sweetened condensed milk. Light butter will make it watery.

column4: 1 lb crab1 Tablespoon capers2 Tablespoon chopped scallionscayanne pepper to taste1 egg whitea little flour1 Tablespoon white wineButter
column5: Mix all ingredients lightly, and saute to taste in butter.

column2: Mount Bruce Station Leg of Lamb
column4: 3 1/2 to 4 pounds boneless leg of lamb2 T. olive oil1 t. salt1 t. freshly ground black pepper1 t. crushed coriander seeds1 t. minced garlic3 T. chopped fresh mint Zest and juice of 1 orange1/2 cup dry white wine, plus up to  1/4 cup more as needed
column5: 1.  Make about 15 small slits, 1/8 to 1/4 inch deep, over the surface of the meat.  Rub the olive oil over the lamb.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper. 2.  In a small bowl, combine the coriander, garlic, mint leaves, orange zest and half the orange juice into a paste.  Push about 1/2 of the paste mixture into the small slits.  Rub the remaining paste over the surface of the lamb. 3.  Place the lamb in a large sealable plastic bag or large, shallow dish.  Seal the bag or cover the dish and marinate 2 hours in the refrigerator.  Remove from the refrigerator and continue to marinate about 1 hour to bring the meat to room temperature. Heat the oven to 350*.  Place the lamb on a rack in a roasting pan.  4.  Add 1/2 cup wine and the remaining orange juice to the pan.  Roast uncovered for 35 minutes without basting.  Increase temp to 375*and roast another 35/40 min for medium doneness, basting 3 or 4 times.  If juices evaporate add more wine.  Deglaze pan.  Rest. 5.  Serve lamb with sauce made from the deglazed pan juices.

column4: 1 cup bulgur wheat2 cups boiling water3 large tomatoes1 large cucumber1 large green pepper4 spring onions1/4 cup fresh  mint leaves1/3 cup lemon juice2 Tbs. olive oilSalt and pepper to taste
column5: In a medium bowl,cover bulgur with boiling water; let stand 30 minutes.  Dice all vegetables.  Thouroughly combine all ingredients in a large bowl.   Chill several hours before serving.

column4: 2 Eggs2 Egg yolks1/2 Cup sugar2 tsps. finely minced lemon zest1/4 cup fresf lemon juice2 Tbs cold butter cut into small pieces
column5: Combine eggs, egg yolks,sugar,lemon zest and lemon juice in large metal bowl.  Place over a pan of simmering water( bowl not touchng water) and cook, vigorously whisking continuously with wire whisk, until thick, like pie filling, about 4 minutes.  Remove from heat. Whisk in butter.  Do not overcook or mixture will curdle.  Let cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate until needed.

column4: 1 Duncan-Hines Butter Recipe cake mix1/2  cup sugar3 eggs2/3 cup Crisco or Mazola oil8 oz. sour cream
column5: sift cake mix beat eggs  add sugar and oil mix 4 mins. , cook at 350 deg. for 45 mins.

column4: 1 tsp safflower oil1 yellow onion, finely chopped1 cup sliced leeks, white part only2 cups chopped raw potatoes (peeled or unpeeled)4 cups defatted chicken broth1/2 to 1 tsp salt1/4 tsp pepper3/4 cup low-fat buttermilk or nonfat plain yogurt2 Tbs. chopped fresh chives for garnishOptional: 2 tsp curry powder
column5: Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add and cook, stirring, 5 mins or untilonions are soft but not browned.  Add leeks and potatoes and cook 5 mins longer.  Add small amount of stock if onions begin to brown.  After 5 mins, add remaining stock. Bring to boil. Lower heat to medium and cook, covered, until potatoes are soft, about 15 mins. Stir in salt and pepper.  Cover, chill soup 1 hour. Stir in buttermilk. Serve soup chilled, garnished with chopped chives.Note:  Use defatted chicken stock.  New red potatoes are especially good in this soup.
