column4: 6 Chicken breasts1/2 c water1/2 c creamy peanut butter1/4 c bottled chili sauce1/4 c soy sauce2 T salad oil2 T rice vinegar (or white)4 cloves garlic, minced1 T grated gingerroot1/4 to 1/2 t crushed red pepperFruit Salsa1 c chopped fresh fruit, such as peaches, nectarines, pears or plums1 c chopped, seeded cucumber2 T thinly sliced green onion1 T sugar1 T salad oil1 T white vinegar
column5: Note:  Marinates for 12 to 24 hours!!Rinse and pat dry chicken, discarding skin, if desired.  Place in plastic bag.Combine remaining ingredients, whisking until smooth.  Pour over chicken in bag.  Seal bag, and turn to coat.  Marinate 12 to 24 hours.  Place chicken over med hot grill and grill until cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes, until no longer pink in middle.Serve over fruit salsa.  Leftovers makes great chicken salad (with mayo, chopped celery and sweet pickle).Fruit SalsaMix all ingredients together.  Cover and chill 1 to 2 hours.

column4: 2 cups packed fresh basil leaves, washed well and spun dry2/3 cup olive oil1/2 cup pecans,toasted golden brown and cooled1/3 cup freshly grated Parmesan2 large garlic cloves, chopped and mashed to a paste with 1/2 teaspoon salt
column5: In a food processor, blend together all ingredients and peper to taste until smooth. Pesto keeps, surface covered with plastic wrap, chilled, 1 week.  Makes about 1 1/4 cups.                                           OR *1 1/4 basil                              3 T. Olive oil 2 T pine nuts, toasted 2 T. parmesan cheese 1 t. minced garlic1/4 t. salt 1/4 cup chicken stockPut all ingredients except stock in food processor until finely chopped.  Add stock and process until smooth.

column4: 2 pkgs. frozen chopped spinach, cooked & drained1/2 cup Parm. Cheese1/2 t. pepper1/2 t. thyme2 T. onion, chopped3 cups Pepperidge Farm Stuffing6 eggs3/4 cups melted butter1 T. Garlic salt
column5: Mix all ingredients and form into balls. Bake at 350* for 15 to 20 minutes. May be cooked and frozen. Serve with honey mustard sauce.

column4: 1 (14 oz) package firm tofu3 tbs pine nuts1/3 cup sun dried tomatoes packed in oil1 tbs sun dried tomato oil1/2 cup packed fresh basil leaves1 medium clove garlic peeled and coarsely chopped1 tbs balsamic vinegar1/4 tsp saltfreshly ground black pepper to taste
column5: Drain tofu and cuat inatoquarters. Place on a paper towel lined plate,  cover with another paper towel and plate. Weight the plate down with a can and let tofu drain for 30 minutes.While tofu is draining, toast the pine nuts in a small skillet over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes until just starting to turn golden.In a food processor,chop the sun dried tomatoes,oil,basil and garlic.  Add the pine nuts and chop finely. Then add the tofu vinegar,salt and pepper. Process until blended.  Transfer to a crock and refrigerate. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before and serve with toast baguettes or crackers

column4: 1 tbs. olive oil1 cup chopped onion1 medium clove garlic minced1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper1/3 cup minced carrot2 tbs water2 plum tomatoes coarsley chopped1/2 tsp dried oregano1/2 tsp ground cumin1/4 tsp chipotle powder or cayanne pepper1 15oz can of black soybeans, drained1 3/4 cups vegetable broth1/2 cup water 1/4 tsp salt1 tbs chopped cilantro2 tbs chopprd parsley1 tbs lime juiceFresh ground pepper to taste
column5: In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over med. heat. When hot, add the onion and saute five mins. Add the garlic, bell pepper, carrot and 2 tbs water. Cover and cook,stirring occasionly, for 10 mins.Stir in chopped tomatoes, oregano,cumin and cayenne pepper. Cook covered 5 minsStir in drained soybeans, broth, water and salt. Bring to boil and reduce to med heat and simmer for 15 mins.Mash some of the beans and vegetables with the back of a spoon and simmer fot 5 more mins. Stir in cilantro, parsley, pepper and lime juice.  Remove from heat and set aside for 5 mins before serving

column4: 1 small new potato3 c. chicken broth3 (1/4" thick) slices ginger1 carrot, pared & diced1 celery rib, diced1 jalapeno chile, cored, seeded and minced1 small lime, grated & juiced1/2 boneles, skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced1 t. soy sauce1/4 c. minced green onionsFreshly ground white pepper
column5: Boil potato in water to cover in 2-quart pan until tender, about 30 minutes.  Peel and dice.  Set aside.In same pan, combine chicken broth, gingerroot, carrot, celery and jalapeno chile.  Grate rind of lime and add to soup.  Simmer until carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.  Add chicken to soup along with potatoes, lime juice, soy sauce and green onions.   Simmer 3 to 5 minutes for flavors to blend and chicken to cook through.  Season to taste with pepper.  Discard ginger.  Serve hot.

Grated sharp cheese      Half as  much grated carrot      Grated onion      Little grated green pepper      Little grated red pepper      Bit of hot red pepperButter the bread to make the sandwiches
column6: Good with a basil leaf on the sandwich.Mother

column4: 1 1/2 cups flour, divided1 teaspoon sugar1 pkg. quick-rise yeast (2  1/2 Teaspoons)1/2 cup water (105 to 115*)1 teaspoon olive oil1/2 teaspoon salt (divided)Cooking spray, & pinch of cornmealTOPPING:1/3 cup homemade pesto1 cup pizza or spaghetti sauce1/2 cup sliced green pepper1 tablespoon fresh cilantro1 cup shredded part skim mozarella cheese1 cup shredded cheddar cheese1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
column5: 1.  Lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with knife. 2.  Dissolve sugar and yeast in warm water in a large bowl.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Add 1 1/4 cups flour, oil, and 1/4 teaspoon      salt; stir to form a soft dough. 3.  Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface.  Knead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes); add enough of remaining flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, to prevent dough from sticking to hands. 4.  Place dough in a bowl coated with cooking spray; turn to coat top. Cover; let rise in a warm place (85*), free from drafts, 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. 5.  Preheat oven to 450*.  Punch dough down; roll dough into a 12-inch circle on a lightly floured surface.  Place dough on a baking sheet or a 12-inch pizza pan coated with cooking spray and      sprinkled with cornmeal.  Let dough stand 10 minutes. 6.  Spread other ingredients over dough in order given.  Bake at 450* for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden.  Remove to cutting board, cut into wedges and serve.

column4: 1 small onion, chopped 1/3 C.1 Tbsp.  olive oil1 cup long-grain rice1/2 tsp. ground cardamom1/2 tsp. paprika1/4 tsp. ground corriander1/4 tsp. ground cinnamon1/4 tsp. ground cumin1/4 tsp. black pepper1/8 tsp. ground nutmeg1 14 1/2 oz. can veg. broth (1 3/4 cups)1/4 cup water 1 cup chopped fresh spinach or one package frozen1/4 cup golden raisins1/4 cup sliced almonds1/4 to 1/2 tsp rose water (optional)Small fresh spinach leaves (optional garnish)
column5: In a medium saucepan, cook onion in hot oil until tender, but not brown.  Stir in uncooked rice, cardamom, paprika, coriander, cinnamon, cumin, pepper, and nutmeg.  Cook and stir over medium heat about 5 minutes or until rice is golden.  Add broth and water.   Bring to boiling; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.*Remove from heat; let stand covered, for 5 minutes.  Stir in chopped spinach, golden raisins and almonds.  Sprinkle with rose water, if desired.  Garnish with small fresh spinach leaves, if desired.290 cal., 9 g total fat (1 g sat. fat), 0 mg chol., 437 mg sodium, 51 g. carbo., 2 g fiber, 6 g pro.*Mother's note:  I used frozen spinach and pot stickers added here. I did not use the rose water.This is good as a side dish or with the pot stickers as a main dish.

column2: Spaghetti Rotolo with Zucchini  and Bacon
column4: 1 lb. fresh young zucchini2 T. vegetable oil2 T. butter3 garlic clovesone 6-inch rosemary sprigSalt and Freshly ground pepper3 ozs. bacon, cut crosswise into fine julienne (1/2 cup)12 cup dry white wine1 pound imported spaghetti2/3 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese (2 1/2 ounces)
column5: 1.  Soak the zucchini in a bowl of cold water for 20 minutes.  Scrub under running water.  Trim ends and finely shred in a food processor or on a box grater. 2.  In a large deep skillet, combine the oil, butter, garlic and rosemary and cook over moderately high heat until fragraant; do not let the garlic brown. Discard garlic and rosemary.  Add the zucchini, season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring, until thoroughly coated, about 1 minute.  Stir in bacon and cook for 1 minute.  Add the wine and simmer over moderate heat until the sauce is creamy, about 6 minutes. 3.  Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling water with 1 1/2 T. of salt.  When cooked, add 3 T. of pasta water to sauce, then drain the spaghetti well.  Add to the sauce and stir.  Remove from the heat and add cheese. 4.  Spear one-sixth of the pasta with a long tined meat fork and hold it a few inches above the plate.  Working quickly twist the fork so the pasta forms a coil about 2 inches wide by 5 inches long; repeat using all spaghetti, and serve with remaining sauce.

column4: 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained1 small onion chopped (red, green, or Vidalia)1 can chopped tomatoes1 small can corn1 green pepper, chopped jalapeno to taste12 to 1 cup of prepared salsafresh cilantrocumincorreander
column5: Toss together and serve, chilledGood with chips, on omelette, as a sideDiced chicken may also be added.

column4: Crust:1 1/4 c flour1 T. fresh thyme or 1 t. dried1/2 t. salefresh black pepper to taste8 T. cold butter, cut small2 t. Dijon mustard4 T. ice waterFilling:6 T. olive Oil1 large onion, slivered2 each yellow and red peppers thinly sliced1 T. fresh thyme, or 1 t. dry1T. fresh rosemary or "Salt & freshly ground pepper1/2 c. slivered fresh basil1/4 c. chopped flat leaf parsley4 cloves minced garlicTopping:  1 C. grated fresh mozzarella cheese2 to 3 large ripe tomatoes cut into 1/4 inch slices                1/4 t. freshly ground black pepper 2 T. fresh thyme leaves1 T. chopped flat leaf parsley 1 T. extra-virgin olive oil
column5: 1.  Prepare pastry:  Combine flour, thyme salt & pepper; add butter, and mix; stir in mustard and water.  Form dough into a disc and chill for at least 1 hour. 2.  Filling:  Heat oil, add onions, peppers, thyme, rosemary, salt, & pepper.  Cook, stirring frequently until veggies are soft, and the mixture resembles marmalade, about 45 minutes. 3.  Add basill, parsley and garlic and cook, stirring, 5 minutes. 4.  Preheat oven to 375*; roll out pastry; transfer to an 11 inch tart pan bake for 10 minutes, check, bake 10 minutes more. 5.  Spread cheese over bottom; then reserved filling.  Arrange tomatoes to cover surface.  Sprinkle with pepper, thyme, and parsley.  Drizzle with olive oil.  Bake 40 minutes, rest for 10 min. before serving.

column4: 2 c. milk2 cakes yeast (3 tsp)8 c sifted flour1 lb butter, softened1 c sugar2 eggs1/4 c rumgrated lemon rind1 t salt1/2 c chopped almonds3/4 lb raisins
column5: Warm milk and add yeast with 1 c flour.  Mix well and let stand until light.  Meanwhile, cream butter and sugar.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Add yeast and remaining ingredients.  Knead until smooth and elastic.  Cover, let rise.  Divide into 3 parts.  Roll out slightly into rectangle.  Press center and brush with melted butter.  Let rise.  Bake in moderate (350) oven 25 - 30 minutes or until browned on top.Frost (for each loaf): 1 c confectioners sugar 2 T warm milk 1/2 t each vanilla and almond extractThese may be wrapped and frozen.

column4: 1 pound black eyed peas2 cloves garlic3 fresh jalapeno peppers1 whole onion1 small bell pepper2 beef bouillion cubes2 bay leaves2 T. Cavendar's all-purpose Greek seasoning
column5: Soak and cook dried black eyed peas, or use frozen/fresh peas.Brown chopped garlic, jalapenos, onion, bell pepperAdd bouillion cubes, bay leaves, seasonings, and enough water to cook the peas.Cook until peas are done.Serve over cooked rice for Hoppin' John.

column4: 2 T butter2 garlic cloves, minced4 c water3/4 t salt1/2 t pepper1/4 t dry mustard1/4 t tumeric1 c uncooked regular grits4 large eggs, seperated2 c sharp cheddar, shredded1/8 t hot sauce1/4 t cream of tartarpaprika
column5: Melt butter in med saucepan over medium heat; add garlic and saute until tender.  Stir un 4 c water and next 4 ingredients; bring to boil.  Gradually stir in grits.  Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 - 20 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from heat and add egg yolks, cheese, and hot sauce.Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks form.  Fold 1/4 egg whites into grits.  Fold grits into remaining egg whites.  Pour into a greased and floured 2 qt souffle dish.  Sprinkle with paprika.Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned.VERY VERY GOOD!

column4: 1 1/4 t. coarse black pepper1/4 t. salt4 tuna steaks1/4 c. chicken broth1 T. balsamic vinegar4 t. dark brown sugar1 T. soy sauce1/2 t. cornstarch1/4 c. diagonally sliced green onions
column5: 1.  Grill fish on grill pan, sprinkle with pepper and salt.  Cook 3 minutes on each side until medium-rare or desired degree of doneness. Remove from heat.*2.  Combine broth, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and cornstarch in a small saucepan.  Bring to a boil, cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Spoon glaze over fish; top with green onions.*Or brown in iron skillet on top of stove and finish cooking in oven at 450* for 10 minutes.

column4: 6 large red bell peppers1/2 cup golden raisins1/4 cup olive oil3 Tablespoons balsamic vinegar2 large garlic cloves, minced            PORK1 1/2 cups chopped green onions1 cup olive oil1/2 cup purchased barbecue sauce1/3 cup white wine vinegar3 Tablespoons light soy sauce2 tablespoons brown sugar1 tablespoon green hot pepper sauce (Tabasco)2 teaspoons Worchestershire sauce2 large garlic cloves, minced1 tablespoon honey1/2 teaspoon Lawry's seasoned salt3 pounds pork tenderloins
column5: For Peppers:Char peppers over gas flame or in a broiler until blackened.  Wrap in paper bag, let stand 10 minutes; peel and cut unto strips.  Mix all remaining ingredients; season with salt and pepper.(Can be prepared 2 days ahead, refrigerate.  Let stand at room temperature 2 hours before using.)For Pork:Mix all ingredients except pork in large bowl.  Place pork in shallow glass baking dish.  Pour marinade over; cover; chill at least 2 hours or up to 12 hours.  Prepare grill (medium heat) or broiler. Grill pork until meat thermometer inserted into center registers 155*, turning often, about 20 minutes.Slice, arrange on platter.  Spoon bell pepper mixture around pork.Mother's Notes:Charles cooks pork, then if it is not done enough, slices it into about 3/4" slices which he then grills.

column4: The Crust 2 1/2 sticks (10 ounces) unsalted butter, softened 1 1/2 cups confectioner's sugar, sifted 1/2 cup (lightly packed) ground blanched almonds 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/2 teaspoon vanilla bean pulp or 1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 2 large eggs, at room temperature, lightly beaten 3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour The Raisins:  1/2 cup golden raisins 3 tablespoons dark rum 3 tablespoons water The Banana:1 ripe but firm banana 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice 1.5 tablespoons unsalted butter sliver of habanero pepper, optional 3.5 tablespoons sugar pinch of freshly ground black pepper (about 2 turns of the pepper mill) The Ganache: 4.75 ounces of bittersweet chocolate (preferably Valrhona Noir Gastronomie), finely chopped 1 stick unsalted butter, cut into 8 pieces 1 large egg, at room temperature 3 large egg yolks, at room temperature 2 tablespoons sugar
column5: The Crust To make the dough in a mixer: Place the butter in a bowl fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on low speed until creamy. Add the sugar, almonds, salt, vanilla and eggs and, still working on low speed, beat to blend the ingredients, scraping down the paddle and the sides of the bowl as needed. The dough may look curdled - that's all right. With the machine still on low, add the flour in three or four additions and mix only until the mixture comes together for form a soft, moist dough - a matter of seconds. Don't overdo it. To make the dough in a large-capacity food processor: Place the butter in the work bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade and pulse and process, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed, until creamy. Add the confectioner's sugar and process to blend well. Add the almonds, salt and vanilla and continue to process until smooth, scraping the bowl as necessary. Add the eggs and process to blend. Add the flour and pulse until the mixture just starts to come together. When the dough forms moist curds and clumps and then starts to gather into a ball, stop! - you don't want to overwork it. The dough will be very soft, pliable and Play-Do-ish, more like your favorite butter-cookie dough than traditional pie dough - that's just the way it should be. To shape and chill: No matter the method you used to make the dough, gather it into a ball and divide into four pieces. Gently press each piece into a disk and wrap each one in plastic. Allow the dough to rest in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or for up to 2 days before rolling and baking. (At this point, the dough can be wrapped airtight and frozen for up to a month.) To Roll: 1. For each tart, place a buttered tart ring on a parchment-lined baking sheet and keep close at hand. Work with one piece of dough at a time; keep the remaining dough in the refrigerator. 2. Working on a lightly floured surface (marble is ideal), roll the dough into a round between 1/16 inch and 1/8 inch thick, lifting the dough often and making certain that the work surface and the dough are amply floured at all times. (Because this dough is so rich, it can be difficult to roll, but a well-floured surface makes the job easier. If you are a novice at rolling, you might find it easier to tape a large piece of plastic wrap to the counter and to roll the dough between that and another piece of plastic. If you do this, make sure to lift the top sheet of plastic wrap from time to time so that it doesn't crease and get rolled into the dough.) Roll the dough up and around your rolling pin and unroll it onto the tart ring. Fit the dough into the bottom and up the sides of the ring, then run your rolling pin across the top of the ring to cut off the excess. If the dough cracks or splits as you work (as it may, since it is so fragile), don't worry--patch the cracks with scraps (moisten the edges to "glue" them in place), and just make certain not to stretch the dough that's in the pan. (What you stretch now will shrink later.) Prick the dough all over with the tines of a fork (unless the tart will be filled with a runny custard or other loose filling) and chill it for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator or freezer. Repeat with the remaining dough, if necessary. To Bake: When you are ready to bake the crust(s), preheat the oven to 350F. Fit a circle of parchment paper or foil into each crust (cut the paper large enough to extend above the top of the tart) and fill with dried beans or rice. To partially bake the crust(s), bake for 18 to 20 minutes, or until lightly colored. If the crust needs to be fully baked, remove the parchment and beans and bake for another 5 to 7 minutes, until golden. Transfer the crust(s) to a rack to cool. The Raisins:  Place all the ingredients in a small saucepan over low heat and cook, stirring, just until the raisins are soft and plump, about 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and allow the raisins to macerate for at least 2 hours, or for up to a day. The Banana:1. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it close to your range. 2. Peel the banana and cut it on the bias into slices about 1/8 inch thick. Toss the banana slices with the lemon juice to keep them from discoloring. 3. Melt the butter in a large heavy skillet, preferably non stick, over high heat. If you are using the habanero pepper, add it to the pan along with the butter, then remove it when the butter starts to bubble. Add the bananas and turn to coat them with the bubbling butter. Sprinkle the sugar over the bananas and cook, still on high heat, turning the bananas, until they are golden and caramel-coated. (You need to work over high heat so that the bananas caramelize rather than melt.) Add the black pepper, stir, and cook for 1 minute more; the bananas will be soft inside and caramel crisp outside. Transfer the bananas to the parchment-lined baking sheet and pat them gently on both sides with paper towels to remove any excess butter; cool to room temperature. (The bananas can be caramelized a couple of hours ahead of tie and kept at room temperature.) The Ganache: 1. Center a rack in the oven and preheat the oven to 375F. Fill the crust, still on its parchment-lined baking sheet, with the raisins and all but a few slices of the banana. (You'll use the reserved slices to top the tart.) 2. Melt the chocolate and butter in separate bowls and cool each to 104F, as measured on an instant-read thermometer. (It's crucial to the creamy texture of the ganache that both the chocolate and the butter be 104F.) 3. In a medium mixing bowl, gently stir together the egg, yolks, and sugar with a small whisk; whisk just until the sugar is blended into the eggs, taking care not to beat air into the mixture. Switch to a rubber spatula and, little by little, gently stir in the melted chocolate; stir in concentric circles. Add the butter in the same manner--you'll have a glossy, perfectly smooth mixture; by incorporating the chocolate and butter slowly, you are creating an emulsion not unlike mayonnaise. Once mixed, the ganache must be used immediately, so quickly pour it into the crust. To Bake: Bake the tart for exactly 11 minutes--no longer--at which point the top will look a little dry around the edges but the center will be shiny and a little jiggly. Remove the tart from the oven and top with reserved slices of caramelized bananas. The tart is ready to eat as soon as it comes from the oven.

column4: 2 cups Pioneer Biscuit Mix2/3 cup milk1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning1 quart chicken or beef broth
column5: Mix first 3 ingredients.Drop by teaspoonfuls into boiling broth.Cover and simmer 5 to 8 minutes.
column6: Order Pioneer Biscuit Mix from Pioneer Flour Mills, 800-531-7912. http://www.pioneermills.com

column4: 1 teaspoon unsalted butter 4 large eggs 1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1/8 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, melted 1/4 cup Grand Marnier or other orange flavored liquer 2 cups half-and-half 8 slices day-old white bread, crusts removed and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 4 cups) 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips Spiced Cream (See Recipe)
column5: 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees farenheit. Grease a 6-cup (9 1/4 x 5 1/4 x 2 3/4-inch) loaf pan with the butter.2. Whisk the eggs, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, melted chocolate, and Grand Marnier together in a large mixing bowl until very smooth. Add the half-and-half and mix well. Add the bread and let the mixture sit for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 3. Pour half of the mixture into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the top with the unmelted chocolate chips. Pour the remaining bread mixture over the chocolate chips. Bake until the pudding is set in the center, about 55 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. 4. To serve, cut the pudding into 1-inch thick slices. Top with the spiced cream.
column6: Good Morning America By Emeril LagasseABCNEWS.com

column4: *	1 quart heavy cream *	1/4 cup granulated sugar *	1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon *	1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg
column5: 1. Beat the cream with an electric mixer on high speed in a large mixing bowl for about 2 minutes. Add the sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg and beat again until the mixture forms stiff peaks, another 1 to 2 minutes.

column4: 2 T. butter2 garlic cloves, minced4 cups water3/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper14 teaspoon dry mustard1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric1 cup uncooked regualr gritss4 large eggs, separated2 cups (8 ozs) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese1/8 teaspoon hot sauce1/4 teaspoon cream of tartarPaprika
column5: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add garlic, and saute until tender.  Stir in 4 cups water and next 4 ingredients; bring to boil.  Stir in grits.  Reduce heat, simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from heat, stir in egg yolks, cheese, and hot sauce.Beat egg whites and cream of tartar at high speed until stiff peaks form.  Fold 1/4 of egg whites into grits.  Fold grits into remaining egg whites.  Pour into a greased and floured 2-quart souffle dish; sprinkle with paprika.  Bake at 400* for 45 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned.

column4: 4 regular size tea bags2 cups boiling water1 1/2 cups sugar*1/2 cup lemon juice1 teaspoon vanilla extract1 teaspoon almond extract 2 quarts water
column5: Warm teapot by rinsing with small amount of boiling water.  Place tea bags in teapot; pour 2 cups boiling water over tea.  Cover and steep 3 to 5 minutes.  Remove tea bags.  Add sugar, lemon juice, and flavorings; stir until sugar dissolves.  Add 2 quarts water; stir.  Chill tooroughly.  Serve over ice.Yield:  2 1/2 quarts

column4: 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour1 cup packed brown sugar2 teaspoons baking soda2 teaspoons ground cinnamon1/2 teaspoon salt2 cups shredded carrot1 cup shredded Rome or other cooking apple3/4 cup raisins1/3 cup pecans1/4 cup flaked sweetened coconut1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained1/3 cup vegetable oil1/3 cup apple butter2 teaspoons vanilla extract2 large eggs2 large egg whitesCooking spray
column5: Preheat oven to 350*; Combine flour and next 4 ingredients (flour through salt) in a large bowl.  Stir in carrot and next 5 ingredients (Carrot throughpineapple); Combine oil and next 4 ingredients (oil through eggwhites); stir with a whisk until just moist.  Spoon into 24 muffin cups coated with cooking spray.  Bake at 350* for 25 minutes or until muffins spring back when touched lightly in center.  Remove muffins from pans immediately; cool on a wire rack.
column6: Muffins can be stored in an airtight container and frozen for up to 1 month.  Wrap in foil, reheat at 300*.165 calories

column4: 2 cups fresh sliced peaches (thinly sliced)3/4 cup sugar3 Tablespoons cornstarch1/2 stick butter1 Tablespoon lemon juice1/2 Teaspoon almond flavoringBaked pie shell
column5: Mix sugar and peaches and let stand until juice comes out.  (2 or 3 hours)Drain juice, add cornstarch and butter.  Cook until thickened.  Mix lemon juice with peaches to prevent darkening.  Cool syrup and add almondflavoring.Mix with peaches and put into baked pie shell.  Cover with sweetened almond flavored whipped cream.

column4: Beets to fill a 4 quart pan1 cup sugar1 cup vinegar1 cup water1 tablespoon pickling spices in cheese cloth bag
column5: Cook and peel beets.Slice and put into pot with brine.  Put beets into brine, boil, put into jars and seal.Makes about 5 quarts + 1 pint.
column6: Or these may be stored in the refrigerator.

column4: 1/4 cup onion*3/4 cup sugar1/2 cup tarragon vinegar1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard1 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder1/4 teaspoon salt1 1/2 cup oil added*Onion should be a good hearty onion--not a mild Vadilia
column5: Place first  six ingredients into food processor.  Blend.Add oil in small amounts with machine running.Pour on to spinach.

column4: 1 cup hollandaise sauceMarchand de Vin Sauce8 large, thin slices cooked ham (3/4 pound)8 (1/4 inch thick) sliced tomato2 teaspoons olive oil8 large eggs8 round slices of instant crisp toast or toasted     English muffin halves (Holland rusk)PaprikaGarnish:  Italian Parsley sprigs
column5: Prepare hollandaise sauce; keep warmWarm Marchand de Vin Sauce in a heavy pan over low heat.Warm ham slices; brush tomato with oil, and broil for 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated.Poach eggs, trim edges.Place crisp/toast on each plate; spoon 1/4 cuup Marchand de Vin Sauce over each.  top evenly with ham, tomato, egg, and holandaise sauce.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Garnish

column4: 3 tablespoons butter 3 tablespoons flour1 small onion, chopped1/2 cup chopped mushrooms1 large tomato, peeled, seeded, chopped1 garlic clove, minced1 celery rib, minced 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley1 cup dry red wine1 cup beef broth1 bay leaves12 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
column5: Melt butter in saucepan, whisk in flour, and cook until lightly browned.  Add onion and mushrooms; cook, sitrring constantly 1 minute.Add tomato and remaining ingredients; bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer stirring occasionally for 45 minutes.  Remove bay leaves before serving.
column6: this is served with Eggs Hussarde

column4: 2 cups Bisquick1 cup milk1 Tbsp. sugar2 Tbsp. lemon juice2 tsp. baking powder2 eggs
column5: Heat pan over medium-high heat; or use 375* griddle; grease.Stir all ingredients until blended.  Pour by slightly less than 1/4 cupfuls onto hot griddle.Cook until edges are dry.  Turn; cook until golden.

column4: 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, melted3/4 cup packed brown sugar1 egg1 1/2 cups chopped pecans1 teaspoon vanilla
column5: Preheat oven to 350* F.  Combine all ingredients.  Fill each unbaked tart shell.  Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool compoetely; dust tops with powdered sugar.(Filling for mini tarts made with wooden press)

column4: 1/2 cup butter or margarine, softened1 package (3 ozs.) cream cheese, softened1 cup flour
column5: Combine butter and cream cheese.  Add flour and mix to form a soft dough.  Chill at least overnight.Form the dough into 30 walnut-sized balls.  Place each ball of dough in a mini-muffin cup.  Dip the Mini-tart shaper in flour, press into the dough to shape perfect tarts.Pierce the shells with a fork.  Bake empty shells in 450* oven 10-12 minutes; or fill unbaked tart shells with one of the following fillings.  Bake as directed.

column4: 5 whole green onions, minced2 garlic cloves, peeled and minced1/2 lb. snow peas2 T. dried coriander 1 T. olive oil1/4 cup dry white wine1 lb. spaghetti, cookedSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste4 ozs. gorgonzola cheese, crumbled
column5: Saute green onions, garlic, snow peas and coriander in oil and white wine for  5 to 6 minutes.Pour the spaghetti into the vegetable mixture and combine.  Season with salt and pepper, then top with gorgonzola and serve.

column4: 4 cups mixed baby greens1 apple1 pearEnglish walnuts to tasteGorgonzola cheese, crumbled to tasteDressing:olive oilchampagne vinegarsugartaste of mustard
column5: Dress greens, and add apple and pear, washed, seeded, and cut into large dice.  Mix gently.Add nuts and cheese to top.

column4: 1 cup butter1 teaspoon Worchestershire Sauce3 Tablespoons Mustard3 Tablespoons brown sugar1 medium onion, finely chopped3 Tablespoons poppy seedsSmithfield hamSwiss Cheese, thinly sliced
column5: Cook onion in butter until caramelized and tender.Add other ingredients except cheese and ham.Spread about one teaspoon of mixture on small rolls; fill with Smithfield ham and Swiss cheese.Wrap in foil, bake 450* for 10-15 minutes.

column4: 35 to 45 Nilla Wafers5 to 6 medium bananas, fully ripened, sliced3/4 cup sugar, divided1/3 c flourdash salt4 eggs, seperated, room temp2 c milk1/2 t vanilla extract
column5: Combine 1/2 c. sugar, flour and salt intop of double boiler.  Stir in egg yolksand milk; blend well.  Cook over boiling water stirring constantly; 5 minutes or until thickened (this process can be speeded by heating the milk in the microwave first - heat to warm, not hot).  Remove from heat; stir in vanilla.  Spread small amount of pudding on bottom of 1 1/2 qt casserole; cover with laer of Nilla Wafers.  Top with bananas.  Pour about 1/3  of custerd over bananas and continue to layer wafers, bananas and custard to make 3 layers of each, ending with custard.  Beat gg whites until stiff but not dry.  Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.  Spoon over top of pudding, sealing well to edges.  Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes or until browned.  Cool slightly or chill.  Garnish with remaining wafers and banana before serving.
column6: Linda says this is too sweet and cuts the sugar by 1/4.

column4: 4 large egg yolks3 1/2 Tablespoons lemon juice1 Tablespoon water1/4 teaspoon saltDash Cayenne1/2 cup butter, just melted, not very hotServes 6 for Eggs Benedict-------------------------------------------------------or3 egg yolks3 Tablespoon lemon juice1 Tablespoon water2 drops red pepper sauce1/2 cup melted butter
column5: Heat egg yolks, lemon juice and water in 8-inch skillet over low heat, stirring constantly until you see wisp of steam or bubbles around edge or yolks begin to thicken.  Remove instantly and stir rapidly to cool down.  Cool about 3 minutes.Pour into blender.  Add salt, cayenne, and process a few seconds.  Allow to cool another 2 minutes.With blender running, slowly drizzle in melted butter.  If butter is not too hot, sauce will be perfect.  (140* for perfect sauce.)++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++In double boiler:  Place yolks, lemon juice, water, salt, lemon juice and rind.  Stir constantly until warmed.  Add melted butter, stir until thickened.Do not not boil water in double boiler.

column4: 12 ozs. Saute 10 minutes, remove from pan.Press rosemary mixture into both sides of pork chops, and cook for 6 minutes on each side.  Add wine, cook, covered, 10 minutes.  Add onion, pear, and brown sugar to skillet; cook, stirring occasionally 10 minutes.  Serve over pork chops

column4: 4 Tablespoons butter1 Tablespoon olive oil24 sea scallops1 Tablespoon minced fresh ginger1 garlic clove, minced1/4 cup dry white wine2 Tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar1/2 cup whipping cream3 Tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro1 green onion, finely chopped  sliced mushrooms  zucchini
column5: Sear scallops  in 2 tablespoons butter and oil, 1 minute per side.  Transfer to bowl.  Add ginger, garlic musshrooms, zucchini to pan and saute about 30 seconds.Add wine and vinegar and boil 2 minutes.  Add cream and remaining 2 tablespoons butter.  Boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon, about 3 minutes.  Return scallops and any collected juices to skillet.  Simmer about 2 minutes, Mix in cilantro and green onions.Serve with rice or crusty bread.
column6: Bon Appetit, June 2001, Page 146I added mushrooms and zucchini.

column2: LONDON BROIL WITH LEMON AND GARLIC
column4: 1 2-to 2 1/4 lb top sirloin steak1/4 cup olive oil1/4 cup fresh lemon juice6 large garlic cloves2 tablespoons Dijon mustard1 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary2 teaspoons grated lemon peel
column5: Place steak in heavy large resealable plastic bag.Puree remaining ingredients in blender or processor.  Season marinade with salt and pepper.  Pour marinade into bag with steak; seal bag.  Let steak marinate at room temperature 2 hours or chill up to 6 hours, turning bag occasionally.Preheat broiler or prepare barbecue.  broil or grill steak until cooked to desired doneness, about 7 minutes per side for medium-rare.  Transfer steak to platter; let stand 15 minutes.  Thinly slice steak crosswise.

column4: Crust:1 stick butter1/2 cup light brown sugar1 1/4 cup all purpose flour1/2 cup chopped pecans or walnutsFilling:7 tart apples, peeled, cored, sliced1/2 cup sugar1 teaspoon cinnamonTopping:1/4 cup light brown sugar1/2 cup chopped nuts1/2 cup flour1/2 teaspoon cinnamon1/4 teaspoon ginger1/8 teaspoon mace1/4 cup butter, cut into small pieces
column5: Crust:  Cream butter and brown sugar.  Add flour and nuts.  Press into 10-inch pie plate; refrigerate at least 10 minutesFilling:  Arrange apples on pie crust.  Combine 1/2 cup sugar with 1 teaspoon cinnamon and sprinkle over apples.Topping:  Combine topping ingredients, cutting in the butter last, until crumbly.  Bake at 400* for 40 minutes.

column4: 2 hard-boiled large eggs, yolks mashed and whites chopped fine3 tablespoons tarragon white-wine vinegar1 tablespoon Dijon mustard6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil3 tablespoons minced shallots (about 2)2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh tarragon leavesSalt and pepper1/2 pound fresh spinach, coarse stems discarded and leaves washed well andspun dry10 ounces fresh white mushrooms
column5: Make dressing: In a small bowl whisk together yolks, vinegar, and mustard and add oil in a stream, whisking constantly until dressing is emulsified. Stir in egg whites, shallots, tarragon, and salt and pepper, to taste. Thinly slice spinach leaves and spread on a platter. Cut mushrooms into very thin slices and mound on spinach. Spoon dressing over salad

column4: 8 to 12 (1/2" thick diagonal slices of country style Italian breadFor Marinade:5 tablespoons balsamic vinegar6 large garlic cloves, minced2 tablespoons chopped fresh thymeleaves or 2 teaspoons dried thyme,crumbled1/2 cup olive oil1 1/2 pounds fresh portobello mushrooms Garnish:  fresh thyme leaves
column5: Make the bruschetta: Grill the bread on an oiled rack set about 4 inches over glowing coals for 1 minute on each side. Make marinade: In a small bowl whisk together marinade ingredients. Put half of mushroom caps and half of marinade in each of 2 large sealable plastic bags, arranging mushroom caps in 1 layer, and seal bags, pressing out excess air. Marinate mushrooms at room temperature, turning bags over several times, at least 1 and up to 2 hours. Prepare grill. Remove mushrooms from marinade and grill 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until tender. (Alternatively, mushrooms may be grilled in a hot well-seasoned ridged grill pan over moderately high heat.) Transfer mushrooms with tongs to a cutting board and slice thin. Spread 1 side of bread with gorgonzola butter. Arrange warm mushrooms on toasts and spoon vinaigrette over each bruschetta. Garnish with thyme. For gorgonzola butter:2 ounces gorgonzola cheese (about 1/4 cup), at room temperature1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softenedMake gorgonzola butter while mushrooms are marinating: On a plate with a fork mash gorgonzola and butter together until blended well.For red pepper vinaigrette:1 red bell pepper, roasted (procedure follows), or 1/3 cup chopped drained bottled roasted red peppers1 tablespoon white-wine vinegar1 tablespoon water2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oilMake red pepper vinaigrette: In a blender blend vinaigrette ingredients with salt and pepper, to taste until smooth and emulsified.

column4: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour1/3 cup sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract2 large eggs, lightly beaten2 tablespoons vegetable oil1/3 cup whole milk4 baking apples (about 2 pounds total), cored, peeled, and cut into thin wedgesTopping:1/3 cup sugar1 large egg, lightly beaten3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
column5: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch springform pan and set it aside. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and sea salt, and stir to blend. Add the vanilla extract, eggs, oil, and milk, and stir until well blended. Add the apples and stir to thoroughly coat them with the batter. Spoon the mixture into the prepared cake pan. Place the pan in the center of the oven and bake until fairly firm and golden, about 25 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the topping: In a small bowl, combine the sugar, egg, and melted butter, and stir to blend. Set it aside. Remove the cake from the oven and pour the topping mixture over it. Return the cake to the oven and bake until the top is a deep golden brown and the cake feels quite firm when pressed with a fingertip, about 10 minutes. Transfer the cake pan to a rack and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Then run a knife around the sides of the pan, and release and remove the springform side, leaving the cake on the pan base. Serve at room temperature, cut into thin wedges.
column6: From the Paris CookbookPrep Time: 20 minutesCook Time: 55 minutesDifficulty: Easy

column4: For the Croutons:2 Tablespoons unsalted butter, melted2 Tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil1 eight to 10 oz. loaf rustic Italian bread,1/4" cubes2 teaspoons salt1/4 Teaspoon ground cayenne pepper1/2  Teaspoon freshly ground black pepperFor the salad:2 cloves garlic4 anchovy fillets1 Teaspoon salt1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice1 Teaspoon Worchestershire sauce1/2 Teaspoon Dijon mustard1 large egg yolk1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil2 10-oz. heads romaine lettuce, outer leaves discarded, inner leaves washed and dried1 cup freshly grated Parmesan or Romano cheese, or 2 1/2 ounces shaved with a vegetable peeler
column5: Heat oven to 450*.  Combine butter, olive oil in a large bowl.  Add bread cubes, and toss.  Sprinkle with salt cayenne pepper, and black pepper; toss until coated.  Spread in a single layer on baking sheet.  Bake until golden, about 10 minutes.Place garlic, anchovy fillets, and salt in a large wooden salad bowl.  Using two dinner forks, mash the garlic and anchovies into a paste.  Using one fork, whisk in the pepper, lemon juice, W'shire sauce, Dijon, and egg yolk.  Whisk in the olive oli.  Chop the romaine into 1 to 1 1/2 inch pieces.  Add the croutons, romaine, and cheese to the bowl, and toss.  Grate extra cheese over top.  Serve immediately..
column6: Instead of raw yolk, substitute one tablespoon of mayonnaise.To store dressing, mince garlic and anchovies, and place with the remaining ingredients in a jar.  Screw the lid on tightly and shake.  Store up to 4 days.

column4: 3 ounce sugar free lime jello2  8 oz. light key lime pie flavor yogurt1  8 oz. fat free Cool Whi[9" prepared graham cracker crustlime zest
column5: Dissolve jello in small amount of boiling water.*Stir in other ingredients.Place in crust.Grate lime zest over.Chill.
column6: *I used about 1/4 cup boiling water and some lime juice to dissolve jello.

column4: 1 (3 oz.) package ramen noodle soup mix1/4 cup butter or margarine1 cup walnuts or pecans, chopped1 (16-oz.) package fresh broccoli florets1 head romaine lettuce, torn4 green onions, choppedSweet-and Sour Dressing:1/2 cup vegetable oil1/4 cup sugar1/4 cup red wine vinegar1 tablespoon soy sauce1/2 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon pepperWhisk together oil and remaining ingredients.
column5: Remove seasoning packet from ramen noodles, and break noodles into pieces.Melt butter in large skillet over medium high heat; add broken noodles and nuts, and saute until lightly browned.  Drain.Toss noodle mixture, broccoli, lettuce, and onions in a large bowl; add 1/4 cup Sweet-and-Sour dressing, tossing to coat.  Serve with remaining dressing.

column4: 2 cups 1/2-inch cubes cooked steak (about 1 lb.)2 tablespoons drained capers2 tablespoons chopped cornichons or gherkins2 tablespoons minced red onion1 tablespoon Dijon mustard5 tablespoons mayonnaise8 1/2-inch slices olive or rosemary country-style   bread each about 3x5 inches*8 large tomato slices2 small bunches arugula, trimmed
column5: Combine all ingredients and 2 tablespoons of the mayonnaise in medium bowl; toss.  Season with salt and pepper.  (can be prepared 6 hours ahead.  Cover and refrigerate)Arrange bread, spread slices with remaining mayonnaise.  Divide steak salad among bread slices, topping each with tomato slices and arugula.  Press second bread slice, mayonnaise side down onto each sandwich.  Cut diagonally in half and serve.
column6: *Bon Appetit 08/01I used focaccia bread.  Yummy!

column4: 4 skinned boned chicken breast halves1/2 cup uncooked orzo1 (8-oz.) pkg. sliced fresh mushroomsVegetable cooking spray1 (10-oz.) pkg. chopped frozen spinach, thawed and well drained1 (10-oz.) can fat-free cream of mushroom soup1/2 cup reduced-fat mayonnaise2 teaspoons lemon juice1/2 teaspoon seasoned pepper3/4 cup (6 ozs.) shreded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese1/4 cup Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs
column5: Boil chicken and water to cover about 12 minutes.  Remove chicken, reserve broth.  Chop chicken and set aside.Cook pasta in reserved broth according to package directions omitting salt and fat.Saute mushrooms until tender with cooking spray.  Remove from heat.  Stir in chicken, pasta, spinach, and next 4 ingredients.  Spoon mixture into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs.Bake at 350* for 30 minues or until thoroughly heated.

column4: 3/4 pound unpeeled medium shrimp1 (32oz) box low sodium fat free chicken broth1 small onion, diced1 Tablespoon olive oil1 garlic clove, minced1 1/2 cups uncooked Arborio rice2/3 cups dry white wine1 (8-oz) package sliced fresh mushrooms2/3 cup fresh sugar snap peas1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper1/2 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
column5: Peel shrimp, devein.  Bring chicken broth to a boil, reduce heat to low; Saute onion in hot oil 7 minutes while broth simmers.  Add minced garlic, and saute 1 minute.Add rice and saute 2 minutes.  Reduce heat to medium.  Add wine and 1 cup hot broth.  Cook stirring constantly until liquid is absorbed.  Repeat, adding broth 1/2 cup at a time, stirring.When adding the last cup of broth, stir in mushrooms and peas.  Cook 10 minutes.  Add shrimp and cook 5 minutes.  Remove from heat, stir in salt and pepper.  Sprinkle with cheese.
column6: Fair, and I added fresh tarragon.

column4: 1/3 cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs1 TBSP grated parmesan cheese1 TSP Italian Seasoning1/4 TSP garlic powder1 medium eggplant2 large egg whites, lightly beaten1 cup tomato sauce of your choice1/2 cup part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded
column5: 1 Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Coat 8x8x2-inch baking dish with cooking spray--set aside2 Combine bread crumbs,  Parm cheese, and seasonings together in bowl;  set aside.  Remove skin from eggplant and trim off ends.  Slice into 1/2 inch thick slices.3 Dip eggplant into egg whites and them in bread crumb mixture.  Bake eggplant on a nonstick cookie sheet until lightly browned, about 20 minutes4 Place layer of eggplant on bottom of prepared baking dish, then add 1/3 sauce and 1/2 Moz cheese .  Repeat for two more layers.  Bake until sauce is bubbling, about 10 minutes more.  Slice into 4 pieces and serve.

column4: 3/4 cup fresh orange juice2 Tablespoons soy sauce1 teaspoon sugar1 clove garlic, peeled and crushed1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper8 sprigs fresh thyme2 tablespoons butter2 Tablespoons safflower oil8 lean (1/2" thick) loin pork chops
column5: Combine juice with soy sauce, sugar, garlic, pepper and thyme.With very sharp knife, score the chops 1/8" deep in a crisscross pattern on each side.  Place in a glass or stainless steel dish in a single layer.  Pour marinade over chops and let sit at least 30 minutes.  Drain and reserve marinade.Heat butter and oil in large heavy skillet.  Add chops and saute for 3 minutes on each , browning well.Reduce heat to low and pour reserved marinade over chops.  Cook until done, about 8 to 10 minutes.  Remove chops to a heated platter.Reduce the marinade in the skillet to 1/3 cup.  Pour over the cooked chops and serve.--
column6: May be grilled.  Reduce marinade in a separate saucepan; good with fresh orange sections added to the marinade.

column4: 2 Tablespoons olive oil1 Tablespoon butter1 medium onion, chopped2 ribs celery, cut into 1/4" dice1 carrot, peeled, cut into 1/4" dice1 cloves minced garlic1/8 teaspoon ground cloves1 can (35 oz.) Italian plum tomatoes3 to 4 cups canned broth1/3 cup dried lentils, green or brown1/4 cup dry red wineSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste1/4 cup chopped flat leaf parsley
column5: Cook onion, celery and carrot in oil and butter over low heat until wilted about 15 minutes.  Add garlic and cloves during the last 3 minutes.Puree tomatoes, and add.  Add broth and lentils; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 20 minutesAdd the wine, season to taste, and simmer 20 minutes more.  Stir in parsley and serve immediately.

column4: 1  1 oz. envelope ranch salad dressing mix	1 teaspoon dried savory, crumbled	1/2  teaspoon garlic powder	1/2 teaspoon dill weed	1/4 teaspoon lemon and pepper seasoned salt	1/2 cup vegetable oil	2  7-oz. boxes small oyster crackers
column5: Preheat oven to 200*.  Combine first five ingredients in a large bowl.  Stir in oil, then 		      crackers.  Transfer to 9 x 13-inch      oven proof glass baking dish.	Bake until golden stirring frequently, about 20 minutes. Cool.  Store in airtight container.

column4: 1 cup grits4 cups water3/4 teaspoon salt1 tablespoon butter or margarine5-ounce package shredded parmesan cheese
column5: Cook grits according to package directions, using 4 cups water.  Stir in salt, butter and parmesan cheese.

column4: 1 (19-oz.) package sweet Italian sausage3 red, yellow or green bell peppers cut into strips1 large sweet onion, cut in half, thinly sliced2 garlic cloves, minced1 to 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning1/2 teaspoon garlic powder1/2 teaspoon pepperParmesan Cheese Grits
column5: Remove sausage casings and discard.  Cook sausages, peppers, onion, garlic, seasoning, garlic powder, salt and pepper, stirring until sausage crumbles and is no longer pink and vegetables are tender.Serve over Parmesan Cheese Grits.  Garnish, if desired with parmesan cheese.

column4: 1 clove garlic, halved1 cup whipping cream1 cup dry white wine1/2 cup chicken broth2 Tablespoons cornstarch8 ounces Italian made Gorgonzoladash ground white pepper
column5: Rub bottom of heavy medium saucepan with garlic, discard.  Add cream and wine; bring to a boil. Stir broth and cornstarch until combined.  Stir into cream mixture.Cook and stir until slightly thickened and bubbling.  Gradually add cheese, stirring until melted.  Stir in white pepper.  Pour hot mixture into pot over burner.Serve with dary rye or pumpernickel, French baguette cubes; slightly blanched asparagus spears, cooked new potatoes, grapes, apple chunks, pears or strawberries.

column4: Nonstick vegetable oil spray3 cups all purpose flour2 teaspoons ground cinnamon1 teaspoon baking soda1 teaspoon salt1 pound Golden Delicious apples, peeled, cored, cut into 1/3-inch cubes2 cups (packed) golden brown sugar1 1/2 cups vegetable oil1 cup sugar3 large eggs4 teaspoons vanilla extract3/4 cup pecans, coarsely chopped (about 3 1/2 ounces) 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter1/4 cup whole milk
column5: Preheat oven to 350F. Spray 12-cup Bundt pan with nonstick spray. Sift flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt into medium bowl. Transfer 3 tablespoons flour mixture to Bundt pan and tilt to coat. Set pan aside. Place apples and 2 tablespoons flour mixture in another medium bowl; toss to coat apples. Combine 1 cup brown sugar, vegetable oil, 1 cup sugar, eggs, and 3 teaspoons vanilla in large bowl. Using electric mixer, beat until mixture is thick, about 4 minutes. Gradually beat in remaining flour mixture. Fold apple mixture and pecans into batter; transfer to prepared Bundt pan. Bake cake until tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Transfer cake in pan to rack. Let stand while making caramel. Melt butter in heavy small skillet over medium heat. Whisk in remaining 1 cup brown sugar, then milk. Continue to whisk until topping is smooth and blended and comes to boil, about 5 minutes. Whisk in remaining 1 teaspoon vanilla. Spoon 1/4 cup hot caramel topping over warm cake in pan. Let stand until topping is absorbed into cake, about 15 minutes. Turn cake out onto platter. Pour remaining warm topping over cake. Let stand until cool, at least 1 hour. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover with cake dome. Let stand at room temperature.)

column4: 1 yellow or vanilla cake mix1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar2 cups sour cream2 packages frozen coconut (6 ozs. each)8 ounces Cool Whip
column5: Bake cake according to directions.  Cool on wire rack, split each layer in half making 4 layersCombine sugar, sour cream and coconut.  Blend well and chill. (Some recipes suggest over night.)Add some of the Cool Whip to this mixture.Save 1 cup + mixture.  Spread remaining mixture between layers.  Combine reserved coconut mixture with Cool Whip.   Blend and spread on top and sides of cake.Store in airtight container.  Refrigerate up to 3 days before serving.
column6: Use only one 6 ounce package of coconut and use 1 large crushed pineapple, well drained.

column4: fresh spinachbleu cheesepecansbaconlow-fat raspberry vinaigrette dressing
Diced turkeymushroomsfresh spinach,onionsMonterey Jack cheesecrepediced tomatoesHollandaise Saucedill
column5: In crepe, place first five ingredients.Top with tomatoes and Hollandaise sauce

column4: Olive pestopeasant breadgrilled eggplanttomato grated cheesesliced tomato
column5: Grill eggplant.Oil bread with pestoAssemble sandwichPress togetherCook on grill

column4: 3/4 cup sugar1/2 cup chopped pecans2 teaspoons grated orange rind1/2 (8-ounce) package reduced fat cream cheese2 (11 ounce) cans refrigerated buttermilk biscuits1/2 cup butter or margarine, melted1 cup sifted powdered sugar 2 tablespoons fresh orange juice
column5: *Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowl.*Place about 3/4 teasoon cream cheese in center of each biscuit; fold in half over cheese, pressing edges to seal.*Dip biscuits in melted butter and dredge in sugar mixture; place biscuits, curved side down, in a single layer in curves of a lightly greased 12-cup Bundt pan, spacing evenly.  Do not stack.  Place any remaining biscuits around the center of tube of pan, filling in spaces if necessary.  Drizzle remaining butter over biscuits; sprinkle with any remaining sugar mixture.*Bake at 350* for 35 to 40 minutes until done.  Invert onto a serving plate.*Combine powdered sugar and orange juice, stirring well; drizzle over warm coffee cake, Serve immediately.

column4: 1 (6-ounce) package dried apricots1/2 cup butter or margarine, softened1/ 4 cup sugar1 1/2 cups flour, divided2 large eggs3/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar1/2 teaspoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 cup chopped walnuts1 teaspoon vanilla extractPowdered sugar
column5: Bring apricots and water to cover to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered 15 minutes.  Drain and coarsely chop; set aside*Beat butter until creamy; add 1/4 cup sugar, beating well. Stir in 1 cup flour, and press mixture into a lightly greased aluminum foil lined 9" square pan.*Bake 350* for 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned.* Beat eggs until thick; add brown sugar.  Beat and add remaining 1/2 cup flour. baking powder, and salt.  Stir in chopped apricot, walnuts and vanilla; spread mixture evenly over crust.*Bake at 325* for 45 minutes.  Cool completely, cut into bars, sprinkle with powdered sugar

column4: 2 1/2 cups flour, divided1/2 cup powdered sugar1 cup butter or margarine, softened4 large eggs2 cups sugar1/3 cup lemon juice1/2 teaspoon baking powderPowdered sugar
column5: *Combine 2 cups flour and 1/2 cup powdered sugar.* Cut butter into flour mixture until crumbly.  Firmly press mixture into al ightly greased 13 x 9-inch pan.*Bake at 350* for 20 to 25 minutes until lightly browned.*Whisk egg in a large bowl; whisk in 2 cups sugar and lemon juice.  Combine remaining 1/4 cup flour and baking powder; whisk into egg mixture.  Pour batter over crust.* Bake at 350* for 25 minutes or until set.  Let cool completely.  Cut into bars and sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.

column4: 3/4 cup water1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 cup couscous1 cup red bell pepper, chopped1/3 cup Kalamata olives, chopped1/2 cup fresh mint, chopped3 Teaspoons olive oil vinaigrette1/2 cup feta cheese, in small blocks
column5: Boil water, add couscous* bring back to a boil and remove from heat.Add other ingredients, mix well.
column6: Bon Appetite, June '01*I used chicken bouillon in water instead of salt.

column4: 1/2 cup red wine vinegar1 heaping teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper1 tablespoon Dijon mustard1 heaping teaspoon horseradish (Optional)Dash of Worchestershire sauce (optional)1/4 teaspoon sugar or to tastePinch of salt1/2 teaspoon minced garlic1 cup extra virgin olive oil
column5: Combine all ingredients except olive oilWhisk in olive oil in a slow, steady stream

column4: 1 cup packed fresh cilantro leaves1/2 cup packed fresh mint leaves1 Tablespoon lime juice1 fresh jalapeno chile pepper, quartered & seeded1 clove garlic2Tablespoons Parmesan cheese
column5: Process first five ingredients in food processorStir in cheese.

column2: Fruits Of The Forest Pie-2003 First Place Nut
column4: Crust:1/3 cup solid shortening (recommended: Crisco)2 tablespoons butter2 tablespoons ice water1 cup all-purpose flourFilling:4 eggs, lightly beaten1/4 cup packed brown sugar1/2 cup white sugar1 teaspoon vanillaI cup light corn syrup1/2 teaspoon salt4 tablespoons melted butter2 cups lightly toasted mixed nuts (1/2 cup pecan halves, 1/3 cup coarsely chopped macadamias, 1/3 cup slivered almonds, 1/2 cup cashewhalvessplit, 1/3 cup chopped hazelnuts)
column5: To prepare crust by hand:In a narrow bowl, combine flour, salt and shortening. Using 2 knives scissors-style, cut fat into flour until only small pea-size bits of shortening remain.Sprinkle water over flour mixture as you toss with a fork. Don't keep stirring. Turn only about 8 to 10 times. Continue with Step 3 below.Or prepare crust using a food processor:Chill flour, shortening, butter, water.Measure flour into work bowl. Add salt and pulse 3 times.Add shortening. Pulse 6 times. Add butter that has been cup up into chunks. Pulse 4 times.Add water 1 tablespoon at a time. Pulse after each addition.Pour out of bowl onto plastic wrap. Create a 5-inch disk and flatten. Refrigerate.After about 15 minutes in the refrigerator, remove your disc. Place a piece of plastic wrap or parchment paper on the counter. Flour it. Cover thedisk with another piece of wrap or parchment. Roll out from the center, until disk is about 11 inches in diameter. Remove top wrap, flour the surfacelightly and drape crust over rolling pin. Center over pie plate and put it in. Smooth into 9 1/2-inch pie pan. Remove wrap. Trim edge to about 1/2inch around outside of pan.Fold edge under and flute using thumb and forefingers to make a stand up edge. Refrigerate until ready to fill.To prepare filling and topping:Heat oven to 350 degrees F.Coarsely chop macadamias and almonds, put all nuts (separate large nuts from chopped) on cookie sheet and toast 5 to 6 minutes. Cool. Puthazelnuts into a kitchen towel and rub together to remove skins. Chop hazelnuts.Combine filling ingredients. Mix well. Sprinkle chopped nuts on bottom of crust. Arrange pecan halves, slivered almonds and cashews in attractive pattern on bottom of unfilled crust. Pour filling into pan deflecting on back of a spoon. Larger nuts will rise up to top. Cover edge of crust with foil.Bake for 45 minutes to 50 minutes. Test with a stainless steel knife in center. When it comes out clean, it's done. Cool completely on wire rack.Serve after cooling or wrap in heavy foil and refrigerate until next day to serve.

column4: 3 cups cooked mashed sweet potatoes1/2 cup sugar1/4 cup milk2 large eggs1 teaspoon vanilla extract1 stick butter, melted1/3 cup all-purpose flour1 teaspoon freshly grated orange zest (peel)2 tablespoons fresh2 tablespoons fresh orange juiceTopping:1 cup chopped pecans1 cup brown sugar4 tablespoons butter, melted1/3 cup all-purpose flour
column5: preheat oven to 350 degrees. combine sweet potatoes and next 8 ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Combine topping ingredients in a small bowl and sprinkle over sweet potato mixture.  Bake 40 minutes. Serve immediately.

column4: 2 sticks butter1 cup sugar2 eggs beaten2 cups floursalt12 oz. apricot preserves 1/2 cup pecans or almonds
column5: Beat butter and sugar until creamy.Add remaining ingredients except for preserves and nuts.Pour 1/2 of batter in a 9x13 in. panUse 1/2 preserves and nuts in center and 1/2 on top, or use all on top.Bake @ 350* 30 to 40 minutes oruntil brown

column4: 1 large egg, lightly beaten1/2 cup buttermilk1/2 cup flour1/2 cup cornmeal1 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper3 medium size green tomatoes, cut into 1/2" sliceVegetable oilSalt to taste
column5: Combine egg and buttermil;Combine 1/4 cup flour, cornmeal salt, pepper; Dredge tomato slices in remaining 1/4 cup flour; dip in egg mixture, and dredge in cornmeal mixture.Pour oil  to a depth of 1/4 to 1/2" in large cast iron skillet; heat to 375*.  Drop tomatoes in batches into hot oil, and cook 2 minutes on each side until golden.  Drain on paper towels or rack.  Sprinkle hot tomatoes with salt.

column4: 2 dozen large fresh shrimp1/4 cup olive oil1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley3 cloves garlic, minced12 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper1/4 teaspoon pepper1/4 cup Butter1/2 cup French breadcrumbs, toasted12 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
column5: Peel ,devein shrimp.  Arrange in a 11 x 7" baking dish; pour olive oil over shrimp.  Combine parsley and next 3 ingredients; sprinkle over shrimp.  Cover and bake at 300* for 15 minutesTurn shrimp over; drizzle with butter, and sprinkle with breadcrumbs and cheese.  Bake, uncovered 5 to 10 minutes.

column4: 2 lbs. fresh green beans, trimmed1/4 cup butter2 garlic cloves, pressed1 teaspoon dried pesto seasoning*1/2 teaspoon salt
column5: Steam green beans over boiling water.  Cover and steam 6 minutes until crisp tender.Melt butter in large skillet; stir in garlic, pesto and salt; saute about 1 minute.  Add green beans and saute 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated.  Serve
column6: *I use frozen pesto made from garden.Southern Living, August 2003, page182

column4: 2 Tablespoons butter, melted2 teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning2 Tablespoons Worchestershire sauce1/2 teaspoon garlic powder1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce2 cups pecans2 cups almonds
column5: Stir together melted butter, Old Bay, Worchestershire, garlic powder and hot sauce.  Add nuts, tossing to coat. Place nuts on an aluminum foil lined 15-x 10 inch jelly roll pan.Bake nuts at 300* for 30 minutes, stirring twice.  Cool.  Store in air tight container.Be careful not to over cook.

column4: 1 (20-ounce) cane pineapple slices2 Tablespoons butter1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper 1 (8-ounce) container soft chive-onion cream cheese1 (8-ounce) French bread  loaf, split1 pound sliced turkey or chicken1 (8-ounce) [aclage Swoss cjeese s;oces
column5: Drain pineapple cut each slice in half.Melt butter, add pineapple, and saute 2 to 3 minutes.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.Spread cream cheese on each bread half.  Layer bottom bread halves with pineapple, turkey, and cheese slices; top with French bread halves.Cook sandwiches on a lightly greased griddle over medium heat 5 minutes on each side until bread is toasted and cheese melts.  Cut sandwiches into thirds.

column4: 2 1/2 c chicken stock1 1/2 c wild rice1 med onion, minced fine2 stalks celery, minced fine2/3 c dry white wine.salt and pepper to taste2 T butter, softened
column5: Heat stock to boil.  Combine boiling stock and wild rice over top of double boiler, heated and set over medium heat.  Lightly season rice with salt and pepper and cover tightly.  Cook over med heat for 1 hour.As soon as rice begins to cook, heat 2 T butter in saucepan over med high heat.  When hot, add onion and celery, season with salt and pepper and saute for 3 minutes.  Add the white wine, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer until almost all liquid has evaporated, about 45 to 50 minutes.  Combine rice and vegetables, adjust the seasoning and serve immediately or cool and keep refrigerated.

column4: 2 lb. shrimp4 slices bacon, chopped2 Tablespoons butter1 clove garlic, minced1 cup chopped onion1 1/2 cup chopped green pepper1/4 cup chopped parsley1 1/2 cup thinly sliced celery1 large can (1 lb 12 oz) tomato1 can (6 oz) tomato paste1 Tablespoon lemon juice1 teaspoon salt (or to taste)1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon pepper1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes 1 bay leaf1/2 teaspoon thyme1 cup water1/2 cup red wine (optional)Cooked White Rice
column5: Saute bacon in large pot.  When crisp, remove and drain.  To the bacon fat, add the butter, garlic, onion, gr. pepper, parsley, and celery.  Saute for about 5 minutes, stirring, or until veggies are tender.  Add the bacon, and remaining ingredients EXCEPT shrimp and simmer, covered, 30 minutes (or longer if desired).  Just before serving, add shrimp and bring to boil.  Reduce heat and cook until shrimp is just pink and curled (will depend on size of shrimp).  Serve over rice.  Yum!
column6: This is great as it can be made ahead.  Just make the sauce without the shrimp and refrigerate or freeze.  When ready to use, just bring to boil, add the shrimp and continue as directed.

column2: ROASTED BEEF AND BLUE CHEESE PINWHEELS
column4: 1 stick butter, softened 1 8 ounce cream cheese 4 ounces crumbled blue cheese roasted red peppers basil leaves sliced roast beef flour tortilla wraps
column5: Beat butter, cream cheese, salt and blue cheese at medium speed with electric mixer until creamy.  spread 2 to 3 tablespoons mixture in center of each tortilla.Place sliced red peppers in rows 1 inch apart over cheese mixture to within 1/2 inch of edge.Place basil between rows of peppers.  (Do not overlap.)Place roast beef over peppers and basil, covering tortilla to within 1/2 inch of edge.  Roll uptightly, jelly roll fashion; cover with plastic wrap and chill.Unwrap rolls; cut off and discard 1/2 inch from each end.  Cut rolls into 3/4 inch slices.  Place pinwheels, cut side down on serving platter.  Makes six dozen pinwheels.

column4: Pie Crust  (Makes 2 pie crusts)1 1/2 cups flour1 stick butter1 cup finely chopped pecansFilling: 8 ounces cream cheese1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk16 ounces cool whipMix:7 ounces coconut1/2 stick melted butter1 cup chopped pecans12-ounce jar of caramel sauce
column5: Make pie crust and bake 10 minutes at 350*Combine and pour first three filling ingredients into cooked, cooled pie shells.Spread coconut, butter and pecan mixture on cookie sheet and toast until lightly browned.Spread toasted coconut mixture on top of the pies.Pour 12-ounce jar of caramel sauce over the piesFreeze.  Partially thaw before serving.
column6: from the "Sweet Potato Queens Book of Love Cookbook"

column4: 2 cups loosely packed fresh basil leaves3 large cloves garlic1/2 cup Shredded Parmesan cheese1/2 cup pine nuts, toasted1/2 cup olive oil2 Tablespoons Greek oregnao leaves2 Teablespoons parsley1/8 teaspoon salt
column5: Process fresh basil leaves and remaining ingredients in food processor until smooth.  Stoere in refrigerator up to 5 days

column4: 4 poblano chile peppers3/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese1/2 cup fresh cilantro1/4 cup chopped walnuts3/4 cup olive oil3 garlic cloves3 tablespoons fresh lime juice1 teaspoon salt
column5: Place peppers on aluminum foil lined baking sheet.Broil about 5 minutes until each side is blistered.Place peppers in a zup loc plastic bag; seal and let stand 10 minutes until skins are loose.  Peel, remove and discard seeds.Process peppers and remaining ingredients in a food processor until smooth.  Store in refrigerator up to 1 week.

column4: 1  8 ounce package frozen strawberries partially     thawed5 cups ice3/4 cup tequila1/2 cup thawed limeade concentrate1/3 cup powdered sugar3 tablespoons orange liqueurLime juiceRed sugar crystalsGarnishes:  lime slices, fresh strawberies
column5: Place first 6 ingredients in a blender until smooth.Dip margarita glass rims in lie juice; dip rims in red sugar crystals, coating well.  Pour margarita mixture into glasses.  Serve immediately.  Garnish.JOTE:  Used Grand Marnier

column4: 1 cup butter, melted2 cups sugar1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa4 large eggs, lightly beaten1 teaspoon vanilla extract1/8 teaspoon salt1 1/2 cups all purpose flour1 1/2 cups coarsely chopped pecans, toasted1  10 ounce bag miniature marshmallowsChocolate Frosting(next)
column5: Whisk together melted butter and next 5 ingredients.  Stir in flour and chopped pecans.  Pour batter into a greased and floured 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan.Bake at 350* for 20 to 25 minutes.  Remove from oven; top warm cake evenly with marshmallows.  Return to oven, and bake 5 minutes.  Drizzle Chocolate Frosting over warm cake.  Cool.
column6: 2  19.5 ounce packages brownie mix, prepared according to directions may be substituted.  Stir in pecans, bake 350* for 30 minutes. Proceed with marshmallows and frosting as directed

column4: 1 1/6 ounce package powdered sugar, sifted1/2 cup milk1/4 cup butter, softened1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa
column5: Beat all ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth

column4: 1  12 ounce package fettuccine1  6 ounce package portobello mushrooms1/2 cup butter3 garlic cloves, mimced1 cup whipping cream1 cup milk1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Parmesan cheese1 teaspoon coarsely ground pepper1/2 teaspoon salt2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian flat leaf parsley
column5: cook pasta .Remove brown gills from undersides of mushroom caps using a spoon.  discard gills; chop mushrooms.Melt butter in a large saucepan add mushrooms and galric, saute 5 to 6 minutes.  Stir in cream and milk.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, whisking constantly 10 minutes.  Stir in cheese, pepper, and salt.  Stir constantly until cheese melts and mixture thickens.  Stir in 2 tablsspoons parsley.  Serve over hot cooked pasta.Garnosj

column4: 2/3 cup chicken broth1/3 cup chunky peanut butter 3 Tablespoons lite soy sauce3 tablespoons fresh lime juice1 Tablespoon honey1 tomato, peeled, seeded, and chopped4 green onions, minced2 garlic cloves, minced1 Tablespoon minced fresh ginger1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced1/4 cup chopped cilantro
column5: Bring first 11 ingredients to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.  Reduce heat, and smiier, whisking constantly 2 minutes or until thick and creamy.
column6: Serve with grilled chicken or pork.

column4: 2/3 cup ineapple preserves1/3 cup apple jelly2 tablespoons prepared horseradish1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
column5: Microwave pineapple preserves and apple jelly in a glass bowl at HIGH 2 minutes or until melted.  Stir in remaining ingredients

column4: 6 hard boiled eggs3 Tablespoons sour cream2 Tablespoons mayonnaise2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice1/4 teaspoon dry mustard2 Tablespoons green onions, chopped4 teaspoons capers1 teaspoon fresh tarragon, chopped
column5: Peel eggs, cut in half lengthwise.Mix yolks with other ingredients and stuff back into shells.

column2: Roasted Eggplant and red Pepper Topping
column4: 3/4        lb eggplant, left unpeeled and cut into  1/4-inch dice 1        medium onion, chopped 1        red bell pepper, chopped 3        tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 3/4        teaspoon salt 1/4       teaspoon black pepper 2        tablespoons chopped fresh basil
column5: Preheat oven to 450F. Toss vegetables with oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl, then spread in an oiled large shallow (1-inch-deep) baking pan. Roast vegetables in middle of oven, stirring occasionally, until tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool in pan on a rack, then coarsely mash with a potato masher and stir in basil.
column6: Vegetables can be roasted and mashed 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature, then stir in basil just before serving.

column2: BRAISED EGGPLANT WITH ONION AND TOMATO
column4: 6   small Italian eggplants  (2 lb total) 2    medium onions, cut lengthwise into 1/4-    inch-thick wedges 1/4  cup plus 3 tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil 1  large tomato, coarsely chopped, plus 1 1/2 cups drained chopped tomatoes from stuffed tomatoes 1/3  cup chopped fresh  flat-leaf parsley 1/3   cup chopped fresh basil 3       tablespoons fresh lemon juice 1        tablespoon plus  2 teaspoons sugar 1        teaspoon salt 1/3     cup water
column5: Preheat oven to 400F. Halve eggplants lengthwise and score flesh 1/2 inch deep in a crosshatch pattern to make 1-inch squares (do not cut through skin). Arrange eggplant halves, cut sides up, in a large roasting pan and season with salt. Cook onions in 3 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat and stir in tomatoes, parsley, basil, lemon juice, 2 teaspoons sugar, and salt. Divide topping among eggplant halves, mounding in centers. Stir together water, remaining 1/4 cup oil, and remaining tablespoon sugar until sugar is dissolved, then add to roasting pan. Cover pan tightly with foil and bake in middle of oven, basting eggplants every 15 minutes with cooking liquid, 45 minutes. Uncover and bake until eggplants are tender (they will collapse and flatten slightly) and cooking liquid is reduced and beginning to caramelize, about  40 minutes more. Serve hot or at room temperature, drizzled with pan juices.
column6: Braised eggplant may be made 1 day ahead, then cooled completely before being chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature before serving.

column4: Pie dough recipe including lemon peel3/4 cup bottled lemon curd2 1/2 cups cottage cheese1/2 cup sour cream6 Tablespoons sugar1/4 teaspoon salt1 1/2 teaspoon freshly grated lemon peel1 teaspoon vanilla extract2 eggs1 Tablespoon flourThin lemon slices or sliced almonds or whipped cream as garnish
column5: Preheat oven to 325*Prepare pie dough in a 10-inch tart pan.  Spread lemon curd on the bottom of the pastry*Combine the remaining ingredients except garnishes in a food processor and process until smooth and uniform. Pour into the pastry shell.Bake 35 minutes or until set.  Let cool, refrigerate and chill.  Garnish
column6: I baked pastry some before filling.From Virginian Pilot/6/16/04

column4: Flour Tortillas Thin sliced roast beefRoasted red peppersFresh Basil 8 ounces cream cheese1 stick buttersmall carton crumbled blu cheese
column5: Soften cheeses and butter; combine until smooth; spread to within 1/2" of edge of tortilla.Alternate rows of sliced peppers and fresh basil leaves.  Do not overlap rows.Place sliced beef on top.Roll up in plastic wrap,  store in  refrigerator.  Slice in desired thickness.

column4: 2 to 2 1/2 cups flour, plus flour for work surface1/4 cup rice flour (substitute cornstarch)2 sticks butter, softened1/4 cup packed brown sugar1/4 cup superfine sugar1 large egg1 tablespoon milk1 teaspoon ground ginger1 teaspoon cinnamon
column5: Mix butter and sugars; add egg, milk, ginger, cinnamon and mix.  Reduce speed and add flours.Beat until dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.Roll out and cut into shapes and bake at 325*Dough may be shaped into rolls and stored in refrigerator until ready to bake.  Slice 1/4" thick.Bake about 20 minutes until lightly browned.  A thinner roll of dough will yield more cookies; the thinner cookies will take less time to bake.
column6: I used 1/4 cup Splenda and 3/4 cup brown sugar and added an extra egg.

column4: 1 1/4 cups flour1/2 cup powdered sugar2 teaspoons instant coffee granules2/3 cup butter or margarine1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract2 cups (12-ounces) semisweet chocolate morsels    (divided)Vanilla or coffee ice cream (optional)
column5: Combine first 3 ingredients; add butter and vanilla, and beat at low speed until blended.  Stir in 1 cup chocolate morsels.Press dough into an ungreased 9-inch square pan, prick dough with a fork.Bake at 325* for 20 minutes or until lightly browned; sprinkle remaining cup morsels over top and spread to cover.Cut shortbread into 25 squares; cut each square into 2 triangles  Let cool 30 minutes in pan before removing.

column4: 1 (8oz) container light sour cream1 (8 oz) container plain yogurt1/4 cup honey2 tablespoons chopped crystallized ginger1/4 teaspoon ground allspice1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper (optional)3 ripe mangoes, peeled, seeded, and diced3 bananas, peeled and diced 1 (15.25 ounce ) can pineapple tidbits, drainedGarnish: 1/4 cup pistachios, toasted and chopped
column5: Stir together first 6 ingredients, Fold in mangoes, bananas, and pineapple.Cover and chill at least 2 hours.  Garnish if desired.

column4: 5 cups apple cider or apple juice5 cups cranberry juice1 1/2 cups guava juice or mango nectar1/4 cup lime juice1 teaspoon ground ginger1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon1/2 teaspoon ground allspiceHoney (optional)Kumquats (optional)Lime slices (optional)
column5: In a 4-quart Dutch oven combine apple cider, cranberry juice, guava juice, lime juice, ginger, cinnamon, and allspice.  Bring t boil; reduce heat.  Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  If desired, sweeten to taste with honey.Pour into mugs; garnish with lime slices and kumquats.

column2: Roasted Red Bell Pepper & Fennel Salad
column4: 2 large red bell peppers*5 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice3 garlic cloves, minced2 Tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper1 medium fennel bulb, trimmed, thinly sliced   fronds chopped and reserved6 cups mixed baby greens 1/4 cup halved putted Kalamata olives Parmesan cheese shavings
column5: Char broil peppers, sweat in paper bag, peel, etc.Whisk lemon juice, oil, garlic, and dried crushed pepper to blend.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.Toss sliced fennel bulb with half of dressing in medium bowl.  Toss red peppers and remaining dressing in another medium bowl.Divide greens among 4 plates.  Arrange fennel and red peppers over.  Sprinkle reserved fennel fronds, olives, and Parmesan shavings over.  Salt and Pepper to taste.
column6: *I used Trader Joe's blackened, peeled peppersBon Appetit, September 2004

column4: 1 Graham cracker pie crust1 packet unflavored gelatin1/4 cup cold water 2 cups strawberries, sliced1/4 cup extra fine granulated sugar1 cup heavy cream3 Tablespoons powdered sugar
column5: Sprinkle gelatin over cold water in saucepan; let stand 1 minute to soften; stir over low heat until gelatin is dissolved.  Place berries, extra fine sugar and gelatin mixture in food processor; puree; pour into bowl.  Chill until mixture mounds when dropped from spoon.  Beat cream and powdered sugar until soft peaks form, stir 1/4 of cream into strawberry puree; fold in remaining cream;  pour into crust.  Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.
