column4: 1 cup ground ham1/2 cup butter, softened3 Tablespoons prepared mustard 1 teaspoon poppy seeds1/3 cup Swiss cheese, grated1/3 cup sharp cheddar cheese, grated1/3 cup Parmesan cheese, grated1/3 cup Asiago cheese, grated1/3 cup chopped green onions1 teaspoon Lea & Perrins worchestershire sauceRolls or biscuits
column5: Combine all ingredients.Slice rolls or biscuits and place small amount of filling in each.  Warm rolls in pan covered with aluminum foil in 350* oven for 10-15 minutes.Garnish with lettuce if desired.

column4: 1  14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk1   6-ounce can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed1 teaspoon grated lime rind
column5: Stir all ingredients in a small bowl until blendedCover and chill 2 hours.
column6: Use as a dip for fresh fruit or with sugar cookies for an easy dessert

column4: 1  12-ounce package semisweet chocolate morsels1/2 cup whipping cream1 tablespoon butter or margarine1/4 cup strong brewed coffee
column5: Heat chocolate morsels, cream, and butter in saucepan over low heat until chocolate and butter melt; stirring often.Cook stirring constantly, 2 to 3 minutes until smooth.Remove from heat; stir in coffee.  Serve warm.

column4: 3 large eggs, beaten1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar1/4 cup flour1/4 cup butter or margarine, melted1  teaspoon vanilla extract1 12-ounce package semisweet chocolate morsels, melted1 1/2 cup walnut halves or pecan pieces1 piecrustJava Chocolate SauceCoffee ice cream
column5: Stir first 5 ingredients together until blended;Stir in melted chocolate morsels and nuts.Fill unbaked piecrust with mixture.Bake at 375* for 30 minutes.  Cool.  Serve with coffee ice cream and java chocolate sauce.

column4: 3 tomatoes, seeded and chopped1  15-ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced1/2 small sweet onion, chopped 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro1/2 teaspoon grated lime rind3 tablespoons fresh lime juice1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon ground pepperBaked tortilla chips
column5: Combine first 9 ingredients.  Cover and chill until ready to serve.Serve with baked tortilla chips.

column4: 1 large lemon1/4 cup milk2 medium eggs, beaten2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary2 tablespoons minced fresh garlic4 (4 to 6-ounce catfish fillets)2 cups yellow cornmeal14 cup extra-virgin olive oil
column5: Grate lemon rind into large bowl; squeeze lemon joice into bowl.  Stir in milk, eggs, rosemary, garlic until blended.Rinse fillets, pat dry; add fillets to lemon mixture; cover and chill 1 hour.Place cornmeal in shallow dish; dredge fillets until coated evenly.Cook fillets in hot oil in non stick skillet over medium-high heat 4 minutes per side until browned.Garnish with rosemary and/or lemon slices.

column4: 1/4 cup Equal Spoonful3/4 cup cider vinegar1/2 cup vegetable oil1 medium-size green bell pepper, chopped1 medium onion, chopped3 celery ribs, sliced1 15-ounce can small sweet peas, rinsed and drained1 14 1/2-ounce can French-cut green beans, rinsed and drained1 11-ounce can white shoepeg corn, drained1 7-ounce jar diced pimento, undrained1/2 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon pepper
column5: Bring first 3 ingredients to a boil over medium heat; 5 minutes until no-calorie sweetner dissolves.  Remove from heat and cool 30 minutes.Stir together bell pepper and next 8 ingredients in a large bowl; gently stir in dressing.  Cover and chill up to 8 hours.

column4: 2 8-ounce packages cream cheese, softened8 ounces goat cheese2 garlic cloves, minced4 teaspoons chopped fresh or 1 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano1/8 teaspoon freshly ground pepper1/4 cup basil pesto1/2 cup dried tomatoes in oil, drained and choppedGarhishes:  dried tomato slivers, fresh oregano sprigsFrench bread slices or crackers
column5: Process first 5 ingredients in food processor.  Spread1/3 of cheese mixture in bottom of a plastic wrap-lined 8 x 4" loafpan.  Top with pesto; spread 1/3 cheese mixture over pesto.  Sprinkle with dried tomatoes; top with remaining cheese mixture.  Cover and chill 8 hours.Invert spread onto a serving plate. Garnish and serve with French bread slices or crackers.

column4: 1 cup whole milk1/4 cup sugar1/4 cup shortening2 teaspoons salt1 tablespoon active dried yeast14 cup warm water1 egg, slightly beaten3 cups bread flour, sifted 3 times2 tablespoons butter, melted
column5: Scald milk with sugar, shortening, and salt until shortening is almost melted.  Allow milk to cool to lukewarm.In large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water; combine with milk mixture.  Beat in egg.  Add 1 cup flour and beat well.  Mix in remaining flour.On a floured surface, knead dough about 20 turns until slightly sticky.  Place into a lightly oiled bowl, cover, and allow to rise until doubled in size.Punch down dough and roll into a lightly floured surface to 1/2 inch thickness.  Cut into 2-inch rounds; place rounds on greased baking pan almost touching.  Let rest 15 minutes.  Brush tops with melted butter.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes. Brush again with butter
column6: Good on top of John Morrell Convenient Cuisine Beef Pot Roast with Gravy prepared according to directions on package.

column4: 1 16-ounce package ground pork sausage1  12-ounce package English muffins, split and buttered1 10 ounce-block sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded1  8 ounce-bloxk mozzarella cheese, shredded8 large eggs1 1/2 cups sour cream1 4-ounce can chopped green chilies, drained
column5: Cook sausage, stirring until it crumbles; drain on paper towels.  Cut muffin halves into quarters, and arrange in an even layer in lightly greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish.Sprinkle half each of sausage, Cheddar and mozzarella cheeses evenly over muffins.Whisk eggs, sour cream and chilies in a large bowl; pour evenly over sausage and cheeses; top with remaining sausage and cheeses.  Cover and chill 8 hours.Bake at 350* for 40 minutes Let stand 10 minutes before serving

column4: 6 bacon slices1/2 small onion, chopped12 very thin white bread slices4 to 6 plum tomatoes, sliced1 teaspoon salt, divided1/2 teaspoon black pepper1/4 teaspoon dried basil6 Swiss cheese slices4 large eggs1 1/2 cups milk 1/3 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
column5: Cook bacon until crisp, drain, reserving 1 teaspoon drippings.  Crumble baconAdd chopped onion to hot drippings, and saute 5 minutes or until tender.Trim crusts from bread slices and arrange 6 bread slices in an even layer on the bottom of a greased 11 x 7" baking dish.  Top with tomato slices, sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, and basil.  Sprinkle bacon and onion evenly over tomatoes; top with Swiss cheese slices and remaining bread slices. Whisk eggs, milk and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt together.  Pour evenly over bread slices.  Cover and chill at least 4 hours.  Bake at 350* for 40 minutes until set.  Top with Parmesan cheese and bake 5 more minutes.

column4: 1/2 cup olive oil6 large garlic cloves, chopped2 tablespoons (scant) dried oregano3 pounds uncooked medium shrimp3/4 pound plum tomatoes, seeded, coarsely chopped1/2 cup chopped fresh basil1/1/2 cups coarsely crumbled feta cheese (7 ounces)Fresh basil sprigs.
column5: Heat oil in heavy skillet over high heat; add garlic and oregano; stir 30 seconds.  Add shrimp and olives; saute 3 minutes.  Add tomatoes and chopped basil; saute until shrimp are opaque in center, about 1 minute longer.  Season to taste with salt and papper.  Transfer to large platter.  Sprinkle with feta cheese, garnish with basil springs.

column2: SAFFRON COUSCOUS WITH PEAS AND MINT
column4: 2  3/4 cups low-salt chicken broth1 10 ounce package frozen peas3  tablespoons butter1/4 teaspoon saffron threads, crumbled2 cups plain couscous (about 10 ounces)2 green onions, chopped3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint
column5: Combine broth, peas, butter, and saffron in heavy large saucepan.  Bring to boil over high heat, occasionally stirring until butter melts.  Mix in couscous.  Remove from heat cover, and let stand until broth is absorbed and couscous is tender about 12 minutes.  Fluff with fork; mix in green onions and mint.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.Mound in bowl.

column4: 6 cups water2 ribs celery with leaves, cut in half1 1/4 teaspoon salt4 whole peppercorns1 pound chicken livers trimmed1 cup unsalted butter, cut in one inch cubes1/4 cup Clavados or Aplejack Brandy1/4 cup coarsely chopped onion2 Teaspoons dry mustard1 clove garlic1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg (fresh)1/8 Teaspoon ground clovesPinch ground red (cayenne) pepper1/2 cup dried red currants
column5: Heat water, celery, 1/4 teaspoon salt and peppercorns to boiling.  Add chicken livers; return to boil; reduce heat to medium low and cook for 10 minutes.  Drain, discard celery and peppercorns.Combine livers, butter, brandy, onion, mustard, 1 teaspoon salt, and other ingredients.  Process in food processor until smooth.  Work in batches.Put in bowl, add currants; place in 3 cup crock; cover surface with plastic wrap.Refrigerate 4 to 6 hours; remove from refrigerator one hour before serving with crackers or corn chips

column4: 2 tablespoons corn or canola oil2 tablespoons butter1 medium onion, chopped (about 1 cup)1 tablespoon curry powder1 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon white pepper1 (15-ounce) can (1 1/2 cups) pumpkin puree1 cup chicken broth1 cup milk1 tabespoon honey1/4 cup whipping creamChopped fresh cilantro and red bell pepper for garnish, optional
column5: Heat oil and butter in medium saucepan.  Add onion and saute over medium low heat until soft, about 15 minutes.  Stir in curry powder, salt and pepper and cook, stirring until fragrance is released, about 1 minute.Add pumpkin, chicken broth, milk and honey, and stir to combine.  Do not heat.  Puree in blender or food procesor.  Return to pan, add cream and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until heated through, about 5 minutes.Garnish each serving with a sprinkling of cilantro and red bell pepper if desired.

column4: 2 cans Bush black beans, drained1/2 cup red onions, chopped1  8-ounce package cream cheese1 jar Robert Rothchild Farms Raspberry Salsa10 ounces Monterey Jack Cheese, grated
column5: Place drained beans in a 9 x 13" pyrex dish.  Layer next ingredients ending with Jack cheese.Bake 350* for 30 minutesServe with dippers

column4: 1/2 large onion, chopped1 yellow pepper, chopped2 stalks celery, sliced2 cloves garlic, minced1 T curry powder (more or less to taste - could use a curry paste, if available)4 T butter3 T flour1/2 cup cream1 cup mmilk14 ounce can chicken broth8 ounces muenster cheese, grated
column5: Cook veggies and curry in butter until very tender.  Add flour and cook for 2 minutes, making a roux.Add cream to roux in small stream, stirring constantly.  Continue with milk and broth.  Use immersion blender at this point, or transfer to a blender or cuisinart.  Puree until smooth.  Return to pot and cook 5 minutes or until a nice simmer.Add cheese, stirring until melted.May serve with cilantro and a slice of lime on the side.

column2: LOBSTER STUFFED BEEF TENDERLOIN w/ BERNAISE
column4: 2 rock lobster tails 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1/4 pound pancetta or bacon, chopped 1/2 cup chopped shallots 3 tablespoons minced celery 2 teaspoons minced garlic 4 ounces baby chanterelle mushrooms, stems trimmed and sliced Salt and freshly ground black pepper 2 tablespoons minced green onions 2 tablespoons dry white wine 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley leaves 1 center-cut beef tenderloin, about 3 1/2 pounds, trimmed and butterflied Steamed fresh asparagus, as accompaniment Bearnaise Sauce, recipe follows
column5: Cook lobster tails; peel, remove tail meat whole.Cook pancetta or bacon until fat is rendered about 5 minutes, leaving about 2 teaspoons fat in the pan.Add shillots, celery and cook until soft about 2 minutes.  Add garlic, cook 30 seconds, then mushrooms and pinc of salt and pepper, cooking until mushrooms give off liquid-3-4 minutes.  Add green onions, stir; add wine, and cook until nearly evaporated, 1 to 2 minutes.  Add parsley, stir.  Remove from heat and add pancetta or bacon. CoolButterfly beef.  With cut side up spread pancetta vegetable mixture in a line across the meat about 2" from top leaving 1/2"border on sides.  Lay lobster tails on top of mixture.  Pull top flap of beef over lobster and roll over the stuffing.  Tuck and tiePlace in large heavy roasgint pan, rub on all sides with remaining 2 teaspoons olive oil, season.  Placee over medium-high heat and sear on all sides, about 6 minutes.  Place in 400*oven and roast to desired temperature, 30 to 35 inutes for medium-rare.Transfer to cutting board.  Tent and rest for 10 minutes before carving.  Removed twine and slice thickly.  Place on platter, surround with asparagus and drizzle with Bernaise Sauce.

column4: 2 tablespoons chopped shallots 4 sprigs fresh tarragon 1/4 cup dry white wine 1/4 cup dry vermouth 4 large egg yolks 1 cup (2 sticks) melted unsalted butter or clarified butter 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice 2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon leaves 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon ground white pepper
column5: In a small saucepan, combine the shallots, tarragon, white wine, and vermouth. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced to 2 tablespoons. Remove from the heat, strain, and cool. In the top of a double boiler, or in a metal bowl fitted over a pot of barely simmering water, whisk the egg yolks and reduced wine until ribbons start to form. Whisking constantly, drizzle in the melted butter a bit at a time until all the butter is added and the mixture is thick. Remove from the heat. Whisk in the lemon juice, chopped tarragon, salt, and pepper. Adjust the seasoning, to taste. Cover to keep warm until ready to serve. To serve, place in a decorative bowl with a small sauce ladle.

column4: 1 cup butter3 ounces cream cheese1 cup sugar1 egg1 teaspoon lemon zest1 1/2 teaspoons vanillaFew drops green food coloring2 1/2 cups flour1 teaspoon baking powder
column5: Preheat oven to 375*.  Cream butter, cheese and sugar until fluffy.   Beat in egg, lemon zest, vanilla and food coloring.Add flour and baking powder, mixing well.  Chill at least 1 hour.  Put dough in cookie press and press out onto ungreased cookie sheet.  bake 8 minutes

column4: Crust: 15 to 18 shortbread cookies, finely crushed 2/3 cup melted butter Layer 1: 2 ounces softened cream cheese 2 cups whipped topping 1/2 cup powdered sugar 1/2 cup smooth peanut butter Layer 2: 4 ounces softened cream cheese 4 cups whipped topping 1/2 cup powdered sugar 2 ounces melted German sweet chocolate Whipped Cream, for garnish
column5: Crust: In a bowl, stir together cookies and butter with a fork until moistened then press into an 8 or 10-inch pie crust. Freeze. Layer 1: Beat together all ingredients, spread onto the frozen crust, and freeze for 5 minutes. Layer 2: Beat together all ingredients except for the chocolate. Stir in the chocolate. Place this mixture on top of the peanut butter layer. Top with whipped cream and refrigerate until firm.

column4: 1 small eggplant, peeled and diced 3/4"1 red pepper 1" dice1 yellow pepper, 1" dice1 red onion, peeled, 1" dice2 cloves garlic, minced1/3 cup good olive oil1 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper1/2 pound orzoDRESSING:1/3 cup lemon juice (2 lemons)1/3 cup good olive oil1 teaspoon kosher salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepperAdd:4 scallions, minced both white and green parts1/4 cup toasted pine nuts3/4  pound feta, 1/2" dice, not crumbled15 fresh basil leaves, cut into chiffonade
column5: Preheat oven to 425*.  Toss eggplant, peppers, onion, garlic with olive oil, salt and pepper on a large baking sheet; roast 40 minutes until brown, turning with a spatula;Cook orzo in water 7 to 9 minutes, drain, add roasted vegetables to pasta.Dressing:  Combine lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper and pour over pasta and vegetables; let cool to room temperature; add scallions, pine nuts, feta and basil; serve at room temperature

column4: 3/4 cup baby lima beans, soaked 4 to 8 hours in water to cover*1 tablespooon oil1 1/2 cups coarsely chopped onion2 cloves garlic, minced5 cups low sodium chicken or beef broth, plus more if needed1 pound mushrooms, trimmed and sliced1/2 cup pearl barleySalt and Pepper1/4 cup low fat sour cream and chopped dill for garnish, optional
column5: Drain beans and set aside.  In a large soup pot, heat oil.  Add onion and garlic and cook over medium-high heat until golden.Add broth, drained lima beans, mushrooms and barley.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and cook at a gentle boil, stirring occasionally until beans and barley are tender, about 45 minutes.  If the soup becomes too thick, stir in additional broth until desired consistency.  Add salt and pepper to taste.If desired garnish each protion with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkling of dill.
column6: Virginian Pilot 2/23/05*I use fresh frozen limas and add them the last 20 minutes of cooking

column2: AVOCADO, HEARTS OF PALM, RED ONION w/coriander vinaigrette
column4: For vinaigrette1 small garlic clove1/4 cup fresh coriander, washed and spun dry3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice1/2 teaspoon sugar1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 cup olive oilFor salad14-ounce can hearts of palm, drained4 California firm-ripe avocados1 small red onion, sliced thinBoston lettuce leaves (from about 2 heads)
column5: Make vinaigrette:In a blender pure garlic and coriander with lemon juice, sugar, and salt. With motor running add oil in a stream, blending until dressing is emulsified.Make salad:Cut hearts of palm and avocado into 3/4-inch cubes and in a large bowl with a rubber spatula gently toss with onion and vinaigrette until combined well.Line 8 salad plates with lettuce leaves and mound avocado mixture on top.

column4: CucumbersMayonnaiseBlack Pepper	SaltSugarVinegar	PaprikaVery thin white bread( These can be open faced or closed)
column5: Peel, slice cucumbers paper thin.  Put sugar into ice water (to taste); Put a little vinegar into water, also.  Let soak for 2 hours.  Dry well with towels.Remove crust from bread. Cut bread into rounds, using round biscuit cutter to cut breadSpread with mayo.  Sprinkle with pepper. Put slice of cucumber on each round.  Put a layer of waxed paper in large tupperware container with top.  Place sandwiches on waxed paper.  Cover with moist paper towels.  Repeat each layer.  Cover with lid.  Refrigerate until ready to use.  Place small piece of parsley in center of each sandwich.

column4: 2 eggs1 1/2 cups milk2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted1 teaspoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon saltCooking oil
column5: Combine eggs and milk, beating until well blendedSift together flour, baking powder and salt; add to egg mixture and beat until smooth.Heat coking oil 1 inch deep in frying pan, electric skillet or deep fryer to 360*Cover the b ottom of a funnel with finger, pour in 1/2 cup batter and release into hot oil in spiral pattern.Fry until golden, turn with spatula and tongs, drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and/or cinnamon.May serve with syrup.

column4: SausageCream cheeseThin sliced Pepperidge Farm bread, crusts removedbacon
column5: Brown sausage, drainMix with cream cheeseSpread on bread and roll up.Wrap in thin sliced bacaon and secure with a tooth pick.  Bake until bacon is browned..Serve hot.

column4: 4 sweet Italian sausages2 pounds ground beef1 pound ground pork1 cup drained red kedney beans1/2 cup coarsely grated yellow onnion2 cloves garlic, finel shopped1 tablespoon Dinon mustard2 eggs2 tablespoons tomato paste2 scallions, thinly sliced2 tablespoons cilil powder2 teaspoons salt1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper1 1/2 teaspoons cumin1 teaspoon dried basil1 teaspoon dried oregano2 cups sweet red peppers, cut in 1/4" dice2 cups coarsely grated sharp Cheddar cheese2 cups chopped pitted black olives1 cup coarsely chopped parsley1/3 pound bacon strips
column5: 1. Prick sausages and place in skillet; cover with water, bring to a boil, and simmer for 20 minutes.  Drain, discard water; return sausages to skillet and brown.  Reserve on paper towel.2. Preheat oven to 350*3. In large bowl, combine beef pork, beans, onion, garlic, mustard, eggs, tomato paste, scallions, chili powder, salt, pepper, cumin, basil and oregano.  Mix gently with hands, but do not overmix..4 On flat surface, place a 20" square of parchment or waxed paper.  Spread meat loaf mixture to form a 12 x 15" rectangle.5. spread red peppers over surface, patting down slightl; cover peppers with grated cheese, then olives and parsley, patting all into place.6. Place the reserved sausages in a line along one 15" side of the meat rectangle.7. Using the waxed paper, carefully roll meat and stuffing into a jelly-roll shape.  Place in shallow baking pan, seam side down.8. Lay bacon strips over the loaf.  Bake for 2 hour and 10 minutes or until bacon is browned.  Carefully remove loaf from pan with two spatulas.  Let rest 15 minutes before slicing.
column6: May be served at room temperature

column4: 4 bone in pork rib or center cut chops (1/2")1 Teaspoon vegetable oil1/2 teaspoon sugarSalt and ground black pepper
column5: On medium heat place pan and 1/8 teaspoon oil.  sprinkle chops with salt and pepper.  sprinkle one side of each chop evenly with 1/8 teaspoon sugar, avoiding bone.Place chops, sugared side down in a 12-inch non stick skillet.  Press meat of each chop into pan.  Cook until lightly browned, 4 to 9 minutes.  Use tongs to flip chops.  Cover skillet, reduce heat to low, and cook until center of each chop registers 140*.  Transfer chops to platter, tent, and rest 5 minutes.Reduce pan juices adjust seasonings; place chops in juices and serve immediately.

column4: 2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) butter, divided2 tablespoons olive oil, divided2 cups chopped leeks (white and pale green parts only; about 2 medium)1 cup low-salt chicken broth 1/2 cup dry white wine2 garlic cloves, minced1/2 cup crme frache or sour cream3 tablespoons whole grain Dijon mustard2 1-pound pork tenderloins, each cut crosswise into 6 slices2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
column5: Melt 1 tablespoon butter with 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add leeks and cook until beginning to turn golden, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth, wine, and garlic. Boil until mixture is reduced to 1 2/3 cups, about 4 minutes. Whisk in crme frache and mustard; set aside. (Sauce can be made 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.) Melt 1 tablespoon butter with 1 tablespoon oil in another large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. Saut until browned and cooked, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer pork to platter. Add sauce to skillet; simmer sauce over medium heat until slightly thickened, scraping up any browned bits, about 2 minutes. Stir in chopped chives and tarragon. Season with salt and pepper.Return pork to skillet. Cook over medium heat just until rewarmed, stirring frequently, about 1 minute. Transfer to platter, sprinkle with parsley, and serve.

column4: 2 cups cake flour or 1 3/4 cup all purpose flour1 Tablespoons baking powder, rounded4 Tablespoons sugar1/2 Teaspoon salt1 stick butter2 eggs1/3 cup cream1 Tablespoon almond extract1 Teaspoon vanilla extract
column5: Sift flour, baking powder, sugar, salt.cut in butter;Beat eggs in separate bowl, reserving 2 tablespoons.  Add to the remainder and beat:1/3 cup cream and extractsMake well in dry ingredients and add liquid.  Combine and handle as little as possible.  Place on floured board.  Pat until it is a one inch thick circle.  Brush with reserved egg and sprinkle with coarse sugar. Cut into desired shapes. Bake 15 minutes at 450*

column4: 3-1/2 cups of water3/4 cup of chopped sweet or Vidalia onions3/4 cup of chopped green peppersOne 16 oz. can cubed tomatoes3/4 cup of long grain white riceOne 15 oz. can of red beans or 2 cups of cooked dry red beans (rinse and drain if canned)1 TBSP. margarine1/2 tsp. black pepper1/3 tsp. salt1/3 tsp. garlic powder3 dashes of cajun sauce or hot pepper spice (optional)
column5: Saut onions and green peppers in a small amount of olive oil, cook until tender.Pour water in a large skillet, add rice, beans, and remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.Turn the heat down to medium or low and allow mixture to simmer for 15 minutes.Add onions, green peppers and tomatoes.Stir, lightly, with a large fork or open spoon.  Keep on low and simmer and do not over stir.Allow water to cook down to desired thickness.

column4: 6 cups torn romaine lettuce1/2 pound grape tomatoes halved4 cups cooked, shredded chicken2 ripe avocados. peeled and diced1 large red onion sliced thinly1 pound cooked medium shrimp1 pint Marzetta chunky blu Cheese Dressing*6 slices cooked, crumbled bacon
column5: Layer:Lettuce, pat down, tomatoes, chicken avocado, onions, shrimp;Pat down more and pour dressing over top.Refrigerate at least one hour;top with bacon and serve.*Too heavy on dressing to use the whole pint.
column6: Season chicken when cooking, or it may be grilled.Layers may be made ahead, but do not add dressing until 1 hour before serving.

column4: 3 cans black beans1 can tomatoes1 can chicken broth2 to 3 cloves garlic, chopped fine2 celery stalks, chopped1 medium onion, chopped1 red pepper, chopped1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped1/2 cup cilantro or  to taste. 2 bay leaves1/2 teaspoon cumin2 or 3 shakes of hot sauce ( tobasco or other )Topping:1 pint sour cream1 limespring onions
column5: Brown onion, garlic, celery, peppers in olive oil. Drain two cans of beans in colander. Drain some of the liquid and mash up the other can with a fork in the can. This is the thickening agent.Add this and other ingredients together with the onions, etc. Simmer for about 30 to 40 minutes.   Topping. I also make a few days ahead. 1 pint sour cream 1 lime Grate the zest of 1 lime, add this and the juice of the lime to sour cream Spring onions cut up for the topping.
column6: Best, if cooked a couple days before serving.From Foodnetwork.com

column4: Fresh curly green kaleonionsbrown sugarMaple syruplemon juicebutter
column5: Wash greens, trim stems out and chop in rough dice.Cook in small amount of water until desired doneness.Onions:Peel, slice onions.  Cook slowly, about 10 minutes in butter until translucent.  Add brown sugar, maple syrup and lemon juice to taste.  Continue cooking until golden.Serve on top of greens.
column6: From the Tamarack kitchen run by chefs from the Greenbrier.

column4: 1 cauliflower headBoursin cheese roundSalt and pepper to taste
column5: Steam cauliflower until soft.  While still hot, place in food processor with Boursin cheese.  Mix.Place into greased souffle dish, top with Parm. cheese, Bake at 375* until browned

column4: 1 Tablespoon canola oil1 3/4 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts   or thighs cut into chunks1 large yellow onion, chopped14-ounce can fat-free less-sodium chicken broth3  15-ounce cans beans, no salt added (black, navy and kidney)3 cups no-salt added tomatoes1 cup sliced celery1 cup sliced carrots1 cup dry red wine1 large bay leaf1 Tablespoon Italian herbs1 cup smoked chicken breast, cubed1 cup fresh Italian parsley, chopped1 cup fresh cilantro, choppedsalt and freshly ground black pepper
column5: Heat oil in a large pot; brown chicken.  Remove chicken and set aside.Saute onions, celery, carrots until soft, about 5 minutes.  Add broth, beans, tomatoes, wine bay leaf, herbs and all chicken.Cover and simmer for 40 minutesAdd parsley, cilantro, salt and pepper and simmer 5 more minutes..

column4: 1 cup chopped walnuts1/2 cup all-purpose flour1/2 cup butter, softened2 (3.9 ounce) packages instant chocolate pudding mix2 cups cold milk1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened1 cup confectioners' sugar1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
column5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a medium bowl, combine walnuts and flour. Mix well, then stir in softened butter or margarine. Stir until ingredients are combined and mixture forms a ball. Press into bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, until golden brown. Remove and cool.Place pudding mix in a medium bowl and whisk in milk. Mix until smooth. Allow to set up for 5 minutes then spread on top of cooled crust.In a large bowl whip cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in confectioner's sugar until mixture is smooth. In a separate bowl, whip cream until soft peaks form, then fold into cream cheese mixture. Spread over pudding layer. Chill before serving.

column4: GROUPER FILETS (6OZ. PER PERSON)GRAPE OR CHERRY TOMATOESBELL PEPPERS SLICEDFRESH MUSHROOMS SLICEDFRESH FETA CHEESE 1-2 CUPSFRESH PARSLEY FRESH ROSEMARY SALT & PEPPER TO TASTEOLIVE OIL /  CUPALUMINUM FOIL BAKING BAG IN BAKING DISH
column5: PRE-HEAT OVEN TO 425BRUSH GROUPER WITH OLIVE OIL AND PLACE IN BAKING BAG IN A BAKING DISH. STIR ALL REMAINING INGREDIENTS (EXCEPT FETA CHEESE) IN THE OIL AND POUR OVER FISH IN THE BAKING BAG.  BAKE FOR 30 MINUTES AT 425 DEGREE OVEN.  REMOVE FROM OVEN, SLIT TOP WITH KNIFE ACROSS THE TOP TO OPEN.  REMOVE FISH AND VEGETABLES AND PLACE ON INDIVIDUAL SERVING PLATES.  SPRINKLE WITH FETA CHEESE AND ENJOY.

column4: 1 cup yellow cornmeal1 cup flour1/2 cup honey1 Tablespoon baking powder1/3 cup butter flavor shortening (Crisco is good)1 teaspoon salt3 eggs1 cup half-and-half cream or milk
column5: Set oven to 400 degrees.Grease an 8" x 8" baking pan.Combine all dry ingredients.Cut in the shortening with a pastry knife until it islike small crumbs.Beat in eggs, cream and honey; beat by hand with a wooden spoon until smooth.Pour into a well-greased and floured baking pan.Bake 20 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean,and the top of the cornbread is golden brown.  Don't overbake.
column6: This recipe can be doubled succesfully.From: Recipe*zaar

column4: Ziploc bagseggscheesehamoniongreen peppermushroomstomatohash brownssalsa
column5: Have guests write their name on a quart-size Ziploc freezer bag with permanent marker.Crack 2 eggs (large or extra-large) into the bag (not more than 2) shake to combine them.Put out a variety of ingredients such as:cheeses, ham, onion, green pepper, mushrooms, tomato, hash browns, salsa, etc.Each guest adds prepared ingredients of choice to their bag and shakes itMake sure to get the air out of the bag and zip it up.Place the bags into BUBBLING, boiling water for exactly 13 minutes.You can usually cook 6-8 omelets in a large pot.For more, make another pot of boiling water.Open the bags and the omelet will roll out easily .Be prepared for everyone to be amazed!
column6: Nice to serve with fresh fruit and coffee cake; everyone gets involved in the process and a great conversation piece.

column4: 2 eggs, separated1 cup sugar1 cup milk2 Tablespoons cake flour (may use all purpose)1 lemon, juice and grated rind
column5: Beat egg yolks and cream the sugar in.Add milk.  Sift the flour into this.Stir in juice and grated rind of lemon..  Fold into stiffly beaten egg whites.Pour into baking dish, and place into a second pan of hot water.  Bake at 325* for one hour.Cool in its own pan of water.Chill and serve with whipped cream

column4: 8 egg whites, beaten9 ounces sugar8 lemons, juice and grated rind1 pint whipped cream1/2 teaspoon lemon extract1 or 2 drops yellow food coloring
column5: To the beaten egg whites add the sugar gradually, then the lemon juice and grated lemon rind.To the whipped cream add the lemon extract and food coloring.  Add this mixture to the egg white mixture.Pour into a 6-inch souffle mold.  Chill in freezer for six hours.

column4: 2 egg whites, beaten stiff1 cup sugar2 Tablespoons room temperature water1 teaspoon vanilla1 teaspoon vinegar1/4 teaspoon salt
column5: To stiffly beaten egg whites, add sugar 1/3 cup at a time.Mix in remaining ingredients.Cook on cookie sheet lined with brown paper* for one hour at 300*.  CoolIce with whipped cream and sprinkkle with chocolate.  Chill.
column6: Draw a cake pan sized circle on the paper so you can make a nice round form.

column4: Boston ButtMarinade:5 Tablespoons soy sauce4 segments minced garlic1 bay leaf1/4 cup vinegar + 3 Tablespoons water3 Tablespoons white wine1 teaspoon black pepper
column5: Trim butt and cut into small pieces.Marinate for up to 10 hours.Thread on to skewers and broil until browned and cooked trough.
column6: I add fresh mushrooms, green pepper chunks, pieces of onion and tomato to the skewers.  This is "meat on a stick" from Letty.

column4: 1 pound backfin or lump crab meat1/2 cup mayonnaise (use less at first)Season mayonnaise with the following to taste:SaltWhite pepperDash of cayenne1 Tablespoon lemon juice!/2 teaspoon Worchestershire sauceDash of mace if desired
column5: Carefully separate crab meat, and gently stir in mayonnaise mixture. Serve cold as a salad or as an appetizer.This may be served hot in shells; or browned in oven topped with bread crumbs and dots of butter.
column6: Culinary Gems from The Kitchens of Old Virginia(out of print)

column4: 3 large lemons1 cup sugar5 large egg yolks1/2 cup unsalted butter
column5: In sucepan over medium heat, combind grated lemon zet from 2 of the lemons with the sugar.  Add egg yolks and lemon juice to the sugar mixture and stir.  Add the butter and stir util m elted.  Cook and stir until thick.  Set aside to cool with a piece of wax paper set against the surface of the curd.  Use to fill the layers of cake.
column6: "Cakes from Scratch in Half the Time."

column4: 1 cup whipping cream2 Tablespoons sour cream or creme fraiche2 Tablespoons sugar1 teaspoon vanilla extract
column5: Combine the cream, sour cream, sugar and vanilla and whip until soft peaks form.  Refrigerate, covered until time to serve.
column6: "Cakes from Scratch in Half the Time."

column4: 1/3 cup whipping cream4 ounces  bittersweet chocolate, chopped1/3 cup salted peanuts, chopped
column5: Place cream in a 2-cup glass measure and heat to boiling in the microwave on high, about 1 minute.Add the chocolate and microwave on high for about 1 1/2 minutes more.  Let stand for a few moments, then whisk until thick and glossy.spread onto cakes.
column6: "Cakes from Scratch in Half the Time."

column4: 1 large egg8 ounces dried apricots, chopped1 cup water1/2 cup unsalted butter1/2 cup sugar2 cups sifted cake flour1 teaspoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup orange juice1/2 cup walnut pieces
column5: Heat oven to 400* RCream butter until light, add sugar and beat until fluffy.  Add the egg, and beat well.  Add the flour, baking powder and salt in thirds alternating with the orange juice and 1/4 cup of the apricot soaking liquid.  Mix just until moistened.  Fold in drained apriccots and nuts.Pour batter into prepared pan; lay foil shiny side down, loosely over top and bake for 25 minutes.  Remove foil and continue baking until a wooden pick inserted in the middle comes out clean, about 20 minutes more.  Cool in the pan on a rack for 5 minutes, ten flip out onto the rack.  Wrap in plastic and store when completely cooled.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.  Makes one9 x 5" loaf cake.
column6: "Cakes from Scratch in half the Time."

column4: 2 teaspoons minced onion1 tablespoon unsalted butter1 tablespoon brandy1/2 cup heavy cream3 tablespoons slivered almonds1 teaspoon minced fresh flat-leaf parsley1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce1/4 lb sea scallops (2 or 3), tough muscle removed from side of each if necessary and scallops sliced into 1/8-inch-thick roundsFine sea salt
column5: Cook onion in butter in a heavy medium skillet over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened. Add brandy and cook until evaporated. Stir in cream, almonds, parsley, and Worcestershire sauce and simmer 1 minute.Lightly season scallops with sea salt and add to sauce. Simmer gently just until sauce is thickened and scallops are cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve immediately in ramekins.

column4: 8    ounces orzo (rice-shaped pasta)6    tablespoons olive oil1    cup crumbled feta cheese1/4  cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese2    tablespoons plus 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil1    pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled,          deveined2    garlic cloves, chopped1   14 1/2-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice1/2 cup dry white wine2    teaspoons dried oregano1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper
column5: Preheat oven to 400F. Brush 11x7-inch glass baking dish with oil. Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain well and return orzo to same pot. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 cup feta cheese, Parmesan cheese, and 2 tablespoons basil; stir to blend. Arrange orzo mixture in prepared dish.Heat 2 tablespoons oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and saut until slightly pink, about 2 minutes (shrimp will not be cooked through). Arrange shrimp atop orzo.* Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to same skillet. Add garlic and saut over medium-high heat 30 seconds. Add tomatoes with juice; cook 1 minute. Stir in wine, oregano, crushed red pepper, and remaining 1/4 cup basil. Simmer uncovered until reduced to thick sauce consistency, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; spoon over shrimp. Bake orzo until heated through, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 3/4 cup feta cheese and serve.Makes 6 first-course or 4 main-course servings.
column6: *I  sometimes add lightly sauted scallops at this point.

column4: Fresh tomatoes, peeledSeasoned Italian bread crumbssalt and pepper to taste8 small fish fillets1/2 cup white Port wine or Marsala4 Tablespoons butter1 teaspoon lemon juiceFreshly grated Parmesan cheesePaprikaSqueeze of lemon
column5: In buttered 13 x 9 inch baking dish slice enough tomatoes to cover bottom; sprinkle with crumbs.Arrange fish in single layer over mixture.Combine wine butter, lemon jusice in saucepan and cook 3 minutes. Pour over fish.Sprinkle with grated cheese and paprika.  Squeeze lemon over allBake at 500* for 10-20 minutes

column4: 1/3 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and diced1 plum tomato, seeded and chopped1 shallot, minced1 Tablespoon julienne fresh basil leaves1 Tablespoon drained capers1/4 teaspoon freshly grated orange zest1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice2 Tablespoons olive oilfreshly ground black peppertwo 6-ounce pieces cod filletFresh basil garnish
column5: Stir olives, tomato, shallot, basil, capers, zest, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon oil in bowl to make salsa.  Season with freshly ground black pepper and salt.Season cod with salt.  In a non-stick skillet heat remaining tablespoon oil over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and cook cod about 4 minutes on each side, or until golden and cooked through.Spoon salsa over cod and garnish with basil sprigs.

column4: 1/2 pound Brussels sprouts2 large garlic cloves1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter1 tablespoon olive oil2 tablespoons pine nuts Serves 2 or 3 as a side dish.
column5: Trim Brussels sprouts and halve lengthwise. Cut garlic into very thin slices. In a 10-inch heavy skillet (preferably well-seasoned cast iron) melt 1 tablespoon butter with oil over moderate heat and cook garlic, stirring, until pale golden. Transfer garlic with a slotted spoon to a small bowl. Reduce heat to low and arrange sprouts in skillet, cut sides down, in one layer. Sprinkle sprouts with pine nuts and salt to taste. Cook sprouts, without turning, until crisp-tender and undersides are golden brown, about 15 minutes.With tongs transfer sprouts to a plate, browned sides up. Add garlic and remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to skillet and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until pine nuts are more evenly pale golden, about 1 minute. Spoon mixture over sprouts and sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
column6: This recipe can be prepared in 45 minutes or less.Gourmet Magazine 1999

column2: TUNA STEAKS WITH GARLIC, TOMATOES, CAPERS, AND BASIL
column4: Serve with Chardonnay or Sauvignon Blanc.6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil2 cups chopped onions2 garlic cloves, minced1 pound plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped1 cup (loosely packed) fresh basil leaves1 1/2 tablespoons capers, rinsed, drained4 5- to 6-ounce ahi tuna steaks (each about 1 inch thick)
column5: Heat 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add onions; saut until tender, about 5 minutes. Add garlic; saut until golden, about 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, basil, and capers. Simmer uncovered until mixture thickens, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.Meanwhile, heat remaining 3 tablespoons oil in another heavy large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Add fish to skillet and cook until light brown at edges but pink in center, about 3 minutes per side. Pour in tomato mixture. Simmer until fish is opaque in center, about 5 minutes longer. Serve fish immediately.
column6: Bon Apptit  June 2001Flavors of the World

column4: 50 middle neck clams1 can chicken broth18 ounces white winefresh garlic
column5: Layer clams in pot with broth, garlic, wine and simmer until they open. Dip in cocktail sauce or melted butter.

column4: 2 sticks of butter1 1/2 cups powdered sugar1 egg yolk3 Tablsepoons boiling water
column5: Cream butter, sugar, egg well.Add water and beat.  Flavor to taste with wine, brandy, or bourbon.Add your spirit of choice slowly to keep from curdling.  Will keep a long time.

column4: 4 fajita size flour tortillas1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts,   grilled and sliced1 red bell pepper, sliced1/4 cup sliced red onion2 cups mixed salad greensHellmann's Mayonnaise
column5: Spread mayonnaise on to tortillasStuff tortilla with layers of chicken, peppers, onion and salad greens down center of each.Roll and fold the filled tortilla

column4: 1/2 cup dry mustard1/2 cup mustard seed2/3 cup water3/4 cup white wine vinegar3 Tablespoons honey2 teaspoons salt2 teaspoons  herbs finely chopped
column5: Combine dry mustard, seeds, water in a blender and whirl to course chop.Place in bowl, cover and let set unrefrigerated for 8 hours.  Return to blender and add other ingredients.  Store in refrigerator for several months.

column4: 1 cup good mayonnaise1 cup chopped scallions, white and green parts1 cup chopped fresh basil leaves1/4 cup freshly ssqueezed lemon juice (2 lemons)2 teaspoons chopped garlic (2 cloves)2 teaspoons anchovy paste2 teaspoons kosher salt1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper1 cup sour cream3 heads Bibb lettuce2 to 3 tomatoes
column5: Place manonnaise,and next 7 ingredients into a food processor and blend until smooth.  Add sour cream and process until just blended.  Refrigerate until ready to serveCut lettuce heads into quarters; remove core, and arrange on 6 salad plates.  Cut tomatoes into wedges and add to the plates.  Pour on dressing and serve.

column4: 1 cup good mayonnaise 1 cup chopped scallions, white and green parts (6 to 7 scallions) 1 cup chopped fresh basil leaves 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (2 lemons) 2 teaspoons chopped garlic (2 cloves) 2 teaspoons anchovy paste 2 teaspoons kosher salt 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1 cup sour cream 3 heads Bibb lettuce 2 to 3 tomatoes
column5: Place the mayonnaise, scallions, basil, lemon juice, garlic, anchovy paste, salt and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth. Add the sour cream and process just until blended. (If not using immediately, refrigerate the dressing until ready to serve.)Cut each head of lettuce into quarters, remove some of the cores, and arrange on 6 salad plates. Cut the tomatoes into wedges and add to the plates. Pour on the dressing and serve.

column4: 8 ounces marscapone cheese, softened*1 1/2 cups whipping cream1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla1 (2 lb.) frozen pecan pie, thawed and cut into 1-inch cubes.1/3 cup chocolate fudge topping1/3 cup caramel topping1/2 cup chopped pecans, toasted
column5: Beat cheese, whipping cream and vanilla 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth and firm.Place half of pie cubes in bottom of a 4-qt. truffle bowl.  Spread half of whipped cream mixture over pie cubes; drizzle with half of each topping. Sprinkle with half of chopped pecans.  Repeat leayers.Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 8 hours.
column6: *may substitute 8-ozs. softened cream cheeseSouthern Living, Dec. '06

column4: 1 Bag Organic Arugula1 Bag Casablanca Trail MixDressing:1 cup Grapefruit Vingar1/4 Cup Olive Oil1/8 cup sugar
column5: Mix ingredients thoroughly.Serve as side dish to fish, chicken or pork.

column4: 1 cup butter1 cup other shortening1 cup sugar1 cup powdered sugar2 eggs4 cups flour1 tespoon cream of tarter1 teaspoon soda1 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon or vanilla or almond extactsugar for topping
column5: Cream shortenings, sugars; add eggs and dried ingredients.Bake at 350* until browned at edges; sprinkle sugar on top

column4: 1 can coconut milk1 medium onion, chopped1 16-ounce can whole plum tomatoes, chop and save juice1 Teaspoon garliccouple of dashes of Tobasco sauce4 to 6 chicken breasts1 or 2 teaspoons ground corinadergrated cheese
column5: Saute chicken with small amount of oil.Remove from pan and saute onion, garlic and coriander;  add tomatoes, a little juice, and tobasco.  Mix chicken and coconut milk wit tomato mixture in casserole.Bakecovered in 350* oven until bubbling.Add grated cheese and broil until melted.

column4: 1 pound extra-lean ground beef1 green bell pepper, chopped1 medium onion, chopped2 garlic cloves, minced2 (14.5 ounce) cans Mexican-style stewed tomatoes, chopped1 (16-ounce) can chili beans1/2 small butternut squash, peeled and cubed     (about 1 1/2 cups)1 cup low sodium beef broth1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder1 cup frozen corn kernels
column5: Cook beef, bell pepper, onion and garlic in Dutch oven over medium-high heat until meat is no longer pink.  Drain.Stir in tomatoes and next 5 ingredients.  Bring to a boil; cover, reuce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 minutes.  Stir in corn, and cook uncovered 15 minutes or until squash is tender and chili is thickened.

column2: TURKEY CUTLETS W/MUSHROOMS AND FONTINA CHEESE
column4: 2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme or 1   teaspoon dried3/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon ground allspice1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper6 1/3-inch-thick turkey cutlets (1 to 1 1/4 pounds total) 5 tablespoons butter2 large shallots, chopped3/4 pound fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed, caps thickly sliced1 tablespoon all purpose flour3/4 cup dry white wine1 cup canned low-salt chicken broth1/2 cup (packed) grated Fontina cheese (about 3 ounces)1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese (about 1 1/2 ounces)
column5: Butter 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Mix first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Sprinkle all of seasoning mixture over both sides of cutlets, pressing to adhere. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 3 cutlets; saut until brown, about 1 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer to prepared dish. Melt 1 more tablespoon butter in skillet. Brown remaining cutlets; transfer to same dish.Melt remaining 3 tablespoons butter in same skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and saut 1 minute. Add mushrooms. Saut until brown, about 6 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon flour; stir 1 minute. Add wine and boil 1 minute, whisking occasionally. Add broth and cook until sauce thickens slightly, whisking occasionally, about 3 minutes. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over cutlets. Sprinkle cheeses over. (Can be made 1 day ahead; cover and refrigerate.)Preheat oven to 400F. Bake cutlets uncovered until heated through and cheeses melt, about 10 minutes.

column2: GRILLED TUNA AND PEPPERS W/ CAPER VINAIGRETTE
column4: 3/4 pound Italian-style peppers (banana or bell)2 (3/4 pond) sushi-grade tuna steaks 1-inch thick1 1/4 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon back pepper1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard1/4 cup olive oil1 1/2 Tablespoons small capers in brine, drained and chopped2 tablespoons chopped fresh flatleaf parsley
column5: Cut peppers lengthwise into quarters; trim ends so that quarters lie flat.Sprinkle tuna with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.  Cook tuna and peppers on oiled grill rack, turning once, 4 to 6 minutes total.Whisk together lemon juice, mustard and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in small bowl.  Add olive oil in slow stream, whisking until emulsified.  Whisk in capers and parsley.Serve tuna topped with peppes and caper vinagette

column4: 2 pounds fresh green beans, trimmed8 bacon slices3 cups sliced shiitake mushrooms (7 ozs.)1/4 cup chopped shallots1/8 to 1/4 tspoon dried crushed red pepper1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper1/4 teaspoon salt
column5: Cook beans in boiling salted water over medium-high heat 4 minutes; drain; plunge into ice water; drain.Cook bacon until crisp; drain reserving 1 1/2 Tablespoons drippings in skillet.  Crumble baconSaute mushrooms and shallots in hot dripping 5 minutes;  Add green beans and crushed red pepper; saute 1 to 2 minutes; stir in crumbled bacon, black pepper and salt.
column6: 2 pounds fresh asparagus may be substituted for green beans.Southern Living

column4: 2 (3-ounce) packages ladyfingers2 tablespoons instant coffee granules1/4 cup hot water6 (1.4-ounce) toffee candy bars, divided1/2 gallon vanilla ice cream, softened*3 tablespoons coffee liqueur, (optional)1 (8-ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
column5: Stand ladyfingers around edge of 9-inch springform pan; line bottom with remaining ladyfingers.Combine coffee and 1/4 cup hot water in a small bowl, stirring until dissolved; let cool completely.Chop 5 candy bars into small pieces; Stir candy and coffee into ice cream.  Spoon into prepared pan.Cover with plastic wrap, and freeze 8 hours.Stir liqueur into whipped topping.  Dollop around edge of ice cream mixture.Chop remaining candy bar and sprinkle over top.Freeze.  Let stand 30 minutes before serving.
column6: *1/2 gallon coffee ice cream may be substituted for vanilla ice cream; omit coffee granules and water.southern Living

column4: 2 1/2 cups whipping cream1/2 cup milk6 egg yolks3/4 cup sugar2 teaspoons vanilla 2 Tablespoons dark rum (optional)1 Tablespoon water1 Tablespoon lemon juice3 firm, ripe bananas, thinly sliced1/3 cup sugar
column5: Preheat oven to 350*Heat cream and milk over medium heat just until bubly around edges.Combine egg yolks, the 3/4 cup sugar, and vanilla.  Beat until just combined; slowly whisk hot cream mixture into the egg mixture; stir in rum.Place 8 3/4 cup ramekins in a baking pan.  Set pan on oven rack. Divide custard mixture evenly among ramekins.  Pour enough hot water into the baking pan around the ramekins to reach halfway up the ides of ramekins.Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.  Remove from water bath, cool, cover and chill at lest 1 hour or up to 8 hours.Before serving let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes.  In medium bowl, stir together water and lemon juice.  Add banana slices, and toss to coat; drain and arrange on top of custards.To caramelize sugar*, place 1/3 cup sugar in a heavy 8-inch skillet.  Heat until sugar begins to melt, shaking skilled occasionally to heat sugar evenly.  Do not stir.  When sugar starts to melt, lower heat and cook about 3 minutes more until all the sugar is melted and a very light golden brown, stirring as needed with a wooden spoon.Using a wooden spoon or fork, drizzle the caramleized sugar over custards.  Let stand for 2 or 3 minutes to harden sugar.*Turbinado raw can sugar may be sprinkled over custards and melted with a kitchen or propane torch.

column2: BEEF AND ANDOUILLE BURGERS WITH ASIAGO CHEESE
column4: 4   oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, drained 1/2 cup mayonnaise 1    tablespoon whole-grain Dijon mustard 8    ounces andouille sausages,* cut into 1-inch             pieces 2 1/2 pounds ground beef (15% fat)  2  large shallots, minced 2  teaspoons salt 2  teaspoons ground black pepper 1  teaspoon fennel seeds, crushed 6  large sesame-seed hamburger buns 6  1/3-inch-thick slices red onion     Olive oil 1   cup coarsely grated Asiago cheese** 1  7- to 7 1/2-ounce jar roasted red peppers, drained
column5: Finely chop sun-dried tomatoes in processor. Blend in mayonnaise and mustard. Transfer to small bowl. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill.)Finely chop andouille sausages in processor. Transfer to large bowl. Add beef, shallots, salt, pepper, and crushed fennel seeds. Stir with fork just until blended. Form mixture into six 1-inch-thick patties.Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Grill hamburger buns until golden, about 2 minutes. Transfer to platter. Brush onion slices with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill until golden, about 7 minutes per side. Grill hamburgers to desired doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Sprinkle cheese over top of burgers.Spread cut sides of hamburger buns with sun-dried-tomato mayonnaise. Top bottom halves of buns with hamburgers, then red peppers. Top with onion slices. Cover with top halves of buns and serve.*Smoked pork-and-beef sausages, sold at specialty foods stores and supermarkets. Kielbasa can be substituted.

column2: ROAST CHICKEN LEGS WITH LEMON AND THYME
column4: 4 chicken thighs and 4 drumsticks (2 1/2 pounds total)3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil5 (3- to 4-inch) sprigs fresh thyme2 garlic cloves, smashed3/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper4 (1/4-inch-thick) lemon slices
column5: Put oven rack in upper third of oven and preheat oven to 500F.Toss chicken with oil, thyme sprigs, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large bowl, then transfer to a large (17- by 12-inch) shallow heavy baking pan (1 inch deep).Bake chicken 10 minutes, then add lemon slices to pan. Continue to bake until chicken is golden and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes more. Serve chicken with lemon slices.

column4: 4-5 cups (16-20 oz) Flour 1 teaspoon Baking Soda 1/2 teaspoon Salt 2/3 cup Shortening (5 1/4oz Butter) 1 cup Sugar (8 oz) 1 cup Molasses (11 oz) 2 Eggs (beaten) 1 cup ButtermilkFilling4 cup Dried Apples1 cup Brown Sugar1/2 teaspoon Cloves
column5: Preheat oven to 350f. Grease, paper and flour 3 9" round pans.Cover apples with water and cook until soft. Mash with potato masher, then add apples and cloves.Cream together shortening, sugar and molasses. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda. Mix beaten eggs and buttermilk together. Add dry and wet ingredients, alternating in small amount, to creamed mixture. (You may need to add more flour (up to 1 cup) at this point so mixture will not flow).Divide mixture into 9" round pans, leveling off dough in each pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 min (or until they test done). Cakes will rise very little.Cool in pans about 10 min then turn onto wire racks until cooled completely. Cut each layer horizontally so you now have 6 layers. Spread approx. 1/2 cup filling between each layer.This cake is best when allowed to sit 24-48 hours at room temp. after assembly. Dust with confectioner's sugar when ready to serve.

column4: 2 cups nuts 1 Tablespoon sugar1/2 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon curry powder1/4 teaspoon ground cumin1/4 teaspoon ground coriandercrystalized ginger to taste Glaze:2 Tablespoons water1 teaspoon brown sugar1 Tablespoon butter
column5: Toast nuts on baking sheet lined with parchment in 350* oven about 10 minutes stirring once or twice.Mix spicesBring glaze to a boil, whisking constantly.  Stir in nuts and cook until nuts are shiny and almost all liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes.  Transfer nuts and glaze mix to bowl with spice mix; toss well to coat. Cool on baking sheet.

column4: 4 cloves garlic, peeled1   teaspoons salt1 bunch broccoli, cut into florets cup olive oil cup red wine vinegar1 Tablesoon Dijon mustard cup grated Parmesan cheese
column5: Place garlic in a mortar dish or on a cutting board and sprinkle with salt. Mash with a pestle or use the flat side of a knife to mash garlic and salt into a paste. Transfer to a medium bowl. Stir in olive oil, vinegar and mustard. Add the broccoli and stir to coat. Chill for 3 hours to marinate, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

column4: 12	4x2 1/2-inch slices smoked salmon3/4	cup (about) crme frache or sour cream3/4	cup chopped fresh basil12	large fresh basil leaves
column5: Place 1 salmon slice on work surface. Spread 2 teaspoons crme frache over salmon. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons chopped basil. Sprinkle with pepper. Starting at 1 short end, roll up salmon slice, enclosing filling. Spread 1 teaspoon crme frache over top of roll; sprinkle with 1 teaspoon chopped basil. Cut roll crosswise into 5 slices (keep sliced roll together). Repeat with remaining salmon, crme frache, and chopped basil. (Can be made 6 hours ahead. Transfer salmon rolls to plate; cover and chill.) Arrange basil leaves on platter. Using small spatula, top each basil leaf with 1 sliced salmon roll, fanning slightly.

column4: 1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for bread2 1/2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced2 teaspoons kosher salt1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper1 1/2 teaspoons red pepper flakes6 pounds small (less than 2 inches wide) hard-shelled clams such as littlenecks or cockles, scrubbed1 1/4 cup white wine1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves2 loaves rustic Italian bread, sliced into 1-inch-thick pieces1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil1/4 cup fresh Italian flat-leaf parsley, coarsely chopped
column5: Cook clams:In 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add garlic and saut until golden brown, about three minutes. Add salt, pepper, and pepper flakes, and saut until fragrant, about 1 minute. Increase heat to moderately high and add clams, white wine, 1 1/4 cups water, and thyme. Cover and bring to a boil. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until clams open, about 5 to 7 minutes. Discard clams that do not open after 8 minutes.2 of 3While clams cook, grill bread:Preheat grill (high heat).Brush bread slices with olive oil on both sides and grill, flipping once, until golden brown and crispy, about 4 minutes per side. (Alternately, bread may be toasted in broiler until golden brown and crispy.) Keep warm.When clams are cooked, stir in parsley. Serve clams with grilled bread.

column4: 3/4 cup chopped pecans1 1/4 cups powdered sugar, divided1 cup butter, softened2 Tablespoons milk1 teaspoon vanilla extract2 cups all-purpose flour1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa1/4 teaspoon salt
column5: Place pecans in a single layer in a shallow pan and bake for 6 to 8 minutes at 350*Beat 1 cup powdered sugar and butter until creamy.  Add milk and vanilla.Combine flour, cocoa, and salt; gradually add to butter mixture.  Stir in pecansShape dough into 1-inch balls and place 1 1/2 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheets.Bake at 400* for 11 to 13 minutes until tops of cookies just begin to crack.  Cool on baking sheets 3 minutes.  Remove to wire cooling racks; dust with remaining 1/4 cup powdered sugar.

column4: 1/2 cup cider vinegar1/4 cup packed brown sugar2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger3 medium cucumbers, sliced4  4-oz. tilapia fillets1/4 to 3/4 inch thick1  6-oz, carton plain yogurt2 tablespoons snipped fresh mint1/4 teaspoon saltgrated lemon peel.
column5: Preheat broiler.  Stir vinegar, brown suga, ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon salt until sugar is dissolved.  Remove 1/4 cup.  Add cucumbers to remaining vinegar mixture; tossSpray broiler pan with Pam.  Arrange fish on rack and brush with reserved vinegar mixture.  Broil 4 o 6 mnutes until fish flakes easily.Combine yogurt and mint.  Place cucumbers on plates, top wth fish, yogurt, lemon peel and coarsely ground black pepper.

column4: 3/4 cup chopped pecans2 lbs. fresh Brussels sprouts2 Tablespoons butter1 shallot, chopped2 cloves carlic, minced1/4 lb. proscoitto, cut into thin strips1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice1/2 teaspoon pepper1/2 teaspoon salt1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
column5: Toast pecans at 350* for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring after 5 minutes.Remove discolored leaves from Brussels sprouts;  cut each sprout into half, then into shreds.Melt butter in large skillet, add shallot and garlic and saute 1 to 2 minutes until tender.Add shredded Brussels sprouts to skillet; saute 8 to 10 minutes or until just tender.  Add prosciutto andnext 3 ingredients; saute 2 more minutes. Remove from heat, and sprinkle with cheese and toasted pecans.

column4: 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter1 small onion, chopped1 green bell pepper, chopped1/4 teaspoon dried basil, crumbled1 14 1/2-ounce can tomatoes, drained, choppedSalt and pepper1 1/2 pounds haddock or lingcod fillets2 cups grated mozzarella
column5: Preheat oven to 350F. Grease 9-inch glass baking dish. Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper and basil and saut until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper and cook until saucelike, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes. Arrange fish in prepared dish. Pour sauce over. Sprinkle mozzarella. Bake until fish is cooked through and top is golden, about 25 minutes.

column4: 3 ounce sugar free lime jello (1 box)2 8-oz. light key lime pie flavor yogurts1 8-oz. fat free Cool Whiplime zest 1 Graham cracker crust (low sugar)
column5: Dissolve jello  in 1/4 cup of boiling waterStir in other ingredients in order listedPlace in prepared crust.Grate lime zest over.ChillGarnish with thin slices of lime if desired.

column4: For Syrup:4 T unsalted butter1/4 c brown sugar (packed)2 T pure maple syrupFinely grated zest of 1 lemonJuice of 1/2 lemon1 t pure vanilla extract1/2 t ground nutmeg6 (12 oz) sweet potatoes, cooked
column5: 1. Mix syrup ingredients into a small pot; swirl over low heat until combined, about 5 min.2. Mash the cooked sweet potatoes with a fork or masher until smooth, drizzling with syrup.  Season with salt.  Serve hot (or cover and reheat later in a preheated 350 oven for 15 - 20 minutes).Per Serving:  310 cal, 62 g carb, 4 g protein, 6g fat, 15 mg cholesterol

column4: 1 cup water1 cup sugar12-ounce bag of fresh cranberries1 or 2 finely chopped jalapenos1 Tablespoon chopped cilantro1/2 teaspoon cumin2 sliced green onions1 Tablespoon lime juice.
column5: Place water and sugar in a sauce pan; bring to a boil.Add cranberries and return to boil.  Cook without stirring 10 minutes.Cool Add peppers, cilantro, cumin, onions, and lime juice.Stir well, Serve chilled or at room temperature.

column4: 4 romaine lettuce bunches1 small red onion2 Tablespoons olive oilVegetable cooking spray1/2 cup freshly shaved Parmesan cheeseKosher salt andd freshly ground pepper to tasteButtermilk-Chive Dressing3/4 cup buttermilk1/2 cup mayonnaise2 Tablespoons chopped fresh chives1 Tablespoon, minced green onion1 garlic clove, minced1/2 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepperWhiskk together alll ingredients.  Cover and chill. May be stored in the refrigerator up to 3 days.
column5: Discard outer leaves of romaine bunches, cut bunches in half lengthwise, keeping leaves intact.Peel onion, and cut in half  vertically, keeping core intact.  Cut each half into 4 wedges.  Brush lettuce and onion with olive oil.Spray cold cooking grate with cooking spray, and grill onion wedges at 300* to 350* for 3 to 4 minutes with grill lid closed. Remove.Place romaine halves, cut sides down, on grate.  Grill without lid 2 to 3 minutes or until just wilted.Divide grilled lettuce, cut sides up among serving plates.  Top with 1 onion wedge, and drizzle with Buttermilk-chive dressing.  Sprinkle with shaved Parmesan cheese.

column4: 5 ounces dried Black Mission figs quartered     (3/4 cup)5 ounces dried Calimyrna figs, quartered (3/4 c)4 Tablespoons unsalted butter2 cups ruby or tawny port1/2 cup water2 strips lemon zest2 dried bay leaves1 cinnamon stick1 Tablespoon sugar1/4 teaspoon course saltFreshly ground pepper to taste.
column5: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until the liquid is the consistency of a loose jam, about 40 minutes.Discard bay leaves and cinnamon stick, or reserve for garnish.Chutney can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 1 week; bring to room temperature, and reheat in a pan over low heat, adding water as needed.

column4: 2 pork loins, 1 1/2 lbs. total4 garlic cloves, crushed   Extra virgin olive oil for drizzling1 teaspoon coarse salt1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper1 medium onion sliced 3/4 inch thick1 bunch small carrots (about 3/4 pound) stems   trimmed to 1/2 inch, halved lengthwise
column5: Preheat oven to 450*.  Rub pork with garlic and oil, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Arrange onion on a rimmed baking sheet, and place pork on top.  Scatter carrots and garlic around meat.Drizzle lightly with oil.Roast, stirring vegetables halfway through, until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the pork registers 145* for medium, 20 to 25 minutes.  Let rest for 10 minutes.  Slice pork, and serve warm or at room temperature with roasted vegetables and chutney.

column4: 1 loaf panettone or 1-lb raisin challah1/2 cup sugar1 teaspoon ground cinnamon8 large eggs2 cups whole milk2/3 cup dark rum8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter
column5: Preheat oven to 200*.  Cut bread into 1 inch thick slices.  Combine sugar and cinnamon in small bowl.  Whisk together eggs, milk, rum.Dip bread into egg mixture; let stand 2 minute.Melt 2 tablespoons butter in large non stick pan over medium heat.  cook bread until golden brown and firm to touch about 4 minutes on each side.Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar over French toast, turning to coat on all sides.  Cook unil sugar melts, turning once, about 2 minutes.  Transfer to baking sheet; keep warm in oven.  Transfer to plates

column4: Dough: 1 cup unsalted butter, room temp 3/4 cup confectioners' sugar 1 1/2 tsp finely grated lime zest 2 T freshly squeezed lime juice 1/4 tsp salt 2 cups flour 1 cup shredded sweetened coconutCoating:1 cup shredded sweetened coconut 1 cup confectioners' sugar (sift for lumps) 1 1/2 tsp finely grated lime zest 2 T cornstarch (sift for lumps)
column5: Combine Coating ingredients in zippered plastic bag:  Preheat oven to 350.  Prepare two baking sheets with parchment.Dough:  Combine butter and sugar, beat on med speed for about 4 min until light and fluffy.  Add lime juice.  Fold in zest, salt, flour and coconut, mixing well.  Lightly flour hands and roll into 1" balls (note:  I used a 1" scoop).  Place balls about 1" apart on baking sheet.  Bake for 15 minutes or until they are puffy but not browned (bottoms will be turning golden).  Cool for no more than 5 minutes.Toss warm cookies gently in coating mix.  Cool completely on wire rack.
column6: This was enough coating for two batches of cookies, though we had to add a touch more sugar)

column4: 1 stick butter1 cup brown sugar1/4 cup whole milk1 teaspoon vanilla
column5: Melt butter in heavy small skillet over medium heat. Whisk in remaining 1 cup brown sugar, then milk. Continue to whisk until topping is smooth and blended and comes to boil, about 5 minutes. Whisk in remaining 1 teaspoon vanilla. Spoon 1/4 cup hot caramel topping over warm cake in pan. Let stand until topping is absorbed into cake, about 15 minutes. Turn cake out onto platter. Pour remaining warm topping over cake. Let stand until cool, at least 1 hour. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover with cake dome. Let stand at room temperature.)
column6: Pour this on top and bottom of Apple cake

column4: 1/3 cup mayonnaise2 Tablespons pesto sauce8 sourdough bread slices4 (1-oz.) fontina, provolone or mozzarella cheese slices1 (12-oz.) jar roasted red bell peppers, drained, chopped4 (1-ounce) Chedar cheese slices
column5: stir mayo and pesto sauce together; spread on 1 side of bread.  Place 4 bread slices, pesto sides down, on waxed paper.Layer 4 slices of bread with cheese, peppers, and one chedda cheese slice.  Top with remaining bread slice, pesto sides up.Cook sandwiches in batches on a hot griddle or in a nonstick skillet 3 minutes each side or until golden brown and cheese melts.

column4: 1 cup steel cut Irish oats2 Tablespoons butter3 cups water1 cup milkpinch salt, optional
column5: Toast oatmeal in pan with butter until golden.Add water and cook, stirring frequently for about 30 minutes.Add milk and cook to desired consistency.

column4: 3/4 cup teriyaki sauce2 tablespoons soy sauce2 tablespoons firmly packed brown sugar1 tablespoon Sherry or white wine1 tablespoon rice vinegar1 tablespoon vegetable oil1 teaspoon Asian sesame oil3 garlic cloves, minceda 1-inch piece fresh gingerroot, peeled and chopped fine2 scallions, chopped finea pinch dried hot red pepper flakes, or to tastefour 8-ounce tuna or swordfish steaks
column5: In a large shallow dish stir together all ingredients except fish until combined well and add fish. Marinate fish, covered and chilled, turning occasionally, at least 1 hour and up to 2.Prepare grill.Grill fish on an oiled rack set 5 to 6 inches over glowing coals about 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or until desired doneness. (Alternatively, fish may be broiled.)

column4: 5 pounds mediumsize yellow squash 2 eggs, beaten 1 cup bread crumbs plus additional bread crumbs for topping 1 stick butter or margarine 1/4 cup sugar Salt, to taste 2 tablespoons chopped onion Dash of pepper
column5: Cut tips off squash and cut each squash into 3 or 4 pieces. Drop squash into a large saucepan with enough boiling water to cover. Return to boil, reduce heat and cook until tender. Drain in colander and mash. Combine with beaten eggs, 1 cup bread crumbs, butter, sugar, salt, onion and pepper. Turn into 3quart casserole that has been lightly greased or sprayed with nonstick spray. Cover with light layer of bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

column4: Pork chop, 1.5" thick1 teaspoon ground alspice1 teaspoon ground coriander1 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper1 clove garlicgrated fresh gingerlime juiceolive oil
column5: MarinateCook 5 minutes per side.

column4: 4 medium-size vine ripened tomatoesKosher salt and freshly ground black pepper4 large eggs4 tablespoons shredded white cheddar cheese4 slices toast, cut into strips
column5: 1. Preheat oven to 425F.2. Slice off and set aside the top third of each tomato. Scoop out the seeds.3. Place the tomatoes in a glass or ceramic baking dish. Season with the salt and pepper.4. Break an egg into each tomato.5. Bake, with the sliced tops, for 10 minutes.6. Top the tomatoes with the cheese and bake until the cheese is bubbly, 5 to 7 minutes more.7. Let cool for 5 minutes. Serve with the tops and toast strips (also called "soldiers"-as your child might be delighted to know) for dipping.

column4: 3 Tablespoons unsalted butter, softened2 Tablespoons coarse-grain mustard1 teaspoon grated zest and 1 teaspoon juice from one lemon1 garlic clove, minced1 Tablespoon minced fresh sage1 tablespoon minced fresh thyme   salt and pepper1 teaspoon sugar2 pork tenderloins (about 3 pounds total)1 Tablespoon olive oil
column5: 1.  Beat butter, mustard, lemon, garlic, herbs, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in bowl.  Reserve 3 tablespoons butter mixture.  Combine sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in small bowl.2. Pat tenderloins dry, butterfly tenderloins; spread interior evenly with herb-butter mixture.  Interlock tenderloins, tie securely with kitchen twine at 1 1/2 inch intervals.  Rub pork with oil and sprinkle sugar  mixture evenly over exteior.3.  Roast on baking sheet until golden brown and internal temperature is 140*, about 35 minutes, flipping pork halfway through cooking.  Transfer to cutting board and brsh top of pork with reserved herb-butter mixture.  Tent with foil and let rest 10 minutes.  Slice and serve.

column4: 4 (3/4- to 1-inch-thick) boneless beef top-loin (strip) steaks (8 to 10 oz each)1 tablespoon kosher salt2 tablespoons whole black peppercorns1 tablespoon vegetable oil1/3 cup finely chopped shallots1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces1/2 cup Cognac or other brandy3/4 cup heavy cream
column5: Preheat oven to 200F.Pat steaks dry and season both sides with kosher salt.Coarsely crush peppercorns in a sealed plastic bag with a meat pounder or bottom of a heavy skillet, then press pepper evenly onto both sides of steaks.Heat a 12-inch heavy skillet (preferably cast-iron) over moderately high heat until hot, about 3 minutes, then add oil, swirling skillet, and saut steaks in 2 batches, turning over once, about 6 minutes per batch for medium-rare.Transfer steaks as cooked to a heatproof platter and keep warm in oven while making sauce.Pour off fat from skillet, then add shallots and half of butter (2 tablespoons) to skillet and cook over moderately low heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until shallots are well-browned all over, 3 to 5 minutes.Add Cognac (use caution; it may ignite) and boil, stirring, until liquid is reduced to a glaze, 2 to 3 minutes. Add cream and any meat juices accumulated on platter and boil sauce, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half, 3 to 5 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter and cook over low heat, swirling skillet, until butter is incorporated. Serve sauce with steaks.

column2: TUNA STEAK w/ GARLIC, TOMATO, CAPERS, AND BASIL
column4: 6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil2 cups chopped onions2 garlic cloves, minced1 pound plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped1 cup (loosely packed) fresh basil leaves1 1/2	tablespoons capers, rinsed, drained4  5- to 6-ounce ahi tuna steaks (each about 1 inch thick)
column5: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in heavy skillet.  Add onions; saute until tender, about 5 minutes.  Add garlic; saute about 3 minutes.  Stir in tomatoes, basil and capers.  Simmer uncovered until mixture thickens, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.Heat remaining 3 tablespoons oil in another skillet over medium heat.  Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper.  Add fish to skillet and cook until light brown at edges but pink in center, about 3 minutes per side.  Pour in tomato mixture.  Simmer until fish is opaque in center, about 5 minutes longer.Serve immediately.

column4: 5 pounds mediumsize yellow squash 2 eggs, beaten 1 cup bread crumbs plus additional bread crumbs for topping 1 stick butter or margarine 1/4 cup sugar Salt, to taste 2 tablespoons chopped onion Dash of pepper
column5: Cut tips off squash and cut each squash into 3 or 4 pieces. Drop squash into a large saucepan with enough boiling water to cover. Return to boil, reduce heat and cook until tender. Drain in colander and mash. Combine with beaten eggs, 1 cup bread crumbs, butter, sugar, salt, onion and pepper. Turn into 3quart casserole that has been lightly greased or sprayed with nonstick spray. Cover with light layer of bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

column2: BASS IN ARTICHOKE AND TOMATO BROTH
column4: 1 small onion, quartered and thinly sliced4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil2 garlic cloves, chopped1/3 cup dry white wine1 (9-oz) package frozen artichoke hearts, thawed and drained1 (15-oz) can stewed tomatoes1/3 cup pitted brine-cured black olives such as Kalamata, chopped2/3 cup water1 1/4 teaspoons salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper4 (6- to 7-oz) black sea bass fillets (1/2 inch thick) with skin1 tablespoon unsalted butter, cut into bits1 teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest
column5: Cook onion in 2 tablespoons oil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and golden, about 6 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine and boil 1 minute. Add artichoke hearts, tomatoes (including juice), olives, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and bring to a simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally.Meanwhile, pat fish dry and sprinkle with remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.Transfer sauce to a 13- by 9- by 2-inch (3-quart) glass or ceramic baking dish and arrange fish (without crowding) over sauce. Dot fish with butter and cover dish tightly with foil. Roast until fish is just opaque and cooked through, 12 to 14 minutes.Meanwhile, stir together zest and remaining 2 tablespoons oil.Transfer fish with vegetables and broth to shallow bowls and serve drizzled with orange oil.

column4: 2 1/2 lb butternut squash (1 large)2 teaspoons maple syrup1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon finely grated peeled fresh ginger
column5: Preheat oven to 400F.Halve squash and discard seeds. Arrange squash, cut sides up, in a shallow baking pan and roast in middle of oven until soft, 45 minutes to 1 hour.Cool squash slightly and scoop flesh into a bowl. Mash squash slightly with a fork with syrup, ginger, and salt and pepper to taste. Before serving, reheat squash if necessary in a baking dish, covered, in a 350F oven.
column6: Squash can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature before reheating.    Gourmet March, 2000

column4: 1 cup of water1 cup of granulated sugar1 pint of fresh cranberries1 teaspoon vanilla1/2 cup or more of sugar
column5: Combine the water and one cup of granulated sugar in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Let boil for 5 minutes.  Add vanilla.  Remove from heat and stir in cranberries. Allow cranberries to sit in simple syrup 10 minutes. Strain, and immediately roll cranberries in 1/2 cup (or more if needed) of granulated sugar. Allow to sit at room temperature at least an hour to harden.

column4: 1 - 3 oz. package ramen noodle soup mix1/4 cup butter1 cup pecans, chopped1 - 16 oz. package broccoli florets1 head romaine lettuce, torn4 green onions, choppedSweet and Sour Dressing1/2 c vegetable oil1/4 c sugar1/4 c red wine vinegar1 T. soy sauce1/2 tsp salt1/4 tsp pepper
column5: For Dressing:Whisk together oil with remaining ingredients.For Salad:Remove seasoning packet and discard from noodles and break noodles into pieces.Melt butter in large skillet over medium high heat; add broken noodles andnuts, and saute until lightly browned.Toss noodle mixture with broccoli, lettuce and green onions in a large bowl;add 1/4 cup dressing, toss to coat.  Serve with remaining dressing.
