column4: 3 tablespoons red-wine vinegar3 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme1 large garlic clove, finely chopped1 3/4 teaspoons salt3/4 teaspoon black pepper1/3 cup plus 1/4 cup olive oil2 1/4 cups pearl couscous (sometimes called Israeli couscous; 3/4 pound)1 3/4 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth (14 fl ounces)1 cup water1/4 teaspoon crumbled saffron threads2 lb large shrimp (21 to 25 per pound), peeled and deveined if necessary2 medium red onions (1 pound total)2 pounds large zucchini (about 4), cut diagonally into 1/2-inch-thick slices6 ounces feta, crumbled (1 1/4 cups)
column5: Whisk together vinegar, oregano, thyme, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl until salt is dissolved. Add 1/3 cup oil in a slow stream, whisking until vinaigrette is combined.Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wide 3-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat until hot but not smoking, then toast couscous, stirring occasionally, until fragrant and pale golden, 3 to 5 minutes. While couscous toasts, stir together broth, water, and saffron in a large glass measure. Add to couscous with 1/2 teaspoon salt and bring to a simmer, uncovered. Simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed and couscous is al dente, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, 10 minutes. Stir vinaigrette to combine, then stir 2 tablespoons into couscous and let stand, uncovered, at room temperature.Prepare grill for cooking over medium-hot charcoal (moderate heat for gas).Toss shrimp with 1 tablespoon oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a bowl and thread 4 or 5 shrimp onto each skewer (don't crowd, or shrimp won't cook evenly).Peel onions and trim root ends slightly, leaving ends intact, then halve lengthwise and cut halves lengthwise into 1/2-inch-wide wedges. Insert 1 wooden pick through each wedge to hold layers together while grilling, then put onions in a large bowl with zucchini. Toss vegetables with remaining 2 tablespoons oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.Grill shrimp skewers on lightly oiled grill rack, covered only if using a gas grill, turning over once with tongs, until just cooked through, about 4 minutes total. Transfer shrimp, discarding skewers, to a clean bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons vinaigrette.Grill vegetables on lightly oiled grill rack, covered only if using a gas grill, turning over once, until just tender, about 5 minutes, transferring to bowl as grilled. Remove and discard picks from onions. Drizzle vegetables with remaining vinaigrette and toss to combine.Spoon couscous onto a large platter or shallow serving bowl. Arrange shrimp and vegetables on top of couscous and sprinkle with feta. Serve warm or at room temperature.

column4: 6 Idaho potatoes1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil1 tablespoon salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper3 Meyer lemons, zested2 tablespoons freshly chopped Italian parsley leaves2 tablespoons minced garlic
column5: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.Peel potatoes and cut into 3/8-inch thick slices (lengthwise) cut again into 3/8-inch thick fries. Place the potatoes into a bowl with cold water; this will help keep the fries crisp and white. Just before cooking, drain water and place on paper towel, pat dry completely. Put in a bowl; add olive oil, 1 tablespoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Toss well and lay out in 1 layer on nonstick baking sheets. Bake until light brown. Cook for approximately 30 to 40 minutes, turning frequently until golden brown.Remove from oven. Add lemon zest, parsley, garlic, salt and pepper. Toss well and serve.

column4: 1/4 pound (1 link) fresh Italian sausage1 teaspoon minced garlic1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, optional1 jar (8 ounces) large pitted green olives4 to 6 cups peanut oil, for deep-frying1/2 cup all-purpose flour2 large eggs1/2 cup fine bread crumbs2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oilSalt and freshly ground pepper
column5: Remove the sausage meat from the casing and place it in a medium bowl. Add the garlic, a pinch of salt, and red pepper flakes, if using. Mix to evenly distribute the ingredients. Drain the olives and rinse them under cold water. Remove the pimentos, if necessary. Stuff each of the olives with 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of the sausage mixture.Heat the oil in a deep fryer, or stock pot, to 375 degrees F.Spread the flour on a dinner plate.Break the eggs into a shallow bowl and beat lightly.Spread the bread crumbs on another dinner plate and sprinkle them with salt and pepper. Moisten the olives with the olive oil, stirring to evenly distribute the oil and seasoning.

column4: 6 spicy Italian sausages1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for brushing15 whole garlic clovesSalt and pepper2 tablespoons Dijon mustard3 (4-ounce) pieces pizza dough, store bought
column5: In a saucepan add 1/2-inch water to the pan. Immerse sausages in water and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove sausage and dry the pan. Return to the heat and add the olive oil on medium heat. When hot return the sausage to the pan with garlic cloves and saute until medium brown all over. Remove garlic to a bowl. Remove sausage to a plate to cool. Use a fork to mash the garlic with salt and pepper. Stir in mustard and set aside.Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.Cut each piece of dough into 2 and roll out until 1/4-inch thick. Cut 6 pieces of dough about 3 inches wide and 1/2-inch shorter then the length of sausage, just enough to wrap around sausage with the ends peeking out. Spread bottom of each dough with a tablespoon of garlic/mustard paste. Set sausage on top, moisten 1 dough edge with a wet finger so it sticks together and roll. Press the seam firmly and set them on a lightly floured sheet pan, seam side down. Brush with olive oil. Bake until brown all around.Remove and let cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 3/4-inch long pieces and serve.

column4: 2 Tablespoons butter1 small onion, chopped fine1 12 ounce bag fresh cranberries (frozen is fine to substitute)1/2 cup honey1 teaspoon cinnamon1 teaspoon ground cloves\1 Tablespoon crushed crystallized ginger3 Tablespoons brown sugar1/4 cup apple cider vinegar3/4 cup water1 Tablespoon pineapple sage, finely chopped (optional and not a deal breaker)1 crisp apple, peeled, cored and chopped1 rib celery, chopped
column5: In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and cook until translucent, about 4-5 minutes. Add cranberries, raisins, honey, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, vinegar an water. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes until cranberries pop and soften.Add celery, sage and apple. Cover and allow to cool. Refrigerate for up to one week in an air-tight container.

column4: 8 cups sliced peeled tart apples (about 6 medium)2  cups packed brown sugar, divided2 teaspoons ground cinnamon1 cup butter or margarine, softened2 eggs2 cups all-purpose flour1 cup finely chopped walnuts, dividedVanilla Ice cream, optional
column5: Place apples in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2 in. baking dish. Sprinkle with  cup brown sugar and cinnamon. In a mixing bowl, cream butter and remaining brown sugar. Add eggs. Stir in flour and  cup walnuts. Spread over apples. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts.Bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes or until the apples are tender. Serve warm with ice cream if desired.

column4: 1 pound ground beef1 can (16 oz) kidney beans, rinsed and drained1 can (15 oz) pizza sauce1 can (14  oz) Italian stewed tomatoes1 can (8 oz) tomato sauce1  cups water1 package (3  oz) sliced pepperoni cup chopped green pepper1 teaspoon pizza seasoning or Italian seasoning1 teaspoon saltShredded mozzarella cheese, optional
column5: In a large saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. Stir in the beans, pizza sauce, tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, pepperoni, green pepper, pizza seasoning and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until chili reaches desired thickness. Garnish with cheese if desired.
column6: This can be a quick meal, or can be simmered slowly in a crock pot.

column4: 1/2 cup chopped onion2 stalks celery, chopped1 carrot, diced1/4 cup butter1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder6 cups chicken broth2 apples, cored and chopped2/3 cup white rice2 or 3 skinless, boneless chicken breast half - cut into cubessalt to tasteground black pepper to taste1 pinch dried thyme1/2 cup heavy cream, heated
column5: Saute onions, celery, carrot, and butter in a large soup pot. Add flour and curry, and cook 5 more minutes. Add chicken stock, mix well, and bring to a boil. Simmer about 1/2 hour.Add apple, rice, chicken*, salt, pepper, and thyme. Simmer 15-20 minutes, or until rice is done.When serving, add hot cream.

column4: 3 eggs1 1/2 cups vegetable oil (scant)2 cups sugar3 cups flour (unsifted)1 tsp each soda, salt & vanilla extract3 cups chopped raw apples1 or 1 1/2 cups chopped nutsTopping1 cup brown sugar1 stick butter/margarine1/4 cup Pet milk (or cream)
column5: Beat eggs & oil, add sugar & beat.  Add sifted dry ingred. & vanilla.  Beat well.  Add nuts & apples.  Bake at 350 - tube or layer cake (45 - 60 minutes until pick inserted is clean).  Topping:  Stir ingredients in heavy sauce pan. Boil 3 minutes.  Cool & spread on cake.

column2: COD BAKED W/ SALSA AND SPINACH
column4: 1 Tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil2 cloves garlic, minced1 10-ounce bag baby spinach, rinsed1 cup tomato salsa, drained (use mesh strainer)1 pound cod fillets, (haddock OR other firm white fish), cut into 4 portions   Ground black pepper, to taste1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
column5: Preheat oven to 450*.  Coat 8-inch square or small glass baking dish with cooking spray.In large skillet, heat oil.  Aadd garlic and stir until it begins to color, about 1 minute.  Add spinach, a handfull at a time, and cook until it is all wilted.Stir in salsa, then remove from heat.Arrange half the spinach mixture in a layer over bottom of prepared baking dish.  Arrange fish in a skingle layer over it.  Season with pepper.  Spread remaining greens mixture over the fish, then sprinkle with feta cheese.Bake for 20 minutes, or until fish is opaque at the center..  Serve with some of the pan juices over each portion.

column4: 2 red bell peppers and 1 yellow2 pounds wild salmon, preferably cut as a long fillet, not steaks3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil2 tablespoons capers, drained and rinsed in cold water if packed in vinegar OR if packed in salt, rinsed, soaked in cold water for 10 minutes, then rinsed again; if their size is much larger than nonpareils, cut them up a little bit4 whole peeled garlic clovesFine sea saltBlack pepper ground fresh from the mill
column5: 1. Char the peppers, skin them, split them, and remove their core and seeds. Cut them into strips less than an inch wide and 1 1/2 -inch long. You can prepare the peppers early the same day that you are making the fish for dinner.2. Turn on the oven to 375.3. Wash the fish in cold water and pat it dry with paper towels.4. Coat a baking dish with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Lay the salmon down in the pan, skin side facing down if you have long fillets. Distribute all around the salmon the peppers, capers, and the whole peeled garlic cloves. Sprinkle with a liberal quantity of salt and freshly ground black pepper. Pour the remaining olive oil over the fish. Put the dish in the preheated oven and cook for 16 minutes. Let it settle for a few minutes before serving.

column4: 4 tablespoons flour 4 tablespoons sugar 2 tablespoons cocoa 1 egg 3 tablespoons milk 3 tablespoons oil 3 tablespoons chocolate chips (optional) A small splash of vanilla extract 1 large coffee mug (MicroSafe)
column5: Add dry ingredients to mug, and mix well.  Add the egg and mix thoroughly. Pour in the milk and oil and mix well..Add the chocolate chips (if using) and vanilla extract, and mix again. Put your mug in the microwave and cook for 3 minutes at 1000 watts.The cake will rise over the top of the mug, but don't be alarmed!Allow to cool a little, and tip out onto a plate if desired.EAT ! (this can serve 2 if you want to feel slightly more virtuous).
column6: And why is this the most dangerous cake recipe in the world? Because now we are all only 5 minutes away from chocolate cake at any time of the day or night!

column4: 1 (3-inch) piece ginger, grated fine1/2 cup rice wine vinegar1 tablespoon soy sauce1 lime, juiced2 tablespoons sesame oil1/2 cup peanut butter1 head Napa cabbage, sliced thin1 red bell pepper, julienne fine1 yellow bell pepper, julienne fine2 serrano chiles, minced fine1 large carrot, grated fine with a peeler3 green onions, cut on the bias, all of white part and half of the green2 tablespoons chiffonade cilantro2 tablespoons chiffonade mint1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
column5: In a small bowl, or food processor combine ginger, vinegar, soy sauce, lime juice, oil, and peanut butter. In a large bowl, combine all other ingredients and then toss with dressing. You can save some of the dressing to dress noodles that can be added to this dish along with stir fried pork to make an entire meal.

column4: 1/2  cup cider vinegar1/2 cup oil3/4 cup sugar1/3 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon pepperCanned corn, drainedCan black beans drained and rinsed1/2 green pepper, chopped1/2 red pepper, chopped1/2 large red onion, chopped
column5: Combine first five ingredients.Add to the marinade:Canned cornCan black beanspeppers and onion.
column6: Must make at least 24 hours ahead of time, but is better if done 48 hours ahead.

column4: 1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce2 tablespoons brown sugar2 tablespoons dry sherry2 tablespoons rice vinegar2 garlic cloves, crushed with a garlic press or minced1 teaspoon finely grated fresh ginger1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes2 pounds skinless chicken thighs2 teaspoons sesame seeds
column5: Combine the soy sauce, sugar, sherry, vinegar, garlic, ginger and red pepper flakes and stir until the sugar dissolves. Transfer to a resealable plastic bag and add the chicken. Seal the bag and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator, turning once, for 1 hour. The chicken can be marinated for up to 4 hours.Heat the broiler to high. Arrange the chicken on a broiler pan skin side down and broil until brown and crispy, 8 to 10 minutes. Flip the chicken and broil until almost cooked through, about 8 minutes longer. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and cook until the seeds turn golden brown and the chicken is done, 1 to 2 minutes longer.

column4: 12 boneless skinless chicken thighs1/3 cup chopped fresh basil1/3 cup chopped fresh coriander (cilantro)1 tablespoon minced ginger1 tablespoon minced garlic1 tablespoon minced chili1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil1 1/2 tablespoons brown sugar
column5: Combine all ingredients except chicken in a bowl.Mix thoroughly.Add chicken and leave to marinate at least one hour, preferably longer.Grill chicken on the BBQ, hotplate or in the griller until golden brown and cooked through.NOTE:Ususlly you would expect 12 thigh fillets to feed 4 to 6 people- in my family the kids eat 4 each so this recipe serves 3.

column4: 1 lb. green beans, cleaned & trimmed1/2 lb. mushrooms, cleaned & thinly sliced2 tbsp. pine nuts or walnuts1 1/2 tbsp. olive oil1 1/2 tbsp. butter1 clove garlic, minced1/4 tsp. saltPepper to taste2 tsp. dried dill1/2 tsp. lemon juice
column5: Cut beans in half and drop into large pot of boiling water. Boil 6 to 7 minutes. Drain and drop into pan of ice water until chilled. Wrap in paper towels and store in plastic bag in refrigerator until ready to use.In a large skillet, heat 1/2 of the oil and butter, over medium high heat. Add mushrooms and minced garlic, saute quickly until mushrooms are lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.Heat remaining oil and butter in same skillet over medium heat. Add green beans and pine nuts. Add salt and pepper and saute until heated through - about 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, dill and lemon juice and serve.

column4: 1/2 cup fine grain #1 bulgur1/4 cup fresh lemon juice2 cups finely diced tomatoes1/2 cup thinly sliced scallions2 pinches of ground cinnamonSalt and freshly ground pepper1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil2 cups finely chopped flat-leaf parsley2 tablespoons slivered fresh mint leavesTender romaine leaves
column5: 1.  Stir tabouli and flavor packet into one cup boiling water.  Let stand.2. In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, scallions, cinnamon, and a few pinches of salt and pepper. Drizzle on the olive oil and toss. Fold in the bulgur,parsley, and mint and mix well. Refrigerate, stirring occasionally.3. Taste and correct the flavors with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Serve with crisp inner leaves of romaine lettuce for scooping up the salad.2. In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, scallions, cinnamon, and a few pinches of salt and pepper. Drizzle on the olive oil and toss. Fold in the bulgur,parsley, and mint and mix well. Refrigerate, stirring occasionally.3. Taste and correct the flavors with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Serve with crisp inner leaves of romaine lettuce for scooping up the salad.
column6: I used "Near EAst" Taboule wheat salad mix

column4: 1/2 cup lime juice1/3 cup olive oil1 teaspoon red wine vinegar1/2 teaspoon sugar1 pound lump crab meat1 avocadoRomaineSalt and pepper to taste
column5: Combine first four ingredients well, whipping until well emulsified.Place avocado slices on individual plates, anddrizzle with small amount of dressing.Divide crab between plates.Slice lettuce into "ruffles" and coat with remaining dressing.  Place on top of crab.

column4: 2 pounds shrimp (30-40/lb.),peeled and deveined cup mayo1/3 cup buttermilk1 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice1 tsp. Dijon mustart1 Tbsp chopped fresh tarragonKosher salt and freshly ground pepper2 Cups diced Fuji apples1 cups red seedless grapes cut in half1   cups finely diced celery (3-4 ribs) cup blanched slivered almonds, lightly toasted1 Tbsp. chopped chives (optional)tender butter lettuce leaves
column5: 1. Cook shrimp 2 minutes or steam 3 minutes, until just cooked.  Let cool.  2. Whisk together buttermilk, mayo, lemon juice, tarragon, and mustard.  Season with salt and pepper to taste.3. Assemble cut shrimp, apples, grapes, calery, and almonds in a salad bowl.  Toss with enough of the dressing to coat the ingredients well.  Sprinkle with chives.  Serve over beds of lettuce leaves, or put the leaves next to the salad and have guests spoon salad into leaf and roll it up.

column4: 3 medium tomatoes (about 3/4 pound total), each cut into 8 wedges2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided1 tablespoon red-wine vinegar4 (6-ounces) pieces mahi mahi fillet (1 1/2 inches thick) with skin1/2 cup mayonnaise1/4 cup crumbled feta3 tablespoons chopped mint2 tablespoons chopped dill1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice8 very thin lemon slices
column5: Preheat broiler.Toss tomatoes with 2 tablespoons oil, vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.Line a broiler pan or small 4-sided sheet pan with foil or parchment paper and lightly oil foil. Put fish, skin sides down, on pan and season with 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.Whisk together mayonnaise, feta, herbs, and lemon juice and spread over top of fish. Put 2 lemon slices (slightly overlapping) on center of each fillet. Drizzle lemon slices with remaining 2 teaspoons oil.Broil fish 8 inches from heat until just cooked through, 14 to 16 minutes. If topping browns before fish is cooked, cover loosely with foil. Serve fish with tomatoes.

column4: 2 packages prepared mashed potatoes ( Bob Evans or Country Crock)1 8 oz cream cheese1 cup sour cream cup chopped fresh chives (optional)8 bacon slices, cooked and crumbled1 tsp salt tsp pepper1 cup shredded cheese
column5: Mix potatoes with next six ingredients and put in a greased 9 x 12 baking dish.  Top with shredded cheese.Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated through and cheese is bubbly.

column4: 6 Tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 3 Tablespoons balsamic vinegar 1 large garlic clove, pressed 6 large portobello mushrooms, stemmed, gills    scraped out 1 cup whole milk ricotta cheese 1/2 cup plus 6 Tablespoons finely grated       Parmesan cheese 3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, divided 6 1/2-inch heirloom tomato slices 7 to 8 ounces Fontina cheese, thinly sliced
column5: Prepare barbecue (medium high heat.)Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and garlic in a small bowl.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.  Arrange on baking sheet, gill side up.  sprinkle with s&p.  Spoon tablespoon dressing into each mushroom, swirl to coat.  Stir ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil in small bowl to blend.  Season to taste.  Arrange tomato slices on plate; sprinkle with s&P.Place mushrooms on grill, gill side down.  Grill until edges begin to soften, 3 to 5 minutes, depending on thickness.  Transfer mushrooms to baking sheet.  Place 1 tomato slice into each mushroom; divide ricota cheese mixture atop sliced tomatoes, about 3 tablespoons per  muchroom.  Top with Fontina cheese slices.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon Parmesan chese over each.  Return to grill, cover and cook until mushrooms are soft and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.  Sprinkle remaining chopped fresh basil over.  Place mushrooms on plates.  Drizzle remaining dressing around mushrooms and serve.

column4: 1 cup pecan halves, toasted 1 cup unsalted butter, softened 1 cup confectioners' sugar, plus more for dusting 1 Tablespoon pure vanilla extract 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, sifted
column5: Preheat oven to 325*.  Break pecans into 2 or 3 pieces.  Cream butter and sugar until pale.  Add vanilla and salt.   Gradually add flour, beating until just incorporated.  Stir in pecans.  Cover dough, and refrigerate until firm.Drop 2-tablespoon scooops of dough onto baking sheets, 2 inches apart.  Bake, rotating sheets during baking until edges of cookies are golden, about 15 minutes.  Cool.Dust with confectioners' sugar just before serving.

column4: 1 pkg (2.5 oz.) processed ham (I use Bidding ham)2 Tbsp finely chopped onion1/2 C (2 oz) shedded cheddar cheese1 egg1 Tbsp fresh parsley (I sometimes leave out)1 1/2 tsp Dijon mustard1/8 tsp pepper1 pkg (8 oz) of cresent rolls
column5: preheat oven to 350, will need a mini muffin pan, spray with Pam Finely chop ham, onion, put in bowl with mustard, pepper and cheese, mix well. unroll cresent roll, pinch seam together and cut into 24 squares, place one square in each muffin cup and press lightly, then fill with ham & cheese mixture.  Bake 12-14 minutes or until puffs are lightly brown.   remove from pan and serve!
column6: Pampered Chef recipe.  Double recipe; use non-stick muffin pans; don't over fill the cups

column4: 8 slices bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces1 large onion, chopped2 (28 ounce) cans diced tomatoes1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce1 teaspoon white sugar, or more to taste1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste1 tablespoon butter
column5: Place the bacon in a Dutch oven, and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the fat starts to cook out, about 2 minutes. Add the onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce to the pan. Season with sugar and black pepper. Simmer until the sauce is reduced by at least 1/4 and up to 1/3, 30 to 45 minutes. Stir in the butter just before serving.
column6: Serve over rice, pasta or meatloaf

column4: 6 cups peeled chopped green pears1 cup apple cider vinegar3 cups brown sugar1 cup raisins1 cup golden raisins1/4 cup chopped candied ginger1 onion, chopped1/4 teaspoon red pepper1 teaspoon cinnamon2 Tablespoons mustard seedlemon rindchopped pecans to taste
column5: Cook pears,, onion,vinegar and brown sugar until tender. About 30 minutesAdd remaining ingredients and cook until desired texture is reached.Place into prepared jars, seal with lids.

column4: 1 cup flour 1/4 teaspoon baking powder Pinch of slt 2 large eggs 1/2 cup bown sugar 1/2 cup sugar 1 stick unsalted butter, melted 1/2 cup walnuts, finely chopped
column5: Preheat oven to 350*; Butter a 9-inch cast-iron skilletWhisk together flour, baking powder and salt.Whisk eggs and sugar together.  Add butter and whisk until satiny.  Stir in flour mixture; whisk until smooth.  Spread batter in the skillet and top with walnuts.Bake 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.  serve slightly warm or at room temperature.May also be used for upside down cake.

column4: Duke's MayonnaisePlochman's Kosciusko spicy brown mustardHP Steak Sauce
column5: Mix in proportions of 4-2-1Mayo to mustard to steak sauce.

column4: 1 Duncan Hines Butter Cake Mix1/2 cup sugar3 eggs2/3 cup Crisco or Mazola oil8 ounces sour cream
column5: Sift cake mix; beat eggs,Add sugar, oil and mix for 4 minutes.Bake in 2 prepared cake pans for 45 minutes at 350*

column4: 1 angel food cake mix1 cake mix of any other flavorFor individual cake:3 Tablespoons cake mix2 Tablespoons water1 Cook 1 minute
column5: In a zip lock bag, mix well the two cake mixes.For individual serving:Take 3 tablespoons of this mixAdd 2 tablespoons waterMix wellPour into a well greased pyrex custard cupCook 1 minute in microwave.
column6: Best served warm with ice cream

column4: 1 onion2 ribs celery4 carrots4 turnips4 potatoes4 strips bacon1 teaspoon thyme2 bay leavesChicken buillion1/2 cup half and half1/2 pound processed cheese
column5: Fry bacon and saute chiopped onion and celery;Add other ingredients to large pot with water to cover.  Cook until vegetables are soft, remove bay leaves.Use stick blender, then cube and add about 1/2 pound processed cheese and half and half.
column6: If bouillion is salty, do not add salt.

column4: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine1  (8-ounce) package sliced fresh mushrooms2  cups  chopped cooked chicken3  cups  cooked long-grain rice1  cup  frozen sweet green peas, thawed1  (2-ounce) jar diced pimiento, drained1/3  cup  butter or margarine1/3  cup  all-purpose flour1  (14 1/2-ounce) can chicken broth1  cup  whipping cream1/2  teaspoon  salt1/2  teaspoon  pepper1  (12-ounce) container fresh oysters, well drained2  tablespoons  butter or margarine, melted1  cup  soft bread crumbs
column5: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet; add mushrooms, and saut until tender; drain well. Return mushrooms to skillet; add chicken and next 3 ingredients.Melt 1/3 cup butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat; whisk in flour until smooth. Cook, whisking constantly, 1 minute. Gradually whisk in broth and whipping cream; cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Stir in salt and pepper. Add to chicken mixture, stirring gently. Spoon half of chicken mixture into a lightly greased 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Top with oysters and remaining chicken mixture.Stir together 2 tablespoons melted butter and bread crumbs; sprinkle over casserole.Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

column4: 4 eggs2 1/2 cups whole milk6 to 8 slices white bread1 teaspoon mustard1 teaspoon Worchestershire saucesalt1 cup or more grated cheddar cheeseButter
column5: Line a a  two quart casserole greased with butter with the sliced bread, crusts removed, In separate bowl, beat eggs, add milk and other ingredients except cheese.Pour over bread.  Top with grated cheese.Place in refrigerator over night.Bake at 350* the following morning until puffed and browning.Serve immediately.
column6: Browned sausage may be sprinkled over egg mixture if desired before adding cheese.

column4: 1/4 cup soy sauce1 teaspoon wasabi powder1/4 teaspoon garlic powder4 6-ounce tuna steaks (each about 3/4 inch thick)1 pound green beans, trimmed1 tablespoon oriental sesame oil1 or 2 Tablespoons (packed) golden brown sugar
column5: Mix soy sauce, wasabi powder and garlic powder in 8x8x2-inch glass dish. Add tuna; turn several times to coat with marinade. Let stand 15 minutes.Meanwhile, cook beans in large pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain well.Heat sesame oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove tuna from marinade; reserve marinade. Sprinkle tuna on all sides with pepper. Add tuna to skillet and cook until just opaque in center, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer tuna to plates. Add green beans, sugar and reserved marinade to skillet. Cook until sauce is reduced enough to coat beans, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Using tongs, place beans alongside tuna and serve.

column4: 1 cup butter or margarine2/3 cup light brown sugar1/2 cup granulated sugar3 eggs; separated1 Tablespoon water1 teaspoon vanilla extract1/2 teaspoon almond extract2 cups Flour; sifted1/4 teaspoon baking soda1/2 teaspoon salt12 ounce semi-sweet chocolate bits1 cup chopped black walnuts or pecans1 teaspoon cream of tartar1/2 cup brown sugar
column5: Cream butter with the 2/3 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup granulated sugar in large bowl of electric mixer. Beat egg yolks lightly and add. Beat in water and flavorings.Sift flour with soda and salt and blend in well. Spread in ungreased 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan. Sprinkle with chocolate bits, then walnuts; press down lightly with palm of hand.Beat egg whites until foamy; add cream of tartar; continue beating until stiff. Fold in the 1/2 cup brown sugar; spread over chocolate bits. Bake at 300` for 50 to 55 minutes. Cool, cut in squares (small for cookie, larger as a base for ice cream dessert). Freezes well. Yield 60 small cookies.
column6: Not enough egg white topping.  I use 5 egg whites, more sugar, etc. Baked in 13 x 8 pyres dish.

column4: 1/2 large onion, sliced lengthwise 1/4 inch thick (1 cup)2 1/2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided1/4 teaspoon Spanish smoked paprika2 pounds Swiss chard, center ribs discarded and leaves coarsely chopped1/2 cup golden raisins1/2 cup water1/4 cup coarsely chopped almonds with skins
column5: Cook onion with 1/4 teaspoon salt in 2 tablespoons oil in a 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over medium heat, stirring, until softened. Sprinkle with paprika and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add chard in batches, stirring frequently, until wilted, then add raisins and water. Cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until chard is tender, about 7 minutes. Season with salt.Cook almonds in remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil in a small heavy skillet over medi

column4: 1 1/2 lb. ham, coarsely chopped1/2 cup finely chopped fresh parsley1/2 cup mayonnaise6 Tablespoon butter, softened1/4 cup whole-Grain Dijon mustard3 Tablespoons dry white wine1 celery rib, finely chopped2 green onions, finely chopped1 teaspoon lemon zest3/4 teaspoon black pepper1/4 teaspoon ground red pepperCrackersQuick Winter pickled Veggies
column5: Pulse ham in food processor; stir parsley and next 9 ingredients.  Stir in ham until well blended.  Cover and chll 8 hours.  Store in an airtight container in refrigerator up to 3 days.  Let stand at room temperature 39 minutes before serving.  Serve with crackers and Quick Winter Pickled Veggies.Garnish with sliced pickled okra

column4: SEE "PORK'  category for recipe

2 cups apple cider vinegar2/3 cup sugar1/ cup kosher salt3 garlic cloves1 teaspoon mustard seeds1 teaspoon fennel seeds1 teaspoon black peppercorns1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper8 cups assorted cut vegetables2 1/2 cups water
column5: Bring first 8 ingredients and water to a boil in a large non aluminum saucepan; stir until sugar is dissolved; boil 1 minute; let stand 30 minutes.Cook vegetables in batches in boiling water to cover 1 to 2 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain.  Plunge into iice wzter, drain.Transfer vegetables to a large bowl; pour cooled vinegar mixture over.  Let stand 1 hour.Cover and chill 1 day before serving.  Store in an airtight container in refrigerator up to 1 week.Use:  Cauliflower, swiss Chard stalks, carrot sticks, sliced parsnips, halved Brussels sprouts, radishes, sliced fennel, green beans, bell pepper rings.

column4: 3/4 cup (loosely packed) crumbled Gorgonzola cheese6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) butter, room temperature1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice2 tablespoons olive oil1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil3 garlic cloves, minced2 pounds asparagus, trimmed
column5: Stir Gorgonzola cheese, butter and lemon juice in medium bowl to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate. (Gorgonzola butter can be prepared 2 days ahead. Keep refrigerated.)Prepare barbecue (high heat). Whisk oil, basil and garlic to blend in small bowl. Spread out asparagus in single layer in baking dish. Pour oil mixture over asparagus and turn to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer asparagus to barbecue. Grill until charred on all sides, turning occasionally, about 4 minutes. Transfer to plates. Top asparagus with some Gorgonzola butter and serve.

column4: 1 pound asparagus1/2 pound smoked salmon1 wedge of imported Brie1 baguette, sliced into 1/2-inch slices1/2 cup olive oilsea salt and pepper
column5: Heat oven to 350*.  brush both sides of baugette with olive oil.  Place on sheet pan, season with salt and papper.  Bake for aout 5-7 minutes until golden.  Blanch trimmed asparagus in rapidly boiling salted water for about 2-3 minutes.  Transfer to an ice bath.  Remove once cooled to dry.  Cut into 1-inch pieces.To assemble:  Place a small piece of salmon on top of the crostini, then two pieces of asparagus, and top with one small slice of Brie.  Garnish with fresh cracked pepper.
column6: From Gourmet Trading Co., Los Angeles

column4: 1 1/2 lb. unpeeled large raw shrimp (21/40 count)1 pound fresh asparagus 3 cups chicken broth1 cup uncooked quick-cooking grits1/2 cup half and half4 Tablespoons butter, divided1 (8-oz.) package sliced fresh mushrooms1 bunch green onions, cut into 1/2-inch pieces1/2 teaspoon dried thyme1/2 teaspoon salt
column5: Peel shrimp, devein.  Snap off and discard tough ends of asparagus.  Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces2.  Bring chicken broth to boil; whisk in grits and half and half.  Cook whisking constantly, 7 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from heat.  Stir in 2 Tbsp. butter.  Keep warm.3.  Melt remaining 2 Tbsp. butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Add asparagus, mushrooms, green onions and thyme.  Saute 3 to 4 minutes.  Add shrimp, and cook 2 to 3 minutes.  Stir in salt; cook 3 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink.  Serve immediately over grits.

column4: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour2 Tablespoons baking powder1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg1/2 teaspoon salt2 cups ricotta cheese1/4 cup sugar4 large eggs1 1/3 cups milkJuice and grated rind of 2 lemonsButter, for griddle1 jar prepared lemon curd1 pint fresh raspberriesConfectioners' sugarMint sprig and thinly sliced lemon for garnish
column5: Combine flour, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt in a small bowl.  Whisk together the ricotta, sugar, eggs, milk, lemon juice, and zest in a large bowl.  Whisk the flour mixture into the wet ingredients until just combined.  Brush griddle with butter, Pour 1/4 cup of the batter on the griddle and cook on both sides util light-golden brown.2.  Empty the jar of lemon curd into a small saucepan; warm over low heat.  drizzle a few tablespoons over the pancakes, top with fresh raspberries, and dust with confectioners' sugar.From:  "Parade" 3/28/10
column6: Yields: 12 pancakes.  Per paiar: 790 calories, 91g carbs, 30 g protein, 355mg cholesterol and 36g fat.

column4: 2 Tablespoons Olive oil1/2 cup roasted red peppers, drained and  chopped2 Spanish onions, sliced and carmelized4 new potatoes, roasted, sliced into 1/4 inch thick pieces12 large eggsSalt and freshly ground pepper3 Tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley, plus more for garnish
column5: 1.  Preheat oven to 425*F.  Heat oil in non stick ovenproof saute pan or a cast-iron pan over medium heat.  Add the roasted peppers, caramelized onions, and roasted potato slices.  Cook for 1 minute.2.  Crack the eggs and whisk  until light and fluffy, season with salt and pepper.  Pour the egg into the pan and stir with rubber spatula.  Cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until the eggs mixture has set on the bottom.  sprinkle the top with the parsley and transfer pan to the oven.  Bake until tortilla is set and slightly puffed, about 6 to 8 minutes.3.  Carefully invert tortilla into a large plate or cutting board and cut into wedges.  Garnish with parsley.
column6: "Parade"  Per serving:  380 calories; 23g carbs, 15g protein, 435mg cholesterol, and 25g fat.

column4: 2 large red onions, cut into 1/3-inch-thick slicesOlive oil2 large red onions, cut into 1/3-inch-thick slices1 cup crumbled Maytag blue cheese3 tablespoons sour cream1 tablespoon minced fresh thyme8 5x3x1/2-inch slices multi-grain bread8 radicchio leaves3/4 pound sliced smoked turkey2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
column5: Caramalize onions in olive oil for about 2 minutes per sliced side.  Salt and pepperMix cheese, sour cream and thyme in small bowl toblend.  Season with pepper.  Spread cheese mixture over bread slices.  Top cheese with onions, radicchio, then turkey.  Spread mustard on remaining 4 bread slices; lace atop turkey.  Press sandwiches lightly to compact.  Cut sandwiches in half; wrap each tightly in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate at least 2 hours and up to one day.
column6: EpicuriousServe with potato salad, grapes or fresh figs and brownies

column4: 3 tablespoons butter, divided2 tablespoons all-purpose flour1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of shrimp soup, undiluted1 cup milk1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese1/2 pound frozen cooked small shrimp, thawed and chopped12 hard-cooked eggs1/2 cup mayonnaise1/4 teaspoon curry powder1/4 teaspoon ground mustard1/4 teaspoon paprika1/8 teaspoon salt1 cup soft bread crumbs
column5: In a large saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter; whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually add soup and milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat; stir in cheese until melted. Stir in shrimp.Pour 2 cups of sauce into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish; set remaining sauce aside. Cut eggs in half lengthwise; arrange whites over sauce. In a bowl, mash yolks. Stir in the mayonnaise, curry powder, mustard, paprika and salt. Spoon into egg whites. Top with reserved sauce.Melt the remaining butter; toss with bread crumbs. Sprinkle over the top. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 12 servings.
column6: Recipe ZAARServe over Holland Rusk

column4: 1/2 cup dry white wine2 tablespoons white wine vinegar8 garlic cloves, minced1/2 cup chilled butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice2 tablespoons olive oil1 1/2 pounds uncooked large shrimp, peeled, deveined2 tablespoons grated lemon peel1 tablespoon chopped fresh chivesRead More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Sauteed-Shrimp-with-Lemon-Garlic-Butter-101959#ixzz0l7NJccjl
column5: Boil wine, vinegar and garlic in small saucepan until mixture is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 4 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in butter, 1 piece at a time, allowing butter to melt before adding more. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and keep warm.Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over high heat. Sprinkle shrimp with salt and pepper. Add to skillet and saut until shrimp are opaque in center, about 3 minutes. Transfer shrimp to plates. Drizzle lemon-garlic butter over. Sprinkle with lemon peel and chives and serve.Read More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Sauteed-Shrimp-with-Lemon-Garlic-Butter-101959#ixzz0l7NUaGlo

column4: 2 Tablespoons butter1/4 cup minced onion1 Tablespoon tomato paste1/4 cup Marsala wine1/2 pound raw shrimp, peeled, deveined and cut      into 1-inch pieces1/2 pound scallops, cut into 1/2-inch pieces2 Tablespoons minced fresh parsley2 Tabelspoons chopped fresh chivesSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste1 (9-inch) pie crust, baked1 1/4 cups shredded Gruyere cheese3/4 cup heavy cream3/4 cup half-and-half5 eggs, lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon dried basil, or 1 1/2 teaspoons       fresh1/4 teaspoon fennel seedsDash of cayenne pepper
column5: 1.. Preheat oven to 375*2. Melt butter in a large skillet; add onion and saute until softened.3. Stir in tomato paste and wine.  Cook over high heat for 2 minutes, or until sauce is reduced to 2 tablespoons.  Add shrimp; cook over medium heat until shrimp just turn pnk.4. Stir in scallops, parsley, chives, salt and papper..  Cook 1 minute.  Spoon into pie crust.  Sprnkle with cheese.5. Combine cream, half-and half, egg, basil, fennel, and cayenne pepper.  Pour over cheese6. Bake 35 to 40 minutes, or until well-puffed and set in the center.  Cool on a rack for 10 minutes before serving.

column4: 1/3 cup canola oil3 Tablespoons chopped mint1 Tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon1 Tablespoon honey mustard1 teaspoon lemon zest1/4 cup fresh lemon juice1 teaspoon salat1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper
column5: 1.  Whisk together all ingredients until blend.* Lemon-Herb Dressing with Cives and TarragonSubstitute chopped fresh chives for mint*Lemon-Herb Dressing with BasilSubstitute 1/3 chopped fresh basil for mint and tarragon.
column6: Use original recipe for shrimp and pasta salad.Use chive and tarragon in potato salad*Basil variation in tomato salad with fresh lady peas"Southern Living"Aug. 2009

column4: 1 cup fresh lady peasLemon-Herb dressing with Basil* (divided)2 pounds tomatoes cut into 1/4-inch thick slices4 fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced1 (4-oz.) package soft goat cheese crumbledSalt and freshly ground pepper to taste*See recipe in file
column5: cook peas in boiling salted water to cover until tender.  Drain, cool, drizzle 1/3 cup lemon dressing over peas and toss to coat.*Arrange tomato slices, spoon peas over, sprinkle with basil, goat cheese and salt and pepper to taste.  Serve with remaining dressing.

column4: 2  (6 oz. ) packages fresh baby spinach1 Tablespoon butter1 (8 ounce ) package 1/3-less fat cream cheese1 garlic clove, shopped1 (14-oz.) can artichoke hearts, drained, chopped1/2 cup light sour cream1/2 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese      dividedFresh pita wedges or baked pita chips
column5: Microwave spinach at HIGH 3 minutes until wiltedDrain, pressing between paper towels.  Chop.Melt butter; add cream cheese and garlic.  Cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly until cream cheese melts.  Fold in spinach, artichokes, sour cream, and 1/4 cup mozarella cheese.  Stir until cheeese melts.Transfer to a 1-quart shallow baking dish, sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese.Bake at 350* for 15 minutes.Serve with fresh pita wedges or baked pita chips

column4: 1/2 cup packed fresh mint leaves1 1/2 pounds green beans, trimmed1 1/2 pounds wax beans, trimmed   Salt and pepper2 Tablespoons extra virgin oilve oil1 lemon
column5: Cook beans and 1/2 teaspoon salt in rapidly boiling water for 7 to 8 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Drain.2. Finely chop half of mint3. While beans are still warm, toss with oil, chopped mint, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper.  4.  Transfer to serving bowl and grate lemon peel directly over beans.  Tear remaining mint leaves and scatter over beans.

column4: 3 lbs tuna steaksMARINADE1 tablespoon brown sugar1 tablespoon sesame oil1/3 cup soy sauce1/3 cup rice wine vinegar2 garlic cloves, crushed and minced finely1/4 inch fresh ginger, gratedblack pepperchili pepper flakes
column5: Directions1Put all marinade ingredients into a zip-lock bag shake and add tuna.2Zip and chill for 2 hours.3Place steaks on a clean, hot, oiled, grill. And marinade in pot and reduce to half.4And turn after 3 minutes and cook for three more minutes. Place on serving dish and pour reduced marinade over steaks.

column4: 2 T. (1/4 stick) butter2 T. olive oil5 cups thinly sliced fennel bulb (about 3 bulbs)2 onions, sliced1 lb. small white potatoes, cut into  inch pieces4 cups chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth2 T. Pernod or other licorice flavored liqueurSalt and Pepper2 cups half and half(White pepper,   t. or to tasteopt)
column5: Melt 2 T. butter with 2 T. olive oil in heavy large pot over medium heat.  Add sliced fennel and onions.Cover,  cook until fennel is tender, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.Add potatoes and chicken stock; increase heat and bring to boil.  Reduce heat,Cover and simmer until potatoes are very tender, about 30 minutes.Remove from heatMix in PernodSeason with salt and pepperWorking in batches, puree soup in blender (or processor, or emulsion blender)Transfer to large bowl.  Mix in 2 cups half and half.  Season soup to taste with S & P.  Cool slightly.Chill soup, uncovered until cold, then cover and refrigerate(Can be prepared ahead.  Keep refrigerated)
column6: The recipe called for potatoes to be unpeeled.  I have done both ways and prefer peeled, just for the white look.

column2: CHICKEN W/ HARICORTS VERTS & LEMON BUTTER
column4: 4 boneless chicken breast halves (with or without skin)All purpose flour2 tablespoons olive oil8 shallots, peeled, halved2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) butter1/4 cup fresh lemon juice1 1/2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel1 pound haricots verts, trimmed2 tablespoons minced fresh chivesRead More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Chicken-with-Haricorts-Verts-and-Lemon-Butter-353311#ixzz0s51TKmK4
column5: Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper; lightly dust with flour to coat. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and shallots; saut until chicken is golden and just cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to plate.Melt butter in skillet with shallots over medium heat. Add lemon juice and lemon peel, then haricots verts; toss. Cover and cook until beans are crisp-tender and shallots are cooked through, about 3 minutes. Return chicken and any juices to skillet; sprinkle with chives. Simmer until sauce thickens enough to coat, about 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer chicken and vegetables to platter and serve.Read More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Chicken-with-Haricorts-Verts-and-Lemon-Butter-353311#ixzz0s51fsW3q

column4: 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil2  cups sugar3 eggs3 cups flour1 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon soda1 teaspoon vanilla3 cups raw apples1 cup dried cranberries 1 cup chopped nuts (English walnuts or and pecans)Topping:1/2 cup buttermilk1 stick butter1 cup sugarvanilla1 Teaspoon sodavanilla
column5: Dust apples, cranberries and nuts with some of the flour and set asideBlend oil and sugar add and beat eggs one at a time, add the vanilla and mixed dried ingredients, beat well stir in fruit and nuts.Bake in a 10 inch greased pan or I use 4 loaf pans 325 degrees fir 1 hour 15 minutes as whole cake or 35 to 40 minutes in loaf pans
column6: test with toothpicks and they must come out clean, not a pretty sad cake...from Ann.

column4: 1 eggplant, 1  to 2 lbs.4-5 T. butter, room temperatureSalt and Pepper to tasteChopped parsley or basil to garnishGrated dry Monterey Jack or Parmesan
column5: Peel eggplant, cut it into  to 1 inch-thick slicesSmear them, both sides, with a paste made of 4 T. butter blended with 3 T. grated Parmesan.Season with salt and pepperBake 20 minutes, 400 degrees.Garnish with either parsley or basil

column4: 1 cup gingersnap crumbs2 tablespoons butter, melted1/2 (8-ouce) package cream cheese, softened1 Tablespoon sugar1/4 teaspoon grated lemon rind1/4 cup plus 1 Tablespoon lemon juice, divided12 cup unsweetened orange juice2 teaspoons cornstarch3 medium pears, peeled, ored, and thinly sliced
column5: Combine gingersnap crumbs and margarine in a small bowl; mix wellPress mixture into the bottom of a pie panBake at 375* for 5 minutes.  Cool completely.Combine cheese, sugar, lemon rind, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice, beat until blended.  Spread mixture evenly over cooled crust.Combine orange juice, 2 tablespoons lemon juice and c ornstarch in a non-aluminum sauce pan, beat with whisk until blended.  Bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat and cook until mixture thickens, stirring frequently with whisk.  Remove glaze from heat, cool.Dip pear slices slices in remaining 2 tablespoons lemon juice; drain well.  arange pear slices over tart.  Drizzle glaze over pears.  Cover.  Chill thoroughly.

column2: ROAST CHICKEN LEGS W/LEMON AND THYME
column4: 4 chicken thighs and 4 drumsticks3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil5 (3 to 4 inch) sprigs fresh thyme2 garlic cloves, smashed3/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper4 (1/4-inch thick) lemon slices
column5: Put oven rack in upper third of oven and preheat to 500*Toss chicken with oil, thyme sprigs, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large bowl, then transfer to a shallow heavy baking pan.Bake chicken 10 minutes, then add lemon slices to pan.  Continue to bake until chicken is golden and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes or more.  Serve chicken with lemon slices.

column4: 1/2 cup packed dark-brown sugar1/2 cup light corn syrup1 tablespoon unsalted butter1/4 cup dark rum1/4 cup golden raisins1/4 cup dark raisins1 pint best-quality vanilla ice cream
column5: In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar and corn syrup. Set over medium-low heat. Stir until well combined and sugar has melted, about 5 minutes.	 Remove from heat, and add butter, rum, and raisins, stirring until butter has completely melted. Serve the sauce warm or at room temperature over the ice cream.

column4: 4 or 5 Comice or Bartlett pears, peeled, halved, cored and sliced1/3 cup melted unsalted butter1/3 cup granulated sugar1/3 cup all purpose flour2 teaspoons vanilla extract3 large eggs3/4 cup milk1/4 teaspoon saltConfectioners' sugar
column5: Preheat oven to 350*; butter a 9-inch pie dish.  Prepare pears; slice 1/4 inch thick lengthwise.  Arrange slices, overlapping slightly in dish.In a blender, process butter, sugar, and flour with 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 large eggs, 3/4 cup milk and 1/4 teaspoon salt until smooth.Pour batter over pears; bake until golden and firm to touch, 40 to 45 minutes.  Dust with confectioner's sugar.  Serve chilled.
column6: Martha Stewart via Jeanne LamptonMay be made in a pie crust.

column4: Smithfield hamColby cheeseMayonnaiseSmoked TurkeyMunster cheeseMayonnaiseBacon cooked very crispColby cheeseLoaf round Hawiian breadDurkey's spread dressing
column5: Slice top from bread and hollow out.Coat inside with Durkey's spreadLayer  1. ham and colby cheese           2.  Smoked turkey and munster           3.  Bacon and ColbyIce top layer with Durkey'sSlice and place in aluminum bread pan and wrap in foil.Bake at 300 for 30 to 40 minutes.Serve.Can be made the day before

column4: 1  3-ounce package ramen noodles1  3-once package roasted sunflower seed kernels1  3-ounce package sliced almonds1 bunch green onions, chopped1/2 bottle Newman's Own oil and vinegar dressing (1 to 1 1/2 cups)1/3 cup sugar1  16-ounce coleslaw mix or 2 bags angel hair shredded cabbage
column5: Combine onions and slawCombine dressing and flavor packet with sugar until dissolved.Mix dressing into slaw and chill over nightCrush noodles and add

column4: Salmon3 8-ounce bottles clam juice3/4 cup dry white wine3 lemon slices3 fresh dill sprigs4 whole peppercorns4 6- to 8-ounce salmon filletsMayonnaise1 cup mayonnaise2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice2 teaspoons grated lemon peel2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsleyButter lettuce leaves4 lemon slices8 lemon wedgesTomato wedgesRead More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Poached-Salmon-with-Lemon-Mayonnaise-2082#ixzz13Zrjr2kk
column5: For salmon:Combine first 5 ingredients in deep skillet. Simmer 10 minutes to blend flavors. Add salmon, cover and simmer until just cooked through, about 9 minutes per inch of thickness. Transfer salmon to plate, using 2 spatulas as aid. Reserve liquid in skillet. Cool salmon. Cover and chill until cold. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead.)For Mayonnaise:Boil salmon poaching liquid in skillet until reduced to 1/4 cup, about 20 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, lemon peel, chives and parsley in medium bowl. Mix in 1 tablespoon poaching liquid. Season to taste with pepper. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.)Line platter with lettuce. Top with salmon. Make cut in each lemon slice from center to edge. Twist lemon slices and place atop salmon. Garnish with lemon wedges and tomatoes and serve with mayonnaise.

column4: Dressing8 Tablespoons sugar1 teaspoon dry mustard1 teaspoon salt1 medium onion grated or ground really fine (I use my Cuisinart)1/3 cup of regular cider vinegar1 cup vegetable oil1 Tablespoon celery seedSaladChopped romaine lettuceClean and section a grapefruit (white or pink)Ripe avocado, cut into pieces
column5: Place the romaine in a large flat bowl and then decorate the top with alternating pieces of grapefruit and avocado, or  just mix it all up and serve it  before the dinner begins (less fussing around with passing).
column6: The dressing makes a double recipe, but it keeps in the fridge a long time.  From Martha

column4: 2 large packages cream cheese1 teaspoon curry Major Grey's chutney1 Tablespoon Dijon mustardcoconutgreen onions
column5: Cream cheese, curry and 1/2 jar Major Grey's chutney in food processor.Place in serving bowl; top with coconut, chutney, and finely chopped green onions.Serve with dipping chips.

column4: 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided6 large chicken thighs with skin and bones1 tablespoon coarse kosher salt2 teaspoons dried thyme1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper1/4 teaspoon freshly grated or ground nutmeg2 pounds unpeeled medium Yukon gold potatoes, scrubbed, cut into 2-inch long 1/2 inch thick spears2 pounds medium carrots, peeled, cut same as potatoes3 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
column5: Preheat oven to 450*.  Coat large rimmed baking sheet with 1 tablespoon oil.  Place chicken on baking sheet,  turn to coat with oil and set skin side up.Mix salt, thyme, pepper and nutmeg in a small bowl. sprinkle half of mixture over chicken.  Roast until chicken starts to brown and some fat has rendered, about 30 minutes.Meanwhile, combine potatoes, carrots, remaining oil and salt/herb mixture in bowl.  Transfer thighs to medium bowl.  Place potato-carrot mixture in same baking sheet, turning to coat with drippings.Roast until vegetables soften, 30 minutes.  Place thighs on vegetables, roast until chicken is cooked and vegetables brown 15 minutes.  Place chicken on platter.  Top with chives.
column6: I cooked the chicken 30 minutes, then put veggies in with chicken on top and cooked until done. Left out the middle step.  From Epicurious

column4: 1 medium onion, sliced1 cup fresh mushrooms1/3 cup butter1/3 cup dry sherry1/2 cup flour1/2 teaspoon salt1 pound chicken livers, cleaned
column5: Saute onions and mushrooms in butter for about four minutes.Combine flour and salt with the remaining butter and brown roux.  Toss chicken livers in enough flour to coat, and saute livers.  Combine with sauted vegetables and sherry.

column4: pair of shadlemon1 beaten eggwhite winecapers
column5: Soak the shad in cold water to get the blood out.Poach shad in simmering water until it turns from brick red to gray and a brownish froth forms on the water's surface.  Add 1/4 cup of the poaching liquid with the lemon juice to taste to the beaten egg.Place poached shad in baking dish, cover with sauce.  Bake 350* about 20 minutes
column6: Check during cooking to make sure the shad does not dry out

column4: 1 pound Brussel's sprouts1/2 lemon juiced2 T. olive oil2 garlic cloves, finely chopped1 T. poppy seeds1/4 cup white wine1/4 teaspoon Kosher salt1/8 black peppr
column5: Halve sprouts and slice to 1/8 inch thickness.  Toss with lemon joice.Place olive oil in pan, stir in sprouts and poppy seeds; add wine; stir for three minutes.  Reduce heat to low.  Season with salt and pepper.  Cook for one minute additional.  Serve.

column4: 2 cups King Arthur flour2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder1/2 teaspoon sodapinch salt1/3 to 1/2 cup shorteningButtermilk
column5: Sift dry ingredients together.Mix with enough buttermilk to keep moist.Knead 6 times and pat to thickness desired.Bake 425* for 14-17 minutes
column6: From Linda Consolvo who uses Crisco shortening.

column4: Garlic herb flavored (Alouette) spreadable cheese10 inch flour tortillas, red10 inch flour tortillas, greensmall carton crumbled bleu cheeseThin sliced roast beefThin sliced smoked turkeyarugula

1 1/2 sticks  unsalted butter, melted and cooled1 cup packed light brown sugar (scant)1/2 cup whole milk2 large eggs1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder1 teaspoon cinnamon1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/2 cups blueberries (7 1/2 oz)Turbinado sugar for topsSpecial equipment: a muffin pan with 12 (1/2-cup) muffin cups; 12 foil or paper muffin liners
column5: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400F. Put liners in muffin cups.Whisk together butter, brown sugar, milk, and eggs in a bowl until combined well. Whisk together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl. Add milk mixture and stir until just combined. Fold in blueberries gently.Divide batter among muffin cups and sprinkle tops with Turbinado sugar.  Bake until golden brown and a wooden pick inserted into center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 30 minutes.

column4: 48 little neck clams9 ozs. spaghetti2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced5 Tablespoons extra virgin olive oilPinch of crushed red pepper1 cup wine1.2 cup cherry tomatoes, quartered2 Tablespoons fresh parsley, coarsely chopped
column5: Wash clams thoroughlyBring large pot of salted water to boil; add spaghetti and cook 8 minutes, al dente.  Drain, but do not rinse.Saute garlic in 3 Tablespoons olive oil until translucent.  Add clams; season with salat and crushed red pepper.Add white wine; cook over medium-high heat about 5 minutes, or until clams steam open and liquid is reduced by half.Add cherry tomatoes; cook until soft.Gently toss with cooked pasta; add parsley and drizzle with 2 Tablespoons olive oil.  Serve immediately.

column4: Spaghetti with clams.See Pasta for recipe.
Juice of 1 lemon1 Tablespoon Worchestershire Sauce8 medium soft-shell crabs, cleaned2 cups egg wash1/2 cup sifted flour1/2 cup yellow cornmeal1 cup unsalted clarified butter
column5: In mdeium bowl, mix lemon juice and worchestershire sauce together;  Marinate crabs in mixture for 30 minutes.  Dip in egg wash, flour and then cornmeal.  Shake off excess.Heat a large skillet over medium-high temperatureAdd clarified butter and heat until hot.  Saute crabs 1 minute on each side.Chef's Note"  An excellent sauce for this dish is a modified bearnaise sauce.  Start with a basic bearnaise, and add Dijon mustard, Tabasco sauce, peeled, minced tomato and pureed watercress.  Mix well and serve over crabs.

column4: 1 cup finely chopped white and pale green park of leek, washed well1 clove garlic, minced2 Tablespoons unsalted butter1 pound asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces1/ 1/4 cups chicken broth1/3 cup sour cream
column5: In a saucepan cook the leek and the garlic in the butter over moderately low heat, stirring, until the leek is softened, add the asparagus, the broth, and 1/2 cup water, and simmer the mixture, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the asparagus is very tender. Pure two thirds of the mixture in a blender until it is very smooth, stir the pure into the mixture remaining in the pan, and whisk in the sour cream and salt and pepper to taste. Cook the soup over moderately low heat until it is heated through, but do not let it boil.Read More http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Asparagus-and-Leek-Soup-11958#ixzz1JuU95scY

column4: 1 pound asparagus, trimmed2 teaspoons extra-vigin olive oil11/2 cup halved grape tomatoes1/2 teaspoon minced fresh garlic2 Tablespoons balsamic vinegar1/4 teaspoon salt3 Tablespoons crumbled goat cheese1/2 teaspoon black pepperLEMON-TARRAGON VARIATIONCombine 1/8 teaspoon lemon rind,  1 Tablespoon lemon juice2 teaspoons chopped tarragonGarlic1/2 teaspoon minced shallot1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard, salt, pepper and oil.  Drizzle over asparagus
column5: Cook asparagus in boiling water 2 minutes or until crisp tender.  Drain.Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.  Add tomatoe and garlic; cook 5 minutes.  Stir invinegar; cook 3 minutes. Stir in salt.  Arrange asparagus on platter, top with tomato mixture.  Sprinkle with cheese and pepper.

column4: 1/2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts4 Tablespoons lime juice w/zest4 green onions6 large radishes, thinly sliced4 Tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro1 teaspoon smoked paprika 1/4 cup chicken brothSalt and pepper to taste2 Tablespoons olive oil
column5: Split chicken breast in half horizontally.Marinate in 2 Tablespoons lime juice for 30 minutes.  Sprinkle with paprika and pepper.  Saute chicken in olive oil for  3 minutes per side.  Remove from heat.Slice radishes thinly and cut onions into 1/2 inch pieces, mix with radishes, remaining lime juice and zest and saute until wilted.  Add broth, chicken and reduce.Serve with TJ's Brown Rice Medley

column4: 8 ounces tuna1/3 cup finely diced tart apple1/4 cup fiely diced celery2 Tablespoons mayo1 1/2 teaspoons chopped flat-leaf parsley1/2 teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juiceSalt and freshly ground pepper
column5: Mix with a fork the tuna, apple, celery, mayo, parsley and lemon juice.Avoid over mixing.  Season with salt and pepper.

column4: 3 tablespoons olive oil1 medium-large eggplant, cut into 3/4-inch cubes2 medium zucchini, cut into 3/4-inch cubes4 plum tomatoes, cut into 3/4-inch cubes2 teaspoons ground cumin1 large green onion, chopped1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice1 tablespoon minced fresh mint1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro1 large garlic clove, pressed
column5: Preheat broiler. Brush heavy large baking sheet with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Combine eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes on baking sheet. Drizzle with remaining olive oil; toss well. Sprinkle with cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Broil until eggplant begins to brown and vegetables are tender, stirring frequently, about 20 minutes. Transfer to bowl; cool slightly. Mix in remaining ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

column4: 1 (16 ounce) package spaghetti1/4 cup olive oil2 large sweet onions, thinly sliced2 cloves garlic, minced2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar4 ounces Gorgonzola cheese, crumbledDirections
column5: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta, and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Saute onions until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in garlic, and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in balsamic vinegar.In a large bowl, combine pasta, onion mixture, and Gorgonzola. Toss until evenly coated, and cheese is melted.
column6: allrecipes.comLinda used asparagus in this dish, and a bit of brown sugar to help the onions caramalize.

column4: 2 slices center cut bacon1/2 cup (4 ozs.) cream cheese, softened1/2 cup fat-free cream cheese1/4 cup (1 ounce) shredded extra-sharp cheddar     cheese1/4 cup minced green onions1 teaspoon fresh lime juice14 teaspoon kosher salt1 small garlic clove, minced14 jalapeno peppers halved lengthwise and    seededCooking spray2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro2 tablespoons chopped seeded tomato
column5: Cook bacon crisp.  Drain and crumble.  Combine bacon, softened cheeses, and next 4 ingredients.Divide cheese evenly and fill pepper halves with seeds and pith removed.Place peppers, cheese side up on grill and cook covered 8 minutes or until bottoms of peppers are charred and cheese mixture is lightly browned.  Place on a serving platter and sprinkle with cilantro and tomato.

column4: 2 tablespoons olive oil1 large onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice1 tablespoon minced garlic1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger2 tablespoons curry powder3 tablespoons all-purpose flour1 cup diced (1 inch) carrots1 cup diced (1/2 inch) peeled potatoes3 cups beef broth2 cinnamon sticks, 3 inches long2 tablespoons chopped mango chutney1/2 cup golden raisins1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed1 tomato, cut into 1/2-inch dice1/4 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley2 cups diced (1/2 inch) leftover roast beefSalt and pepper, to taste1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed
column5: 1. Heat the oil in a large, heavy pot over low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, 8 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, curry powder and flour; cook, stirring constantly, 2 minutes.2. Add the carrots, potatoes, broth and cinnamon sticks; simmer, partially covered, 20 minutes. Add the chutney, raisins, peas, tomato, parsley, beef, salt and pepper; cook 5 minutes more.3. Place the mixture in a 1 1/2-quart, round, ovenproof casserole dish. On a floured surface, roll the pastry into a circle 2 inches larger than the dish. Brush the dish rim with some of the egg ; cover with pastry, crimping the edges around the rim. Cut 3 slits in the top and brush with remaining egg. Bake in a 350F oven until golden, 40 minutes.
column6: Drop biscuit toppingCHEDDAR SCALLION DROP BISCUITSParade, Oct. 2007

column4: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder2 teaspoons sugar3/4 teaspoon baking soda1 teaspoon salt6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes6 oz Cheddar, coarsely grated (1 1/2 cups)3 scallions, finely chopped1 cup well-shaken buttermilk
column5: Preheat oven to 450F.Whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a bowl, then blend in butter with your fingertips until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in Cheddar and scallions. Add buttermilk and stir until just combined.Drop dough in 12 equal mounds about 2 inches apart onto a buttered large baking sheet. Bake in middle of oven until golden, 18 to 20 minutes.

column4: 1 tablespoon olive oil1 pound boneless sirloin steak, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch cubes1 3/4 cups chopped onion (about 1 medium)2 garlic cloves, minced1 1/2 cups fat-free, less-sodium beef broth1/2 cup merlot or other dry red wine2 tablespoons no-salt-added tomato paste1 tablespoon low-sodium Worcestershire sauce1 1/2 cups sliced carrot (about 5 medium)1 cup sliced mushrooms2 thyme sprigs2 tablespoons all-purpose flour3 tablespoons water1/2 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon black pepperCooking spray1/2 (15-ounce) package refrigerated pie dough (such as Pillsbury)
column5: Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add steak, onion, and garlic; cook 5 minutes or until steak is browned. Add beef broth and next 3 ingredients to pan; stir well to combine. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and simmer, uncovered, 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.Stir in carrot, mushrooms, and thyme; cover and simmer 30 minutes.Combine flour and water in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk; add to steak mixture in pan. Cook over medium heat 2 minutes or until thick. Remove and discard thyme; stir in salt and pepper.Preheat oven to 425.Spoon steak filling into a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate coated with cooking spray. Unroll pie dough; cut small slits in center to vent, and place over filling. Fold edges under; flute.Bake at 425 for 17 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned.

column4: 1 cup quinoa1 cup tomato, chopped1 (15 ounce) can black beans1 cup bell pepper, chopped1/4 cup scallion, chopped8 ounces corn1 seedless cucumber, chopped1/4 cup cilantro, chopped1/4 cup olive oil3 tablespoons lime juice1 teaspoon cumin1 teaspoon coriander2 teaspoons chili powdersalt and pepper
column5: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Allow to cool.Combine quinoa with chopped vegetables.Whisk together remaining ingredients to make the dressing.Thoroughly combine dressing with quinoa-vegetables mixture and chill.Adjust seasonings as preferred.

column4: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil2 -8 garlic cloves, depending on preference1 (2 ounce) can anchovy fillets red chili pepper flakes1 (32 ounce) can diced tomatoes1/4 cup crushed black olives1/4 cup stuffed olives sliced1 tablespoon capers, heaping1/4 cup chopped Italian parsley3 leaves fresh basil, chiffonade1 pound pasta cookedparmesan  or romano cheese grated
column5: Add olive oil, garlic, anchovies and crushed pepper to large heated skillet over medium heat.Saute until the anchovies disolve into the oil and the garlic is tender.Add the tomatoes, olives, and capers.Simmer sauce 6 to 8 minutes and add parsley and basil.Taste for salt and add fresh black pepper.  Toss with pasta, sprinkle with cheese and serve.
column6: I added one jalapeno and two red banana pepperswww.food.com

column4: 2 tablespoons olive oil1 large onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice1 tablespoon minced garlic1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger2 tablespoons curry powder3 tablespoons all-purpose flour1 cup diced (1 inch) carrots1 cup diced (1/2 inch) peeled potatoes3 cups beef broth2 cinnamon sticks, 3 inches long2 tablespoons chopped mango chutney1/2 cup golden raisins1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed1 tomato, cut into 1/2-inch dice1/4 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley2 cups diced (1/2 inch) leftover roast beefSalt and pepper, to taste1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed
column5: 1. Heat the oil in a large, heavy pot over low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, 8 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, curry powder and flour; cook, stirring constantly, 2 minutes.2. Add the carrots, potatoes, broth and cinnamon sticks; simmer, partially covered, 20 minutes. Add the chutney, raisins, peas, tomato, parsley, beef, salt and pepper; cook 5 minutes more.3. Place the mixture in a 1 1/2-quart, round, ovenproof casserole dish. On a floured surface, roll the pastry into a circle 2 inches larger than the dish. Brush the dish rim with some of the egg ; cover with pastry, crimping the edges around the rim. Cut 3 slits in the top and brush with remaining egg. Bake in a 350F oven until golden, 40 minutes.
column6: EpicuriousTop with pie crust or cream drop biscuits

column4: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour1 tablespoon baking powder1 teaspoon salt1 tablespoon sugar2 cups chilled heavy cream
column5: Preheat oven to 400F.Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a large bowl. Add cream, then stir just until a dough forms.Drop heaping 1/4 cups of batter about 1 inch apart on an ungreased large baking sheet. Bake in middle of oven until tops are pale golden and bottoms are golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes.

column4: 3 medium ripe tomatoes, cored, seeded, and chopped2 fresh jalapeo peppers, seeded and minced1 bunch fresh cilantro, leaves chopped, stems discarded4 garlic cloves, minced3 red bell peppers, cored, seeded, and chopped1 red onion, choppedJuice of 1 limeKosher salt to taste
column5: Combine all in large ceramic bowl.  Stir, add salt as needed

column4: 2 cups heavy cream4 tablespoons unsalted butter4 tablespoons granulated sugar12 ounces semisweet chocolate, broken into 1/2-ounce pieces6 ounces unsweetened chocolate, broken into 1/2-ounce pieces4 ounces white chocolate, broken into 1/2-ounce pieces
column5: Heat cream, butter and sugar over medium high heat.  Stir to dissolve the sugar.  Bring the mixture to a boil.Place the chocolates in a stainless steel bowl.  Pour the boiling cream over the chocolates and allow to stand for 5 minutes.  Stir until smooth.  Allow to cool to room temperature.

column4: 1 can (5 oz.) drained or 2.5 oz. tuna2 ripe avocados, mashed2 Tablespoons fresh lime or lemon juice1/4 cup roasted red pepper strips2 Tablespoons chopped fresh parsley1/2 easpoon garlic salt1/4 teaspoon black pepper8 slices multi-grain bread8 tomato slices8 slices red onion
column5: Combine avocado, lime juice, red pepper strips, parsley, garlic salt and pepper.Flake and fold in tuna.Fill each sandwich with 2 tomato slices. 1/4 avocado filling and 2 slices red onion

column4: 2 large egg whites, or more to thin icing4 cups sifted confectioner's sugar, or more to thicken icing1 lemon, juiced
column5: Beat the whites until stiff but not dry.  Add sugar and lemon juice.  Beat for 1 minute more.  If icing is too thick, add more egg whites.  If it is too thin, add more sugar.  The icing may be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
column6: Raw eggs should not be used in food prepared for pregnant women, young children, or anyone whose health is compromised.

column4: 4 cups cranberries1 whole fresh orangecilantrojalapenosugar to taste
column5: Put cranberries and orange in Cuisinart, pulse until coursely ground.  Add other ingredients to taste.

column4: 1 teaspoon finely chopped lemon zest1 garlic clove, minced and mashed to a paste with 1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon crumbled dried1 tablespoon olive oilfour 1 1/4-inch-thick loin lamb chops (about 1 pound total)
column5: Preheat the broiler. In a small bowl stir together the zest, the garlic paste, the rosemary, the oil, and pepper to taste, rub the lamb chops with the marinade, and let them marinate on a plate for 20 minutes. Broil the lamb chops on the rack of a broiler pan about 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare meat.

column4: 1 1/2 cups fresh cranberries2 Tablespoons chopped walnuts1 tsp. grated orange rind1/2 cup butter softened and divided1/2 cup packed dark-brown sugar 2 Tablespoons fresh orange juice1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 1 1/2 cups flour1/2 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon baking powder1 cup granulated sugar1 teaspoon vanilla extract1 egg1/2 cup fat free buttermilkGLAZE: 1 cup confectioners' sugar1 teaspoon melted butter2 Tablespoons fresh orange juice
column5: Preheat oven to 350*; coat 9-inch square or 9-10-inch round pan with spray and flour.Combine cranberries walnuts, and orange rind.In small saucepan, melt 2 Tbsp butter, stir in brown sugar, orange juice and cinnamon.  Cook 3 minutes stirring frequently.  Pour into prepared pan, and sprinkle with cranberry mixtureWhisk flour, salt and baking powder togetherBeat sugar and remaining butter until creamy.Add vanilla, egg, buttermilk and flour mixture in thirds.  Mix and spoon over cranberries.Bake 40 minutes until straw inserted into center of cake comes out clean.  Cool in pan for 5 minutes, then invert  onto rack or serving plate.  Beat glaze ingredients together and drizzle over cake.

column4: 2 T. unsalted butter2 pounds broccoli, florets roughly chopped, stems peeled and chopped into 1/4" slices1 med. onion chopped (1 cup)2 med. garlic cloves, minced (2 teaspoons)1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard powdePinch cayenne pepperSalt3-4 cups water1/4 teaspoon baking soda2 cups low-sodium chicken broth2 ounces baby spinach (2 loosely packed cups)3 ounces sharp cheddar cheese (3/4 cups)1 1/2 ounces Parmesan cheese, grated fine    (about 3/4 cup) plus extra for serving  Ground black pepper
column5: 1-Heat butter in large Dutch oven.  Add broccoli, onion, garlic, dry mustard, cayenne, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook until fragrant about 6 minutes.  Add 1 cup water and baking soda.  Simmer until broccoli is very soft (about 20 minutes.)2- Add broth and 2 cups wate.  When mixture begins to simmer, stir in spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.  Transfer half soup to blender, add chese and process until smooth.  Repeat with remaining soup.  Return to Dutch oven, place over medium heat and bring to simmer.  Adjust consistency of soup with up to 1 cup water.  Season to taste.  Pass extra Parmesan cheese.

column4: 2 cups (10 ozs.) all purpose flour1 Tablespoon baking powder1 teaspoon salt1 (16-oz.) container sour cream7 Tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled
column5: Adjust oven rack to iddle position and heat to 425*.  Prepare baking sheet with parchment paper or butter and flour.Combine flour, baking powder, and salt.  Stir in sour cream and 5 tablespoons butter until combined.Scoop and drop generous (slightly heaping) 1/4 cup of dough 2 inches apart onto prepared pan.Brush with remaining 2 tablespoons butte and bake until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes, rotating sheet halfway through baking.  Let biscuits cool on sheet on wire rack for 15 minutes.  Serve warm.

column4: 6 ounces crimini mushrooms2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons butter5 tablespoons chopped green onions1/4 cup dry vermouth6 large eggs1 tablespoon water1/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
column5: Finely chop mushrooms in processor. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and 3 tablespoons onions; saut 3 minutes. Add vermouth and boil until evaporated, about 1 1/2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.Whisk eggs, 1 tablespoon water, salt, and pepper in medium bowl to blend. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add half of egg mixture. Stir with back of fork until edges begin to set. Cook until omelet is set, lifting edges with spatula to let uncooked egg flow underneath, about 2 minutes. Spoon half of mushroom mixture down center of omelet. Fold both sides of omelet over filling and transfer to plate. Repeat with remaining butter, egg mixture, and mushroom mixture. Sprinkle omelets with remaining onions.

column4: 1 large baking potato diced2 or 3 leeks diced2 or 3 diced carrots8 cups chicken broth1/2 cup orzo1 cup chopped green beans1 can cannellini or whole white beansSalt and pepper to taste1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper
column5: Dice vegetables and cook covered in heavy pot until they begin to get tender, about 10 minutes.Pour in 8 cups broth.  Bring to a boil.Add 1/2 cup orzo and boil until the orzo is tender, 10 to 12 minutes.Add 1/2 cup chopped green beans or young asparagus.Reduce the heat to a simmer; cook for 6 more minutes.  Pour in 1 can of cannellini or other white beans, salt and pepper to taste, and 1/3 teaspoon of crushed red pepper.  Cook until the cnnellini are heated through.  Serve with crusty bread and a dollop of sour cream.
column6: VP newspaper Feb. 2012I used canned green beans.

column4: 1/2 cup softened butterJuice of 1/2 lemon, divided1 lb. pears (Concord or Anjou)peeled, sliced 1/2 inch thick1 cup all-purpose flour1 teaspoon baking powder1/8 teaspoon salt1 cup plus 2 Tablespoons sugar2 eggs1 teaspoon vanilla extract1/2  teaspoon cinnamon
column5: Butter 9-in spring form pan, squeeze half the lemon juice over pearsWhisk together flour, baking powder and salt.Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes with electric mixer.  Beat in eggs one at a time, then vanilla.  Beat in flour mixture until batter comes together.  Spread in pan.  Wrap and chill for at least 20 m inutes.Preheat oven to 375*.
