Arrange pears in tight concentric circles on top of dough.  Squeeze remaining lemon juice evenly over pears.In bowl, mix 2 Tablespoons sugar with cinnamon.  Sprinkle over pears.  Bake for 45 to 55 minutes until edges are golden and center is set.  Cool in tart pan for 10 minutes.  Run a sharp knife around edge.  Remove sides of pan.

column4: 2 apples--McIntosh, empire or Courtland3 cups fresh broccoli, cut in bite size pieces1/4 cup walnuts1 Tablespoon red onion, chopped1/3 cup raisins1/2 cup low-fat vanilla yogurt
column5: Core and chop applesMix all ingredients togetherServe on a bed of lettuce

column4: 2 cups bread flour2 cups all purpose flour2 Tablespoons baking powder2 Tablespoons sugar1 teaspoon salt1 cup butter, but into small cubes1 1/2 cups buttermilk1 large egg
column5: Combine flours and next 3 ingredients in a large bowl.  Place cubed butter and flour mixture in freezer, separately, for 10 minutes.  Whisk milk and egg n a small bowl.Cut chilled butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender until crumbly.  Add buttermilk mixture stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.Preheat oven to 450*.  Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead lightly 3 to 4 times.  Pat or roll dough to 1-inch thickness, but and place on greased pan or parchment paper-lined baking sheet.Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Split biscuits, fill each with 1 cooked chicken thigh and desired toppings.

column4: 8 skinned, boned chicken thighs1 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper1/8 teaspoon onion powder1 cup buttermilk1 large eggVegetable 2 cups all-purpose flour
column5: Salt and pepper, and onion powder on thighs.Whisk egg with buttermilk, add chicken, toss tocoat.Flour chicken 5 to 6 minutes in 325* oil until golden brown and done.  Drain.Serve on split biscuit and desired toppings such as chopped pickled green tomatoes, local honey

column4: 1/4 cup olive oil, divided1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts,   butterflied to 1/2 inch thick scallopini1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided1/2 cup flour1 medium shallot, peeled, minced4 leaves fresh sage, torn into small pieces8 lemon slices, 1/8 tinch thick1 clove garlic, thinly sliced1/4 cup chicken stock2 tablespoons lemon juice1 1/2 capers, drained, washed, and lightly chopped1 tablespoon minced flat leaf parsley2 tablespoons butter, coldGround black pepper
column5: Pound chicken to 1/4 inch thickness, season with 3/4 teaspoon of the salt.  Dredge each piece of chicken through flour, coating both sides, shaking off access.In large heated skillet add olive oil and chicken.  Cook for 3 minutes per side, or until golden and just cooked through.  Remove chicken and lower the heat to medium.Add the shallot, sage and lemon slices to the pan.  Cook for 1 minute, then add the garlic.  Cook for 30 seconds, then ad the stock, lemon juice capers and parsley.  Simmer for 2 minutes, then whisk in the cold butter.  Season.  pour sauce over chicken and serve.

column4: 2 Tablespoons diced pimentos, drained1 Tablespoon grated peeled shallots2 Tablespoons canola mayonnaise1 teaspoon cider vinegar1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper4 ounces shredded reduced fat sharp cheddar cheese (about 1 cup)1.25 ounces grated fresh Parmesan cheese (about 1/3 cup)4 (1-ounce)  slices sourdough bread, toasted12 tomato slices1/4 teaspoon kosher salt4 center cut bacon slices, cooked and halved1 cup baby arugula leaves
column5: Combine first 7 ingredients.  Spread 3 tablespoons cheese mixture on each bread slice; top each with 3 tomato slices.  Sprinkle =tomato with salt.  Top each sandwich with 2 bacon halves and 1/4 cup arugula

column4: 1/4 cup vegetable oil1 medium onion, finely chopped (3/4 cup)3/4 cup ketchup1/3 cup lemon juice or vinegar3 T. brown sugar3 T. prepared mustard3 T. Worchestershire Sauce1 t. all purpose barbecue grill seasoning1 1/2 t. chili powder3 pounds bone-in chicken pieces, rinsed, patted    drySalt and pepper
column5: Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat.  Add onion; cook 5 minutes or until soft.  Add ketchup, lemon juice, sugar, mustard, Worchstershire sauce, grill seasoning and chili powder.  Reduce heat to low. Simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

column4: 3 pounds bone-in chicken pieces (breast halves, thighs and/or drumsticks), rinsed and patted dry.salt and pepper
column5: Heat grill to medium or broiler to high.  Sprinkle chicken generously with salt and pepper.  Place chicken on grill or on broiler pan about 8 inches from heat.Cook chicken, basting with sauce* after 15 minutes.Turn chicken, basting after 10 minutes.  Cook an additional 5 minutes or until internal temperature reads 165* and juices run clear, turning and basting as needed.*See Barbecue Sauce recipe

column4: 1 18 1/2-ounce package yellow cake mix 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, room temperature 6 large eggs 1/2 cup whipping cream 1/2 cup water 1 tablespoon grated lemon peel 3/4 cup raspberry preserves Lemon Cream Cheese Frosting 1 1/2 cups sliced almonds, toastedLemon Cream Cheese Frosting3  8-oz. packages cream cheese, room temperature1  11-oz. jar lemon curd1  cup powdered conf. sugar 2  Tablespoons fresh lemon juice 1  teaspoon grated lemon peelBeat cheese and lemon curd until smoothAdd remaining ingredients
column5: Preheat oven to 350F. Butter two 9-inch-diameter springform pans with 2 3/4-inch-high sides. Combine first 6 ingredients in large bowl. Beat until smooth, about 2 minutes. Divide batter between prepared pans. Bake cakes until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 28 minutes. Cool cakes completely in pans on racks.Using small knife, cut around sides of pans to loosen cakes. Remove pan sides. Using serrated knife, cut each cake horizontally in half. Place 1 cake layer, cut side up, on platter. Spread with 1/4 cup preserves, then 3/4 cup frosting. Top with second cake layer, cut side up. Spread with 1/4 cup preserves, then 3/4 cup frosting. Repeat with third cake layer. Top with fourth cake layer, cut side down. Spread remaining frosting over top and sides of cake. Press almonds onto sides of cake. Chill until frosting sets, about 2 hours. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; keep chilled.)

column4: For pastry dough:2 cups all-purpose flour1/4 cup granulated sugar plus additional for sprinkling1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/2 sticks cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes2 large egg yolks1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract1 tablespoon cold waterFor fig filling:12 ounces soft dried figs (preferably Calmyrna), stemmed and coarsely chopped1 1/4 cups water1 cup fresh orange juice1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar1 stick unsalted butter, melted and cooled3 large eggs, lightly beaten1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract1 teaspoon grated orange zest1 1/2 cups walnuts (6 ounces), coarsely chopped
column5: Make pastry dough:Blend together flour, sugar, salt, and butter in a bowl with a pastry blender (or pulse in a food processor) just until mixture resembles coarse meal with some roughly pea-size butter lumps. Add yolks, vanilla, and water and gently stir with a fork (or pulse) until incorporated and dough begins to form large clumps.Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface and divide into 4 portions. With heel of your hand, smear each portion once or twice in a forward motion to help distribute fat. Gather all dough together (using a pastry scraper if you have one), then divide dough in half and form each half into a 5- to 6-inch disk. Chill, wrapped in plastic wrap, until firm, at least 1 hour.Make fig filling while dough chills: Simmer figs, water, orange juice, and brown sugar in a medium saucepan, covered, stirring occasionally, until figs are soft and mixture is reduced to about 2 cups, 15 to 20 minutes. Pulse in a food processor until finely chopped (mixture should not be smooth). Transfer to a large bowl and cool slightly. Stir in butter, eggs, vanilla, zest, and walnuts.Make tart shell: Preheat oven to 350F with rack in middle. Generously butter springform pan. Roll out 1 portion of dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper into a 12-inch round (dough will be soft; chill or freeze briefly if it becomes difficult to work with). Peel off top sheet of parchment and carefully invert dough into pan. (Dough will tear easily but can be patched together with your fingers.) Press dough onto bottom and 1 inch up side of pan, then trim excess. Chill tart shell until ready to assemble crostata.Roll out remaining dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper into a 12-inch round. Peel off top sheet of parchment, then cut dough into 10 (1-inch-wide) strips and slide (still on parchment) onto a tray. Chill until firm, about 10 minutes.Assemble crostata: Spread fig filling in shell. Arrange 5 strips of dough 1 inch apart on filling. Arrange remaining 5 strips 1 inch apart across first strips to form a lattice. Trim edges of strips flush with edge of shell. Sprinkle crostata with sugar.Bake until filling is slightly puffed and pastry is pale golden, about 30 minutes. Cool completely, then remove side of pan. Serve crostata with mascarpone.v

column2: ROASTED VEGETABLE GOAT CHEESE PESTO ON BAGUETTE
column4: Baguette1/4 - 1/3 cup of fresh pesto 2T+ chevre goat cheese2 portobello mushrooms1 red, yellow, or orange bell pepper1 red onion1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil2 T balsamic vinegar1/4 tsp salt1/2 tsp freshly ground pepper1 T minced fresh rosemary or thyme
column5: Preheat oven to 475. Line two baking sheets with foil.Gently wash the mushrooms and cut out the stem. Cut all vegetables in large pieces. In a large bowl, mix together oil, vinegar, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Add the vegetables to the oil mixture and coat well. Place veggies in a single layer on the baking sheets, making sure each veggie touches the foil and is not on top of another vegetable. Place the vegetables in the oven. Roast for about 15 minutes, flipping the vegetables over at the 7 minute mark. They are ready to take out when the onions are starting to char on the edges and the peppers get nice blisters on the skin.While the vegetables are in the oven, cut your bread to the length that you want your sandwich. Slice in half and remove part of the inside to make room for the filling.Spread 2-3T of pesto on one half of each sandwich. Then spread 1-2T of goat cheese on the other half of each sandwich. Remove the vegetables from the oven, and layer the vegetables in tidy layers over the bread. Close the sandwich up. Place on the baking sheets and put back in the oven to let the residual heat warm up the cheese for 5 minutes.Cut your sandwich in half, serve with a simple salad or chips, and enjoy!

column4: 1 pound lump crab meat1 cup milk1 1/2 cups bread crumbsSalt & pepper2 celery ribs, chopped1/2 cup chopped onion1 garlic clove, peeled and smashed1 tablespoon butter4 ounces shrimp, peeled, deveined, tails removed1/4 cup heavy cream2 teaspoons Dijon mustard1/2 teaspoon hot pepper sauce1 teaspoon lemon juice1/2 teaspoon Old Bay seasoning4 tablespoons vegetable oil
column5: Refrigerate crabmeat and milk at least 20 minutesCrush panko and toast until golden brown. Salt and pepper to taste.Pulse celery, onion, and garlic in food processor until finely chopped.  Melt butter add chopped vegetables, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper; cook until vegetables are softened and all mositure has evaporated, 4 to 6 minutes. Remove from pan and cool.Strain crab meat, pressing firmly to remove milk, but do not break up lumps of meat.  Pulse shrimp in food processor until finely ground.  Add Cream, pulse.  Transfer shrimp puree to bowl with cooked vegetables.  Add mustard, hot pepper sauce, lemon juice, and Old Bay seasoning; Stir to combine.Add crab and stir gently with rubber spatula.  Do not over mix.  Divide mixture into 8 balls and firmly press into 1/2-inch thick patties.  Cover cakes and refrigerate for 30 minutes.  Coat each cake in panko.  Heat 1 tablespoon oil in skillet over medium heat.  Brown cakes, 3 to 4 minutes turning until both sides are golden brown.

column4: 1 chicken breast, grilled20 cherries, pitted and halved1/2 cucumber, peeled and diced2 avocados, pitted and diced1/2 cup Greek yogurt3-4 tablespoons honey2 tablespoons mayonnaisepinch of coriandergarlic salt to tastefresh ground pepper to tastea sprinkled of fresh chopped dillAnnies French Baguette
column5: Stir all ingredients gently in a large bowl.  Serve on Annie's toasted baguette.

column4: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar3 large eggs, separated1/4 cup all purpose flour1/4 cup fresh Meyer lemon juice2 tablespoons fresh regular lemon juice2 tablespoons finely grated Meyer lemon peel3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons whole milk1/4 teaspoon saltWhipped cream (optional)
column5: Preheat oven to 350F. Butter six 3/4-cup custard cups or ramekins. Combine 1/2 cup sugar, egg yolks, flour, lemon juice, and lemon peel in large bowl; whisk until well blended. Whisk in milk.Using electric mixer, beat egg whites and salt in medium bowl until frothy. Gradually add remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and beat until soft peaks form. Fold beaten egg whites into lemon mixture in 2 additions. Divide mixture among prepared custard cups. Place custard cups in roasting pan. Pour enough hot water into roasting pan to come halfway up sides of custard cups. Bake puddings until tops are golden and spring back when lightly touched, about 30 minutes. Remove cups from water. Serve warm or cold with whipped cream, if desired.

column4: 1 1/4 cups uncooked bulgur1 1/4 cups boiling water1 cup diced seedless cucumber1 cup diced seeded plum tomato1/2 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley1/2 cup chopped radishes1/4 cup chopped green onions1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind1/2 cup fresh lemon juice1 1/2 Tablespoons olive oil3/4 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon freshly ground  black pepper
column5: Combine bulgur and water in large bowl.  Cover and let stand 30 minutes.  Drain.  Add cucumber and next 4 ingredients.Combine rind and remaining ingredients in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.  Drizzle over bulgur mixture.  Toss well.Cover and chill at least 1 hour.

column4: 1 Tablespoon butter3/4 cup chopped pecans1 cup mayonnaise*3 Tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon1 teaspoon lemon zest1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice4 cups chopped cooked chicken breasts1 1/2 cups diced Granny Smith apples1 cup diced celery1/4 cup finely chopped red onion*I use 1/2 cup
column5: Toast pecans in butter in small pan until fragrant,  6 to 8 minutesWhisk mayonnaise and next 3 ingredients in a large bowl; stir in chicken and next 3 ingredients just until blended.  Add salt and freshly ground pepper.  Cover and chill 2 to 24 hours; stir in 1/2 cup toasted pecans just before serving.

column4: 4 bone-in rib or center-cut pork chops, about  7 ounces each and 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick. patted dry with paper towels1 teaspoon vegetable oilSalt and ground black pepper1/2 teaspoon sugar
column5: Turn on burner to medium heat.  Rub both sides of each chop with 1/8 teaspoon oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Sprinkle one side of each chop evenly with 1/8 teaspoon sugar, avoiding the bone.Place chops, sugared side down in pan.  Press meat of each chop into pan. Set pan with chops over medium heat; cook until lightly browned, 4 to 9 minutes.  Flip chops, cover skillet, reduce heat to low and cook until center registers 140* 3 to 6 minutes

column4: 1 (14-inch) loaf Italian bread, ends trimmed1 pound bulk pork sausage1 small onion, chopped fine3 cups shredded extra-sharp cheddar cheese12 large eggs, lightly beaten4 cups whole milk1 1/2 teaspoons salt1 teaspoon pepper1 tablespoon hot sauce (to taste)
column5: Slice bread in half crosswise, then slice half into 1/2 inch thick pieces.  Bake until golden.  Let cool.Cook sausage, add onion;Grease 13 x 9-inch baking dish; layer bread, sausage, cheese and soak overnight with egg/milk mixture.  Bake 350*  about 1 hour

column4: 2 Tablespoons white vinegar1 teaspoon salt12 large eggs6 English muffins, split12 slices Canadian bacon or ham1 recipe Foolproof Hollandaise
column5: Poach eggs in vinegar water until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 5 to 7 minutes.Toast muffins, place bacon on muffin, top with egg and Hollandaise

column4: 1/4 cup soy sauce3 Tablespoons red wine3 Tablespoons red wine vinegar2 cloves garlic, crushed or chopped1 bay leaf2 Tablespoons water
12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, softened6 large egg yolks1/2 cup boiling water 2 teaspoons lemon juice1/8 teaspoon cayenne peppersalt
column5: Whisk butter and egg yolks in large heat-resistant bowl set over medium saucepan filled with 1/2 inch of barely simmering water.  Don't let bowl touch water.  Slowly add boiling water and cook, whisking constantly until thickened and sauce registers 160 degrees, 7 to 10 minutes.  Off heat, stir in lemon juice and cayenne.  Season with salt.

column4: 3/4 cup warm water (105-115F.)1 1/2 teaspoons active dry yeast2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour1 teaspoon salt
column5: Stir water and yeast until yeast is dissolved.  In a large bowl, whisk together flour and salt.  Add yeast mixture, stirring until a soft dough forms.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.Transfer dough to oiled large bowl; cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk about 1 1/2 hours.Flatten dough with your hands on a floured surface.  Cut dough into two balls.  (Can be made ahead to this point.  Wrap balls in plastic wrap and chill in a small sealable plastic bag.  Return dough to room temperature before proceeding.)Dust tops of balls with flour and cover to allow dough to expand until double in bulk, about 1 hour

column4: 3 to 4 Meyer lemons (about 1 pound)1/2 cup sugar2 large eggs1 stick unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces
column5: Finely grate enough zest from lemons to measure 2 teaspoons and squeeze enough juice to measure 1/2 cup. Whisk together zest, juice, sugar, and eggs in a metal bowl and add butter. Set bowl over a saucepan of simmering water and cook, whisking, until thickened and smooth and an instant-read thermometer registers 160F, about 5 minutes. Force curd through a fine sieve set into another bowl. Serve warm or cover surface of curd with wax paper and cool completely.

column4: 1 48-oz. pineapple juice1 48-oz. orange juice2 small Sun Drop lemon bottles
column5: Mix all ingredients in punch bowl.Use frozen ring moldsRecipe makes 41 four ounce servings

column4: 4 cups cranberries2 cups sugar (or to taste)2 pears1 lemon1 orange
column5: Grind in food processor or grinder.

column4: Annies Baguette or Country Italian 1 1/4 cups ricotta cheesePear slicesWalnut piecesCoarse salt and ground pepperHoney
column5: Toast Baguette or Country Italian BreadDivide ricotta cheese among crostini. Top each piece with several ripe pear slices and some walnut pieces. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle each with honey. Serve immediately

column4: 2 tablespoons olive oil1 tablespoon lime juice, plus wedges for garnishPinch of cayenneSalt and pepper, to taste1/2 pound jumbo (15-count) shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails on2 avocados1/4 cup finely crumbled feta1/2 cup peeled and chopped grapefruit
column5: preheat broiler with rack on the second highest levelWhisk olive oil, lime juice, cayenne, salt and pepperHalve avocados, poke the flesh of each several times with a fork, brush with oil, lime mixture.Toss shrimp with oil and lime mixture.Place on baking sheet or broiler pan.Broil shrimp and avocado for 2 minutes, turn shrimp and sprinkle feta over avocado.  Broil 2 minutes more, until shrimp are cooked through and cheese is charred.arrange avocados with shrimp hooked on sides, garnish with lime wedges and the chopped grapefruit and serve immediately

column4: 1 cup sugar1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature1/4 cup flour1 tablespoon vanilla extract1/4 teaspoon salt1 1/2 cup old fashioned oatswalnutsTurbinado sugar
column5: Beat sugar and butter until well blendedBeat in flour, vanilla and saltProcess 1/2 of oats in food processor until the size of corn mealChop nuts finelyStir all oats into mixture.Form into a ballCover and refrigerate dough 1 hourRoll dough by tablespoon full between palms into one inch balls.  Place balls on baking sheet with 1 1/2 inch space apart.  Flatten balls with bottom of a drinking glass dipped in sugar.Bake at 350* until cookies are golden brown, about 8 minutes. Sprinkle tops with Turbinado sugar.  Let rest on greased cookie sheet for 1 minute.  Transfer immediately to rack and cool.

column4: 1 large melon4 Tablespoons salt to 1 quart of water2 cups vinegar4 cups sugar2 Tablespoons pickling spices
column5: Trim rind and cut in one inch squares.Soak overnight in brine.Drain, cover with clear water and cook until almost tender (a broom straw will pass through)Mix vinegar, sugar and spices and cook for 15 minutes.Add watermelon and cook until clear and transparent.Place in prepared hot jars and cap.

column4: broccoli2 or 3 cloves garlic2 Tablespoons olive oilsaltpepper
column5: Preheat oven to 375 Chop a head of broccoli (do not rinse, immediately prior to preparing!) Mince 2-3 cloves of garlic Put broccoli, garlic, 2 tbsp. olive oil, and a few shakes of salt and pepper in a ziploc bag. Shake it up!! Spread out on baking sheet, place on top rack, and bake for about 30 minutes. Broccoli will be crunchy and delicious!

column4: 1/2 cup almonds1/4 cup pecans1/4 cup walnuts1/2 teaspoon cinnamon1/4 teaspoon gingerPinch each of nutmeg and allspice3/4 cup light brown sugar1 to 3 Tablespoons water1 12-inch round BrieDried apricots and figs for garnish
column5: Process nuts, spices and sugar in a food processor until the nuts are finely ground.  Add 1 tablespoon of water and process.  If the mixture does not hold together, add another tablespoon of water.  The mixture should be moist, but not runny.  Spread on the Brie.Place the Brie under the broiler, but watch it constantly.  Broil until the topping is slightly browned.  Remove the wheel and decorate with apricots, figs or other dried fruits. Serve with crackers and fruit or French bread.
column6: Can do ahead and can be frozen.From Virginia Carrington

column4: 1 loaf Kings Hawaiian Sweet Round Bread (16)9 large eggs2 cups half-and-half1 cup milk2 Tablespoons sugar1 teaspoon vanilla1/4 teaspoon cinnamon1/4 teaspoon ground nutmegDash salt8 oz. block cream cheese, room temperature1 cup fresh or thawed frozen berriesTOPPING:1 1/2 sticks room temperature butter1 cup packed brown sugar1 cup pecans2 Tablespoons light corn syrup1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
column5: Slice bread into 1-inch slices; arrange half slices in a buttered large pan or Pyrex dish.  In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt until blended.Pour 1/2 of mixture over bread.  Dollop spoonfuls of cream cheese evenly on top.  Sprinkle berries over next.  Layer rest of bread slices over cream cheese layer, pour remaining egg mixture over.Cover and refrigerate overnight.Combine topping ingredients in a medium bowl.Preheat oven to 350*; Spread topping over bread and back for 40-60 minutes until puffed and lightly golden.  May serve with maple syrup.

column4: 2  eggs, room temperature1 cup flour1 teaspoon baking powder1 cup sugar1/2 cup milk2 Tablespoons butter
column5: Grease a 9x9x2 square baking panStir together flour and baking powder.Beat eggs with and electric beater until thick (about 4 mins.)Gradually add sugar beat until light and fluffy. add flour mixture and beat until just combined.In a small saucepan heat and stir milk and butter. Heat until butter melts, add to batter and beat until combined pour in baking pan.Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. cool on baking rack.
column6: www.food.com/recipe/tiramisu-231855Good for strawberry short cakeUse with Tiramasu recipe under DessertsGood sponge cake recipe for shortcake.

column4: 1/2 cup sugar2 Tablespoons instant coffee crystals2 Tablespoons rum2 8-ounce packages cream cheese, softened1/2 cup powdered sugar1 teaspoon vanilla2 1/2 ounces semisweet chocolate, grated1 cup whipping cream2 Tablespoons coffee liqueur
column5: Prepare Hot Milk Cake recipeSYRUP:  in small saucepan, combine sugar, instant coffee and 1/3 cup water.  Cook over medium heat and bring to a boil for about 1 minute, then stir in rum, remove from heat, cool.FILLING:  In medium bowl, stir together cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla.  Then stir in 2 oz. of the grated chocolate.TO ASSEMBLE CAKE:  Cut the cake into 3 horizontal layers.  With first layer, brush 1/3 syrup on cake layer, then put 1/2 of the filling on top. Add second layer, brush with 1/2 syrup and remaining filling on top.  Add top layer, brush with remaining syrup.ICING:  Combine whipping cream and coffee liquer.  Beat until soft peaks form.  Spread on top of cake.  Sprinkle remaining chocolate on top.  Cover and chill for at least 4 hours.

column4: Citronette:4 Tablespoons extra virgin olive oil4 rounded Tablespoons plain Greek yogurt2 Tablespoons lemon juice1 Tablespoon honey2 pinches sea salt.1-2 Tablespoons lukewarm water 4 eggsEnglish muffinscooked baconSpinach, cooked and choppedParsley
column5: Whisk oil, yogurt, lemon juice, honey, salt.Gradually add lukewarm water until pourable consistency.Pouch eggs; arrange  toasted English muffins on plates. Top each with 2 slices cooked bacon.  Add a little chopped spinach.  Top each with a poached egg.  Sprinkle with sea salt.  Drizzle the citronette sauce over and sprinkle with parsley

column4: 2 cups cubed cooked chicken2 cups sliced celery1 cup mayonnaise1/2 cup chopped almonds2 Tablespoons lemon juice2 teaspoons grated onion1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese1 cup crushed potato chops
column5: Mix all ingredients, stirring carefully to keep chicken cubes in tact. Place in casserole dish.Top with cheese and potato chips.Bake at 450* for 10 minutes or until heated through.

column4: 4 egg yolks3 Tablespoons sugar1/2 cup dry marsala wine1 cup heavy cream1 1/2 tablespoons sugarfresh berries
column5: Whisk together egg yolks, 3 tablespoons sugar and Marsala wine.  Place in double boiler over simmering water and whisk continuously until hot and thick, about 8 minutes (do not boil custard).Remove from heat and set pan in bowl of ice water until cold about 30 minutes.Whisk 1 cup heavy cream until stiff, then add 1 1/2 tablespoon sugar.  Using whisk, fold half the cooled custard into the whipped cream, then fold in remainder.  Layer in parfait glasses with fresh berries.

column4: 2 cups chopped cooked chicken1/2 cup chopped red onion1/2 cup chopped celery2 Tablespoons slivered almonds1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro leaf1/4-1/3 cup mayonnaise1 teaspoon sugar2 teaspoons low sodium soy sauce1/8 teaspoon peppersalt to taste
column5: Combine chicken, onion, celery, almonds and cilantro.In separate small bowl, whisk mayo, sugar, soy sauce, pepper, and salt.Pour dressing over salad mixture and toss well to evenly mix.Chill before serving.

column4: 1 pound hot ground pork sausage1 1/4 cups shredded Parmesan cheese1 teaspoon salt6 green onions, sliced1 package mini croissants (about 24) tornVegetable cooking spray3 cups milk1 cup heavy cream5 large eggs, lightly beaten2 cups shredded Gruyere cheese
column5: Cook sausage until brown, stirring to crumble.  Toss cooked sausage, Parmesan, and next 3 ingredients; arrange in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, cream & eggs.  Pour over sausage mixture.  Cover and chill for 8 hours.Preheat oven to 350* and sprinkle casserole with Gruyere.  Bake 45 minutes or until brown and bubbly.

column4: Marinade:1/3 cup olive oil1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice6 or 7 large garlic cloves, minced1/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper1 1/2 pounds extra large or jumbo shrimp, shelledCooking the shrimp:3 Tablespoons buttersalt and pepper1/4 cup dry white wineJuice of 1/2 large lemon2 Tablespoons parsley leaves, chopped
column5: Combine marinade ingredients and shrimp overnight in 'fridge.In skillet, melt 2 tablespoons butter with salt and pepper.  Add shrimp with marinade.  Stir, and reduce heat to medium low.  Cover the skillet and cook for 3 or 4 minutes or until barely firm.  Tastefor seasonings and transfer to heated platter.Raise heat to medium high and stir wine into pan juices.  Boil for 1 minute or until evaporated.  Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon butter, drizzle with lemon juice and serve with chopped parsley.

column4: 1 16-ounce cream cheese3 teaspoons Dijon Mustard2 teaspoons curry powder1/2 cup Major Gray's chutneyTopping:1/2 cup chutney3/4 cup almonds, sliced or choppedchopped onionstoasted flake  coconut
column5: Combine first four ingredients and shape into round cake shape.Top with chutney, almonds, onions and coconut.Serve with crackers or toast rounds

column4: 1 lb. thin green beans, trimmed1/3 cup water2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil  Salt and black pepper1/2 cup pimento-stuffed olives1/2 cup sliced celery1/4 cup thinly sliced shallots1 1/2 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel2 Tablespoons lemon juice2 Tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
column5: Cook beans in the water, the oil and a pinch of salt for 5 minutes.  Drain and cool completely.Add olives, celery, shallots, and lemon peel; toss to coat.  Drizzle with lemon juice and the 2 tablespoons oil.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.May be be made ahead.  Assemble without salad dressing.  Cover; refrigerate up to 24 hours.  Toss with olive oil and lemon juice before serving.
column6: From Better Homes and Gardens Prizewinning Recipes, volume 6; p. 18

column4: 12 medium jalapeno chiles1 8-oz. package cream cheese, softened1 cup finely chopped cooked chicken2 Tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro1 Tablespoon fresh lime juice3/4 teaspoon kosher salt12 hickory-smoked bacon slices cut in half24 wooden picks
column5: Preheat oven to 400*  Cut chilies in half and remove seeds and membranesStir together cheese, chicken, cilantro, lime juice, and salt.  Spoon 1 1/2 to 2 teaspoons chicken mixture into each chile half.  Wrap each half with bacon piece and secure with a wooden pick.  Place on wire rack in an aluminum foil lined backing sheet.Bake until bacon begin to crisp and chiles are softened, about 25 minutes.  Increase oven temp to broil until bacon is crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

column4: 1/4 c. freshly squeezed orange juice3 T. sweet orange marmalade2 T. canola oil1 T. soy sauce1 jalapeno, seeded and minced1 Fresno chili, seeded and minced (I didnt have this, just used a largejalapeno)Generous pinch of cayenne pepperKosher saltFreshly ground black pepper

1/4 cup white wine vinegar1 Tablespoon olive oil1 Tablespoon finely chopped shallots2 teaspoons honey1 1/2 Tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon, divided1 1/2 Tablespoon chopped fresh flat leaf parsley, divided1/4 teaspoon kosher salt1/4 teaspoon black pepper1 1/2 pound heirloom tomatoes
column5: Whisk together all ingredients and pour oversliced tomatoes.  Completely cover and chill for about 2 hoursArrange tomatoes with dressing on a serving platter, sprinkle with remaining 1/2 tablespoon each of tarragon and parsley

column4: 4 medium size ripe bananas1/2 cup butter1 cup packed light brown sugardash of ground cinnamon1/4 cup banana liqueur1/2 cup rumVanilla ice cream
column5: Cut bananas in half crosswise, then lengthwise.  Melt butter in skillet over medium heat; add brown sugar and cook, stirring constantly, 2 minutes.Add bananas to skillet and sprinkle with cinnamon.  Remove skillet fro heat and stir in liqueur and rum.  Carefully ignite fumes justabove the mixture with a long match.  Let the flames die down.  Return to heat, and cook 3 5o 4 minutes or until soft.  Serve over ice cream
column6: SOUTHERN LIVING Anniversary issue. Feb. 2016, page 2016

column4: 1 unbaked pie crust4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled2/3 cup finely shredded Parmesan cheese1/4 cup mayonnaise1 egg, separated1 Tablespoon chopped fresh oregano4 cups assorted tiny tomatoes1 to 2 Tablespoons drained capers
column5: Preheat oven to 375*Stir together feta, 2 Tbsp. of the Parmesan, mayonnaise, egg yolk, oregano, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper.Sprinkle pie crust with remaining Parmesan cheese.  Spoon feta mixture into pie plate spreading over Parmesan.  Top with tomatoes and capers, Sprinkle with 12 teaspoon kosher salt.  Optional:  place second pie crust over top, crimp, and wash with egg white whisked with 2 teaspoons water.Bake 35-45 minutes or until browned.Cool 2 hours on a wire rack

column4: 2 hard boiled large eggs, yolks masked and whites chopped fine3 Tablespoons tarragon white-wine vinegar1 Tablespoon Dijon mustard6 Tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil3 Tablespoons minced shallots (about 2)2 Tablespoons finely chopped fresh tarragonSalt and Pepper1/2 pound fresh spinach, coarse stems discardedand leaves washed well and spun dry10 ounces fresh white mushrooms
column5: In a small bowl whisk together yolks, vinegar, and mustard and add oil in a stream, whisking constantly until dressing is emulsified. Stir in egg whites, shallots, tarragon, and salt and pepper, to taste.Thinly slice spinach leaves and spread on a platter. Cut mushrooms into very thin slices and mound on spinach. Spoon dressing over salad.

column4: 1 cup sugar5 egg yolks5 egg whites1/3 cup milk1 teaspoon vanilla1 cup all purpose flour1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder1 (14 ounce) can condensed milk1 (12 ounce)can evaporated milk1 pint whipping cream
column5: Preheat oven to 350*.  Butter and flour bottom of 9-inch spring form pan.Beat egg yolks with 3/4 cup sugar until double in volume.  Stir in milk, vanilla, flour, and baking powder.Beat egg whites until peaks form.  Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar.  Beat until firm but not dry.  Fold into yolk mixture.Pour into pan.  Bake for 45-50 minutes.  Allow to cool for 10 minutes.  Remove cake and cool completely.Mix condensed milk, evaporated milk,  and 1/4 of whipping cream.Using a fork poke the cake so the milk mixture will absorb into the cake.Pour the milk mixture onto the cake.Whip remaining whipping cream with 2-4 Tablespoons of powdered sugar and 1-2 teaspoons of vanilla.  Spread on cake.  Good with or without fresh fruit.

column4: 4 Tablespoons white wine vinegar3 Tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil2 1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper3 cups shredded cooked chicken2 pounds heirloom tomatoes, cut into 1/2 inchwedges2 Tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley2 Tablespoons finely chopped fresh chives1 Tablespoon chopped fresh thyme
column5: Whisk together vinegar, olive oil, sugar, salt, and pepper.Gently toss together chicken, tomatoes. onion, basil, chives, parsley and thyme.  Add vinegarmixture and gently toss until thoroughly combined.Serve immediately, or cover and let stand at room temperature for up to 1 hour.

column4: 6 cups fresh butter beans1/4 cup kosher salt2 Tablespoons cilii flakes1/2 bunch thyme1/3 cup lemon juice1 cup extra-virgin olive oil20 fresh shrimp3 Tablespoons olive oil2 cups finely chopped celery1/2 cup finely chopped parsleyKosher salt and black pepper to taste
column5: Place butter beans, salt, chili flakes, and thyme in a large pot, and cover with cold water by at least 1 inch.  Bring to boil over high heat, and cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the beans are tender.  Strain through a colander and place in cold water to stop cooking.  Discard thyme and cool beans.Pour lemon juice into a bowl, add olive oil whisking constantly to create an emulsion. Place a large skillet over high heat, swish oil around the bottom of the pan. Place shrimp in pan over high heat one at a time; season with salt and black pepper.  Cook for about 1 minute, flip them and let them finish cooking on the other side, 30-60 seconds.  Remove pan from heat.Toss butter beans with the celery, lemon vinaigrette, more salt and pepper to taste.  Add the dressed butter beans to the hot pan and allow them to warm up.  Stir to scrape up any browned bits from bottom of the pan, and then return the beans to the bowl with the shrimp.  Garnish with parsley.

column4: 2 3/4 cups flour1 teaspoon soda1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon1/2 teaspoon ginger1/2 cup margarine or butter3/4 cup sugar2 eggs2/3 cup molasses1/2 cup milk+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++         GINGER CREAM1/2 cup butter, softened3 cups confectioners sugar1 1/4 teaspoon ginger2 or 3 Tablespoons milk1/4 cup molasses
column5: Mix all; chill one hour; drop by Tablespoons on cookie sheet, two inches apart.Bake 375* for 10 minutesCool and spread with ginger cream.

column4: 1 can sliced beets (not pickled) save liquid3/4 cups cider vinegar3/4 cups sugar1 teaspoon grated onion1 Tablespoon creamed horseradish or to taste1 package lemon Jello++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++     PINEAPPLE SAUCE1 Tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice1/2 cup Mayonnaise1 Tablespoon pineapple juice1/2 cup crushed pineapple, drainedMix all ingredients together and chill.
column5: Put beets into a small Cuisinart and blend with the horseradish.  Bring beet liquid and the vinegar to a boil.Add sugar and Jello to dissolve; add the onion and the beets.Chill until set.Serve with Pineapple sauce

column4: 1 cup flour1 stick butter, softened lb. extra sharp Cheddar cheese, grated teaspoon cayenne pepper teaspoon saltPecan halves
column5: 1. Preheat oven to 400.2. Mix flour and butter, then add cheese and seasonings. Form into a roll (approximately 1 inch in diameter). Wrap the roll in wax paper and chill at least several hours or overnight. Slice into thin wafers, top each with a pecan half, and bake about 8 minutes.

column4: 4 tablespoons butter1/2 cups dark brown sugar1 pinch salt4 apples (about 1 3/4 pounds, peeled, cored, cut into slices)1/2 cups butter1/2 cups sugar1 large egg1/3 cup dark molasses1/3 cup honey1 cup buttermilk2 1/4 cups flour 1 teaspoon baking soda1/2 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon ground ginger1 teaspoon cinnamonwhipped cream (very softly whipped)
column5: Place first four ingredients in a 10" cast iron skillet.  Melt butter and sugar, place sliced apples over.Cream:butter, sugar, and add egg; then add liquid ingredients and dry ingredients in thirds, mixing well after each addition.Pour into pan over apples.Bake at 325* for 45 minutes or until center is set.  Cool in pan for 15 minutes, turn out onto a large plate.  Serve with lightly whipped, sweetened cream.

column4: 1 can crushed pineapple (drained)1 can flaked coconut ( I used fresh because I had some in the freezer)1 box graham cracker crumbs (1 lb.)1 cup nuts, chopped5 eggs1/2 lb. melted butter2 t. baking powder1 cup milk2 cups sugar
column5: Mix crumbs with melted butter; add beaten eggs and other ingredients.Bake in a greased and floured angel food cake pan for about 1 hour and 15 minutes at 325*.
column6: This is the favorite cake I made for Charles before we were married.

column4: 8 ounces French bread4 eggs1/2 cup milk1/4 teaspoon baking powder1 teaspoon vanilla4 1/2 cups blueberries1/2 sugar4 teaspoons cornstarch2 teaspoons cinnamon2 tablespoons melted butterpowdered sugar to garnish
column5: Slice bread and arrange in 9 x 13" dish.Mix together eggs, milk, baking powder and vanilla.  Pour over bread.  Cill overnightPreheat oven to 425*.  Grease new 9 x 13 panCombine blueberries, sugar, cornstarch and cinnamon evenly in the greased pan.  Place bread slices, wettest side down on top of the blueberries in a single layer.  Brush with melted butter.Bake for 24-26 minutes or until golden brown.Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

column2: SHRIMP & GRITS w/ BLACK EYED PEAS
column4: 1/2 cup diced celery root (from 1 celery root)1 tsp. olive oil2 cups water1 3/4 tsp. kosher salt, divided1/2 cup uncooked stone-ground grits2 oz. sharp Cheddar cheese, grated (about 1/2 cup)3 Tbsp. salted butter, divided3/4 cup diced yellow onion (from 1 onion)1 cup frozen black-eyed peas3 multicolored baby bell peppers, diced1 large heirloom tomato, diced1 garlic clove, minced1 1/2 cups seafood stock (preferably homemade), divided12 large raw shrimp, peeled (about 3/4 lb.)12 bay scallops, drained (about 1/2 lb.)1/4 tsp. smoked paprika1/8 tsp. black pepper1 1/2 tsp. hot sauce, divided
column5: Preheat oven to 450*Toss celery in oil;bake in oven on baking sheet until tender, 10 to 15 min.Bring water and 1/2 teaspoon salt to boil.  Stir in grits, simmer, stir until done, 20 to 25 minutes.Remove from heat and stir in cheese.  Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet, add onion, cook until caramelized about 10 minutes.Add celery root, black eyed peas, peppers, tomato, garlic and 1 teaspoon salt; cook until tender, 6 to 8 minutes.  Add 1 cup of the stock; cook until liquid thickens, 20 to 25 minutes.Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in medium skillet; add shrimp, scallops; cook until shrimp turn pink, 2 or 3 minutes.  Add Paprika, black pepper, 1 teaspoon of the hot sauce, remaining 1/2 cup stock and 1/4 teaspoon salt; bring to boil.  Cook until shrimp and scallops are done, about 2 minutes.  Using a slotted spoon, transfer shrimp and scallops to a plate, and cover.  Cook stock mixture until reduced and thickened slightly, 5 to 6 minutes.Divide grits among 4 bowls.  Top each with 3/4 cup of celery root mixture, 3 shrimp, 3 scallops.  Give each bowl a liberal spoonfull of sauce from each skillet.  Sprinkle with remaining  1/2 teaspoon hot sauce.

column2: ROASTED PORK LOIN w/PEARS & CIPOLLINI ONIONS
column4: 3 cups chicken stock, divided1/2 cup dry white wine2 Tablespoons chopped fresh thyme2 Tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary2 Tablespoon Dijon mustard3 cloves garlic, mincedKosher salt and freshly ground pepper1 (3 to 3 1/2 lb.) boneless pork loin tied1/4 cup olive oil, divided2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice2 teaspoons honey6 firm, ripe Seckel pearl, halved*2 (10-oz) package cipollini onions, peeled2 Tablespoons all-purpose flour
column5: Combine 1 1/2 cups stock, next 5 ingredients, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, and 3/4 tsp. pepper in zip lock plastic bag.  Add pork and chill 8 hours or overnight.Remove pork from marinade, and discard marinade.  Let pork stand at room temperature for 30 minutes season with salt and pepper.Stir together 2 Tbsp. oil and next 2 ingredients in a large bowl.  Stir in pears and onions.  Season.Preheat oven to 400*  Brown pork on each side in 2 Tbsp. hot oil,medium high for 4 minutes each side.  Place pork in a roasting pan;  arrange pears and onions around pork in pan.Bake at 400* for 35 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 135*, stirring pear mixture once.  Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes.  Remove pork and pear mixture, reserving drippings in pan.Cook drippings in pan over medium heat.  Whisk in flour and cook 1 minute.  Whisk in remaining 1 1/2 cups chicken stock, and cook stirring constantly, 3 minutes or until thickened.Slice pork and serve with pears, onions, and pan sauce.
column6: *3 firm ripe Bartlett pears, quartered may be substituted.  Southern Living, 11/16

column4: 1 pound crabmeat4 eggs2 Tablespoons flour1 cup mayonnaise1 cup milk8 oz. shredded cheddar cheese8 oz. shreded Swiss cheese1 Tablespoon minced onion1 Tablespoon minced green pepper@ teaspoons pimentos2 nine inch deep dish pie shells
column5: Combine eggs, flour, mayonnaise and milk in a bowl.  Mix well.  Stir in other ingredients being careful not to break up the crab lumps.Bake pie shells at 350* for 5 minutes.  Cool.  Spoon crab mixture into pie shells.  Bake at 350*for 50 minutes or until knife inserted knto center comes out clean.
column6: From The Maryland Store via net

column4: 3/4 cup dried apricot3/4 cup dried prunes*3 cups flour1/2 Tablespoon baking powder3/4 teaspoon baking soda1/4 teaspoon salt3/4 cup softened butter1 1/2 cups sugar4 eggs1/2 tablespoon vanilla1 cup sour creamSTREUSAL:1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar2 tablespoons softened butter2 tablespoons flour1 teaspoon cinnamon2 tablespoons icing sugar
column5: Preheat oven to 350*Butter and flour tube or Bundt pan and dust with flourChop, coarsely, apricots and prunes.  CombineSift together flour, soda, baking powder and salt.Beat butter until fluffy; beat in sugar, then eggs one at a time.  Add vanilla.Blend flour mixture alternately with sour cream, beginning and ending with flour mixture.  Blend until smooth.  Fold in prunes and apricotsMix the first four streusel ingredients with a fork until crumbly.  (Will make about 1 cup of streusel.) Turn 1/3 of batter into prepared pan, spreading evenly.  Sprinkle with 1/3 of streusel mixture.  Repeat, layering the remaining batter and streusel twice.  Bake 55 to 60 minutes, or until cake tester comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 20 minutes.  Remove to platter.  Sift icing sugar over top.  May be served warm.
column6: * I used orange flavored dried cranberries instead of prunes, and softened the dried fruits covered in water in the microwave for 2 minutes.  Save the fruit water and substitute for 1/2 cup of the sour cream.Original recipe from an old McCalls magazine.

column4: 1/4 cup butter1 cup packed brown sugar1/2 cup whipping cream2 tablespoons rum1/2 teaspoon maple extract*
column5: Over medium heat, melt together butter, whipping cream and brown sugar until mixture comes to a boil.  Boil 2 - 3 minutes.  Remove from heat; stir in rum and maple extract.  Serve warm over bread pudding.
column6: *I used pure maple syrup.Adapted from Eagle Brand--Canada

column4: 3/4 cup spicy brown mustard1/2 cup sugar1/3 cup fresh lemon juice1 Tablespoon dry mustard3/4 cup vegetable oil3/4 cup drained capers1/2 cup chopped fresh dillGround black pepper4 pounds assorted smoked fishlemon wedgesdill sprigs
column5: Mix first four ingredients in a bowl.  Gradually add oil while stirring vigorously.  Add capers and dill.  Can be made 3 days ahead.  Line large platter with lettuce; arrange smoked fish and garnish with dill sprigs.  Serve fish with sauce and crackers.
column6: From CindyGood over cream cheese in lieu of chutney or pepper jelly.

column4: 1/2 teaspoon butter, for greasing the pan8 ounces Rich tea biscuits or sweet cookies4 ounces unsalted butter, softened4 ounces granulated sugar4 ounces dark chocolate1 eggICING:8 ounces dark chocolate, for cooking1 ounce chocolate for decoration
column5: Lightly grease a 6-inch x 2 1/2 inch cake ring with the butter and place on a tray on a sheet of parchment paper.Break each of the biscuits into almond size pieces by hand and set aside.In a large bowl, combine butter and sugar until lightened.Melt 4 ounces of the dark chocolate and add to the butter mixture, stirring constantly.  Add the egg and beat to combineFold in the biscuit pieces until they are all coated with the chocolate mixture.Spoon the mixture into the prepared cake ring.  Try to fill all the gaps on the bottom of the ring because this will be the top when it is un-molded.Chill for at least 3 hours. Remove from refrigerator and let it stand.  Melt the 8 ozs of chocolate in a double boiler.  Slide the ring off the cake and turn it upside down on a cake wire.  Pour the melted chocolate over the cake and smooth the top and sides.  Cool and set at room temperature.melt remaining 1 ounce of chocolate and use to decorate the top of the cake.
column6: Chef Darren McGrady, The Royal Chef

column4: 2/3 cup chunky peanut butter1 Tablespoon packed light brown sugar2 cups all purpose flour2 Tablespoons granulated sugar2 teaspoons baking powder1/2 teaspoon baking soda1/2 teaspoon kosher salt2 cups buttermilk1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice2 large eggs2 Tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled1 teaspoon safflower oilSliced strawberries and pure maple syrup for serving
column5: Mix peanut butter with brown sugar.  Drop teaspoons at a time on a parchment-lined baking sheet.  Spread into disks with a spoon; freeze 1 hour.Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, soda and salt until well combined.  zbeat together buttermilk, lemon juice, eggs, and melted butter.  Make a well in dry ingredients; stir i wet mixture until lumpy and just combined.  Let rest 10 minutes.Preheat oven to 200 degrees to warm pancakes as they are cooked  Heat a nonstick cast-iron skillet and add oil, wipe with paper towel, leaving a film.Drop 2 tablespoons batter in skillet; top with 1 peanut butter disk and cover with 2 more tablespoons batter.  Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side.Transfer finished pancakes to oven to keep warm.  Serve with strawberries or blueberries and maple syrup.

column4: 2 cups mixed salad greens1 large tomato, diced1/4 cups fresh parsley, chopped1/4 cups fresh mint, chopped10 kalamata olives (large pitted)1 zucchini (small sliced lengthwise1/2 avocado (diced)1 green onion, (sliced)1 can chunk light tuna in water (drained)1 Tablespoon olive oil1 Tablespoon balsamic vinegar1/4 teaspoons fine sea salt3/4 teaspoons cracked black pepper
column5: Grill the zucchini slices on both sides in a sizzling hot cast iron skillet grill pan.  CoolThrow all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and stir delicately until well combined.

column4: 2 Tablespoons butter 2 Tablespoons water1/4 teaspoon vanilla1 dash salt4 Tablespoons white sugar2 Tablespoons cocoa powder4 Tablespoons flour
column5: Melt butter in a coffee mug.  Add water, vanilla and salt.  Stir until smooth.  Add sugar, cocoa powder and flour.  Stir to remove all lumps.  Microwave mug for 40 seconds, longer if you don't want a gooey fudge center.

column2: OLD FASHIONED SOUR CREAM POUND CAKE
column4: 3 cups sugar1 cup butter6 eggs, separated2 teaspoons vanilla1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice1 cup sour cream3 cups all-purpose flour, sift before measuring1/4 teaspoon baking soda1/4 teaspoon salt
column5: Cream together sugar and butter, add the egg yolks one at time; beat well after each addition. Blend in vanilla, lemon juice and sour cream. Into a separate bowl, sift sifted flour, salt, and soda. Add sifted dry ingredients to batter; beat well. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into the cake batter. Pour into a greased and floured tube or bundt pan and bake at 300 for about 1-1/2 hours or until cake tests done.Cool 10minutes and remove from pan

column4: 1/4 teaspoon grated lemon rind2 Tablespoons lemon juice1 1/2 pounds large sea scallops1/4 teaspoon salt, divided1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided1 /tablespoon butter, divided3/4 cup dry white wine1 tablespoon water 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch1 Tablespoon finely chopped fresh basil
column5: Grate lemon rind, squeeze lemon for 2 Tablespoons juice.  Dry scallops with paper towels.Sprinkle scallops with 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Melt 2 teaspoons butter in non stick pan, add scallops; cook 3 to 4 minutes or until nicely browned and done. Remove from pan, keep warm.Add wine and reserved lemon juice to pan, bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, and simmer 2 minutes, stirring to loosen browned bits from bottom of pan.  combine water and corn starch; add to pan.Cook, stirring constantly, 2 minutes or until sauce begins to thicken.  Add reserved lemon rind, remaining butter, remaining salt and pepper, andbasil.  Remove from heat, serve over scallops with buttery angel hair pasta with Parmesan cheese.

column4: 2 cups apple cider vinegar2 cups water1 cup granulated white sugar1 tablespoon pickling spice1 teaspoon kosher salt teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes1 2-inch piece peeled fresh gingerRinds from 1 8-to-10-pound watermelon, peeled and cut into 1-inch dice (about 8 cups)
column5: In a large pot, combine the vinegar, water, sugar, pickling spice, salt, red pepper flakes, and ginger. Heat to boiling on high. Once boiling, cook, stirring occasionally, 1 to 3 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved.Start the PickleReduce the heat to medium-low. Add the watermelon rinds and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 to 7 minutes, or until just tender when pierced with a fork. Turn off the heat.Finish the PickleIf needed, place a plate on top of the watermelon rinds to keep them fully submerged. Let stand 1 hour, or until cooled to room temperature.Refrigerate OvernightTransfer the pickled watermelon rinds and pickling liquid to an airtight container (or containers). Refrigerate overnight, or until ready to use.

column4: 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter1 1/2 oz. store-bought waffle cones, lightly crushed1 1/2 cups old-fashioned oats2 Tablespoons all purpose flour1 teaspoon kosher salt3/4 cup (packed)light brown sugar1 large egg yolk2 teaspoons vanilla extract2 Tablespoons water4 pints any flavor ice cream
column5: Preheat oven to 350*.  Cook butter in saucepan until it foams and browns, 5-8 minutes.  Stirring and swirling often.  Scrape brown butter and toasty solids into a heatproof measuring glass and let cool.Process waffle cones, oats, flour and salt in a food processor in long pulses until oats are broken up and cones are finely ground.  Add brown sugar and pulse to combine.  Whisk egg yolk, vanilla and 2 Tablespoons water in a small bowl.  With motor running, slowly drizzle into food processor, then stream in brown butter; process until dough forms a ball around the blade.Portion dough into 26 balls; roll them between palms to smooth and divide between 2 parchment lined baking sheets, 3" apart.  Use the bottom of a glass to flatten each into a 2 1/2" round.  Bake cookies until browned, 12-15 minutes.  Cool. Soften ice cream.  Using a 4 oz. scoop or 1/2 cup measuring cup, place dome of ice cream on upside-down cookie.  Place right side  up cookie on top.  Freeze.

column2: HERB CREAM CHEESE & TURKEY TORTLLA ROLLS
column4: 8 ounce cream cheese, softened*1 Tablespoon chopped black olives1 Tablespoon chopped green onion1 Tablespoon minced fresh parsley1 Tablespoon chopped fresh basilSalt and pepper to taste1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice4 burrito size whole wheat tortillas2 cups baby spinach8 ounces shaved roasted turkey1 cup shredded carrots1 cucumber, julienned1 yellow bell pepper, diced
column5: Combine cheese and next six ingredients.  Spread cheese mixture in a thin layer on tortillas.  Layingredients down the middle of the tortilla;  roll as tight as possible, and wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate for at least one hour or overnight.  To serve, unwrap and slice into pieces.  Makes 20-30 pieces.
column6: Yummly.com*I use Boursin cheese with herbs and garlic instead if I don't have time for recipe.

column4: 1 pound lean ground beef8 ounces cream cheese1 ounce taco seasoning1 cup shredded cheddar cheese3 cans refrigerated crescent rolls
column5: Cook the ground beef or turkey in a skillet.  Drain fat.  Mix hamburger, taco seasoning, cheddar cheese and cream cheese together.  Separate rolls into triangles.  Cut each triangle in half lengthwise.  Scoop a heaping tablespoon onto each roll and roll up.Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
column6: YummleyServe with salsa and ranch dressing for dipping.

column4: 1 cup melted butter1 cup (8 oz.) warm milk4 cups flour3/4 Tablespoons dry yeastCookie Filling/Topping:10 ounces apricot preserves1 cup  walnuts cup dried cranberries/craisins, (or dried cherries, or raisins)2 Tbsp. granulated sugar1 teaspoon ground cinnamonPowdered sugar to generously dust cookies
column5: In food processor bowl, pulse together walnuts, dried fruit, 2 Tablespoons sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon until ground.Melt 1 cup butter over low heat, add to mixer bowl fitted with dough hook.  Stir in 1 cup warm milk (100*); Mix flour and yeast; add to butter and milk mixture, adding 1/2 cup at a time.  Knead for 3 to 5 minutes.  Dough is soft.Divide dough into 5 pieces and cover with plastic wrap.  Work one piece at a time, rolling into an 11-inch circle.  Spread 3 heaping tablespoons of preserves evenly over the surface then sprinkle the top with 1/3 cup of the nut mixture.Using a pizza cutter, cut the dough into 12 triangles; roll each from the outside in; transfer with points down to parchment lined baking sheet.Let cookies rise in a warm over no more than 100* for 30-45 minutes or until about 50% larger.  remove from oven and preheat to 350*.  Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly golden.  Transfer to serving platter while still warm and dust with powdered sugar.  Dough has no sugar, so don't skimp.

column4: 1 lb shrimp (we used 21-25 count), peeled and deveined*Salt and black pepper to taste1 Tbsp olive oilJuice of 3 medium limes2 medium/large avocados, peeled, pitted and diced1/2 english cucumber, diced3 medium (or 4 roma) tomatoes, diced1 small onion, finely diced1/2 bunch Cilantro, choppedTortilla chips and hot sauce to serve
column5: Cook and season shrimp.  Transfer to cutting board and chop.  Squeeze juice of 3 medium limes over shrimp, stir and set aside.Dice cucumber, tomato and avocado; add to mixing bowl with shrimp.Finely dice onion and chop 1/2 bunch of fresh cilantro.  Add to bowl and stir together all of the ingredients until well combined and serve.

column4: 1/2 cup chopped walnuts1 Tablespoon salted butter1 Tablespoon packed light-brown sugar7 oz Spring Salad & Spinach blend2 oz parmesan cheese , shaved2 Red Anjou Pears , sliced thin (Bartlett pears 1/3 cup dried sweetened cranberriesBalsamic Vinaigrette:1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil2 1/2 Tablespoon balsamic vinegar1 Tablespoon honey1 tsp dijon mustard1 1/2 Tablespoon finely diced shallotSalt and freshly ground black pepper
column5: Melt butter and sugar over medium heat.  Add walnuts and cook until caramelized, about 2 min.Cool in single layer.Balsamic VinaigretteLayer lettuce and pears in a large bowl and toss with dressing, then top with parmesan, dried cranberries and candied walnuts and serve (alternately just layer all the salad ingredients then drizzle with dressing. Note: top this salad with dressing just before serving as it will wilt the lettuces after a while).

column4: 2 cups cooked mashed butternut squash2 large eggs1/2 cup milk2 tablespoons butter, melted2 tablespoons coconut1 teaspoon vanilla1/2 teaspoon ground ginger2 teaspoons granulated sugar
column5: Perheat oven to 350*Grease 1 1/2 quart casserole; Toast coconut until lightly browned.In large bowl, combine all ingredients until thoroughly blended.  Pour into casserole. Top with toasted coconut and granulated sugar if desired.Bake until set, 50 to 60 minutes

column4: 2 sticks (1 cup) butter, melted1 lb powdered sugar1 tbsp vanilla extract1 14 ounce shredded coconut, sweetened1 14 oz can sweetened condensed milk1 10 oz jar maraschino cherries, drained and chopped3 cups finely chopped pecans1 16 oz package chocolate Candiquik
column5: After chopping cherries, place on a paper towel so the liquid can be absorbed. Blot dry with additional paper towel.Combine all ingredients except for Candiquik in a large bowl.Refrigerate for at least two hours. Tip #1 - the colder the filling is the quicker the chocolate will set upForm into balls about the size of a walnut or whatever size you prefer.Refrigerate balls for 20 minutes. Tip #2 - See tip #1Line baking sheet with parchment paper.Melt Candiquik according to package directions.Dip balls into chocolate, tap off excess, and place on lined baking sheet to set up. Tip #3: Get off as much chocolate as you can otherwise it will pool at the bottom of the candy and you'll have to trim it off.Repeat until all balls are covered in chocolate.Store in airtight container.LegalOptional features shown.CLOSEMore Christmas treats you NEED to make!White Chocolate Cranberry FudgeHomemade GumdropsChristmas Peppermint PattiesChocolate Covered Mint PattiesFor alllunchrecipes, go HERE.For all dessertrecipes, go HERE.Sign up to get emails when I post new recipes!For even more great ideas follow me on Facebook  Pinterest  Instagram  Twitter  Bloglovin.Have a great day!		1.9k0000YUMMY RECIPES STRAIGHT TO YOUR INBOX!real recipes real easy!by trish - mom on timeout december 8, 2014christmas, christmas recipes, dessert, favorites, holiday recipes, recipesPrevious article: Adorable Clay Pot SnowmanNext article:Perfect Soft Ginger Cookies Comments	1	Mallory saysOctober 4, 2017 at 10:08 AMHow long do these keep?Reply		Trish - Mom On Timeout saysOctober 8, 2017 at 4:14 PMA few weeks! Blot dry with additional paper towels.	2	Combine all ingredients except for Candiquik in a large bowl.	3	Refrigerate for at least two hours. Tip #1 - the colder the filling is the quicker the chocolate will set up	4	Form into balls about the size of a walnut or whatever size you prefer.	5	Refrigerate balls for 20 minutes. Tip #2 - See tip #1	6	Line baking sheet with parchment paper.	7	Melt Candiquik according to package directions.	8	Dip balls into chocolate, (I use these tools here) tap off excess, and place on lined baking sheet to set up. Tip #3: Get off as much chocolate as you can otherwise it will pool at the bottom of the candy and you'll have to trim it off.	9	Repeat until all balls are covered in chocolate.	10	Store in airtight container.Used In This Recipe	Ateco 3 Piece Dipping Tool Set$10.85$12.00(149)	Log House Candiquick Coating Choc$19.99(7)	OXO Good Grips Medium Cookie Scoop$13.95(2127)	Reynolds Kitchens Cookie Baking Sheets Parchmen$4.38$5.89(1124)AllAds by AmazonLegalOptional features shown.CLOSEMore Christmas treats you NEED to make!White Chocolate Cranberry FudgeHomemade GumdropsChristmas Peppermint PattiesChocolate Covered Mint PattiesFor alllunchrecipes, go HERE.For all dessertrecipes, go HERE.Sign up to get emails when I post new recipes!For even more great ideas follow me on Facebook  Pinterest  Instagram  Twitter  Bloglovin.Have a great day!		1.9k0000YUMMY RECIPES STRAIGHT TO YOUR INBOX!real recipes real easy!by trish - mom on timeout december 8, 2014christmas, christmas recipes, dessert, favorites, holiday recipes, recipesPrevious article: Adorable Clay Pot SnowmanNext article:Perfect Soft Ginger Cookies Comments	1	Mallory saysOctober 4, 2017 at 10:08 AMHow long do these keep?Reply		Trish - Mom On Timeout saysOctober 8, 2017 at 4:14 PMA few weeks! column4: 1/3 cup mayonnaise1/3 cup sour cream1 Tablespoon lemon juice  (or more)1/8 teaspoon cracked black pepper1 pinch salt1/3 cup blue cheese, crumbled (or more)
column5: Combine first five ingredients; mix well; add bleu cheese.If too thick, stir in milk, water or more lemon juice until desired consistency.

column4: 1 14-ounce sweetened condensed milk1 6-ounce can frozen pink lemonade1 teaspoon grated lime rnd
column5: Stir together all ingredients in a small bowl until blended.  Cover and cill at least 2 hours.Good served as a fruit dip or with sugar cookies or squares of plain cake.

column4: 1 8 oz. package cream cheese, softened6 tablespoons sugar2 tablespoons grated lemon peel10 slices (1/2 inch thick) challah2 cups blueberries8 eggs2 cups whole milk1 cup heavy whipping cream
column5: butter 13 x 9-inch baking dish (3 quart)Beat cheese, 3 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon peel until smooth and creamy.  Spread mixture on 5 slices of the bread.  Press a few blueberries onto cream cheese; place another slice of bread on top to make sandwiches.  Place 4 of the sandwiches in a baking dish.  Cut remaining sandwich into pieces and fill in any gaps in the dish.Beat eggs, remaining 3 tablespoons sugar, remaining 1 tablespoon lemon peel, milk and cream with whisk.  Pour over bread; top with remaining blueberries.  Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate at least 1 hour but no longer than 12 hours.  Remove dish from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking;  bake in preheated 350* oven for about 40 minutes.  Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

column4: 2  8 ounce Crescent rolls1/3 cup cranberry sauce1   12 ounce wheel brie, cut into cubes8 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled2 eggs lightly beatenkosher saltfreshly ground black pepper1 Tablespoon chopped parsley for garnish
column5: preheat oven to 375*; line baking pan with parchment paper.  Unroll crescent dough separating each triangle.  Arrange in a sunburst pattern with pointed ends of the triangle  pointed outward, overlapping base of each triangle.Spread cranberry sauce on dough. Top with cheese and bacon crumbles.  Fold triangle tips over filling and tuck under base to secure.Whisk egg.  Brush top of dough with egg, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until dough is golden 15-20 minutes.  Garnish with parsley.

column4: 1 1/2 cups water2 teaspoons cornstarch6 ounces pecorino romano, finely grated (1 1/2 cups) plus extra to serve12 ounces linguini or spaghetti2 Tablespoons kosher salt2 teaspoons ground black pepper
column5: Boil pasta in 4 quarts water.  Stir the pasta and salt into boiling water, cook until al dente.  Reserve 1/2 cup of cooking water.  Drain, return pasta to pan and cool for 1 minute.While pasta cooks, whisk water and cornstarch until smooth.  Add the pecorino and stir until evenly moistened.  Set pan over medium low and cook, whisking constantly until the cheese melts and mixture thickens slightly about 5 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Pour over cooked pasta and toss with tongs until combined.  Add pepper, tossing two or three times until liquid is absorbed.Serve with more cheese and pepper.FOR PASTA GRICIA:  Cook 3 ounces finely chopped pancetta until crisp, about 5 minutes.  Transfer and drain on paper towel.  Reserve 2 tablespoons of rendered fat.  Whisk fat into the pasta and pecorina mixture, stir into pasta.

column4: 2 Tablespoons fat-free mayonnaise4 1/2 teaspoons low-fat sour cream1 Tablespoon fat free skim milk2 teaspoons lemon juice1 teaspoon lemon zest1 1/4 cups cooked hot broccoli florets or green beans.
column5: Combine all ingredients except the broccoli in the top of a double boiler.  Cook over simmering water 5 minutes or until heated through stirring constantly.Serve over hot cooked broccoli, or also good over hot cooked green beans.

column4: 1 cup whole milk1 packet (2 1/2 tsp) unflavored gelatin2 cups heavy whipping cream1/2 cup + 1 Tablespoon sugarpinch of salt1 teaspoon vanilla extract1 cup sour creamBERRY SAUCE:2 cups berries, divided (1 cup raspberries and 1 cup quartered strawberries)3 Tablespoons granulated sugar1/2 Tablespoon lemon juice
column5: In medium saucepan, place milk and sprinkle withgelatin.  Let stand 3-5 minutes or until softened.Place pan over med/low heat and stir until gelatin dissolves and mixture is steaming, about 4-5 minutes.  Do not boil.Add whipping cream, 1/2 cup + 1 Tablespoon sugar, vanilla and salt.  Continue stirring about 5 minutes until sugar is dissolved and mixture is steaming.  Remove from heat and let cool 5 min.Place sour cream in medium bowl with pouring lip.  Whisking constantly, gradually add warm cream.  When the mixture is completely smooth, divide into 6 wine glasses or 8 ramekins.   Refrigerate until set; 4 to 6 hours.SAUCE:  Combine 1 cup berries, 1/2 Tablespoon lemon juice and 3 Tablespoons sugar.  Bring to a low boil and cook 4 to 5 minutes until syrupy.  Stir in remaining berries and remove from heat.  When syrup is cooled to room temperature, spoon over the top of chilled panna cottas.

column2: CRUDITES AND GRILLED SAUSAGE W/SWEET AND HOT CHUTNEYS
column4: Vegetables to dip (carrot sticks, steamed broccoli, jicima and cauliflower)3 pounds fully cooked sausage (bratwurst or KielbasaSweet Chutney1 cup mayonaise2/3 cup Major Grey's Chutney1 teaspoon curry powder1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepperBlend all ingredients in processor.  Transfer to bowl.  May be made 2 days ahead.Hot Chutney2 cups packed fresh mint leaves2 cups packed fresh cilantro leaves2/3 cup cider vinegar1/4 cup sugar4 jalapeno chilies, seeded1 2-inch fresh ginger, peeled cut into 1/2 inch pieces1 teaspoon salt1/2 cup plain yogurtCombine all ingredients except yogurt in processor and pulse until chopped.  Mix in yogurt, transfer to bowl.  May be made day ahead.  Cover and refrigerate.
column5: Arrange vegetables around edge of platter.  Grill or panfry sausages until browned and heated through.  Cut into 1-inch pieces.  Arrange in center of platter, placing toothpick in each piece.  Serve with chutneys for dipping.

column4: 9 cups Rice Chex cereal1 1/4 cups white vanilla baking chips4 teaspoons grated lemon peel2 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice2 cups powdered sugar*
column5: Measure cerealMicrowave chips, lemon peel and juice on High for 1 minute; stir.  Microwave about 30 seconds longer or until smooth.  Pour over cereal, stirring until evenly coated.  Pour into a 2-gallon re-sealable food storage plastic bag.Add powdered sugar.  Seal bag; shake gently until well coated.  Spread on waxed paper or foil to cool.  Store in air tight container* 1 cup of sugar is enough.

column4: 1  1/2 pound 80% lean ground beef1 large onion, chopped1/2 teaspoon garlic powder1 Tablespoon parsley flakes1 stalk celery, finely diced1/2 bell pepper, chopped2 15-ounce cans diced tomatoes with juice2 15-ounce cans tomato sauce1 teaspoons salt, more to taste1 teaspoon pepper1 15-ounce can whole kernel corn, drained1 15-ounce can cut green beans drained1 15-ounce can green peas3 peeled sliced diced carrots2 large white potatoes, diced3 beef bouillon cubes4 cups water
column5: Brown beef, remove from pan;  add onion, celery, carrot, garlic, parsley saute until soft.  add other ingredients. Do not drain pan.  Pour into large pot; add bouillon cubes and 4 cups water.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are done.Serve with cornbread or crackers.  I added half a quart of beef broth.

column4: 1 large apple, diced 2 tablespoons butter1/2 cup sugar1 teaspoon rumPudding:2 eggs1 egg yolk1/2 cup sugar1 1/4 cups milk, warm		To garnish:Whipped creamMint for garnish
column5: 1Preheat oven to 320 degrees. Prepare a round cake pan with butter.	2	In a saute pan over medium heat, add apples, butter and sugar. Stir with a wooden spoon for about 5 to 6 minutes, until it turns a golden caramel color. Remove from heat and stir in the rum. Pour into prepared cake pan and smooth the top.	3	In a mixing bowl, add the eggs, egg yolk and sugar. Whisk until combined. Gradually stir in the milk. Pour into the cake pan through a sieve. Bake for 40 minutes.	4	Cool in the refrigerator. Turn upside down onto a plate and decorate with whipped cream and mint.

column4: 1 pound ground chuck1 clove garlic, minced2 teaspoons salt1 Tablespoon vinegar1 Tablespoon tequila or water1 Tablespoon chili powder1 one pound can kidney beans, undrained
column5: Saute ground chuck with next 5 ingredients until done.  Stir in undrained kidney beans.Preheat oven to 350*; grease pan; Place 1/3 cup filling in center of each tortilla; roll up.  Arrange seam side down in a 13 x 9 x 1 inch baking dish.Pour tomato sauce over and sprinkle with cheese.See Tomato Sauce

column4: 3 Tablespoons salad oil1 clove garlic finely chopped1/4 cup chopped onion2 Tablespoons flour1 10 1/2 ounce cans tomato puree1 Tablespoon vinegar1 beef bouillon cube dissolved in1 cup boiling water2 Tablespoons finely chopped green chilies1 dash ground cumin12 teaspoon salt1 dash pepper10 corn tortillas
column5: Saute garlic and oinon in over until golden; remove from heat.  Stir flour into mixture until smooth; Stir in tomato puree, vinegar and dissolved cub broth.Bring mixture to boiling point, stirring frequently over medium heat until thickened.Add chilies, cumin, salt and papper.Simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally about 5 minutes.

column4: 4 ounces goat cheese, at room temperature1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice1/2 teaspoon Sriracha sauce (or to taste)12 ounces daikon, cut into 16 slices 1/4 inch thick each slice)8 ounces thinly slices smoked salmon cut into 16 pieces1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives
column5: Combine cheese, juice and Sriracha in a bowl.  Spread a layer of cheese mixture on each daikon slice; top with salmon and garnish with chives.

column4: 5 1/3 cups bread flour, divided1 cup heavy cream1/3 cup mild honey3 Tablespoons nonfat dry milk powder (Alba)2 Tablespoons active dry yeast (3 envelopes)2 Tablespoons kosher salt3 large eggs4 tablespoons butter cut into pieces, room temp.Nonstick vegetable oil sprayFlaky sea salt
column5: Cook 1/3 cup flour and 1 cup water in a small saucepan, whisking constantly until a thick paste forms, about 5 minutes.  Add cream and honey and cook, whisking to blend until honey dissolves.2.  Transfer to bowl with dough hook and add milk powder, yeast, salt, 2 eggs, and 5 remaining cups flour.  Knead on medium speed until dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.  Add butter, a piece at a time, until dough is smooth, shiny and elastic, about 4 minutes3. Coat a large bowl with non stick spray, transfer dough to bowl, turning to coat.  Cover and let rise until double, about 1 hour.4. Shape dough for muffin pans or for two 9-5-inch loaf pans, or 9-13-baking dish (12 pieces shaped to 4-inch logs.  6 down the length of dish.5.  Let shaped dough rise until doubled in size about 1 hour.6 Preheat oven to 375*.  Beat remaining egg with 1 teaspoon water.  Brush top of dough with egg wash and sprinkle with sea salt.  Bake, rotating pan halfway through until bread id golden brown, starting to pull away from the sides of the pan. 25 to 35 minutes for rolls, 50 to 60 minutes for loaf, or 30 to 40 minutes for buns.

column4: 1 can sweetened condensed milk8 ounces cream cheese1/3 cup lemon juicezest of one lemonCooked pie crust
column5: Mix all ingredients until no lumps of cheese remain.  Pour into baked pie crust.  Chill.Recipe calls for Graham cracker crust, but we prefer regular pie crust to cut down on sugar.

column4: 2 stalks celery, roughly chopped1 medium onion, choppedbroccoli stems, peeled and chopped1 teaspoon curry powder16 to 32 ounces chicken brothsalt to tastecream
column5: Saute celery, onion and broccoli stems in small amount of oil until wilted.Add curry, salt and broth.  Cover and cook until vegetables are very soft.Pulverize with wand or Cuisinart.Add a couple of tablespoons of cream to each bowl.  Serve cold or hot.Sour cream may also be used.Garnish with chopped chives.

column4: 12 oz. box vanilla wafers2 cups sugar7 oz. package of coconut6 large eggs1 3/4 sticks melted butter1/2 cup milk1 cup pecans
column5: Crush wafers and mix with other dry ingredients;Beat eggs separately and then stir into dry ingredients;Add milk, butter and nuts;Bake in a greased tube pan at 275 degrees for 2 hours.

column4: 1 14-ounce can diced tomatoes5 or 6 garlic cloves, minced2 teaspoons minced ginger1 teaspoon tumeric1 teaspoon cayenne pepper1 teaspoon paprika2 teaspoons gram masala (divided use)1 teaspoon cumin1 teaspoon salt1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs4 ounces butter, cut into cubes or 1/2 cup coconut oil1/2 cup heavy whipping cream or full fat coconut milk1/4 to 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro
column5: Mix first nine ingredients into sauce in large pan with lid.  Mix thoroughly , then place chicken pieces on top of sauce.  Cook slowly at a low simmer for one hour.Remove chicken.  Using an immersion blender blend all the ingredients to a smooth sauce.  Add the butter cubes, cream, remaining teaspoon of gram masala and cilantro.  Stir well.  Put chicken back into sauce and heat through breaking into smaller pieces.  Sprinkle cilantro on top, serve over rice or cucumber noodles.

column4: 3 lbs. chicken breast, cooked, finely chopped1 8-ounce package cream cheese2 Tablespoons mayonnaise or creme fresh2 Tablespoons sweet pickle juice1 Tablespoon finely grated onion1 cup finely chopped celery3/4 cup toasted pecans or walnuts, chopped1 teaspoon curry powder*Salt and pepper
column5: Cook and chop chicken'Mix cheese, mayo, onion, pickle juice and celery together.  Add nuts and chicken stirring gently to mix.  Place in a spring form mold for at least  four hours to chill.
column6: *I cooked the chicken in the sous vide with tarragon.  Used 1/4-1/2 cup of chopped cilantro instead of the curry.

column4: 1/2 cup vegetable oil1/4 cup lemon juice1 Tablespoon red wine vinegar2 Teaspoons sugar1/2 teaspoon ground mustard1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon Worchestershire salt1/4 teaspoon garlic powder (not garlic salt)1/4 teaspoon pepper6 cups salad greens,2 cups cooked chicken3 hard boiled eggs, peeled and cut up2 medium tomatoes, chopped1 ripe avocado peeled, pitted and chopped1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese4 slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
column5: For Vinaigrette dressing, combine vegetable oil, lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder and pepper in screw top jar and shake well. Chill until ready to use.		Divide salad greens among 4 plates. Arrange each salad ingredient separately in rows on top of leaves. Drizzle with vinaigrette and serve.

column4: 3 6-ounce containers raspberries5 Tablespoons sugar, dividedkosher salt2 teaspoons lemon zest, plus 4 teaspoons lemon   juice2 ounces meringue cookies, broken into rough 1/2 inch bits (about two cups)3/4 cup heavy cream2/3 cup sour cream1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom1/4 cup roasted salted pistachios, chopped
column5: In small saucepan, mash half of 1 container of raspberries (about 1/2 cup), 4 tablespoons sugar and pinch of salt.  Heat, stirring until berries have broken down and sugar dissolved about 3 minutes.Strain over medium bowl, pressing to extract as much liquid as possible; discard solids.  Cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes.  Stir in lemon zest and juice, then gently stir in remaining berries.Spread meringue pieces in an even layer on a baking sheet,and place under broiler until browned about 30 to 60 seconds.  Cool.Beat cream, sour cream, cardamon, remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/8 teaspoon salt until thickened and holds peaks about 2 minutes.Layer in a wide mouthed 10-12 oz. glass or serving bowls.  Layer cream mixture, berry mixture; top with toasted meringue pieces; Layer remaining whipped cream, dividing evenly, and sprinkle top with pistachios.

column4: 2 cups all-purpose flour1/3 cup sugar1 Tablespoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 cup cold butter, cut into 1/2 inch cubes1 cup whipping creamWaxed paper#1:  Chocolate-cherry scones:  stir in 1/4 cup dried cherries, coarsely chopped and 2 ounces coarsely chopped semisweet chocolate with the cream.#2:  Apricot-Ginger Scones:  Stir in 1/2 cup finely chopped dried apricots and 2 T. finely chopped crystallized ginger with the cream.  Drizzle with Vanilla Glaze after baking.#3:  Cranberry-Pistachio Scones:  Stir in 1/4 cup sweetened dried cranberries and 1/4 coarsely chopped roasted salted pistachios with the cream.#4:  Brown Sugar-Pecan Scones:  Substitute brown sugar for granulated sugar.  Stir in 1/2 cup chopped toasted pecans with the cream.#5:  Bacon, cheddar and chive scones:  Omit sugar.
