Stir in 3/4 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup finely chopped cooked bacon, 2 T. chopped fresh chives, and 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper with the cream.#6:  Ham and Swiss scones:  Omit sugar; stir in 3/4 cup shredded Swiss cheese and 3/4 cup finely chopped baked ham with the cream  Serve warm with Mustard Butter:  Stir together 1/2 cup softened butter, 1 T. spicy brown mustard, and 1 T. minced sweet onion.#7:  Pimento Cheese Scones:  Omit sugar; stir in 3/4 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese, and 3 T finely chopped pimento with the cream#8:  Rosemary Pear, Asiago Scones:  Omit sugar.  Stir in 3/4 cup finely chopped fresh pear; 1/2 cup grated Asiago cheese, 1 tsp. chopped fresh rosemary with the cream.
column5: Preheat oven to 450*.  Stir first 4 ingredients together in a large bowl.  Cut butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender until crumbly and resembles small peas.  Freeze 5 minutes.  Add 3/4 cup plus 2 Tbsp. cream, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.Turn dough on to was paper; gently press or pat dough into a 7-inch round (mixture will be crumbly).  Cut round into 8 wedges.  Place wedges 2 inches apart on parchment paper.  Brush tops with remaining 2 Tablespoons cream just until moistened.Bake at 450* for 13 to 15 minutes or until golden.

column4: 2 1/2cups bow-tie pasta (uncooked)6cups romaine lettuce (torn)1medium tomatoes (diced)4bacon slices (cooked and crumbled)1/2cup ranch dressing1tablespoon barbecue sauce1/4teaspoon pepper
column5: 1	Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Then rinse pasta under cold water.2	In a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, tomato, bacon and pasta.3	Drizzle the ranch dressing and barbecue sauce over the top. Gently toss to coat evenly. Season with pepper. Serve immediately and enjoy!

column4: 1/2 cup mayonnaise1 Tablespoon cider vinegar1 Tablespoon Dijon mustard1 Tablespoon honey1 Tablespoon horseradishDash TobascoPaprikaServe with blanched green beans.
column5: Blanch green beans, serve in a glass square dish as a vertical flower arrangement with dip on the side.

column2: GRILLED CORN, AVOCADO & TOMATO SALAD w/ HONEY LIME DRESSING
column4: 1 pint grape tomatoes1 ripe avocado, cubed2 ears fresh sweet corn1 Tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped  HONEY LIME DRESSINGJuice of 1 lime1 Tablespoon honeySea salt and freshly cracked pepper to taste1 clove garlic, mincedDash of cayenne pepper
column5: Remove husks from corn and grill over medium heat for 10 minutes.  The corn should have brown spots and be tender and not mushy.  Cut the corn off the cob, then scrape the cob with the back of the knife to get the juices.  Set aside to cool.  Slice the tomatoes in half.  Dice the avocado and chop the cilantro.HONEY LIME DRESSINGAdd all dressing ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.  Set aside.Combine salad ingredients and dressing and mix gently so everything is evenly coated, being careful not to mash the avocado.  Let the salad sit for 10 or 15 minutes to let flavors mingle.

column4: 4 1/2 cups hummus1 1/2 cups plain Greek yogurt1 cup 1/4 inch Cucumber pieces1/2 cup jarred roasted red peppers, patted dry and chopped1/3 cup pitted kalamata olives chopped4 scallions, sliced thin3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint1/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon pepper2 ounces feta cheese, crumbled (1/2 cup)
column5: 1.  Spread hummus in a single layer on a large, shallow serving platter.  Carefully spread yogurt in even layer over hummus.2.  Combine cucumber, red peppers, olives, scallions, oil, mint, salt, and pepper in bowl.  Spoon vegetable mixture in even layer over yogurt.  Sprinkle with feta and drizzle with extra oil.  Serve with Pita Chips or vegetables for dipping.

column4: 2 salmon fillets1/2 pineapple, halved and sliced cup butter cup honey4 large cloves garlic, crushed2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (juice of  a lemon)Chopped fresh parsleySalt and pepper
column5: Preheat oven to 400*; melt butter over low heat; add honey, garlic and lemon.  Whisk until combined.  Add 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, mix.cut 4 sheets of 14" length aluminum foil.  Divide pineapple slices among sheets, layering in center.  Sprinkle with pepper and arrange salmon fillets on top.  Drizzle with the honey lemon garlic butter sauce.  Salt and Pepper and more parsley.Pull up sides of foil ad seal, then roll edges leaving a little room for heat to circulate.  Transfer packetsti baking sheet, and bake 10-15 minutes.  Serve with brown or white rice and remaining sauce.

column4: 5 pita pockets (regular or whole wheat) 4 tablespoons olive oil*1 teaspoon dried dill weed1 teaspoon dried oregano14 teaspoon cayenne pepper12 teaspoon garlic powder12 teaspoon salt*I added more oil as it was used and herb mixture was left.
column5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Cut each pita into eight wedges with kitchen scissors or a sharp knife. Separate each wedge into 2 triangles.Mix the olive oil with all the herbs in a small bowl.Place the pita pieces, rough side up, on baking sheets. With a brush distribute the oil and herbs on them.Bake for 6 to 8 minutes, or until the pitas are lightly browned and crisp.

column4: In an 8 x 13 dish, place45 good large sized chocolate chip cookies2 quarts of Cool Whip + 1/3 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla(directions not clear here whether this amount of sugar is total or for each quartI think it is total)CoconutChopped pecans
column5: Dip each cookie in milk; line bottom of pan; Spread with Cool Whip; sprinkle withcoconut* and chopped pecans.  Repeat layers 3 times.  Serve in squares garnished with a cherry.
column6: * I would toast the coconut a little to keep it from getting soft.From Mother's file

column4: 3 cups flour1 cup granulated sugar1 cup light brown sugar1 teaspoon salt1 teaspoon cinnamon1/2 cup softened butter2 Tablespoons baking powder2 eggs3/4 cups milk
column5: Mix and sift flour, salt, sugars and cinnamon.Cut soft butter into above mixture with pastry knife or rub in with finger tips.Reserve 1 cup of this mixture to sprinkle on top of cake.To remainder, add baking powder.  Mix well; add beaten eggs and milk.  Beat well.  Pour into two greased layer cake pans or a large square pan. Sprinkle top with reserved cup of crumbs.  Bake at 400*

column4: 1 pound shrimp, peeled4 ounces mozzarella cheese grated1 large egg1/4 cup mayonnaise2 Tablespoons chopped parsley1/2 teaspoon sea salt1/8 teaspoon pepper1/4 cup flour
column5: Chop shrimp, add other ingredients mixing well.Make cakes to desired bite size. or larger for entre.Fry in butter until browned on both sides.Serve with Aioli dipping sauce:1/4 cup mayonnaise1 teaspoon lemon zest2 Tablespoons lemon juice1 clove garlic, minced

column4: 1 pound large shrimp14 ounce pork or chicken sausage, sliced2 medium zucchini, sliced2 medium yellow squash, sliced1/2 bunch of asparagus, sliced into thirds2 red bell pepper, chopped into chunksSalt and Pepper2 Tablespoons olive oil2 Tablespoons Cajun Seasoning
column5: Preheat oven to 400*Place all ingredients in large bowl with oil and seasoning.  toss until coated. Spread evenly on a sheet pan.  Bake until shrimp is pink and vegetables are tender. 15-20 minutes.

column4: 2 large eggs1 cup granulated sugar1 cup sour cream (8oz)1/2 cup light olive oil or vegetable oil1 teaspoons vanilla extract1/4 teaspoons salt2 cups all-purpose flour*2 teaspoons baking powder1 medium lemon zest and juice, divided1/2 Tablespoons corn starch16 oz fresh blueberries **Powdered sugar to dust the top optional
column5: Butter and flour a 9-inch spring form pan.  Oven 375*Beat eggs, sugar until thick.  Add sour cream, oil, vanilla, salt and beat low speed until combinedWhisk together flour, baking powder; add to batter 1/3 at a time.  Add Lemon juice and zest.Rinse and dry blueberries. Toss with 1/2 Tbsp corn starch and 1 teaspoon lemon juice.  Pour half batter into prepared pan, top with half of blueberries; spread remaining batter on top and sprinkle rest of blueberries over the top, pushing them slightly into the batter.  Bake for 45 to 55 minutes.  Dust with powdered sugar.

column4: 1 large egg1 teaspoon vanilla extract1/2 cup + 2 Tablespoons heavy cream1/3 cup granulated sugar2 1/4 cups flour, plus extra for dusting1 Tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 cup cold unsalted butter, cubed3/4 cup assorted berries (sliced strawberries, whole raspberries, whole blueberries), frozen1 teaspoon lemon zest2 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice1/4 teaspoon grated fresh ginger1/2 cup confectioners' sugar
column5: Preheat oven to 400*Beat egg, stir in vanilla, 1/2 cup cream, & sugar.Combine flour, baking powder and salt, add butter.  Cut into flour until small crumbs form.Add cream mixture to flour mixture and mix until a ball is formed.Roll dough out on a floured surface into a 9x9" square about 1/2 inch thick.  Add berries to center of the dough; spreading to form an even layer.  Fold each side of the dough over the berries to form an enclosed square.  Flip the dough and roll it out to about 3/4 to 1-inch thickness.  Cut into 8 even triangle shaped pieces.  Arrange on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.  Brush tops with remaining cream.  Bake 12 minutes or until goldenGLAZE:   Whisk lemon juice, zest, ginger, and confectioners sugar until smooth.  Drizzle over scones.

column4: 1 pound kielbasa10 slices bacon 1 1/2 cups brown sugar, packed3 Tablespoons stone ground mustard3 Tablespoons white wine vinegar1 Tablespoon black pepper
column5: Preheat oven to 375*.  Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, top with a baking/cooling rack;spray with non-stick spray.Cut kielbasa down the middle, lengthwise, and slice each into 1-inch pieces, about 30 pieces.Cut each piece of bacon into thirds.  Wrap bacon around each piece of kielbasa and secure with a toothpick.  Set aside.In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar, vinegar, mustard and pepper.  Heat over low, stirring until sugar is dissolved.  Brush the kielbasa with glaze and place on the rack.  Bake for 40 minutes and baste every 15 minutes.  Serve immediately

column4: 3 1/2 cups flour2 Tablespoons baking powder1/2 cup butter1/2 cup sugar*1 pinch salt1 Tablespoon lemon zest1 1/3 cups whole milk**1 cup blueberries, fresh preferred1 egg yolk1 teaspoon water________GLAZE:1 3/4 cups Confectioner's sugar1 1/2 Tablespoons lemon juice1 Tablespoon butter, melted*Not enough sugar.  Use 1 cup.**I used mostly whipping cream
column5: Preheat oven to 400*FMix flour, salt, baking powder, lemon zest, and sugar.  Grate frozen butter into the dry ingredients.Add milk and berries, gently mix to make a soft dough.  Turn out on to a floured surface.  Pat dough gently to 3/4 inch thickness.  Cut with knife.Place on parchment lined baking sheet.  Mix egg yolk and water; brush on tops of the scones.  Sprinkle with sugar crystals; Let stand for 15-20 minutes in 'fridge if kitchen is warm.  Bake for 12/15 minutes until tops are golden.  Glaze optional.

column4: 2 1/4 cups unbleached flour1 1/2 tablespoons granulated sugar1/4 teaspoon salt1/2 pound unsalted butter, chilled cut into 1/4-inch pieces8 ounces cream cheese, cut into 1/2 inch chunks2 Tablespoons sour creamFRUIT FILLING1 cup granulated sugar1 Tablespoon ground cinnamon2/3 cup apricot preserves, processed to break up large chunks1 cup raisins, preferably golden2 1/4 cups walnuts, chopped fineEGG YOLK & MILK GLAZE2 large egg yolks2 Tablespoons milk
column5: If the dough gathers into a cohesive mass around the food processor blade, you have over processed.  Make sure to stop at the point where the mixture is separate and pebbly.  If the dough becomes too soft, slide it onto a baking pan and freeze until it is firm enough to handle.  Check for doneness at 18 or 19 minutes. (may use prunes, chopped dried apricots, dried currants, cherries, or cranberries for the raisins in the filling.)1.  Pulse flour, sugar and salt.  Add butter, cream cheese pieces, and sour cream; pulse until dough is size of cottage cheese curds, (about 16-1 second pulses)  turn mixture out on work surface, press into 9-inch by 6-inch log, divide log into four equal parts, and press each into a 4 1/2 x 3/4-inch disk.  Place between plastic wrap, roll to form 8 1/2-inch circle.  Stack and freeze 30 minutes.  Mix filling2.  Remove one dough round from freezer, spread 2 1/2 tablespoons preserves, 1/4 cup raisins, 2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar, and 1/2 cup walnuts over dough.  Pat down.  Cut dough into 8 wedges, roll into crescent shape and place 2- apart on parchment paper lined baking pans.  Freeze 15 minutes. 3. Heat oven to 375*; Brush top and sides with egg-milk mixture.  Bake, turning pans from front to back halfway through baking time, until pale gold and slightly puffy, 21 to 32 minutes. Sprinkle with scant teaspoon cinnamon suger; transfer to cooling rack.  Store in airtight container.

column4: cup butter, softened to room temperature1 cup brown sugar cup white sugar1 egg + 1 egg yolk1 Tbsp vanilla extract1 tsp instant espresso powder1 tsp baking soda2 tsp cornstarch tsp salt2 cups all-purpose flour cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (splurge for the good stuff - I like Guittard) cup dark chocolate chips
column5: In a large bowl of a stand mixer, cream together the butter, brown sugar and sugar with a paddle attachment until creamy, about 1 minute. Add in the egg and egg yolk, plus the vanilla and beat to combine. Add in the espresso powder, soda, cornstarch, salt and flour and beat until a soft dough forms. Fold in the chocolate chips.Chill the mixture covered in the fridge for at LEAST 2 hours, up to 3 days long. Chilling is mandatory and prevents spreading the cookie dough.Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with silicone liners or parchment paper. Drop rounded Tablespoonfuls of dough onto the baking sheets about 2" apart. I used a 2-ounce cookie scoop, but if you don't have one, simply use a  cup measuring cup and stack the cookie dough higher rather than wider so when it spreads, it stays puffy in the middle.Bake for approx. 9-12 minutes, rotating pans halfway through baking time to ensure even cooking. Cookies may appear slightly soft in the center - they will continue to cook as they cool. Do not over-bake! Cool completely on the cookie sheets before serving.

column4: 1 1/2 pounds smoked sausage, chopped1/2 teaspoon salt1 1/2 cups uncooked quick cooking grits2  8-oz. blocks sharp cheddar cheese, shredded1 cup milk1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme1/4 teaspoon garlic powder1/4 teaspoon black pepper4 large eggs, lightly beatencooking spray
column5: Preheat oven to 350*.  Brown sausage over medium high heat, stirring often, 7 to 9 minutes until cooked and browned; drain.Bring salt and 4 1/2 cups water to boil over high heat; whisk in grits and return to boil.  Cover, reduce heat, simmer 5 minutes until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat, add cheese, stirring until completely melted.  Stir in milk and next 4 ingredients.  Stir in sausage.  Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish.Bake 350* for 50 minutes to 1 hour until golden and cooked through.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

column4: 8 slices crusty artisan  bread (thick)8 slices mozzarella cheese (1/3 cup shredded)8 slices cheddar cheese1 cup marinara sauce4 Tablespoons basil (freshly chopped)butter for spreading on bread
column5: Butter "outside" of breadSpread marinara sauce on the inside pieces of the sandwich bread.Layer cheese on top of sauce, top with basil.Place bread slices together to make a sandwich.Place sandwich on hot griddle and cook until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown and toasted.Serve immediately.

column4: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter1 cup minced onion1 cup minced carrot1 cup minced celery2 pounds ground venison1 ounce dried mushrooms, reconstituted in 2 cups hot water and chopped1 6-ounce can tomato paste1 cup venison or beef broth or water1 cup white wine1 cup milk nutmeg, grated or  teaspoon ground nutmegSalt and black pepper to tastePasta (tagliatelle, penne, etc)Grated cheese for garnish
column5: Saute onion, celery and carrots in butter for 5-8 minutes.  Do not brown.  Salt slightly.Stir in chopped mushrooms, tomato paste and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.  When the tomato paste begins to turn the color of a brick, add the ground meat, mushroom soaking water and the broth.  Bring to a simmerCook on medium heat.  Stir.  When the liquid has mostly evaporated add the wine and repeat the process.  When that is mostly evaporated add the milk, nutmeg and black pepper.  Stir well.  Simmer and add salt to taste.  Cook until it is the consistency you want.  Add the milk to the sauce, boil salted water for the pasta.  Cook al dente.  Put pasta in a large bowl, ladle sauce over, top with cheese and serve.
column6: I froze this sauce, and added shrimp, mussels, and cubes of fish before serving over rice.  From Garden and Gun August 2016

column4: 4 Tablespoons butter1 cup minced onion1 cup minced carrot1 cup minced celery2 pounds ground venison1 ounce dried mushrooms, reconstituted in 2 cups hot water and chopped1 6-ounce can tomato paste1 cup venison or beef broth or water1 cup white wine1 cup milk1/2 teaspoon nutmegSalt and black pepper to tastePasta (tagliatelle, penne, etc.)Grated cheese for garnish
column5: Cook onion, celery and carrots in butter 5 to 8  minutes, stirring often.  Do not brown; salt lightly.Add chopped mushrooms and tomato paste, cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring often.  When the tomato paste begins to turn the color of brick, add the ground meat, mushroom soaking water and broth.  Simmer.  Cook down over medium heat.  Add wine when liquid is mostly evaporated, and repeat the process.  Add milk, nutmeg, pepper and salt to taste.Serve over pasta or rice.
column6: I added shrimp, mussles, and fish at the last...not a real bolognese at this point.From 2016 Garden and Gun

column4: 4 cups cream cheese, softened1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped1/2 cup red bell peppers (or capsicum diced)1/4 cup dill pickles, finely diced1/4 cup chives, chopped1/4 cup parsley, chopped1 tablespoon onion powder1 teaspoons garlic powderSalt, to taste (if desired)FOR THE DECORATIONS:1 1/2 - 2 cups pitted mixed olives (I use a variety of black, green and Kalamata olives) -- dried with paper towel1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped (dried with paper towel)Rosemary leaves/sprigs to decorateRitz, water crackers or pretzels for servingSalami slices, for servingProscuito slices, for serving
column5: In a bowl combine all the ingredients for the dip and mix until the ingredients are well combined.Place a piece of non-stick plastic wrap on a clean bench top or work surface. Scoop the cream cheese mixture out onto the plastic wrap and completely cover with another piece of wrap (you may need two pieces to cover it). Use your hands to mould the cream cheese into a tree shape. Then, carefully pick up the tree with one hand and peel off the plastic wrap on the bottom of the tree with your other hand. Place the tree straight onto a serving plate.Use a cake spatula to smooth the edges. Decorate with olives, sun-dried tomatoes and rosemary leaves/sprigs, lightly pressing each element into the cream cheese to ensure they stay on. Brush with some sun dried tomato oil from the jar (optional but adds even more flavour)!Top with a star cut out of a yellow or orange bell pepper OR a thick slice of cheese. Serve with crackers of your choice, salami and prosciutto slices rolled up!Recipe

column4: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts4 tablespoons butter, divided1/2 cup chicken broth1Tablespoon minced fresh rosemary
column5: Cook chicken over medium heat, in 1 tablespoon butter 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown.  Remove to a plate and keep warm.Add broth to pan and stir to loosen bits from bottom of pan.  Add cream and bring to a simmer.  Cook and stir until slightly thickened 3-5 minutesStir in minced rosemary and remaining butter until butter is melted.  Return chicken to pan for 2-3 minutes.  Spoon sauce over top just before serving.

column4: 8 ounces shrimp in shells8 ounces scallops8 ounces white firm-flesh fish fillets such as cod8-12 fresh musselsSalt1 pound tiny new potatoes, halved or quartered1/2 of a medium fennel bulb1 cup finely chopped onion4 cloves garlic, minced1 Tablespoon vegetable oil1 32-ounce carton vegetable broth1 1/2 cups finely chopped roma tomatoes1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel1/4 teaspoon saffron threads1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper1 recipe Garlic-Parmesan croutonsGARLIC-PARMESAN CROUTONS3 cups firm-textured bread, cut into 1-inch cubes1-2 tablespoons garlic flavored olive oil or plain1 Tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese1/4 teaspoon ground black pepperPreheat oven to 350*; line pan with parchment; combine bread and other ingredients; spread in pan; bake 20 minutes or until golden.
column5: Clean and prepare seafood.  Rinse, pat dry with paper towels.  Cut any large scallops in half.  Cutfish into 1-inch pieces.  Cover and chill until needed.Clean mussels; soak for 15 minutes in 3 quarts water and 3 tablespoons salt.  Drain and repeat 2 more times with fresh water and salt. Drain and rinse.  Cook potatoes 10 or 15 minutes until tender.  Drain.Cut off and discard fennel stalks, reserving some of feathery tops.  Remove wilted outer layers, cut thin slice from base of bulb.  Cut bulb in half lengthwise; discard core.  Finely chop fennel bulb.In 5 quart Dutch oven cook and stir fennel, onion and garlic in hot oil over medium heat until tender.  Stir in broth, tomatoes, 1/2 teaspoon salt, lemon peel, saffron, and cayenne pepper.  Return to boiling.  Stir in shrimp, scallops, fish, mussels and potatoes.  Return to boiling; reduce heat.  Simmer covered about 5 minutes or until mussels open.Top with Garlic-Parmesan Croutons.  Garnish with reserved chopped  fennel tops.

column4: 4 sweet potatoes, cooked, peeled and mashed2 large eggs, beaten1/4 cup flour1/2 cup sugar1/2 cup milk1 cup raisins1/4 cup sherryjuice and grated zest of one orange1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg1/2 teaspoon cinnamon1 Tablespoon butter, melted   TOPPING:1/2 cup brown sugar1 Tablespoon butter melted1/2 cup chopped pecans
column5: preheat oven to 325*.  Combine potatoes and next 10 ingredients.  Pour into a greased 2 quart baking dish and bake 45 minutes.  Combine topping ingredients.  Sprinkle over potato mixture, and bake an additional 15 minutes.

column4: 3  c. all-purpose flour1 tsp. baking powder c. sour cream c. 2% milk c. amaretto1 c. butter, softened c. shortening3 c. sugar6 eggs2 tsp. almond extract1 tsp. vanilla extractButter Cream Frosting1 1/3 c. butter, softened1 tsp. vanilla extract tsp. salt7-8 c. confectioners sugar2/3 c. amaretto
column5: Directions: 325 degree oven. Line bottoms of three greased 9-inch round baking pans with parchment paper, grease paper.In one bowl whisk flour and baking powder. In another bowl, whisk sour cream, milk and amaretto until blended. In a large bowl, cream butter, shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Beat in the extracts. Add the flour mixture alternately with sour cream mixture, beating well after each addition.Bake 30-35 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Cool cakes completely.Icing: beat butter, vanilla and salt until creamy. Beat in enough conf. sugar, alternately with amaretto, to reach a desired consistency. Reserve 2/3 c. of frosting for the piping.

column4: Green beans, about 1 1/2 pounds, 6-8 beans per bundle1/2 teaspoon baking soda6 slices bacon1/4 teaspoon garlic powdersalt & pepper to taste1 Tablespoon brown sugar
column5: Pre-heat oven to 375*Slightly cook baconTrim and wash beans, bring pot of water to boil, add soda; add beans and cook 3 minutes until tender crisp.  Remove from boiling water and plunge in a bowl of ice water.Dab beans dry and toss with reserved bacon drippings, garlic powder, salt & pepper to taste.Cut each slice of bacon in half and wrap around the 6-8 green beans, secure with a toothpick and place on a parchment lined pan.Combine brown sugar with 1 tablespoon water and brush over each bundle.  Roast 20-22 minutes until bacon is crisp and beans are lightly roasted. Do not overcook.

column4: 2 1/2 cups White Lily self-rising flour1 1/2 cups heavy cream
column5: Preheat oven to 450*Lightly grease a baking sheet or use parchment paper.Put the flour in a medium mixing bowl and add the cream.  Stir until a soft, sticky ball forms.  (The dough will seem wet at first.) On a very lightly floured surface, knead lightly with your well floured hands about 3 times, just until the dough comes together.Put the dough to about 1/2-inch thickness.  Cut out biscuits with a 2 1/2 inch cutter.  Bake on the prepared baking sheet for 10 to 12 minutes until the biscuits are golden brown.
column6: From "Cooking Up a Storm--10th Anniversary: Recipes Lost and Found from the Times-Picayune of New Orleans"

column4: 1 cup fresh cranberries4 large eggs1/2 cup brown sugar, firmly packed1/2 cup sugar2 Tablespoons vanilla3 1/2 cups day old bread1/2 cup butter1/2 cup heavy whipping cream3 1/2 cups eggnog1 tablespoon vanilla rum or dark rum
column5: Cube bread, place in large bowl.Whisk together eggs, sugars, vanilla, cream, rum, eggnog, and melted butter.  Pour over bread cubes.Soak 10-15 minutes.  Add cranberries.Bake in 350* oven 25-30 minutes.
column6: Serve with vanilla rum sauce.Use vanilla brioche bread.

column4: 1 cup butter1/2 cup brown sugar1/4 cup heavy cream1 tablespoon sliced almonds, toasted1/2 tablespoon Amaretto
column5: Melt butter over medium heat; add sugar.  When sugar has dissolved and begins to caramelize, add the cream and bring to a simmer.  Stirring occasionally until sauce begins to thicken.Add toasted almonds and Amaretto.  Remove from heat and serve over warm bread pudding.

column4: 3 cups finely chopped cooked chicken1 1/2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies4 green onions, finely chopped1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce1 teaspoon garlic salt1/4 teaspoon paprika1/4 teaspoon ground cumin1/4 teaspoon pepper2 packages (17.3 ounces each) frozen pastry, thawed1 large egg beatenSalsa and guacamole
column5: Combine chicken, cheese, chilies, onions, pepper sauce and seasonings.Unfold one sheet of puff pastry onto a lightly floured surface.  Roll into a 12x9-in. rectangle.Cut into nine rectangles.Place 2 tablespoons across the center of each rectangle.  Brush edges of pastry with water and roll pastry around filling.  Press edges with a fork to seal.  Repeat, and refrigerate until ready to bake. Place pastries on a lightly greased baking sheet, seam side down, brush tops with egg.  Bake  in 425* oven 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm with salsa and guacamole.

column4: 1 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach1 pound ground pork sausage2 cups chicken broth1 cup whipping cream1/2 teaspoon salt1 cup uncooked regular grits1 cup grated Asiago cheese1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper1 cup (4 ounces) shredded white cheddar cheese, divided3 large eggs, lightly beaten1 1/2 Tablespoons plain white cornmeal
column5: 1.  Thaw spinach; drain well, pressing between paper towels.2. Cook sausage until no longer pink; drain3 Preheat oven to 350*; bring broth, cream and salt to a boil in a large saucepan.  Gradually whisk in grits, and return to a boil.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer whisking occasionally, 12-15 minutesuntil thickened.  Remove from heat, stir in Asaigo, pepper, and 3/4 cup Cheddar until melted.  Mixture will be very thick.4.  Stir about 1/4th of hot grits into eggs; stir egg mixture into remaining hot grits.  Stir in spinach and sausage until blended.5.  Sprinkle bottom and sides of a lightly greased 10-inch deep dish pie plate with cornmeal.  Spoon grits mixture into pie plate; sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese.6.  Bake at 350* for 55 minutes or until set.  Remove from oven and cool 30 minutes.
column6: May be frozen for one month.  Thaw in refrigerator for 24 hours.  Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.  Bake as directed.

column4: 1 12-ounce package Cajun style andouille miniature sausages or cocktail-size smoked sausages1 Tablespoon olive oil1 (9.25-oz.) package dinner rolls, warmedCreole mustardSweet pepper relish
column5: Saute sausages in hot olive oil over medium heat 5 minutes or until lightly browned and thoroughly heated.  Cut slits in tops of rolls.  Fill each roll with 1 sausage, and top with Creole mustard and sweet pepper relish.

column4: 16 asparagus spears1 4-ounce garlic-and-herb spreadable cheese2 heads Bibb lettuce, leaves separated8 thin slices deli roast beef, halved1 red bell pepper, cut into 16 strips16 fresh chives
column5: 1.  Discard tough ends of asparagus.  Cut tips into 3 1/2-inch pieces.2.  Cook in boiling water 1 to 2 minutes until crisp-tender; drain, plunge into ice water; drain and pat dry with paper towels.3.  Spoon cheese into a 1-qt. zip top plastic freezer bag.  Snip corner of bag to make small hole.  Pipe cheese down center of each lettuce leaf.  Arrange 1 roast beef slice, 1 asparagus spear, and 1 red bell pepper strip in each lettuce leaf.  Wrap sides of lettuce around roast beef and vegetables and tie bundles with chives.Note:  Use Alouette Garlic & herb spread

column4: 3 Tablespoons floursalt & pepper4 boneless chicken breasts, skin on2 Tablespoons oil3/4 Cup verjuice or 3/4 cup fruity white wine2 large shallots, finely chopped1 garlic clove, finely chopped1 1/2 cups chicken stock1/2 cup light cream1 cup dried cranberries1 teaspoon lemon juice1 teaspoon chopped fresh tarragon
column5: heat oil i large skillet; combine flour, salt & pepper and dredge chicken breasts.  Cook skin side down turning until golden brown.  Transfer chicken to a baking dish, cook in 350* oven for 12-15 minutesDrain skillet and return to heat.  Deglaze pan with half the verjuice or wine, scraping browned bits.  Add shallots, garlic, stock and cream; simmer util reduced to a consistency that coats the back of a wooden spoon.  Add remaining wine, cranberries and lemon juice.  Reduce sauce a bit more, season with salt and pepper.  Add the tarragon.To serve, slice the chicken breasts on an angle, fan out onto plate.  Top slices with a generous amount of sauce.

column4: 1 8-ounce package softened cream cheese2 Tablespoons softened butter1 teaspoon lemon zest2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice1/4 teaspoon Worchestershire sauceDash of Tabasco1/4 teaspoon kosher salt4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled1/4 cup green olives, pitted and finely chopped1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley2 Tablespoons green onions, finely choppedCucumber slices
column5: Beat cream cheese and next 6 ingredients at medium speed with electric mixer 2-3 minutes.Stir together crumbled feta cheese, chopped green olives, and cream cheese mixture until combined.Chill 5 minutes.Stir together chopped parsley and green onions.  Shape into a ball, roll in parsley mixture to coat. Serve with cucumber slices.

column4: 1/2 cup butter, divided1 cup finely chopped yellow onion1 garlic clove, minced1/2 cup heavy cream1 pound chicken livers1/2 teaspoon kosher salt1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper2/3 cup red pepper jelly1 (8 to 9-ounce) French bread baguette, sliced and toasted
column5: Preheat oven to 300*.  Melt 2 Tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.  Stir in chopped onion.  Cover and cook, stirring occasionally,  to 7 minutes or until tender.  Add minced garlic and saute 10 seconds.  Stir in cream, and bring to a simmer.  Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook 6 minutes.Add remaining 6 tablespoons butter and cook stirring constantly about 1 minute or until butter is melted and well blended.  Remove from heatProcess chicken livers, salt, pepper and onion mixture in a blender for 30-45 seconds until smooth. Place 7 (8-oz.) wide-mouth, oven proof jars with tight-fitting lids in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Divide liver mixture among jars, filling each halfway.  Add warm water to baking dish to a depth of 1 1/4 inches.  Cover jars and baking dish tightly with heavy duty aluminum foil.Bake at 300* for 30 minutes or until mousse is set. Remove from oven, transfer jars to wire rack and cool.  Screw on lids and chill 1 hourJust before serving, spoon 1 1/2 Tablespoon red pepper jelly into each jar, and serve with toasted baguette slices

column4: 1/2 cup packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, finely chopped1/2 cup packed fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1 tablespoon packed fresh oregano, finely chopped 1 tablespoon honey 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper 6 tablespoons olive oil, divided 2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided1 teaspoon black pepper, divided 1 1/4 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch-wide strips 12 ounces thick asparagus, cut into 1 12-inch pieces 2 small lemons, very thinly sliced and seeds removed
column5: Stir together first 6 ingredients, 5 tablespoons of oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.  Add chicken; toss to coat; chill 1 hour.Preheat grill to 400*-450*Toss asparagus and lemon slices with remaining oil. Remove chicken from marinade, discard marinade.  Thread chicken, asparagus and lemon slices on to 8 (8-inch) skewers, folding chicken strips and lemon slices in half as needed.  Sprinkle with remaining salt and black pepper.  Place on greased grill grate.  Grill until asparagus is tender and chicken is charred and cooked through 12-14 minutes, turning occasionally.

column4: 2/3 cup mayonnaise 1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives 1 teaspoon white wine vinegar1/2 teaspoon anchovy paste 1 teaspoon lemon zest plus 1 Tbsp. fresh juice (from 1 lemon) 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1/2 cup loosely packed fresh parsley leaves, divided 1/3 cup loosely packed fresh tarragon leaves, divided 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, divided 3/4 cup water 1/2 cup uncooked quinoa 5 cups torn butter lettuce (from 1 head) 3 cups pulled rotisserie chicken (from 1 chicken) 1/2 cup thinly sliced English cucumber (from 1 cucumber) 1/2 cup thinly sliced radishes (about 5 radishes)
column5: Process mayonnaise, chives, vinegar, anchovy paste, lemon zest, lemon juice, black pepper, 1/4 cup of the fresh parsley, 1 tablespoon fresh tarragon 1/4 teaspoon salt in a food processor until smooth about 1 to 2  minutes.  Set aside.Bring water, quinoa and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a boil over medium heat.  Stir and cover.  Reduce heat to low, and cook until quinoa is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.  Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes, fluff with fork.Toss lettuce remaining   parsley and tarragon leaves.  Toss mixture with 1/4 cup of the dressing.  Transfer to serving platter.  sprinkle cooked quinoa over lettuce mixture.  Top with pulled chicken.  Arrange sliced cucumbers and radishes on top.  Drizzle with an additional 1/4 cup dressing and serve remaining dressing on the side.

column4: 3 large mangoes, peeled and chopped (about 2 lbs.)1 12 cups chopped onions12 cup peeled chopped cooking apple (Granny Smith)12 cup raisins1 cup cider vinegar1 14 cups firmly packed brown sugar12 cup sugar14 cup finely chopped fresh ginger12 teaspoon grated lime rind2 tablespoons lime juice1 tablespoon mustard seeds1 12 teaspoons celery seeds34 teaspoon salt14 teaspoon ground cinnamon14 teaspoon ground cloves
column5: Mix all the ingredients together in a large glass bowl.Cover and chill 8 hours.Transfer mixture to a large pot.Bring to a boil over medium heat.Lower the heat and cook 1 1/2 hours, stirring frequently.Divide mixture into airtight containers.Store in refrigerator up to 1 week; may keep in freezer for up to 6 months.

column4: 2hawaiian rolls (packs)1pound ham (shaved)12ounces shredded swiss cheeseSAUCE:2sticks melted butter2tablespoons mustard1tablespoon worcestershire sauce1teaspoon onion2tablespoons poppy seeds
column5: Preheat oven to 325. Slice rolls horizontally as a unit  dont break apart into individual rolls. Put the bottoms in a 913 dish. Lay meat on top. Cover with cheese. Pour 2/3-3/4 of sauce on top of cheese. Place tops of rolls on top. Pour remaining mixture over tops of rolls and spread evenly. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Watch closely  they scorch easily!!! These can also be made ahead of time and refrigerated before baking.

column4: 6 hard-cooked eggs, peeled 3 tablespoons mayonnaise 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh dill 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh chives 2 scallions, finely chopped 2 teaspoons dill pickle brine or fresh lemon juice 1 teaspoon hot sauce 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1 pound asparagus 3 tablespoons salted butter, at room temperature 8 white sandwich bread slices, crusts removed, toasted
column5: Step 1Using a fork, finely crush eggs in a medium bowl. Stir in mayonnaise, mustard, dill, chives, scallions, brine, hot sauce, salt, and pepper.Step 2Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil over high. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Cut tip ends of asparagus spears into 4-inch lengths (the same length as bread slices); discard remaining asparagus spears or reserve for another use. Cook asparagus tips in boiling water until tender-crisp, 30 seconds to 1 minute; drain. Plunge into ice water to stop the cooking process; drain and pat dry.Step 3Spread butter evenly on toasted bread slices; cut bread slices in half lengthwise. Spread egg mixture evenly over butter; top with 2 or 3 asparagus tips. Serve immediately, or cover with damp paper towels, and chill up to 1 hour.

column4: 9 cups water1 pound dried green split peas2 pounds smoked pork hocks6 leeks, sliced4 stalks celery with leaves, sliced2 cloves chopped garlic1 1/2 teaspoons crushed dried savory leaves1 1/2 teaspoons salt1/2 teaspoon pepper1 pound cooked smoked sausage.
column6: The soup we used to take skiing.

column4: 2 cups flour1 Tablespoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon salt1 large egg1 cup sugar4 Tablespoons butter, melted and cooled1 1/4 cups sour cream1 1/2 cups frozen blueberries, preferably wild
column5: Whisk flour, baking powder, salt in medium bowl until combined.  Whisk egg in second bowl until light colored; add sugar and whisk until thick about 30 seconds.  Add melted butter  in 2 or 3 steps,whisking after each addition.  Add sour cream, whisking just to combine.Add frozen berries to dry ingredients, toss.  Add sour cream mixture and fold until batter comes together and berries are evenly distributed.  Batter will be thick.  Do not overmix.Scoop large spoon full into prepared muffin tins (greased and floured or lined with cup cake liners).Bake in 350* oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until brown.

column4: 6 Tablespoons butter, divided3/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar, divided2 medium size ripe bananas, thinly sliced1 1/2 Tablespoons light rum, divided1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon6 Tablespoons granulated sugar, divided2 8-ounce cans refrigerated crescent rolls1/2 cup butter, very softened1/4 cup heavy cream1/4 teaspoon kosher salt1/2 cup plus 1 to 3 Tbsp. powdered sugar, sifted1/3 cup chopped toasted pecans.
column5: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in medium skillet; stir in 1/4 cup of brown sugar until combined.  Stir in bananas and 1/2 tablespoon rum; cook, stirring until bananas soften and begin to break down, 3 to 4 minutes.  Let cool completely, 20 minutesPreheat oven to 375* Stir cinnamon, 1/4 cup brown sugar and 2 tablespoons granulated sugar in a small bowl.  Unroll 1 can of roll dough.  Separate dough piece along center perforation to form 2 (7 1/2 x 6 inch) rectangles; press perforations to seal.  Repeat with 2nd can.Spread the 4 tough rectangles wvenly with the softened butter, and sprinkle each with about 2 tablespoons of cinnamon sugar mixture.  Dollop each rectangle with 1/4 of cooled banana mixture, and spread a thin layer of the mixture to within 1/4 inch of edges.  Roll up each rectangle, jelly-roll fashion starting at long end. Cut each lot into 6 even slices.  Place rolls in 2 (12-cup) mini muffin pans lined with miniature paper baking cups.  Bake until golden brown 14 to 16 minutes.  Cool.Place cream, salt, remaining 1/4 butter and sugars in a small saucepan over medium heat.  Bring to a boil; boil 1 minute.  remove from heat and whisk in remaining 1 tablespoon rum.  Whisk in 1 to 3 tablespoons powdered sugar, 1 spoon at a time until desired consistency is reached.  Drizzle slightly warm buns with glaze, and sprinkle with toasted pecans.

column4: 2 sticks butter, softened1 cup brown sugar, packed1/2 cup granulates sugar2 eggs1 teaspoon soda1 teaspoon cinnamon1 teaspoon vanilla1 1/2 cups flour 3 cups oats8 ounces chopped datesnuts, optional
column5: Cream butter and sugars.Add eggs beating well after each.Add vanilla.Mix soda, cinnamon and flour;  add to butter mix.Add oats; mix; add dates and nuts.Bake at 350*
column6: Recipe from back of date box called for 2 boxes of chopped dates.  I used one.

column4: 1 pound petite red potatoes (about 15) 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided 1/2 cup sour cream 2 tablespoons brined capers, drained and rinsed 2 teaspoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley 2 teaspoons chopped fresh dill 2 teaspoons whole grain mustard 1 teaspoon lemon zest Garnish: chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
column5: Oven 350* drizzle potatoes with oil and 1 teaspoon of the salt; toss to coat.  Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet, bake until tender when pierced about 40 minutes.  Cool 15 minutes.Cut each potato in half, scoop out pulp into a medium bowl, leaving shells intact.  Place shells, cut side up on baking sheet, and bake until dry about 10 more minutes.  Cool 30 minutesStir together pulp, sour cream, capers, parsley, dill, mustard, zest and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt.Spoon mixture into each shell. Top with lemon zest curls and parsley.

column4: 1  cups (10 ounces) sugar	 cup (6 ounces) egg whites (5 to 7 large eggs)	1  teaspoons distilled white vinegar	1  teaspoons cornstarch	1 teaspoon vanilla extract	TOPPING:3 large mangos, peeled, pitted, and cut into -inch pieces (3 cups)	4 kiwis, peeled, quartered lengthwise, and sliced crosswise  inch thick (about 1 cup)	5 ounces (1 cup) blueberries	1 tablespoon sugar	Whipped Cream2	cups heavy cream, chilled	2	tablespoons sugar
column5: 250*Combine sugar and egg whites in bowl of stand mixer; place bowl over saucepan filled with 1 inch simmering water, making sure that water does not touch bottom of bowl. Whisking gently but constantly, heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture registers 160 to 165 degrees, 5 to 8 minutes.Fit stand mixer with whisk attachment and whip mixture on high speed until meringue forms stiff peaks, is smooth and creamy, and is bright white with sheen, about 4 minutes (bowl may still be slightly warm to touch). Stop mixer and scrape down bowl with spatula. Add vinegar, cornstarch, and vanilla and whip on high speed until combined, about 10 seconds.Spoon meringue on to parchment marked circles, spread to 1 inch high with 1/4 inch depression in center.Bake 1 1/2 hours until exterior is dry and crisp, and meringue lifts from parchment when edge is gently lifted.  Color should be quite pale.  Prop oven door open with wooden spoon and cool completely for 1 1/2 hours.

column4: 3 tablespoons (1 1/2 oz.) salted butter 4 cups chopped Vidalia or other sweet onions (about 2 large) 1 (5-oz.) pkg. fresh baby spinach, coarsely chopped 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, divided 1 (16-oz.) container sour cream 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives Potato chips and medley of veggies like cucumbers, radishes, and bell peppers
column5: Melt butter in a non stick pan, add onions and cook, stirring often until golden and very tender, 20 to 30 minutes.  Add spinach stirring just until wilted, about 1 minute.  Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.  Remove from heat and let stand 30 minutesStir onion/spinach mixture with sour cream and chives.  Add remaining salt and pepper.  Cover and chill 30 minutes or up to 2 days.  Serve with chips and veggies. Peppers, cukes, radish, baby carrots and chips.

column4: 1 8.25 ounce can cream style corn1 cup plain white cornmeal1 cup sour cream2 Tablespoons vegetable oil1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder1 teaspoon salt2 large eggs1 cup creme fraiche2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh dill1 Tablespoon Fresh lemon juice2 (4-oz.) packages thinly sliced smoked salmon, flakedFresh dill garnish
column5: 350* ovenWhisk together first 7 ingredients until smooth.  Spoon 1 heaping teaspoon corn mixture into each cup of a well greased 24-cup miniature muffin pan.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Cool.Stir together creme fraiche, dill and lemon juice.  Top muffins with creme fraiche and salmon.  Garnish with dill frond.

column4: 1 Tablespoon olive oil1 pound sausage1/2 cup diced onion1 Tablespoon minced garlic2 cups chicken broth1 14-ounce can diced tomatoes1/2 cup milk8 ounces dry pasta1/2 teaspoon sale and pepper, each2 cups shredded cheddar-jack cheese1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes1/3 cup chopped scallions, for garnish
column5: Saute onions and sausage in olive oil for 5 minutesAdd garlic and all seasonings; cook for 2 minutes.Add chicken broth, tomatoes, milk, and pasta; bring to a boil; lower heat and cover for 15 minutes. Stir to keep from sticking.Stir in cheeseGarnish and serve

column4: 2 cups ground Smithfield ham1/2 cup chopped celery1/4 cup chopped onion1 teaspoon Dijon mustard2 hard boiled eggs, chopped1/4 cup pickle relish1/2 cups good mayonnaise
column5: Mix all.

column4: 2 cups ground Smithfield ham1/2 cup chopped celery1/4 cup chopped onion1 teaspoon Dijon mustard2 hard boiled eggs, chopped1/4 cup pickle relish1/2 cups good mayonnaise
column5: Mix all.

column4: MIX:1 cup mayonnaise3 Tablespoons minced fresh tarragon1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice1 teaspoon lemon zestADD:4 cups cooked chopped chicken breast1 chopped Granny Smith apple1 cup celery4 Tablespoons red onionSalt and PepperPecans
column5: Mix first four ingredients.Add chicken, apple, celery and onionSalt and pepper to tasteAdd toasted pecans before serving.

column4: 1 cup packed light brown sugar 6 tablespoons butter, melted 1 cup pure maple syrup, divided 1 cup chopped toasted pecans, divided 12 (1-inch-thick) baguette slices (from 1 baguette, ends discarded) 5 large eggs, lightly beaten 1 1/4 cups whole milk 2 tablespoons granulated sugar 1 teaspoon orange zest plus 1 Tbsp. fresh juice (from 1 orange) 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract, divided 2 tablespoons (1 oz.) bourbon Powdered sugar, for serving
column5: Stir brown sugar, butter, and 1/4 cup o the maple syrup together.  Spread into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish; sprinkle with 3/4 cup of the pecans.  Arrange baguette slices on top.Whisk together next 5 ingredients and 1 teaspoon of the vanilla.  Pour over bread; chill  8 hours.Preheat oven to 350*; let dish stand at room temperature for 10 minutes; bake uncovered for about 35 m inutes.Combine bourbon and remaining 3/4 cup maple syrup and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla in a saucepan.  Cook over low, stirring, until warm, 2 minutes.  Remove from heat; cover pan.Sprinkle casserole with powdered sugar and remaining 1/4 cup of pecans.  Serve with Bourbon-Maple Syrup.

column4: 2 cups flour6 Tablespoons butter3/4 cup buttermilk1 Tablespoon baking powder1/2 teaspoon baking soda1/2 teaspoon salt
column5: Chop butter into 1/4 teaspoon size;  place in cuisinart with flour and other dry ingredients.Pulse, add buttermilk with machine running until incorporated.  Remove to cutting board and fold and flatten four times.  Smooth out dough to 1/2 thickness.  Cut biscuits and place on parchment covered baking pan.Bake at 375* for 15 minutes.

column4: 1 lb. andouille sausage, cut 1/4 inch thick slices1/2 cup peanut oil3/4 cup all purpose flour1 large onion, coarsely chopped1 red bell pepper, coarsely chopped1 cup thinly sliced celery2 garlic cloves minced2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper (optional)1 48-ounce container chicken broth2 pounds skinned boned chicken breastsRoasted Potatoes or cooked orzoFresh parsley cooked crumbled bacon, hot sauce
column5: Cook sausage until browned, remove from pan; drain and pat dry.Heat oil in Dutch oven, gradually whisk in flour and cook 18 to 20 minutes until flour is caramel colored.  Do not burn.  Reduce heat to low, and cook, whisking constantly until mixture is milk chocolate-colored and texture is smooth, about 2 minutes.Stir in onion and next 4 ingredients.  Cook 3 minutes.  Gradually stir in chicken broth.  Add chicken and sausage, increase heat, bring to boil.  Reduce heat to low and simmer 1 hour and 30 minutes or until chicken is done.  Shred chicken into large pieces.Place in serving bowls, serve over roasted potatoes or cooked orzo.
column6: May substitute shrimp for sausage.  I do not use peanut oil, but butter, and less flour.

column4: 2 pounds ground beef3 stalks celery, chopped1/2 large onion, chopped1/2 cup Italian-seasoned bread crumbs2 eggs, beaten1/3 cup catsup2 Tablespoons Worchestershire Sauce1 teaspoons Greek seasoning2 teaspoon Creole seasoning1 teaspoon garlic powder1 8-ounce can tomato sauce3 Tablespoons tomato paste1 Tablespoon ketchupGarnish:  chopped parsley
column5: Saute celery and onion  7 minutes in 1 tablespoon butter.Add bread crumbs, 1 Tablespoon Worchestershire sauce, and next 5 ingredients;  mix well; add ground beef, mix and shape into loaf.Bake at 350* for 45 minutes;  remove from oven and cover top with mixture of tomato sauce, remaining tablespoon Worchestershire sauce, tomato paste, and 1 tablespoon ketchup .  Bake 10-15 additional minutes or until slightly brown.  Cool 10 minutes before serving.

column4: 4 eggs 4 egg yolks 1 3/4 cups whole milk 1 cup heavy cream 1/2 cup sugar 2 tablespoons orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier) 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste (or vanilla extract) 1/2 teaspoon salt 8 (1-inch thick) slices of challah bread 1 cup brown sugar 1/2 cup unsalted butter 2 tablespoons light corn syrup
column5: Whisk together eggs, yolks, milk, and cream.  Add sugar, liqueur, vanilla, and salt; whisk until sugar is dissolved.Place bread slices face down in a single layer in a 10 x 15-inch baking dish.  Pour custard over bread, cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight, flipping slices over in the custard after 1 hour of soaking.Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil.  Preheat oven to 375*.  Combine brown sugar, butter, and syrup in medium saucepan over medium high heat.  Stir until sugar is dissolved and boiling.  Pour sugar mixture onto lined baking sheet and spread evenly while still hot.  Lift each piece of toast out of custard, allowing excess to drip off, and place face down onto the warm caramel.Bake in oven until top of the French toast is dry and lightly browned, 25 to 30 minutes.  Flip each piece over with caramel side up; serve with whipped cream.

column4: 12 ounces ziti pasta 1 small yellow onion, chopped 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 garlic cloves, minced 1 1/2 pounds lean ground beef 2 (15-oz.) cans tomato sauce 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano 1 teaspoon sugar 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided 3 tablespoons butter 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour 3 cups milk 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1 (8-oz.) package shredded mozzarella cheese 1/3 cup fine, dry breadcrumbs
column5: Preheat oven to 350* Cook pasta.Saute onion in oil 4 to 5 minutes; add garlic; saute 30 seconds.  Add beef, cook until crumbled and no longer pink.  Stir tomato sauce and next 4 ingredients plus 1 teaspoon salt into the meat mixture.  Cook, stirring occasionally 2 minutes.Remove from heat.Melt butter over low heat, whisk in flour; cook whisking constantly 2 minutes.  Gradually add milk.  Cook until thickened and bubbly, whisking occasionally.  Stir in Parmesan cheese, pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Add sauce to pasta, stir to coat.Transfer pasta to a greased 13 x 9 greased baking dish.  top with beef mixture, mozzarella cheese and bread crumbs.  Bake for 20-25 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
column6: May be frozen before baking.  Let stand 30 minutes before baking, and add 15 to 20 minutes in the oven.  From Southern Living, myrecipes.com/recipe/greek-baked-ziti-0

column4: 6 eggs2 cups milk1/2 cup half and half1 tsp vanilla extract2 tbsp orange juice1/2 tsp ground nutmeg1/4 tsp salt1 loaf french bread (about 1 pound), sliced into 1" pieces4 tbsp butter, melted1/2 cup brown sugar
column5: Mix first seven ingredients; Pour over sliced bread on a high rimmed baking sheet in one layer.  Cover and place in fridge overnight.  Flip bread pieces at least once before baking  in the morning.Oven 350*;  Mix butter and brown sugar;  Spread mixture evenly on a second baking sheet lined with parchment paper.  Lay pieces of bread on the brown sugar, covering each piece.  Bake for 20 minutes; flip pieces and bake for another 5 minutes or until the brown sugar is bubbly.Serve warm topped with powdered sugar and fruit.

column4: 1 18-ounce challah bread loaf, cut into 1 1/2" pieces8 large eggs3 cups whole milk1/2 cup heavy cream1 Tablespoon vanilla extract2/3 cup packed light brown sugar, divided2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, divided4 Tablespoons salted butter3 medium Honeycrisp apples, cored, cut into 1/4-inch slices1/2 cup chopped pecansPure maple syrup, for serving
column5: Place bread in a 13x9-inch baking dish; mix eggs, milk, cream, vanilla, 1/3 cup of brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon of the cinnamon in  large bowl until smooth; pour egg mixture over bread.Melt butter in skillet over medium heat, add apples, remaining 1/3 cup brown sugar and remaining cinnamon.  cook until apples soften,about 8 minutes.  Sprinkle pecans.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.Preheat oven to 350* bake, covered for 30 minutes; Remove foil and bake until puffed and custard has set about 20 minutes.  Let stand before serving with maple syrup.

column4: 1/4 cup butter 6 green onions, sliced 2 celery ribs, diced 1 cup chopped assorted bell peppers 1 1/2 pounds peeled, large raw shrimp, chopped 1 garlic clove, pressed 1 1/2 teaspoons Creole seasoning 1 (8-oz.) package cream cheese3/4 cup sliced pickled okra 1/2 cup plus 2 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley Toasted French bread baguette slices
column5: Preheat oven to 400*.  Melt butter, add green onions, celery and peppers.  cook 6-8 minutes until tender.  Stir in shrimp, garlic and seasoning.Reduce heat to low and add cream cheese, stirring until cheese is melted.  Remove from heat and stir in okra and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.Spoon into a 2-qt. baking dish and sprinkle with remaining 2 Tablespoons cheese.Bake at 400* for 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned.  Sprinkle with parsley.Serve with toasted French bread baguette slices

column4: 1/2 cup (3 ozs.) smoked salmon1/2 cup    "        cream cheese1 Tablespoon lemon juice1 teaspoon horseradish12 very thin slices white sandwich bread2 large seedless cucumbers, peeled
column5: Combine first four ingredientsIn 300* oven, toast and dry out bread slices; cool on wire rack.Spread cheese/salmon mixture on breadPlace thinly sliced cucumber on top, overlapping slices on bread.  Trim crusts and slice each canape in half on the diagonal.  Chill

column4: PANCAKES:2 2/3 cups all-purpose flour 1 tablespoon granulated sugar 2 teaspoons baking powder 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt 3 cups whole buttermilk 3 large eggs 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, meltedCASSEROLE AND STREUSEL6 large eggs 1 1/2 cups heavy cream 1 cup whole milk 1/4 cup granulated sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 1 cup roughly chopped pecans1/4 cup packed light brown sugar 3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon1/4 teaspoon kosher salt 1/4 cup cold unsalted butter, cubed Pure maple syrup
column5: Prepare the Pancakes: Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Whisk together buttermilk and eggs in a medium bowl; gradually stir buttermilk mixture into flour mixture. Gently stir in butter. (Batter will be lumpy.) Let stand 5 minutes.Pour about 1/4 cup batter for each Pancake onto a hot (350F) buttered griddle.Cook until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look dry, about 3 minutes. Turn and cook until golden brown, about 3 more minutes. (You should make about 30 Pancakes.)Prepare the Casserole: Cut each Pancake in half. Lightly grease a 13- x 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange halves, cut sides down and overlapping slightly, in 3 rows starting at 1 long end of prepared baking dish.Whisk together eggs, cream, milk, granulated sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl. Slowly pour egg mixture over Pancakes; cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight.Step 6Preheat oven to 350F. Make the Streusel: Combine flour, pecans, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl; cut butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender (or use your fingers) until mixture is crumbly.Step 7Uncover Casserole, and sprinkle Streusel mixture over the top. Bake, uncovered, in preheated oven until center is set, 50 to 55 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Drizzle each serving with maple syrup.

column4: 5 tablespoons salted butter, divided 1/4 cup chopped yellow onion 1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper 1/4 cup chopped celery 2 scallions, thinly sliced 1 teaspoon minced garlic 2 (16-oz.) containers fresh oysters, drained well 4 ounces fresh mushrooms, sliced (about 1 1/2 cups) 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 1/2 cup heavy cream 1 ounce Parmesan cheese, grated (about 1/4 cup) 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt1/4 teaspoon black pepper1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg1 cup coarse fresh breadcrumbs from 1/4 baguette
column5: Step 1Preheat broiler. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a skillet over medium-high. Add onion, bell pepper, celery, scallions, and garlic. Cook, stirring, until vegetables soften, 5 to 7 minutes. Add oysters and mushrooms. Bring to a simmer, and cook, stirring often, 5 minutes. Set aside.Step 2Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a small saucepan over medium. Whisk in flour, and cook, whisking constantly, until smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add cream, and cook, whisking constantly, until very thick and beginning to bubble. Add Parmesan, and cook, whisking constantly, until cheese is melted. Remove from heat.Step 3Using a fine wire-mesh strainer, strain oyster mixture; discard liquid. Add oyster mixture to cheese sauce; stir until fully incorporated. Stir in salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Spread mixture in a lightly greased (with cooking spray) 11- x 7-inch baking dish. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons of butter; toss breadcrumbs with melted butter. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over oyster mixture.Step 4Broil on middle rack of oven until bread crumbs are deep golden brown and mixture is bubbly, 4 to 5 minutes.

column4: 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar 2 teaspoons black pepper 1 teaspoon kosher salt 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper 24 ounces thick-cut bacon slices
column5: Step 1Stir together light brown sugar, black pepper, kosher salt, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl.Step 2Place a lightly greased wire rack in each of 2 aluminum foil-lined 18- x 13-inch sheet pans, and arrange bacon in a single layer on each rack. Sprinkle bacon evenly on both sides with spice mixture (about 1 teaspoon per side), and rub gently to coat. Cover baking sheets loosely with foil, and refrigerate 8 to 24 hours.Step 3Preheat oven to 375F. Uncover bacon, and bake in preheated oven, rotating pans halfway through baking time, until deep golden brown and crisp around the edges, about 40 minutes. Let cool on racks in pans about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter.

column4: 2 medium (about 3 lb. each) butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded 2 large eggs, lightly beaten 3/4 cup packed light brown sugar 1/2 cup heavy cream 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted 1 tablespoon pure maple syrup 2 teaspoons cornstarch 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt Cooking spray 2 cups miniature marshmallows
column5: Bake butternut halves in 350* oven, cut side down for about 50 minutes.  Cool; scoop out flesh into a large bowl; mash with potato masher, or puree in a food processor until smooth.Add eggs, brown sugar, cream, melted butter, cornstarch, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and salt.  Stir to combine.  Spoon into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Bake until set, about 40 minutes.  Remove from oven sprinkle with marshmallows.Broil until marshmallows have browned, 2 to 3 minutes.  serve immediately

column4: 6 hard-boiled eggs (peeled)1/8 cup mayonnaise18 cup sour cream2 ounces smoked salmon (lox, finely chopped)1 teaspoon chopped dill, plus more for garnish12 teaspoon lemon juice1/2 teaspoon black pepper14 teaspoon salt
column5: Slice the eggs in half lengthwise.Carefully remove the yolks.Press yolks thru a fine-mesh sieve into a mixing bowl, or just mash them real good with a fork.Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, salmon, dill, lemon juice, pepper and salt.Stir to blend thoroughly.Spoon heaping amounts of the mixture into the egg whites.Cover and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.Sprinkle with chopped dill before serving.

column4: Vinaigrette:1/2pink grapefruit juiced about 1/2-2/3 cup2tablespoons balsamic vinegar2tablespoons olive oil1tablespoon grainy mustard1 1/2teaspoons honeysaltcracked pepperSalad6cups baby greens (mixed, such as spinach, kale and chard)1/2red onion (small, sliced thinly)1/2cup crumbled feta cheese1 1/2pink grapefruit (segmented, then cut them in half)1avocado (large, peeled and diced)1/4cup walnuts (toasted)
column5: Divide the greens between four salad bowls. Top each with onion and feta cheese, followed by the grapefruit segments and avocado slices. Sprinkle the toasted walnuts evenly over the four salads.

column4: 6 large eggs 3 tablespoons minced smoked salmon (about 1 oz.) 3 tablespoons minced green onions 3 tablespoons softened cream cheese 1 tablespoon sour cream 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard 2 teaspoons lemon juice 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper Garnishes: fresh dill, smoked salmon slivers, sweet paprika
column5: Cover eggs with water in a sauce pan over medium heat; bring to a boil.  Cover, remove from heat and let stand 15 minutes; Drain, add cold water and ice to cover.  Let cool.  Remove shell, halve eggs, scrape yolks into a bowl.Combine yolks, salmon and next 7 ingredients, mixing until blended.  Spoon filling into reserved whites, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 2 days.  Garnish as desired

column2: DEVILED EGGS w/SMOKED SALMON AND TWO MUSTARDS
column4: 1/4 cup crme frache 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard or Cognac Mustard 1 tablespoon whole-grain mustard or Seeded Agave Nectar Mustard 1 garlic clove, minced 1 teaspoon lemon juice Pinch of cayenne 1/4 teaspoon sweet paprika 1 green onion, minced 2 ounces smoked salmon, finely chopped Salt and pepper 6 large hard-cooked eggs, peeled and halved lengthwise 1 tablespoon finely snipped fresh chives
column5: Stir together crme frache, mustards, garlic, lemon juice, cayenne, paprika, green onion, and smoked salmon in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper.Step 2Scoop out egg yolks and put in a bowl. Mash yolks with a fork and stir in crme frache mixture.Step 3Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves and sprinkle with chives.

column4: 4 lamb loin chops, 1 inch thick 2 tablespoons soy sauce2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce1 tablespoon red wine vinegar2 tablespoons fresh parsley, torn or 1   tablespoon dried parsley2 teaspoons fresh oregano or 1 teaspoon dried oregano1 teaspoon fresh basil or 1/2 teaspoon dried basil1/2 teaspoon ginger12 teaspoon paprika1 clove garlic, minced or 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder1 dash pepper
column5: Place chops in a shallow dish or a ziplock plastic bag.Combine the soy sauce through pepper with 1/4 cup water and pour over the chops.Cover (or zip) and refrigerate 3 hours, turning occasionally.Grill or broil about 5 minutes 3-4 inches from the heat source.Turn, brush with marinade and broil 3-5 minutes more.

column4: 1 cup packed light brown sugar 6 tablespoons butter, melted 1 cup pure maple syrup, divided 1 cup chopped toasted pecans, divided 12 (1-inch-thick) baguette slices (from 1 baguette, ends discarded) 5 large eggs, lightly beaten 1 1/4 cups whole milk 2 tablespoons granulated sugar 1 teaspoon orange zest plus 1 Tbsp. fresh juice (from 1 orange) 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract, divided 2 tablespoons (1 oz.) bourbon Powdered sugar, for serving
column5: Step 1Stir together brown sugar, melted butter, and 14 cup of the maple syrup. Spread mixture into a 13- x 9-inch baking dish lightly coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with 34 cup of the pecans. Arrange baguette slices evenly on top.Step 2Whisk together next 5 ingredients and 1 teaspoon of the vanilla. Pour over baguette slices. Cover; chill 8 hours.Step 3Preheat oven to 350F. Remove baking dish from refrigerator; let stand at room temperature 10 minutes. Bake, uncovered, until golden brown and set, about 35 minutes.Step 4During final 10 minutes of baking, combine bourbon and remaining 34 cup maple syrup and 14 teaspoon vanilla in a saucepan. Cook over low, stirring, until warm, 2 minutes. Remove from heat; cover pan.Step 5Sprinkle casserole with powdered sugar and remaining 14 cup pecans. Serve with Bourbon-Maple Syrup.

column4: 1/2 cup butter (1stick), frozen1 1/2 cups self-rising flour1cup chilled buttermilkParchment paper2 Tablespoons butter, melted+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++1 Cup milk*1 Tablespoon mild vinegar or lemon juice2 1/2 cups flour, divided4 teaspoons baking powder1/4 teaspoon soda3/4 teaspoon salt6 Tablespoons cold butter*Or 1 cup buttermilkflour work space with 1/2 cup; do not work
column5: Preheat 475* ovenGrate butter with large holes of box grater.  Tossbutter and flour in medium bowl.  Chill 10 minutesMake a well in center of mixture.  Add buttermilk,and stir 15 times.  Dough will be sticky. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface.  Sprinkle flour over top of dough.  Roll dough into a 3/4-inch thick rectangle.  Fold dough in half so short ends meet.  Repeat rolling and folding process 4 more times.Roll dough to 1/2 inch thickness.  Cut with a 2 1/2 floured round cutter, reshaping scraps and flouring as needed.Place dough rounds on parchment lined jelly roll pan.  Bake for 15 minutes until browned.  Brush with melted butter.

column4: 8 ounces cream cheese, softened 8 ounces white cheddar, grate8 ounces smoked salmon, chopped 2 tablespoons capers 2 teaspoons toasted sesame seeds 2 teaspoons poppy seeds 2 teaspoons dried onion 2 teaspoons dried garlic
column5: Combine cream cheese and white cheddar in the bowl of a food processor; process until smooth.Gently fold in the salmon and capers until fully incorporated. Using lightly moistened hands, shape cream cheese mixture into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until it can be easily rolled.Whisk together sesame seeds, poppy seeds, dried onion, and dried garlic in a small mixing bowl until evenly combined. Spread mixture evenly on a rimmed baking sheet. Roll the cheese ball in sesame seed mixture to evenly coat.Place cheese ball on a serving platter; serve with bagel chips.

column4: 1 (1-pound) package uncooked ziti (short tube-shaped pasta) 1 pound hot turkey Italian sausage links 1 cup chopped onion 2 garlic cloves, minced 1 tablespoon tomato paste1/4 teaspoon salt1/4 teaspoon black pepper1 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes1/4 cup chopped fresh basil1 cup shredded fresh mozzarella1 cup grated fresh Parmesan
column5: oven 350* Cook pastaCook sausage, onion and garlic to a crumble.Add tomatoes, s&p, bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 10 minutes.Combine cooked pasta, sausage mixture and basil.Place half of mixture into a greased 4 quart baking dish; top with half of cheese; repeat layers.  Bake for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and casserole is bubbly.

column4: 1/2 cup (4 oz.) salted butter 1/3 cup (about 1 1/2 oz.) all-purpose flour 2 cups chopped yellow onion (from 1 large onion) 1/2 cup chopped celery (from 1 large stalk)2 teaspoons minced garlic (from 1 large garlic clove) 1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper (from 1 medium bell pepper) 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper (from 1 medium bell pepper) 1 cup chicken broth 1 cup water 2 pounds medium peeled, deveined raw shrimp 2 teaspoons hot sauce 1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt1/2 teaspoon black pepper 1/4 cup chopped scallions (from 2 scallions) 1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley Hot cooked long-grain white rice
column5: Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium-low; whisk in flour. Cook, whisking constantly, until mixture turns golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Increase heat to medium, and add onion, celery, and garlic. Cook, stirring often, until soft and golden, about 15 minutes.Step 2Stir in bell peppers, and cook, stirring often, 5 minutes. Stir in broth and water, and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens, 7 to 10 minutes. Stir in shrimp, and cook, stirring occasionally, until shrimp turn pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in hot sauce, salt, and pepper; cook 5 more minutes. Stir in scallions and parsley, and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Serve immediately over hot cooked rice.

column4: 1/2 cup butter2 cups brown sugar1 30-ounce can pineapple rings4 eggs separated1 cup sugar2 Tablespoons pineapple juice from can1 cup flour1 teaspoon baking powderwalnuts or pecans
column5: Preheat oven to 350*Melt butter in bottom of a 9 or 10 inch cast iron skillet  Don't let it brown.Cover melted butter with brown sugar spreading in an even layer.Put one slice of drained pineapple in the center and cut the other rings in half. Arrange the rest of the pineapple halves like a spoked wheel -- rounded edges facing the same way. You may have a few unused piecesBeat 4 egg yolks and sugar and pineapple juice until light.Sift flour and baking powder and fold into the egg/sugar mixture 1/3 cup at a time.Fold in 4 stiffly beaten egg whites. Combine until batter is smooth without lumps.  Pour over pineapple, sugar, nuts.  Bake 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Loosen edges and after cake cools a few minutes, turn out on to large plate before the syrup cools.

column2: COUSCOUS PILAF WITH ROASTED CARROTS, CHICKEN AND FETA
column4: 4 large carrots, peeled and diagonally sliced 14 inch thick (about 12 oz.) 1 tablespoon olive oil 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided 1/2 cup butter 2 teaspoons lemon zest, plus 14 cup fresh juice (from 1 large lemon), divided 1 1/2 cups water 1 cup uncooked couscous 1/2 cup golden raisins 1/3 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, plus more for garnish 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds 2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken, warmed (about 12 oz., from 1 chicken) 2 ounces feta cheese, crumbled (about 12 cup)
column5: Preheat oven to 450F. Combine carrots, oil, pepper, and 12 teaspoon of the salt on a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss to coat; spread in an even layer. Bake in preheated oven until tender, 16 to 18 minutes, stirring once. Remove from oven.Step 2While carrots roast, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-high. Cook until milk solids turn golden brown and have a nutty fragrance, swirling pan occasionally as mixture bubbles, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl; let stand 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice; set aside.Step 3Bring water and remaining 12 teaspoon salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over high. Stir in couscous. Cover and remove from heat; let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork; stir in raisins, parsley, almonds, and 5 tablespoons of the browned butter mixture.Step 4Combine carrots, chicken, and 2 tablespoons of the browned butter mixture in a bowl; toss to coat. Divide couscous pilaf evenly among 4 bowls; top with chicken-carrot mixture. Sprinkle with cheese; drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon browned butter mixture. Top with lemon zest and parsley.

column4: 1 (4-pound) cured corned beef brisket, trimmed 16 cups water 2 cups chopped onion 1 cup chopped celery 1 cup chopped carrot 1 1/2 teaspoons pickling spice 3 garlic cloves, peeled Cooking spray 1 tablespoon caraway seeds1 (2 1/2-pound) head green cabbage, cored and cut into 1-inch strips 4 pounds small red potatoes, quartered 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley 2 teaspoons butter 2 teaspoons grated lemon rind 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice 1/8 teaspoon black pepper 1/2 cup dry bread crumbs 1 (5-ounce) jar prepared horseradish, drained and squeezed dry 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard
column5: Place corned beef in a large stockpot; add water and next 5 ingredients (water through garlic). Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 3 hours. Remove brisket from pot.Step 2Place corned beef on the rack of a broiler pan or roasting pan coated with cooking spray; place rack in pan. Strain cooking liquid through a colander into 2 large bowls; discard solids. Return liquid to pot. Add caraway seeds and cabbage; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer 20 minutes. Drain.Step 3While cabbage is cooking, place potatoes in a large Dutch oven. Cover with water. Bring to a boil; cook 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Stir in parsley, butter, rind, juice, and pepper; toss to coat.Step 4Preheat broiler.Step 5Combine bread crumbs and horseradish. Spread mustard over one side of corned beef. Press bread crumb mixture onto mustard. Broil 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve corned beef with cabbage and potatoes.

column4: 3 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and roughly chopped1/2 cup whole buttermilk 1 cup salted butter, softened 8 ounces crme frache 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt 1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper
column5: Place potatoes in a large Dutch oven with cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over medium-high. Boil until tender, 25 minutes. Drain; return potatoes to Dutch oven over medium. Cook, stirring once, until potatoes dry out slightly, 50 seconds.Place buttermilk and softened butter in a microwavable glass bowl; microwave on HIGH until warm, 30 to 60 seconds. Add warm buttermilk mixture, crme frache, salt, and white pepper to potatoes; mash with a potato masher.Make it ahead: Prepare 1 day ahead; cover and refrigerate. Reheat before serving.

column4: 4 slices rye bread 2 tablespoons butter, softened 2 tablespoons apple butter 1/2 pound thinly sliced roasted turkey 4 ounces brie cheese, thinly sliced 1 cup baby arugula <
column5: Spread 1 side of each bread slice with 1/2 tbsp. butter. Spread the other side of 2 bread slices with 1/2 tbsp. apple butter each; top each with half the turkey, brie, and arugula, then a few apple slices. Spread the bare sides of remaining 2 slices of bread with remaining apple butter, then place on sandwiches, buttered side up.Put 1 sandwich in a medium frying pan and cook, covered, over medium heat until golden brown on bottom, 3 to 4 minutes. Turn sandwich over and continue to cook until cheese is slightly melted and second side is golden brown, 3 to 4 more minutes. Repeat.

column4: 1 cup white miso paste2/3 cup coarsely chopped palm sugar cup dry sake cup mirin6 center-cut sea bass fillets, 8 ounces each, boned and trimmed6 large lime wedges
column5: In the top pan of a double boiler, combine the miso paste, palm sugar, sake and mirin, and place over simmering water in the lower pan. As the mixture heats, whisk until the sugar and miso melt and the mixture is smooth. Do not allow the mixture to boil. Remove from the heat and let cool completely.Place the fish in a large air-tight plastic bag, pour in the marinade, press out any excess air, and seal the bag. Make sure the marinade is evenly distributed over the fillets. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.Remove the fish from the refrigerator for about 60 minutes before cooking and preheat the oven to 400 F.Arrange the fish fillets in a single layer in a baking dish, leaving space between the fillets. Pour in enough of the marinade to reach one-fourth of the way up the sides of the fillets.Place the fish in the oven and bake until the fish is cooked and the sauce caramelizes. Serve with lime wedges. This fish pairs perfectly with a coconut or jasmine rice.

column4: 1 tablespoon butter 3/4 cup pecans, chopped 1 cup mayonnaise 3 tablespoons fresh tarragon, chopped 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice 1 teaspoon lemon zest 4 cups cooked chicken breasts, chopped 1 medium Granny Smith apple, diced 1 cup celery, diced 4 tablespoons red onion, finely chopped
column5: In a small skillet, melt butterover medium-low heat. Add pecans. Cookstirring constantly for6 to 8 minutes or until fragrant andtoasted.Step 2Whisk together mayonnaise,tarragon, lemon juice, and lemon zestin a large bowl. Stir in chicken, apples celery, and onionuntil blended. Add salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.Step 3Cover and chill 2 to 24 hours. Stir in 1/2 cup toasted pecans just before serving. Sprinkle with remaining pecans.

column4: 1/2 cup butter (1 stick), frozen 2 1/2 cups self-rising flour 1 cup chilled buttermilk Parchment paper 2 tablespoons butter, melted
column5: 475* oven, preheatedGrate butter into flour on large hole  of box grater.  Chill 10 minutes.Make well in center of mixture.  Add buttermilk, and stir 15 times.Turn dough out on floured surface; sprinkle flour over top.  Flour rolling pin, roll dough to a 3/4 inch rectangle.  Fold dough in half so short ends meet.  Repeat rolling and folding process 4 more times.Roll dough ot 1/2 thickness; cut with round cutter, place on parchment paper lined pan.  Bake for 15 minutes.  Brush with melted butter.

column4: 1/3 cup refrigerated pesto sauce 1 (15 oz.) jar Alfredo sauce 1/4 cup chicken broth 12 ounces uncooked penne pasta, cooked according to package directions 2 1/2 cups chopped rotisserie chicken 4 ounces pre-shredded low-moisture part-skim mozzarella cheese (about 1 cup) 2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh basil 1/4 teaspoon paprika
column5: 375* oven.Toss spinach and pesto in a medium bowl.Stir together Alfredo sauce and chicken broth; spread 1/3rd of Alfredo mixture into a lightly greased 11 x 7-inch baking dish. Top with half the spinach mixture.Stir cooked pasta, chicken and remaining Alfredo mixture; repeat layers.Bake 30 minutes in preheated oven.  remove from oven, sprinkle with cheese; return to oven until hot and bubbly, about 5 minutes.  Top with basil andpaprika.
